description:
BIX is a really cool spot. When we walked in, I could barely believe we were still in San Francisco. With a jazz pianist playing and lovely leather booths upstairs, we felt transported.

Our server was lovely and made my partner's birthday celebration wonderful. The tableside steak tartare was delicious, and the steak and duck were great too. But the bread pudding - that was a real treat. One of the best I've ever had.

BIX is a lovely place when you want to dine somewhere off the beaten path!
author: Christina S.

description:
If you want to splurge on a special occasion or impress your date, I recommend Bix. 

I called about a week in advance for a reservation for 5 people for that Friday - my Birthday Dinner. The earliest time they had was 9:00 PM AND they require a credit card to hold your reservation, because if you no-show, they'll charge $25 per person of the reservation. 

However, I think it's worth the dining experience here. The live Jazz sold me alone. (But I'm a sucker for live music). 

My parents are really picky with their wines, so we brought two (max amount allowed per table) for a $30 corkage fee per bottle. 

Yeah... if it's not obvious yet from this review, expect a hit on your wallet when you visit haha. 

I ordered the Lobster Spaghetti and it was really light and filling at the same time - recommend! The portions are small, but they know what they're doing because all of us were full by the end. 

I do suggest ordering an appetizer for the table to share, because with the combination of that, the bread, and my entree, I was stuffed. 

Bix is definitely an experience to have in San Francisco. Inside, does not feel like the city anymore. It's a nice break.
author: Joscelynne R.

description:
We love coming here for impromptu date nights and sitting at the bar.

Great Caesar salad, burger and martinis. They split the entries, I love that touch.

Had the potato pillows, tomato salad, and desserts all great! 


Classy and professional service every time.
author: Inga W.

description:
So the ambiance here just transports you back in time. Like 1920s? 1940s? The decor, the way the tables are laid out, how the waiter is dressed and how they speak to you. I really liked the art they had on the walls too (and there's an awesome historic map of SF in the men's bathroom!). That was the coolest part of the experience for me.

Maybe you're thinking, well if the best part was the ambiance, then the food must not be good.

(I amused myself by wondering what would happen if I just ended the review right there. But alas, there are no trolls to be found here :) )

Overall, the food is definitely on the good side - but kind of that "that was a pretty good meal" versus "holy crap, we have to come back here for the food." I did really enjoy my truffle burger (burgers are my weakness), but the other dishes we had were just "good". If I were forced to not order a burger, I would probably go with the pork chop in hindsight. Everything else we ordered definitely was smaller on the portion size. As for dessert, definitely go for the chocolate (if they have it)!

So yeah, Bix is a pretty neat concept tucked away in an alleyway in North Beach. It would definitely be interesting to try their tastings at the bar next time!
author: Greg G.

description:
An elegant, multi-level venue with one key attribute in its favor: live jazz - without cover (!!!) - every single night of the week. The lineup changes by day, so check their website for what's being offered each night, but if you're a jazz fan like me and enjoy borderline swanky environments like this every once in a while, you won't be disappointed.

Reservations are generally a must here, although you can try wiggling your way into the bar. The food is certainly not going to be cheap (remember? no cover!) and is not going to rise to the level of a Michelin star, but at least the flavors, quality, and preparation are reasonably up to snuff, in tandem with the prices. The General Tso's fried chicken is indeed a nice appetizer to begin things with, while there are plenty of meaty entrees to choose from, whether the lamb porterhouse or dry aged New York strip steak. I was perfectly fine with a lobster spaghetti dish.

Drinks, in particular the cocktails, are quite solid, and overall this is quite a festive, cheery venue with good service. Even as a jazz fan who's lived in the Bay Area for almost 9 years now, I only heard about it after reading former mayor Willie Brown's column in the Chronicle, and I can see why he likes a classy place like this. (In particular, if you're here to talk business or politics, you can do so without fear of being overheard, thanks to the music and other background noise.) Thanks for the recommendation!
author: Vincent L.

description: Went here on a Sunday night for me and my bf's anniversary dinner. The location is hidden, but not too bad to find. Right when we walked in, the ambiance of the restaurant is what I loved. It was dim, romantic, and there was also a pianist that played songs throughout dinner. We had reservations for 7 and was sat right next to the Pianist which I loved! He even played, "Ribbon in the Sky" as one of my favorite old school songs were. I got a Lobster pasta which was helllllllaaaa good and I also got the Truffle Cheeseburger which was yummy and had rich flavors to it! I loved it all and will definitely be coming back!
author: Loreah D.

description: Bix has an old timey feel. Once you walk in, it's very dark and to be quite frank, I was concerned I was going to fall AT LEAST twice because it's so darn dark. Please forgive the pics that were taken, the lighting was off. Said waiter Jorge, initially seemed a bit stiff, but loosened up after time went on. A nice time was had, no complaints, really. It just wasnt my cup of tea, per se. Again, it was a nice establishment, I think I was just expecting something "different."
author: Monika C.

description:
You would never know that this restaurant was created in the 1980's,  you will be transported to the 1920's. The historic Barbary Coast neighborhood, the building, and the restaurant- down a quiet alley- all add to a feeling when elegance and wildness danced the foxtrot and knowing the password would open doors instead of apps. 

The food is delicious and service excellent. But your eye will eventually wander to the large painting over the piano of a butler holding a glass. The painting, which looks very 1920's was actually painted in the 1980's by Mark Scott and is also the subject of a film by David Arquette. The title:"The Butler's in Love- Absinthe". 

While a bit pricy it is a destination restaurant. Check out the lovely galleries in the neighborhood while you are there.
author: Jane F.

description:
My husband (when he worked in the city) and my neighbor and her husband love this place.  It's been over a year and we finally got a date night together.

We had reservations for 7:00 on a Saturday night; wanted to stay long enough to hear some of the live jazz that starts at 8:30.  Valet is $15.  Totally worth it.

I wasn't sure about the dress code, the website looks suit fancy.  But we ended up casual.  Jeans and a nice black shirt.  We fit in fine.  There was the other end as well, a woman dressed more like a flapper and men in fine suits.  It's a "supper club" - which means they serve a meal and entertainment.  There was live piano music until the jazz started.  Oh and we sat in the balcony.  Beautiful.

The pics say it all about the decor.  The place is jazzy and smooth and it makes me want to drink and eat and enjoy myself.

I had the Bix Sidecar - tasty and poured at the table.  A waiter came by and delivered hot sour dough rolls.  Um.  This was enough to make me swoon.  I'm not usually this easy but the decor AND carbs were too much to bear.
Chose safe starters, meatballs and crab rolls.  Both great tastes and fine for a table of four.  Then we had the Chicken Hash, Truffle Cheese Burger, Duck, and Pork chop.  Order of personal preference from what I tasted... Chicken Hash, Duck and Burger.  I suspect the burger was my bad, I said med well. I should have asked for the chef preference.  It was a tad dry for me.  The Pork chop was gorgeous but I didn't try.  

Finishing the night with the Banana's Foster was a must and I was almost willing to embarrass myself by licking the bowl.  Don't worry I didn't.  It was just such a tasty end to the night.  Go! for a special night this place is special.
author: Jennifer H.

description:
Bix is one of my favorite restaurants in the city for a romantic night out with live jazz music and great food. I discovered this place because my company had its holiday party here a few years ago, which was very nice. After that, I've been here about several other times since. 

I generally come here on Friday or Saturday nights, and they always have live jazz music playing. The place has great vibes and has an upscale/elegant feel, so definitely dress up a bit when coming here (i.e. no jeans for men). 

I've also been here for Valentine's day, which requires a reservation well in advance for a decent dinner time. The menu was pre-set but you did each get a salad, an hors d'oeuvre or starter, a main course, and dessert. The price wasn't bad given the fact each of you got to select one from each category. The only thing that wasn't included were the drinks.

The service here has always been spectacular, with everyone always being very warm and friendly, and on top of the service. They're very quick to seat you if you have a reservation. 

Unlike many other places in the city with live jazz, the food here is spectacular. I've had a lot of the options from their menu: potato pillows, crab rolls, steak tartare, truffle fries, calamari, stuffed quail, chicken hash, lobster spaghetti, and the dry aged NY strip. My favorite entree was probably the stuffed quail, but it seems like they no longer have that as an option, and the NY strip was a close second. I will say I wasn't the biggest fan of the chicken hash or the lobster spaghetti. All the hors d'oeuvres and starters I've had have all been really good, and I generally rotate through them. As for drinks, the Bix Sidecar is my personal favorite.

Overall, this has been my favorite place when looking for a romantic date night with good food and live jazz in the city.
author: Eric U.

description: Wonderful food, service, and ambience, and fantastic service from our bartender Ben and especially from the very wonderful Will.
author: Sean H.

description:
It must have been an inconvenience for the staff to  do their jobs this evening. The bartender had an attitude and our server was annoyed that we needed an extra minute to look at the menu. And when we approached the manager (after we paid the bill) to let him know, he felt compelled to make excuses. "The bartender has been here for 30 years," isn't an excuse to be a jerk--sounds to me that the bartender needs to find a new job.

The only redeeming part of this place is that the food was solid. All in all, there are much better places in SF to spend your money. Unless you feel like paying for attitude and excuses.
author: Kevin B.

description:
Love this place , great food , great music!
Staff was very nice ! First time here , birthday surprise! Very welcoming and will continue to visit when in San Francisco!!!
author: Natalia Y.

description:
We came here for a team outing.

I was trying to make reservations online but Open table was being slow and wouldn't let me select a certain time. I called the restaurant at 4:30 and made reservations for 5:30 the same day. I received a text message saying we were ready to be seated. We checked- in and got seated immediately. The hostess checked-in our bags for us.

The seating for us was a little tight, some guests had to squeeze in behind us to get to their tables. But no biggie, I also found the chairs to be uncomfortable. Maybe I am used to chairs having arms. Anyhow, the seats were red/velour which was a very classy look.

The waiter greeted us quickly giving us the drink selections and asked us if we had any questions. We put in our drink order and he did recommend some great appetizers.

Before we got our appetizers, they brought us fresh HOT rolls with butter. Wow, we could of just ate that all night and been satisfied!

We opted for the Chef's appetizer which fed everyone at the table; it came with deviled eggs, potato pillows, crab rolls and a fancy version of grilled cheese. Every one of those items were delicious. The eggs were perfectly seasoned.  The pillows were light and fluffy. The crab roll had a nice chunk of crab in it. The grilled cheese was buttery and toasted just right.

In between courses, the waiters would come and clear out plates and make sure we had the correct silverware. They also asked us if we wanted more bread and checked in to see if we needed more drinks. 

The waiter made great suggestions on our entrée order and answered all our questions. We placed our orders and the food came out rather quickly.

The chicken hash was GREAT! Pulled roasted chicken made into a hash sitting on bed of smoked corn sauce. The cherry tomatoes and bourbon barrel smoked paprika gave it a bold taste. I ate every bite, the portion was just right.

After dinner, we got our dessert menu and shortly placed our order. The warm chocolate brioche pudding was excellent! The mascarpone on top made it a very tasty treat!

We got our bill, hung around for a bit but were not rushed to leave what so ever. The staff is VERY attentive and gives everyone the undivided attention they deserve. You get the royal treatment up in HERE!

I was a little disappointed in how the restrooms looked, they could use some upkeep. Also,  I understand fancy places like this need to dim the lights but it was way too dark! Being that is was so dark, I could not turn on my flash ( I did in one picture, but it was so noticeable) so the quality of my pictures are not great.

But overall, 4.5 stars baby! A must try! Happy eating folks!
author: Kam H.

description: The service was outstanding. The live music and vibe was great. The main course was mediocre at best and the prices were out of sight. My bill was $500 with a good tip, for three people. I would definitely go back for drinks though.
author: Damon C.

description:
This place is AMAZING!! 

I reviewed the pictures before we came here and my mouth was already watering. This food will not disappoint!! 

There were 5 of us.. we made a reservation ahead of time and were seated right away. We ordered lots appetizers, an entree each and were stuffed!! The appetizers are single bite size.

We got the crab rolls, foie gras special, ceviche, albacore carpaccio, croques, deviled eggs, truffle fries, they gifted us the sautéed wax beans and shisito peppers. Nobody had any complaint about any of the appetizers. Each one was so flavorful and the perfect texture. My tastebuds were in heaven. 

For drinks we ordered a bottle of the Domaine Carneros champagne, rose Bellini, and the Nico. The Nico was very sweet so if you're not a sweet drink person this isn't the drink for you. They do have a full bar available and the other people at our table ordered a Manhattan and whisky. 

For entrees we ordered lobster spaghetti, the salmon entree and the porkchop. The lobster spaghetti was amazing the tomatoes were cooked perfectly and the pasta had a great al dente texture. The salmon was soft and buttery. The porkchop was so juicy and flavorful. 

We finished dinner with the chocolate brioche bread pudding topped with vanilla ice cream. It was amazing! The dark warm chocolate mixed with a cold vanilla ice cream was the perfect combination. They gifted us the bon bons which were these cute painted chocolates filled with tart fruit jelly. 

This was a great fine dining experience and would be a perfect place for anniversary dinner or a special dinner.
author: Meghan P.

description:
My husband and I met friends at BIX for dinner this past Saturday night. We went a bit early to have a drink at the bar. As soon as we walked in the hostess "greeted" us with "do you have a reservation???" and when my husband asked if there might be a table upstairs she shouted in a snarky tone saying "I'll see what I can do!" Unacceptable. I give the bar and bartender five stars; great cocktails (BIX Negroni and Gin Martini), and super bartender.

Don't expect the food to be amazing...it's not. We had spaghetti lobster, scallops and split a Waldorf salad and everything was OK (not A-OK). Wait staff was nice, music was good and we agreed on our ride home that we'd go only for the cocktails and music next time.
author: Jennifer B.

description:
One of my favorite SF restaurants - old school but good.

Favorite dishes:
Deviled eggs with truffles on top

Pork chop - just done perfectly.

If you're in the mood for something heavier the burger with truffle and cheese is quite good with the fries too.

I've tried other appetizers and they've been ok - the meatballs, and something else I forget. Oh the tomato appetizer was AMAZING. I think it's seasonal but if it is on the menu, get it. Super fresh and those tomatoes are something else.

Other people LOVE - tableside preparation of the tartare and the bone marrow (those just aren't my dishes).

Two levels.  Bathroom on the first level.  Don't think there's an elevator.

It's fairly dark in there so if you don't like dark then this isn't for you.

Located down a small alleyway easiest to find parking before you hit Gold street or catch an Uber/Lyft instead.  I think they offer valet parking but I've never used it.

Reservations on OpenTable

Oh, and we brought our infant here (in an infant carseat) once.  I'm not sure it's exactly "welcomed", but they were super nice and accommodating with it - we did come on a Sunday at like 5pm so we at least tried to avoid date night, business dinners, and the general dinner crowd. They didn't make us feel awkward at all but it's not what I would call good-for-kids in general.
author: Traci H.

description:
I celebrated my birthday here yesterday and had an absolutely fantastic evening. The place is tucked away like a gem in the city and transports you into a different era completely. The live jazz and the beautiful space promises to be an experience you will not forget. 

The food here was super ! We started the meal with a delicious fresh oyster plate 10/10 accompanied by a lovely glass of wine. For the main course I tried the truffle burger (I like truffle everything) and was not disappointed but extremely impressed. It is the best burger I have ever eaten 11/10. We also got the lobster ravioli which was divine and so very fresh 11/10. 

We ended the meal with some coffee and memories to last a lifetime. The staff is very friendly and the ambience is unmatched. I highly recommend this place !!
author: Shivani B.

description:
Drinks: 5/5
Atmosphere: 5/5
Service (bar): 5/5
Service (floor): 3/5 

The drinks were spectacular (and I'm picky). We came here late Friday night for drinks and jazz and enjoyed it very much. The space is not too big, which makes it cozy. The bar staff are all well dressed and courteous. Floor service wasn't great but with everything else, we didn't care too much. Great for friends gatherings or dates!
author: Terrie C.

description:
Great spot in FiDi with love jazz music which starts around 8:30. It's great to make the reservation right around that time so you can enjoy the amazing food, ambiance and music! 
Service: always a 5 star 
Food: 
potato pillows with caviar ( a tad oily but yum) 4 stars
Ceviche: 5 stars. not your traditional kind that you will see everywhere but as tasty. ( picture is attached) 
Tomato salad: 5 stars. Very tasty. 
The fig salad:3 stars. it was very light but not our favorite
 We didn't order any entree but as for dessert we had their signature dessert. It's a banana ice cream with chunks of banana in a compote. It tastes more like a creme brûlée but 10 times better. Served warm. Neither of us were a huge banana fan but don't leave this place without ordering this dessert! One word a-mazing!
author: Ghazal P.

description:
It's been about 20 years I've been here. I think that's because are so many great places to eat in San Francisco and I figured that Bix was more of an old-school type of place. I forgot how much fun it is.  
    Food was good but not stellar. I will give the food 3 1/2 stars. The atmosphere was five stars. The cocktails five stars. The jazz music five stars. My overall experience five stars. Hosted a party of 10 people on a Saturday night for my 60th birthday party. I just can't describe how much fun I had. I will definitely not wait 20 years before coming back. I might be dead!
    Appetizers were solid. Get the tater tot's with the caviar, deviled eggs with truffle, the crab crostini. Avoid the lobster spaghetti it was kind of tasteless.  The steak was good not great. Black truffle cheese burger was very good (better at wayfarer tavern or even Roam!).
      Again please understand this is not a real foodie place.. If you're looking for really great time you will certainly get that. The bartenders make top notch ccocktails.They are very good at their craft.And the food by the way was good enough. My party really enjoyed themselves!
author: Jeffrey L.

description:
This place blew me away. It's not every day you experience service like this. This was hubby's pick for dinner based on a recommendation from a friend. We made a reservation that evening and headed on down to the restaurant.

We walked in and were greeted by a friendly host who checked out coats before escorting us to our table on the second floor. Two rows of tables on a balcony that overlooks the rest of the dining room. There was a jazz pianist playing throughout our meal which only added to the ambience.

I highly recommend the tartare appetizer which is dressed at the table.
author: Sarah S.

description:
Great escape for Bubbles or a Manhattan with live Jazz 
Bix is a Destination! Ran here in my stilettos  in the rain!
author: Michele O.

description:
I'm a very happy restaurant patron almost always.
Please don't read this as my commonplace review.

Overview-
-Overpriced
-Bland, common, well-dressed bar food.
-Bad personality server

My lowest restaurant rating to date:
Let me preface this review by saying:
I'm 43, very well traveled, 6 figure (not 7 figure) income and a lover of fine dining.

It's always a treat getting to eat in San Francisco... but this time the city really disappointed.

Bix:
I have a local friend that doesn't get out for moderately nice dinners very often and I had her name the spot.  Cool entry through a financial district alley... Art Deco type of sign, entry in to what I would qualify as being a "very San Fran feeling restaurant."  

We weren't wearing suits but were dressed nice-casual.   We we sat up in the balcony, in the corner.  Not a big deal and it was quiet and peaceful.  

The waiter was pretty brash... no "table-side manor" if you will.  We were informed briefly and I must add "sternly" about the specials and he returned severely times in rapid succession to if we were ready to order yet.  Finally, we ordered.

Our Food came:
The food had zero personality.
Uninspired.
Small portions.
Boring.  
Bland.

Scallops, Pasta, Crab Cakes, Deviled Eggs snd Oysters.

Good Kumamoto Oysters...
Everything else would have been better pre-made from Costco or Sams Club.  Especially the Crab Cakes... 

Don't waste your money here.  WAY overpriced for the quality of food you get... add to that a waiter with an attitude and you'll get 2 stars from me.
author: Brett B.

description:
After circling the block a few times and actually figuring out you can drive down that tiny alley they have super convenient and reasonable valet parking. 

Once you stop out of your car you will literally step into epitome of a San Francisco destination restaurant.  In the classic dark but elegant setting I felt as if Humphrey Bogart and Lauren Bacall could be seated at the bar. Some of your more established SF landmark restaurants can have a pretty crusty curmudgeonly bar staff which is definitely not the case here. The bar tender was nice and talkative and could pour a proper martini.  Our table was on the second floor and we really felt like we had a VIP table but upon glancing around it seemed as though all the tables have great views.  Came in hot so were really prepared to eat !! Having their, bix mix,  deviled eggs, crab rolls, spinach, Caesar salad, cerviche, bone marrow, pork chop, sword fish, and more. It was a good thing my wife was not hungry as I probably could not afford to feed her!  Every dish was perfectly preparred and the entire staff was so friendly and accommodating which is really a great feeling at such a landmark place.
author: BGinLove B.

description:
If you are in a new city and Google Maps tells you to go to the outskirts of the city in a dark neighbourhood down a dark alley where the Uber driver "doesn't want" to go then maybe you shouldn't go. But if you are in San Francisco then this is the recipe for an adventurous night!

I love jazz and want to check out the best live jazz spots in each city I visit and Bix was it for San Fran. So we hopped in a Urber to get there. My friend was complaining how far it is. 

We finally found this place, deep down some dark alley in a building with no windows... what are we getting into.

We got into one of the best experience restaurants I've been to. It feels like you are going into the past, nothing much as changed since it open probably around the 1920s. Slow piano music play as you walk into a 30 feet high grand ceiling darkly lit candle light restaurant. We were greeted by our hostess and had to wait 20 minutes for our table but worth it since we came all this way.

We were seated upstairs where we had a grand view of the restaurant and downstairs. 

Bread is baked perfectly and I had the Lobster Spaghetti ($37) and my friend had a breaded fish dish. Both were very delicious. 

Overall we both were very happy we made the trip out here and recommend you do too if you are in San Francisco. 

Food 5.0/5
Service 4.2/5
Ambiance 5.0/5
Value 4.5/5

=========

Overall 4.8/5
author: Sharky L.

description: Went here on a date night with my husband. They had a piano player and a woman singing jazz. Great atmosphere. It is two levels. Both levels seem great. You can hear the music perfect from the second level. We order a la minute ceviche- oh my gosh. The flavor was amazing!! I had the lobster spaghetti and my husband had the swordfish. We both finished our plates. Not huge portions- which was nice. We left feeling satisfied but not uncomfortable. Dress is upscale.
author: Adrianna S.

description: Great ambiance with impressive decor and live music... but food wasn't make me "fall in love" with neither presentation nor simply taste; service was decent but not impeccable as I expected to be told about this one of the "great romantic places in SF".
author: Sevda G.

description: Great ambiance. Amazing music. And possibly the best dessert I've ever had in my life. The bananas foster was to die for.
author: Raquel M.

description: I really liked the vibe of this place. We were seated on the upper level, which made a great dining experience. We could see the colorful and beautiful bar from above. The service was a bit slow, we had asked for more bread a few times and didn't receive it. The food was good and I would definitely bring out of town friends for the ambiance alone.
author: Jason T.

description: Can I give a restaurant 10 stars??? When a restaurant has been there for over 30 years it must be doing something right! Old school cool! Live music and a seat at the bar is our favorite. The escargot, oysters , bone marrow! I wish there was a Bix in LA but it's a must every time we go back to SF!
author: PM L.

description: I love this bar. It's just what the doctor ordered.   Don't miss the wonderfully creamy potato pillows with creme fraiche and caviar.
author: Suzy Q.

description:
Great ambiance.  Definitely the biggest reason to go here is the jazz vibe and live music while dining.

Food was decent, drinks were decent.  But nothing over the top.
author: Amjad S.

description: I had not been to this restaurant in years. I wonder why? The atmosphere is fantastic, they have live piano and singing and the food was exceptional. I had the duck breast which was simply fantastic. Definitely will be going back again very soon.
author: Niloufar M.

description:
Get this: a Lyft to Harris'

Are usually start out my reviews with a "Get this" and proceed to advise on the highlights of the meal. 

I came here for the burger, which has made some "best" lists. At $30, it should be, well, the Best. It was good, but small and definitely not amazing. I would give it a B. It came with fries, but they were in a 3X3X3 ramekin. And I'm not talking feet here. Service was tepid and disinterested.  I was able to eat at the bar, which I like and the live music was quite pleasant. My martini was decent, but the olives were mushy which is tolerable at a dive bar, but not at a $$$ restaurant. And now that I think about it, the glass should've been colder, and the martini shaken longer. And it's pretty hard to f#ck up a martini. All in all, if you want a great steak place with live music, try Harris'. For a phenomenal burger, try Street or Causewell's. Bix's Burger was as good as Roam, and 3X as expensive.
author: Scott W.

description:
A little pricey for what it was.
It was good overall but for this price, I would have expected a more refined dressing and subtle flavors.
author: Diane G.

description:
What a vibrant and bustling place! I love the Art Deco design and the live jazz music was perfect!  
Food was superb! 
Fig Salad, Heirloom Tomato and Burrata, Petrale Sole, Pork Chop. They were all incredibly tasty! 
The meal was punctuated with Hazelnut Chocolate Mousse with an extra heaping of the house spun Chocolate Sorbet. 
It was a great meal, accompanied by great service.
Bix has been in business for 30 years, so obviously, they sure know what they are doing!
author: Malu D.

description:
Put on a sexy dress, your big girl heels and some smoldering lipstick!! What a gem this place is!! Celebrated our anniversary dinner here and had a great time! They even celebrated with us. The drinks, the food,  the service- everything was exceptional. For mains we had the Guinea Hen with Foie Gras & Brioche Stuffing, grilled romano beans and baby turnips in a mustard sauce.  It all went really well together. He had the California Lamb T-Bone, Crushed Yukon Gold potatoes, roasted garlic with capers and a mint and sorrel pesto. Only, there was no bone- the Lamb came in pieces. Cooked perfectly and delicious,  nonetheless.  
This place, hands down is one of the best dining experiences we've had!
author: Teresa S.

description: This place is an old time favorite of mine and has a nostalgic feel enhanced by the soft lighting, piano soft music and a singer. Food is awesome anything in the menu is delicious
author: Cecille P.

description:
My boyfriend planned a romantic date night in the city last Saturday and set up a reservation here. This place is pretty easy to pass by if you don't know exactly what you're looking for so luckily we did a little research before arriving and found the valet parking. 
We were seated quickly and had a good amount of time to figure out what we wanted to order. To drink, I got the pisco punch which was super good, it kind of reminded me of a mojito. For our entrée I got the lamb and my boyfriend got the truffle burger. The lamb was cooked to perfection, it was really tender and had really great flavor and my boyfriend really liked his burger even though he was taken aback that there was no top bun haha.
We decided to skip an appetizer and got dessert instead; we ordered the bread pudding and it was amazing. I would seriously go back just to have it again.
Bix is super pricey but it makes a great treat every once in a while. The ONLY downside was the service. Our waiter went MIA a few times, we had to hunt servers down just to get refills on our water, we were only checked on once during our meal and our waiter never asked if I'd like a another cocktail (I obviously could've just asked for another one if I wanted one but it's all about service).
In general, we had a very good and pricey experience. I'd come back again.
author: Monique L.

description:
Came here with a reservation for a girlfriend's birthday with a party of 6 total. Early arrivals get to hang out at the bar until the entire party arrives. There are two floors, and we got seated upstairs where the pretty tree and corner booth seating was. Our waitress was friendly and very accommodating; she also gave great recommendations for our group. We split a bottle of Riesling among us 6 and received complimentary bread and butter. Since there were so many options for starters, our waitress suggested a sampler plate for 4 different appetizers (one for each person) - win!

Starters: 
- Potato Pillows (with Creme Fraiche & Caviar): (Part of the appetizer sampler with 6 pieces) Reminded us all of hashbrowns in texture and taste - which wasn't a bad thing, but didn't taste unique; still good though.
- Dungeness Crab Roll (with Meyer Lemo Aioli): (Part of the appetizer sampler with 6 pieces) one of the harder starters to eat since the crab pieces tend to fall off the bread piece. Tasty; would order again.
- Brazilian Queijo Fritters (with Stuffed Braised Oxtail & Pepper Jam): (Part of the appetizer sampler with 6 pieces) this was my favorite starter and I highly recommend ordering. The texture reminds me of mochi when you bite into it, with a crisp exterior. Not sure if I liked the sweet and sour sauce on top, but this was awesome in texture and taste!
- Deviled Eggs (with Truffles & Radish): (Part of the appetizer sampler with 6 pieces) Love anything with truffle on top, but this wasn't a unique dish either; however, I still enjoyed the egg.
- Steak Tartare (not part of the appetizer sampler): didn't taste very unique, and it was more on the sour side for me, but did like it.

Main:
- Pacific Sea Bass (with Hollandaise sauce): One of my friends ordered this, and the sea bass was good, especially with the Hollandaise sauce. I would recommend trying if you were feeling something light for dinner.
- Lobster Spaghetti (with cherry tomatoes & jalapenos): I ordered this for dinner along with 4 others. We wanted something light for dinner, but I definitely want to try the steak the next time I return. The lobster was good, and the noodles had a great chewy texture. I didn't taste any spiciness even though the dish included jalapenos. Light and yummy; would reorder.

Desserts:
- Miso Butterscotch Creme Brulee (with Malt Meringue, Blonde Chocolate Ganache, and Black Yuzu Ice Cream): The yuzu ice cream and creme brulee tasted better separate than together. The creme brulee was too salty for me and the yuzu ice cream just didn't go well with the rest of the flavors. I wouldn't reorder this dessert.
- Warm Chocolate Brioche Bread Pudding: The chocolate was very rich and soft. Enjoyed this more than the creme brulee.

Overall, great service, good food. The meal came out to be around $108 per person including the birthday girl's portion. Definitely worth trying. Something to mention, this restaurant is in a dark alley-way, so be careful when walking down to the middle of the block where the restaurant resides. There will be seats and tables outside to help you identify :)
author: Amanda C.

description:
Had a great evening here with my parents in town. Service was impeccable, food was excellent, and music was swinging!

Bananas Foster for desert was a highlight
author: Scott J.

description: It is an all time gem. Best oysters in town and martins are outstanding. Old school streak house with a second floor that allows for perfect people watching.
author: Maya K.

description:
DO NOT GET THE POTATO PILLOWS. Literally tasted like hash browns from McDonalds. The caviar on top is overrated and you can hardly taste it since it sits on top of a fried food. That's why it's best to have caviar on something plain so you can actually taste it (go to Petrossian in LA for caviar).

Everything else was amazing. My sister got the burger and I got the steak. My steak definitely tasted better than her burger. We also shared a chocolate dessert and that chocolate dessert was superb. It had hazelnut with some sort of cookie crust paired with coffee ice cream.

I gave it 4 stars because of the potato pillows. Seriously yelpers....
author: Ellen C.

description: The ambiance here is simply amazing! The food, cocktails, and service was wonderful, we will definitely be coming back.
author: sadaf s.

description:
If I could give this place zero stars I would the only good aspect of the restaurant is the live jazz music. 

My husband and I ordered expensive Pinot noir so naturally I was expecting very good wine, it was awful. To pay over $20 for a glass of wine and it be so bad was an unexpected waste of money. 

After the disappointment with the wine we were hoping the food would redeem our opinion about BIX. Regrettably, the food was also terrible and overpriced for its quality. 

When you pay over $200 for dinner you have certain expectations. BIX was a huge disappointment. I will never eat here again.
author: Courtney Y.

description: The food was delicious. The jazz music was amazing. If you are looking for a swanky place, you need to head here. We had a great time and would totally go back again.
author: Michelle V.

description:
Beautiful atmosphere and amazing food. The drinks are delicious and customer service is the best!! 

Highly recommend this restaurant!
author: Erika B.

description:
Food was EXEMPLARY.  The lamb was truly the "best thing I ever ate" packed with flavor and tenderness.  Delicious!  The aged NY strip was also deemed "amazing" by the husband who never orders anything but steak wherever we may travel.  The salmon was good, but was the only thing not classified above-above average.

Service was A+++.

Piano entertainment was okay.  My mother was a pianist, so I probably have too high an expectation on this one.

Complaint:  the temperature in the balcony dining was FAR to warm.  We skipped extra drinks and coffee just to escape.

We would certainly return but on a cooler day (it had gotten up to 78 that day).
author: Delora B.

description:
After feeling lucky being able to find street parking on Saturday evening in Financial District, we couldn't be more pleased. Always heard great things about Bix, and finally got to try it. The first thing I noticed when we entered this restaurant was how grand and beautiful the interior was. Dim lighting, Jazz music and Gourmet food made for a perfect combination.

Now, onto food - We ordered the Deviled Eggs and Dungeness Crab Rolls for Hors D'oeuvres. The Deviled Eggs were very good and so were the Dungeness Crab Rolls. For Entrees, I ordered the Lobster Spaghetti with Gluten free pasta and husband ordered a Salmon dish. My Lobster Spaghetti was ok. We finished our meal with desserts - Strawberry Goat's Milk Ice Cream and Chocolate Hazelnut and Coffee. I was not so impressed with the Strawberry Goat's Milk Ice Cream dessert as it tasted quite heavy and buttery to me. However, the Chocolate Hazelnut and Coffee was good. Amazing service, very receptive and accommodating to allergies. We enjoyed our food, the service and the overall experience.
author: Sun B.

description:
This is an overdue review but I took my boyfriend here as a surprise for his birthday a few months ago and I was blown away by the customer service.

Bix is a hidden gem tucked in an alley with a great atmosphere inside. Art all over the walls, live jazz musicians, and lit candles.

We arrived at our table to a birthday card greeting and had a great view of the whole restaurant below on the second floor. The food (we got dungeness crab rolls, black truffle cheese burger, and the lobster spaghetti) was all amazing. To be honest it didn't look filling at first but I was stuffed by the end. 

The incredibly attentive waitress also slyly brought out the birthday dessert with a lit candle and the manager (I think?) at one point stopped by to wish my boyfriend a happy birthday.

It's a great place to get dressed up for the night! The only thing I'd say is that it gets toasty on the second floor so I wouldn't wear anything heavy.

Nevertheless, can't wait to find an excuse to go back :)
author: Wendy C.

description: This restaurant was recommended by several friends, so we made reservations (which is a must), saved up some money, put on our fancy clothes and had a great time.  The food was fantastic. I would recommend the lobster spaghetti, and the strawberry shortcake and chocolate pudding. The entrance is in an alley, which is pretty cool. You won't regret spending a little money to eat here during your stay.
author: Kristin P.

description: Not my first time here. Drinks are good. And the food is excellent. The truffle fries and hamburger were tasty and cooked just right. Pricey though. And noisy, so beware of that. I was there on a Saturday evening. First they had a piano bar, and later a three piece band. Lots of history in the building.
author: Karen P.

description:
I am in love--- with BIX!!! Came to celebrate friend's sister's upcoming wedding. I hope she loved BIX as much as myself.

Gorgeous throwback to Mad Men era, classy, hushed, romantic as BLEEP,& and reminded me so much of the Roosevelt in NOLA.

Loved the drinks and dessert choice of Hazel's (oba, soul sister!)--- amazing amazing place tucked deep on Gold ( apropos street name too, for its what I felt I hit when I crossed its threshold).

The desserts (2) were decadent and indulgent-- perfect. Spoons in, people ! Champs was nice and bright , not dry and Brut-y, which is not the way I roll.

Aiming to come back sometime. Lovely piece of SF history-- great live jazz and bass---

Oh such an awesome spot to park it for a few--- even though I lost my Jawbone after arriving to this dark paradise!
author: Jana C.

description:
I came to BIX with a group of friends on a Tuesday night. The ambiance says, "dress up, yet we're still casual Californian serving up high quality food". Located in a small alleyway in FiDi, it reminded me of my time in New York. 

FOOD: Hanger Steak. Deviled Eggs. Potato Pillow. Tartare. I must say, the potato pillow was by far my favorite appetizer/hors d'oeuvre. The fried potato without all of that extra oil and creme fraiche to cut through the heaviness of the potato and then topped off with the caviar on top gave that umami taste at the end. The other appetizers were not as memorable as the potato pillows. 

The hanger steak was A-OK. Mine came out a little on the rarer side, but was not bad. 

SERVICE: Attentive and good. Nothing more to comment on. 

Overall, come here to impress friends for the $$$ kind of place. It's fun to dress up (San Francisco dress up) and enjoy a fancy meal!
author: Albert H.

description: We were they on Valentine's Day and it was awesome. Loved every single dish, from appetizer to main dish. Very, very good.
author: Jonathan W.

description:
Sleeper.
Probably the best description for this sexy restaurant tucked away in the Financial District's Gold Alley.  My friends gave me a gift card several years ago so I finally used it for a business lunch.  Being the Friday of the July 4th weekend, the restaurant was only about a quarter full.  After being shown a semi circular booth upstairs, we opted for a conventional one, given my portly shape.
Our waiter offered us drinks so I chose the strawberry lemonade while my guest had a signature Bloody Mary.  After a few questions, here's what I tried:

Appetizers (all shared)
1) Potato pillows (https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=rysfMkV3XiFGPRbTzKQYLQ&userid=saJuyv784apZzH--psHZ3Q) - Think rectangular tater tot (not that one, Cherylynn?!) topped with crème fraiche and sturgeon caviar.  Decadent combination and, at four per order, not a cheap app.

2) Steak tartare - Prepared/mixed tableside and served with some small baguette pieces, I believe, everyone complimented this dish and there was not a drop to be scraped from the plate when we were done.

Entree
3) Bix burger (https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?userid=saJuyv784apZzH--psHZ3Q&select=vg32_U8Ye-7vTsWe6YEtjA) - Very efficient presentation as it allows the diner to construct the burger as they like.  Great that they separated the various sauces and toppings as pictured.  I also liked that my burger was cooked medium, leaning towards the medium rare side.

While one of my guests also had a burger (cheddar cheese), the other had the chicken hash and enjoyed it.  Service was efficient as water and drink glasses were filled and empty dishes removed in a timely manner.  Since it was a workday for everyone, we passed on dessert.  Thanks to my friends for 'gifting' me this meal and my guess for making the lunch an enjoyable catch up meal.
Might be back for dinner, but need to find someone for that romantic meal.
Any takers?!
author: Mike C.

description:
Loved this place! I took my boyfriend here for his 25th birthday, and I would definitely recommend it to anyone looking to celebrate.

In the online reservation, I told them that we were celebrating a birthday. The host told him happy birthday, the waiter gave him a birthday card, and we were given a bananas foster (delicious) on the house with a candle! They made it beyond special.

Besides the birthday festivities, the restaurant in itself is such a gem. There's a top and bottom floor, live music, and amazing service. We ordered a Caesar salad, truffle fries, chicken hash, and the lobster pasta. All were amazing! It was not cheap but I will definitely be back.
author: Sinead G.

description:
Sadly I am torn between the experience and the food. The restaurant is a one of a kind experience set in a old San Francisco jazz venue. The ambiance takes you back to perhaps the 20's or 30's. The decor and ambiance was on par with what the restaurant was trying to achieve. My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed the piano entertainment as well as the jazz ensemble later on at night. The appetizers (marrow bones) were a hit as well as their fresh sourdough roll and decadent butter. 

The entrees were subpar. We had hoped for more given that this place is an institution in SF. He had the t-bone lamb (which I tried and to my dismay found it atrocious). I had the lobster spaghetti which I found lackluster. The cherry tomatoes were too abundant as the lobster (which consisted of 1 oz of lobster claw meat, not so rich and buttery), left more to be desired. The sauce was a light cream sauce which should have tied the whole dish together, but I just was confounded and disappointed at the end. I will say the saving grace of the dining experience was the truffle fries (what was that amazing white aioli) and the bananas foster we ended our meal with. 

All in all, this place is an iconic terrific venue with such an amazing old school jazz feel. The music/entertainment takes you to such a great state of mind. The appetizers and deserts are to die for. I may suggest to do your research on the entrees and to get recommendations. Stay away from the t-bone lamb and the lobster spaghetti. This left more to be desired.
author: Lynn E.

description: Lovely place to enjoy a romantic dinner. The servers are amazing, the food is delicious and location you can't beat it.
author: Michael M.

description: Would not recommend this place for the food. Ambience is great, service is spectacular, drinks are good, but the food is incredibly mediocre.  We were excited to try the potato pillows and deviled eggs based on good reviews we had read, but both were underwhelming (the potato pillows are McDonald's hash browns with caviar thrown on top).  For our entrees we tried the duck breast and sole.  While we enjoyed the duck, the sole might as well have been called "white fish doused in Sunny D".  The citrus flavor felt cheap and overwhelming for such a delicate piece of fish.  This is a place you go to for drinks and jazz, but avoid spending $200 on a meal you wish you could forget.
author: Alex C.

description: Great service and attention to detail. First time dining experience at Bix and Jonathan was so accommodating to my friend's dietary requirements. The food was terrific. The Bone marrow was spectacular and the lobster spaghetti delicious. Can't wait to come back.
author: Stewart H.

description:
Came here for a business dinner. 

Service was nice, everyone seemed super helpful in making sure we were seated and taken care of drinks wise. 

My drink of choice was a Nico, which is literally like spiked spa water. I loved it. But I ordered it twice and got the same looking drink that didn't taste at all the same. So someone messed up somewhere. 

For starters we tried:

Deviled Eggs - These were delish, I had two. Not sure you can go wrong with these. 

Potato Pillows - They were literally fancy mini McDonalds hash browns, so if you like the hashbrowns at MickyD's, you'll love these. I just feel like everything overpowered the caviar, so you can't really taste it like you should. It's almost just there for show. 

Croques - These were yummy. Not tasty enough for me to grab two but good enough to finish my one. 

Oysters - We ordered 4 platters of which were...well...what I expected. I've had better. 

Lobster Spaghetti - this was the bell of the ball. The noodles were tender, the lobster was juicy and the sauce was light but still perfectly flavorful. I opted to go without the jalapeños so it was also very mild. I loved this dish. 

Banana Foster - Delicious. 

All in all the food was decent, my only reason for the low rating is that the second I got home after dinner, nothing (and I mean nothing) stayed down. Something I ate gave me food poisoning because I ended up sick through the entire night (Thursday, July 20th), which sucks because I very much wanted to like this place.
author: Veronica S.

description:
This place was perfect for dinner night! The ambiance is lovely with live music. I love live music!
Can't beat their great cocktails and food. 

The staff was very attentive and informative. 
We ordered Foie Gras Torchon, Marrow Bones, Trout and duck breast.
All dishes were on point with seasoning and the way they were prepared. Delicious!
The Foie Gras came with strawberry rhubarb preserves, balsamic and grilled bread. 
It literally melts in your mouth. Also, The marrow is salted and cooked to perfection. 
I had so many bone marrows that were TOO salty at other resturants. 
Bix know how to keep it consistent 
The trout skin was crispy - the way I like my fish. The duck breast was out of this world!
I will be coming back again with my girl friends. Great hidden gem in SF.
author: Christina L.

description:
The food too expensive, I order fish I will rank it D.
The music/band very nice .
I would come just for desert and music nothing else.
author: Nava E.

description:
The ambiance is beautiful, old school, and romantic. The lights are dim for dinner, and there are comfy booths upstairs. There is enough room between the tables that you can have a quiet conversation. 

The lobster spaghetti came in a generous portion size, but everything else was definitely on the smaller side. The savory bread pudding (vegetarian entree) was flavorful and delicious, but small. You would want to also order an appetizer for sure. 

The truffle deviled eggs were great and had a special kick to them. Everything was beautifully presented. 

I would recommend this restaurant for a special night out like a family dinner (of 5 people or less) or date night.
author: Leeyen R.

description: BIX was everything it was made out to be; Romantic, Delicious, with Attentive service. Walking into BIX, we were greeted by a friendly hostess who was able to seat us early, which was very accommodating. My fiancé and I were seated at an intimate corner booth, and immediately approached by our friendly server who offered us water and the wine list. We discussed the menu with our server who was well versed in wine and the different items on their dinner menu. My fiancé had seen a salmon dish on their online menu, but the salmon had been replaced with halibut for the evening. Not a problem, there were plenty of other options that caught his eye. We tried the oysters (incredibly fresh), the steak tartare (prepared table side! How fun!) , the Lamb entree and the Lobster Spaghetti (the specialty of the house!), and the Hot fudge bread pudding (yum yum!). Our server and buster were both very attentive, our wine glasses were never left empty! Everything was phenomenal and we will DEFINITELY be coming back with friends and family. Thank you again, BIX!
author: Nicole W.

description:
We recently booked a rehearsal dinner at BIX for a large party of 22 people, and it was an amazing way to kick off the weekend's events.  Working with Amy to finalize the reservation logistics, customize the menu and get some wine suggestions made the whole process quite easy.  The atmosphere was great sitting upstairs; semi private area at our own tables made for great conversation but still part of the overall energy of the room.  

Food and service excellent on all points.  From the pre fix menu, the coconut lime soup, deviled eggs, lobster spaghetti, and sea bass were crowd favorites.  Recommended wine selections were also all great and within our budget.
author: Matthew B.

description:
Yet another Yelp review where I would like to give 4.5 stars - one thing prevents me from going the distance with 5 stars.

First off, a place that focuses on cocktails and great live jazz is always a welcome option for me. Love the speakeasy vibe of the place.

The Perfect Manhattan does not disappoint. Great choice of a quality rye, and the ideal blend of dry and sweet vermouth. Well done.

Love the preparation of steak tartare at the table. Also had an amazing take on the Taiwanese gua bao sandwich, with duck confit and foie gras substituting for the pork belly. 

For mains, recommend the lobster spaghetti. The sauce augments the rich, buttery flavor of lobster with perfectly cooked spaghetti, adding a savory and sweet touch with cherry tomatoes.

For dessert, the bananas foster will not disappoint. Ideal New Orleans-inspired dessert to reinforce the jazz vibe, and perfectly executed.

OK, so why not five stars? The salt content on a few dishes was a bit over the top. I was with some friends from France and we all agreed the tartare was over-seasoned, especially on the salt. Ditto for the open-faced black truffle burger.

That aside, look forward to revisiting this little gem of a place. Love the music, the cocktails, and there are plenty of other great items on the menu to explore. Definitely will ensure someone at the table gets the lobster spaghetti.
author: Darrin K.

description: While some reviews commented on a snarky wait staff we looked forward to a  wonderful dinner for a birthday celebration with good friends. Five stars for the bar, the atmosphere the and the food were out of this world.  For all practical counts this would have been a 5 star review.  However everything was overshadowed by the constant pressure to order and finish our meal and move on.  This started within the first 10 minutes after we sat down....and culminated with  the maitre d telling us that he needed the table and to leave (we had only been here 2 hours and we were still ordering and drinking).   This is not the kind of treatment we would expect at a five star restaurant or any restaurant that would treat their clientele.  When we commented to the maitre d and he said that he had to run a business and that means they won't make money unless they turn the tables and this is a business and he didn't  care about how we felt he had to make money.  This pressure moved what would have been a solid 5 star experience to a 2 star review.  So if you plan on eating here make sure you plan for a short evening
author: Linda W.

description: Super fancy restaurant with excellent and attentive service. The food was absolutely amazing! I love to try deviled eggs everywhere I go and I feel like the ones here are almost as good as Leo's Oyster Bar. We ordered a ton of appetizers and I got the salmon for dinner. There was a piano player and singer downstairs which made the ambiance a little romantic. The lighting inside was dim which also made it super chill and relaxing. I would recommend this place to anyone going on a date or any type of dress up occasion really! Don't show up in jeans like I did, you will feel out of place haha.
author: Samantha R.

description: I took my boyfriend to Bix's for his birthday and I was blown away by the entire experience. I was a bit worried by some of the reviews on Open Table so after my experience I was compelled to write a review. First and foremost the service was impeccable! I can honestly say the best service I've received at a restaurant. The restaurant is beautiful with a retro 1920's feel which I fell in love with. The bar and dinner menu pays homage to the 20's with a modern twist. We ordered the steak tartare, porterhouse lamb,chicken hash and a few drinks from the bar and everything was amazing. Not to mention the live jazz music was a nice added bonus. We really enjoyed ourselves and we will be going back.
author: natasha t.

description: The music was outstanding, and the vibe of the restaurant is terrific. Could not have asked for better service. The food was really good, but not quite 5 stars.  Cesar salad was bland. Really bland. A bit disappointing, I expected anchovies, and a lovely garlicky salad- definitely needs improvement. The steak tartare was done table-side and was lovely, great balance of flavors. Bone marrow was generous- the parsley shallot accompaniment was a little lackluster though. The NY strip was bland. We asked for sauces on the side but it came swimming in sauce. I didn't love the flavor, and wished it was seasoned. Swordfish was tiny in size - like a chunk really, and delicious. Cooked beautifully. The lamb powerhouse is awesome, and very small in size. Don't think "porterhouse" think medallions.  The interpretation Black Forest cake is not very good in our opinion. Strange flavor. The sorbet, however was amazing!!!!!!
author: Mo F.

description:
Food 3*
Ambience 5* 
I say this because first of all, trying to find this place was fin. They are hidden down a seemingly seedy alley with a dim lit sign saying BIX. Very cool vibe here. We came in without a reservation and were lucky enough to grab a seat at the bar. A foursome had just closed out and we only waited for abut 5 mins. My bf had a manhattan I think because it just felt like you should. The bar is dark and bustling. An old school feel. The restaurant and the upstairs dining area feels formal but very old world. We also tried the scallops. They came sliced thin with herbs and a light sauce,  but a tad on the salty side. Enough to share with one other if you are sharing dishes. Not enough for your meal. We also ordered a lobster salad, they split is for us and I must say there wasn't much on either of our plates. But I loved the flavor of the dressing, the peppery arugula and the fresh herbs. The lobster was a bit fishy on both of your plates. The bartender ended up taking it off our bill which was very sweet because we didn't make a big deal about it. The dinner menu looked nice and I would have probably dined here but we had other plans. The drinks were spot on.
author: Valerie M.

description:
Finding the restaurant was interesting...
Residing down a shady alley was kinda cool. You walk in and the place is amazing! Large place, friendly staff. It was very decorated for Xmas which gave it some charm. Live music didn't suck
The scallops and the steak tartare were outstanding. Definitely a romantic restaurant that my wife and I would go back to.
author: Eric H.

description:
The location of this place is super cute, in this narrow alley way. I was surprised our Uber fit in there, lol. We arrived pretty late around 9:30pm on a Sunday but were seated fairly quickly because I made last minute reservations online for hubby and I. I loved the live piano player and singer. Food was yummy. I specifically remember the truffle fries being amazing. Slightly on the pricier side, but the ambiance and vibe makes up for it. Very classy, jazz feel. I liked that it was two stories and enjoyed the decor/paintings on the wall as well. 

Only downside was that the dinner/seating area is so close to the bar and there was a really drunk/rowdy guy in a group. He totally killed the mood, he kept screaming at the top of his drunk lungs, it was super awkward. Eventually he left, but I don't think any of the waitstaff or hosts said anything to him to calm down - which we didn't appreciate. Given the vibe of the place you would think they would tell him to relax or leave... 

Overall, would recommend this place for a date night. We came from out of town, from NY. P.S. - I found this place on Yelp, so thanks fellow Yelpers.
author: Tanzima R.

description:
Food and service fantastic:  the duck is to die for!

Our party of 5 went whole hog:  lots of appetizers, including foie gras, oysters, potatoe pillows, deviled eggs, and something else.  Plus entries (the lobster spaghetti was enjoyed by both of my adult sons), that lamb was probably the biggest dinner at our table, plus the NY steak.  Wine, dessert, coffees, and some whisky brought the bill to $600.00 including tip.

The only real negative about this restaurant is that it is unnecessarily dark downstairs.  You can barely read the menus, but the decor would look so much better with a bit more lighting.  The piano was great (now I feel bad I didn't tip him).

The waitstaff were very pleasant, but because the background noise (and music) drowned them out, it was difficult to hear about specials, etc.

A bit pricey, but we had a memorable and enjoyable celebration, and nothing went wrong with the service or food!  Looking forward to next time!
author: Yelp R.

description:
When the roommate's in SF, we normally keep it simple and get delivery or takeout. Last Tuesday, November 3rd, the roommate realized we hadn't gone out for dinner in a while and told me to pick a restaurant. Scrolling through OpenTable (www.opentable.com), I saw an opening for Bix at 6pm and decided to take it. I've had it bookmarked forever. Plus, I've never had any luck making same day reservations for a 6pm dinner, so I thought it was meant to be.

Drinks:
*PERFECT MANHATTAN: George Dickel Rye, Dolin Dry & Carpano Antica Sweet Vermouths Bitters ($13)
*2014 Sauvignon Blanc, Duckhorn, Napa Valley, CA ($15)
*2012 Cabernet Sauvignon, Pied à Terre, Sonoma County, CA ($18)

Their cocktails are delish. I definitely enjoyed my Manhattan. The wines by the glass are a little pricey in my opinion. I thought they should have offered some glasses priced closer to $10. There were a few, but no Sauvignon Blancs or Cabs in that price range. I picked the cheapest ones.

Food:
*Dungeness Crab Rolls: Meyer Lemon Aioli ($18)
*Deviled Eggs: Truffles, Radish ($12)
*Foie Gras Torchon: Pears, Walnut and Pear Coulis, Candied Walnuts ($23)
*Marrow Bones: Parsley & Shallot Salad, Grilled Durum Batard ($18)
*Compart Farms Pork Chop: Warm Autumn Salad, Squash, Radicchio, Apples, Maitake Mushrooms, Pomegranate Vinaigrette ($29)
*Black Truffle Cheese Burger: On Rye with Truffle Fries, served open-faced ($28)
*Bananas Foster: Dark Rum & Vanilla Ice Cream ($10)

My favorite dish was the bone marrow. Three very generous bone halves filled with rich fatty marrow. Yum! The crab rolls and deviled eggs were good small bites to start off our meal. My coworker raves about the truffle burger and the bananas foster. I thought they were good, but not mind blowing. I ordered the burger medium rare which was a mistake on my part. I should have asked for it medium as the flavors and textures would have melded together better. The bananas foster was just eh in my opinion. I'm not a huge fan of melting ice cream, but I liked the bananas and rum sauce. I didn't eat much of the duck, but the roommate finished the whole dish. The one thing that was disappointing was the torchon. It didn't have much of the decadent foie flavor that I love.

I didn't really notice anything off about service, but the roommate mentioned that our server wasn't very attentive. Our water glasses were empty most of the night and plates took a while to be cleared. When I mentioned we're in a drought, he said he saw the older couple next to us getting water refills and plates cleared promptly all night long. Yes, there was a lag in between courses for us, but I didn't really mind. We did have an incredibly long dinner though.

After spending a little over $200 on dinner for two before tax and tip, I wanted the food to better. Overall, everything was just okay. Glad I finally tried Bix, but other than checking a restaurant off my list, I didn't really walk away with much.
author: Elena N.

description:
Saw the neon sign, walked through the doors, and thought wow, this place looks nice. 
The decor and artwork transports you to the classy 1920s era. Time-travel + dinner? I'm in. You may want to dress nicely. Usually, I say any attire is acceptable in SF, because it's a casual city. But in the '20s, gentlemen and ladies were known for being classy, so you probably should try to look classy too.

The cozy, intimate setting was warm, inviting, and just right. If anyone is attempting an intimate, romantic, candlelit setting, they ought to learn a thing or two from Bix. It didn't feel too cozy or cramped at all. Bix has been around since 1988, so they must be doing something right.

Mr. Joy made reservations and we were led upstairs to the balcony level that was full of booths. Booths are comfy, kind of classy, give you a little privacy, and girls like to have a place to rest their handbags. Am I right? 

All the while, the sound of jazz music lightly emanated from downstairs. 
I was starting to wonder how the waiters got themselves up and down the stairs all night, but I think they go through some secret elevator.

$18 Potato Pillows - Crème Fraîche, California Sturgeon Caviar:
It was the most interesting sounding of the hors d'ouvre choices. 
4 delicate potato puffs resting on a napkin, like pillows on bedding ... very nice touch.
The first thing that came to my mind: This is one expensive version of MickyD's hash browns from their breakfast menu. I'm not knocking the dish. I like McD's hash browns, but I just never get there early enough to order breakfast. 
Was it elevated? Certainly. 
Crispy & crunchy on the outside, nice and puffed up inside. 
Each had a dollop of creme fraiche. The flavor of the salty sturgeon caviar stood out, but was not heavily briny or salty as a lot of caviar is known to be.
I tried to eat them slowly, because they were so small and I wanted to savor them.

$24 Chicken Hash a la Bix - Mascarpone Vodka Sauce:
I was attracted to the idea of hash that night, but it seemed more like I ordered two chicken patties over a light cream sauce, adorned with halved cherry tomatoes. 
I liked the vodka sauce, but it didn't have enough flavor. Chicken already doesn't have much flavor, so I was hoping the sauce would do it.
I did feel like they did something interesting with chicken, but not something I would crave. 

$28 Black Truffle Cheese Burger - On Rye with Truffle Fries, served open-faced:
Thick, juicy beef patty cooked just right - medium-rare, golden brown on the outside, and pink on the inside. The cheese was melted over the patty just the way I like. It was topped with an entire ring of caramelized onions. Great, that's the only way I'll eat onions on a burger. None of that annoying raw onion nonsense. It was accompanied with a pile of arugula on the side. I wasn't all that interested in an open-faced burger though.
I don't care for fries,  but Mr. Joy, the French fry lover, said the fries were good, but couldn't really taste the flavor of truffles.

$10 Warm Chocolate Brioche Bread Pudding:
This was more like a rich chocolate brownie topped with a mound of vanilla ice cream, and drizzled with chocolate sauce. If I didn't know what it was, I wouldn't have guessed that this is bread pudding. It doesn't have the consistency or texture of bread pudding, or the custard flavor of bread pudding. 
However it is, of course, delicious. It's hard not to like chocolate. Hot, gooey, rich, decadent, fudgy chocolate.

This would probably be 5 stars for me if I were more wowed by the food. I should have stuck to my usual favorites and ordered the steak tartare or bone marrow. I'm not sure about the foie gras since it has quinoa in it, but if I come back, I'd be interested in trying it.
author: Joy W.

description: Wonderful menu with really interesting dishes and flavoursome food. Very nice atmosphere and really delicious food. The staff was friendly and knowledgeable.
author: Osvaldo F.

description:
Was taken here for my bday. Loved the ambiance. It wasn't too big and was in a hidden alleyway which was cool. 

The food was delicious. I loved every dish I ordered (see pics for details). 

Service was good. I'd recommend checking this place out and I'd definitely come back!
author: Lucky N.

description: Walked here randomly after a visit to our estate lawyer a few blocks down.  I found the restaurant on yelp when I was looking for a place with brussel sprouts.  OMG the food, drinks, and service were excellent.  Highly recommend!
author: Viv C.

description: Came here for my birthday and was treated to a nostalgic aura of old, if that makes any sense!?!  You'll know what I mean when you go.  We had a reservation and was seated right away, although our dinner reservation was at 9:30 pm there were still people waiting to get seated.  We were treated with great service, good food, and live jazz entertainment.  Of course, there's no parking so expect to do valet... didn't take long to get our car.  Weather and the mood of the night was perfect so nothing can go wrong.  San Francisco is the Paris of the West.
author: Bess M.

description: As always loved the experience, been coming to this swank place for over 25 years and never forgotten how delightful it is to sit and eat. The food was splendid and the service was on point. The selection of top shelf liquor cabinet and wine list kept my attention. Their version of a Manhattan is very delightful. This drink is always a great start to the perfect night out. They continue to have music on certain nights so prepare to be wowed by the dinner jazz. The atmosphere is plush and feels like something out of the 1940's. All in all it's a great Saturday night out place.
author: Jon S.

description:
This review is based on a dinner dining on a Friday night..

1) parking: nonexistent on the street they're on, unless you get lucky and find a spot on a near by street - otherwise its valet only.
2) Indoor lighting: poor and bad - makes everything look orange.. the dishes look very colorful and pretty only if you use your phone light to see them otherwise everything looks like different shades of brown.  Also had to use flashlight to read the menu.. yes.. that bad unless you have perfect vision!
3) Food:  although excellent, the portions are total hit and miss.. some plate are baby servings and some are manly servings.. we had to order an additional entree after our food arrived.
4) Ambience:  Although trying to be romantic with live jazz play in background, unfortunately its like an open hall so it gets very loud.
5) Service: very attentive.

Overall experience: pleasant and a solid 4 star..  If it were a little quieter with better lighting it would be a 5 all day.
author: Danny D.

description:
I have wanted to try Bix for YEARSSSSS. I knew I wanted to try their Friday lunch (they ONLY do lunch on Fridays) and I had taken the last Friday of the year off. On Friday morning, I woke up late, not knowing what to do with my day off, and decided, you know what? Today is the day. We're doing this. With it being basically a day that no one was working, and right before a holiday, I figured the crowd wouldn't be bad, because the financial district crowd wouldn't be there. I was correct. I made a reservation a few hours ahead of time, and flounced in there at 12:30 PM and was seated immediately. 

First of all: Bix is SOOOOOOOOO pretty. Like, my heart pitter pattered when I walked in there. It's so classic looking, so beautifully old school. I'm already dying to return on a night when someone is playing the beautiful grand piano that I saw sitting there. 

We ordered deviled eggs to start, and they were perfect. I'm getting aroused just thinking about them. I had the chicken hash, which was unlike anything I have ever had. I will warn you that it is a rich dish, so I would suggest sharing it with someone, and having half of whatever they're eating. That's what I ended up doing with my husband, who ordered the burger. Granted, a burger isn't exactly a huge move from the rich category, lol. But the burger was great, the fries were great, and we both LOVED the chicken hash. I would say a must try dish, as it is very unique. Our server told us that it is one of the dishes that never leaves the menu, because it is always in demand (along with the lobster spaghetti.) We finished with the Bix Millionaire Bar for dessert, which was heavenly. iT was like a Twix bar, with caramel and chocolate. I guess IT changes flavor by the year though, because now I'm seeing that their menu has it with peppermint. 

Our server was very nice, and very attentive. Food and drinks came out in a timely manner. Atmosphere was dreamy. Take someone you love there and hold their hand and gaze into their eyes and order martinis and then float out of there. I plan on coming back to try dinner and listen to the piano!
author: Liz M.

description: One of my favorite restaurants for good food and live jazz music. They regularly have jazz musicians and singers perform in the evening and they're absolutely wonderful. The inside of the restaurant is masterfully decorated, has high ceilings, and gives off a traditional feel. Just my type of place. It has two floors, with the second floor acting as a kind of balcony to observe the performance below. The bar is very nice too. The waiters there are super courteous and professional. It seems like a hole in the wall from the outside, in a dark alley, but once you walk through the doors, you'll see that it's a gem of a place.
author: Chris L.

description:
Everything from the music to the servers to the chefs to the ambiance and the food was amazing.  Went here with my GF for her 30th bday and we were blown away.

The spot is definitely pricey but it's worth every penny. 

TRY THE BONE MARROW!!!
author: Felix N.

description:
Fantastic place -- quickly becoming one of my favorite spots in SF.

My faves:
Steak tartare - just like what I used to have in Paris. Phenomenal balance of flavor and great quality meat. I try to get this each time when I am here. 

Lobster spaghetti - I was a bit hesitant given the I have always thought of the restaurant to be more meat heavy but this seafood pasta is perfectly cooked. The pasta al dente. The lobster In the just the right sizes without being over cooked. The tomato bursting with flavor without garlic overwhelming the dish which often happens in NY traditional Italian places. 

This place also had a great list of wine by the glass. I had a glass of graves (white Bordeaux) and Pinot Gris from willamette valley and they never disappoint.
author: Rebecca C.

description:
This place is just wow. The staff was extremely good and really knew everything about the menu and what wine to pair it with. 

I had the salmon as main and it was the best salmon I ever had. Finishing with some melon sorbet the server said "was worth living for" and it was spot on.

When I looked at the menu it felt it was a bit to pricy but not after eating there.
author: Calle W.

description:
Great ambience and food. It also has live music and it's tucked away in an ally which takes you back to prohibition period.
 
Nice bar and staff!
author: Lupita M.

description: The deviled eggs and potato crisp appetizers (forgot actual name of dish) are incredible. Price is steep but live jazz and New York type of environment is generally worth it
author: Ken M.

description: Food and desserts are delicious. The place is Cozy and beautiful and great for special occasions. I just had my 34 years wedding anniversary. The staff are out of this world with the service and hospitality. I highly recommend this place to anyone.
author: George A.

description:
Very disappointed. Definitely not vegetarian friendly. In a city like San Francisco, I would expect there to be at a minimum some vegetarian options even if just 1 or 2. There was one sub-par option not really allowing me to enjoy with the party I was with.

More than menu choices, the service was poor too. Jorge was our server - I called him out asking a few times but I got a rude response not representative of what I thought was an up-scale spot. Out of the appetizer course I ordered, it didn't come with the appetizers for the rest of the group and the items showed up with the main course which basically defeats the point.

I would highly recommend folks avoid Bix.
author: Sachin T.

description:
BIX is hands down my favorite spot in the city (so far!) for jazz. The service from the moment you say hi to the valet guys outside to the moment you leave, it is impeccable. I was really astonished with how genuinely kind and friendly everyone was. I usually anticipate a little 'tude or air of pretentiousness, but not here. Service is fantastic. The decor is PERFECT. It is dark enough for my liking, dimly lit for date night perfection. Everything is wood and leather and old school elevated feeling. It has two stories, and is very spacious by SF standards. I love the vibe and music I have heard here. Even the musicians are friendly and smiley! 

BUT here's the kicker...the food! It was disappointingly mediocre. I had the nearly $40 lobster pasta. The pasta was NOT cooked. It definitely wasn't homemade which is OK, but it wasn't cooked! It had this really odd rubber texture. I was with a group of 4 and 3 of ordered it. I finally said something and everyone sighed and agreed! I think no one wanted to say anything. I've never had pasta with that hard rubber texture before. The lobster was sufficient, but I couldn't get past that pasta! I do wish I had said something because everyone was so helpful I know they would have fixed it without hesitation. I was with a group of 4 I didn't know well and didn't want to be the girl that sent food back. I won't stop going to BIX but I'll probably skip dinner and have drinks at the bar.
author: Jane R.

description:
So....this might be in my list of worst meals in SF? I know, I know, can SF even have bad food? Why yes it can and it tastes even worse when you pay too much. I feel bad for the low ratings. I'm not picky, and I came in with zero expectations as I hadn't heard of this place. The ambience was nice and dim, with nice jazz tunes playing in the background. The two story restaurant is beautiful, with art deco lamps. Service was good.
