The food....oh the food.....severely overcooked and over-seasoned. 1 star for the atmosphere, the second star for the crab roll appetizer
We ordered the:

Crab roll- Best item of the night. Perfectly seasoned crab atop a buttery toasted bread cup? I guess would be the best way to describe it. The crab tasted fresh. 

Peppercorn crusted steak with mashed potatoes- The peppercorn seasoning was overpowering the steak. I sliced the outer layer off to tone the flavors down. "You're brown, how can food taste over seasoned to you?!" they made it happen, and you just don't do that to steak, damn it!

Seabass with shrimp- This was the worst dish, by far. The shrimp and fish were really rubbery. The sauce had an extremely strong licorice flavor? It completely overpowered the entire dish. We were hungry, but didn't finish this dish. Even the price tag wasn't enough motivation for my greedy butt to take another bite.

We left, disappointed. How could this happen?! We could've tried a handful of other restaurants that promised more, but no.........
You lied to us, Yelp reviews.......you lied...........
author: Sadia C.

description: This restaurant is more fitting for people with an old soul who appreciate jazz and for non-ragey couples celebrating or wanting to enjoy a fancy night out. We got some kind of an appetizer sampler which was deeeelicious. I got the lobster spaghetti which I thought was just aaaiiitteee... People were dressed very nicely (women wearing dresses for example), so I felt under dressed with my black jacket and black pants. The music isn't loud (I expected it to be super loud). I'll definitely come back but probably to chill at the bar with good friends! Love the alley this restaurant is in!
author: Annie S.

description: Celebrated my husband's 29th Birthday here in October! I loved that we walked down a hidden alley near north beach to the restaurant with a glowing sign outside. The food was good, the drinks tasty, but the ambiance was the detail that made this restaurant stand out. The live jazz, oversized paintings on the wall, dimmed lighting, and a sultry stairway leading to the intimate table tucked upstairs were the cherry on top. We ordered the marrow bones to share to start- I would give 8/10. They are delicious and classic, but I wouldn't order again. For mains, hubby had the lamb it was medium rare and seared to perfection. 9/10, the crispy rice accompaniment was paired perfectly for a fall meal. I had the famous lobster spaghetti, 8/10. It was good, but not as amazing as I had expected. The sauce had a hint of spice, cherry tomatoes, and fresh tasty lobster. I am also the type of diner that is not necessarily impressed by a dish unless it is unique and memorable. I feel I could've made the lobster spaghetti myself. Dessert was a nice sorbet with a happy birthday message. There were about 6 birthdays situated around us. The two couples to the right also had birthdays. It's a romantic place to take an intimate group of friends or partner to celebrate their birthday in style. The only negative I have about the experience was that our waiter didn't seem engaged at all, and actually seemed displeased that we had shared our first course and not ordered dessert besides the birthday gift. He seemed to want to sell more to get a better tip. We did not let his nonchalant attitude bother us. The other staff were very nice and friendly, I would go back but would hope the service would be friendlier and engaging.
author: Lisa H.

description: Great evening. I was hesitant to book based on some of the negative reviews where there was a consistent theme about rushing people. Our experience was different!  We made an 8 pm reservation and arrived at 7:20 to get a drink at the bar before dinner. When we arrived there was a table available and they seated us early. The waitress was great and specifically said "no rush" when we weren't ready to order a drink right away. We both had an appetizer and then a main course. The food was excellent. After we finished, we chose not to get desert and sat for a few minutes after we paid the bill. The manager, Will, then came over and politely asked if there was anything else we needed.  We knew this was our cue that they needed the table and after 2.5 hours, we were ready so we got up. As we were walking out, Will thanked us for recognizing that he needed the table and offered us a drink at the bar which we took advantage of. He came over once more and chat for a few minutes. Classy joint, great service, atmosphere and food. Thanks for a great night!!!
author: Bruce F.

description:
Upscale atmosphere, service, food, and live music. I had a fantastic time in a 6 top booth upstairs with friends, but I also imagine it would be a great date night place. Our waiter was attentive and super nice even though we were being rowdy and difficult customers. The sea bass entree was delicious. The bartender made me a custom cocktail when I asked for "something with gin and elderflower" -- amazing! 
Chocolate ganache dessert was great, and they gave us all complementary sorbet scoops with sparklers for a birthday.
author: Rachel D.

description:
After I finished grad school a few years ago, I built a strong network of grad school friends.  We promised to meet at least once a month to catch up on our lives, careers etc. For the first year, we did pretty well and kept that promise. Then our lives took over and one of us moved further down the Peninsula.  So this once a month affair turned into a once year affair with all of the changes that happened in our lives.  

After settling on a date and time, I checked out our options and decided to go for Bix. I've had Bix on my radar for years and for some reason never had the chance to make reservations until recently.   I was excited.  This place has been raved about from many of my friends and I've read several articles about it.  It's been in the SF restaurant industry for quite some time.  

The place has an old school club vibe to it.  Not too stuffy and the service was amazing.  Our waiter was wonderful and he never skipped a beat.  I ordered a bellini (get it - it's delicious!) and we shared the following dishes: 

fried chicken (lite crispy bites of fried chicken - my friends loved it)
burrata with tomatoes (they dress it at your table; my expectations of this were high so I thought it could be better but definitely still good)
ceasar salad (it was ok)
spaghetti with lobster (delicious!) 

For dessert, we ordered the bananas foster and another dish.  Definitely get the bananas foster!  It's sweet but delicious.  We all loved it.  

It can get a bit loud in there so if you want a quieter area, request the upstairs.  I will definitely be back for drinks and happy hour soon. This can be a nice place for a date or a business dinner.
author: Christine P.

description:
I really really enjoyed my meal here. It's off the main road in an alley, but the inside is spacious with a great dark and lively atmosphere. We were there for my grandmother's birthday - they had a table of 12, and we were placed next to them at a table of 4 since we were added on. They could've made a bigger table, but then everyone would have to do the prix fixe menu. 

The food and service was spectacular. We started with the potato pillows and crab rolls which were delicious. Then we got a dozen oysters - 2 types split even. For entrees, I had the lobster spaghetti which was good but a little small for the price I was paying. My family members had the sea bass and pork chop which were very good as well. 

Would definitely return! Highly satisfied with my experience.
author: Margaret K.

description:
3.5/5 solid stars

The restaurant is a bit hidden in the alley way, but very accessible to public transportation, Bart.

We came here for dinner and we ordered the following:

1) BIX Fried chicken: 4/5 VERY GOOD and tender. ALMOST perfect. It was a bit too saucy and salty for me, but nonetheless, delicious.

2) Marrow Bones: 3.5/5 Marrow good, but the toast for the marrow could've been better. I ended up using the house bread for my bone marrow. I asked the staff to pack the bone home for my pup and they did! Thanks. He loved it!

3)Black Truffle Cheese Burger: 3.5/5 YUM! I love how it is open face. The fries were delicious as well.

4) Lobster Spaghetti: 3/5 I wasn't a fan. It was a bit bland for me, but my friend enjoyed it. She devoured all of it!

5) Warm Chocolate Brioche Bread Pudding:3/5 this was OK. Would've have been better if there was some ice cream a la mode to go with this dish.
author: Jen H.

description: Tucked away in a skinny alley, you can go back in time and eat, drink and listen to some awesome Jazz. A very speakeasy feel. Awesome Bar, upstairs and downstairs, very interesting menu and of course excellent service. Bix made my birthday special and unforgettable... I'll be back!!! The food is amazing!!
author: Cecilia D.

description:
We made family dinner reservations at Bix after waiting too late to get them at Foreign Cinema. I didn't realize how big of a step down this would be, and I thought the 30s-40s theme would make this fun, but it wasn't enough to make up for mostly lackluster food and service.

DRINKS: Parents ordered three drinks, none were made correctly. We shared a bottle of a decent cab, but prices are either under $50 or a couple hundred, range seemed to be inconsistent. 
APPETIZERS: The potato pillows were divine, but be aware the portion is very small (4 bite size pieces), bone marrow was decent, and the avocado salad was better than expected. The apps were promising but entrees were a step down.
ENTREES: Pork was juicy but bland and underseasoned, duck breast was a generous portion but unusually tough, lobster spaghetti (split portion) was cooked nicely al dente but featured maybe an ounce of lobster and a mediocre tomato-heavy sauce. The side of fresh green beans that our server recommended was the highlight of this course, sadly. 
DESSERT: We got the chocolate brandied cherries, which was very rich. Coffees were better made than the drinks, surprisingly.

Service was awkward and table for four was a very tight fit. Server brought our wine, dropped it to the table corked, came back and opened it a few minuets later, offered to clear out serving plates between appetizer rounds then didn't follow through, just not on par with the price point or expectations for this caliber restaurant.
author: Stefany V.

description:
Sadly this review is overdue almost to the point of ridiculousness. That said, I remember the experience very fondly (even three years later). What still stands out to me was the service, and as my review draft only named our fabulous waiter--Stu--I guess that's what stood out to me that night, too.

There's a long list of restaurants I've yet to try in San Francisco, but I'm sure I'll be back at BIX.
author: Amanda P.

description: I came here for dinner late last night. Bix is a beautiful space; the lighting is dim and warm, the paintings and framework gorgeous, and the live jazz music makes for perfect ambiance. Our service was fantastic, the server was attentive and made sure every need was met. I had the salmon tartar and the bass, both were excellent dishes. I removed a star because the espresso martini was dissatisfactory and the bread was hard.
author: Leann W.

description: Tired menu, tired furnishings.  A San Francisco Icon that could do better.  Was here a week before Xmas for lunch.   Slow service.  But really, the menu (the food was okay) and the furniture (very worn out and faded) really made me give Bix a so so rating.  Not a cheap place.   Given its location, where business lunches and dinners are part of the environment, it is not unreasonable to expect a little more.
author: Norwich Lover V.

description:
Had an amazing time at BIX. Great vibes, live jazz band playing, great service. Loved it. Definitely great for special occasions. 

Food: We had the lobster spaghetti and lamb t-bone. Both dishes were AMAZING. For appetizers, we had crab rolls, which were okay. Absolutely loved the food. 

Vibe: The place has a classic, early 1900's design/art. The live jazz band was really good, definitely added to the fun. 

Service: This was my biggest issue with the night. We had a reservation through opentable, but weren't seated for about 45 minutes. Everyone was very polite, but this just took way too long.
author: Juan C.

description:
This is a very good restaurant. 

If the bartender was a little more chatty and pleasant I would have given them 5 stars. 

The food was excellent, I started with the foie gras and it was delicious. We moved to the bone marrow and that was equally as good. We ended with the meatballs as an appetizer and they were fantastic. We skip the salads and went right to the main course and I got the lobster spaghetti which I ate every bite, which is rare, and my buddy got the duck breast which was equally as good. We finished with the desserts which were fairly good
author: Brad M.

description:
Food was nice, the wait person was nice.  It took forever for our food to arrive.  Sure made you gobble up your small portions.  I had to laugh at the review I read about the Cesar Salad with 4 pieces of romaine! Ha! I almost felt guilty taking a taste of 1/2 a lettuce leaf off my hubby's plate. He was lucky.  He got 6 little leaves.

I was super disappointed at how LOUD it was there. I thought the place was supposed to be about enjoying music and food.  It felt like I was eating fancy food in an out of control school cafeteria while trying to listen to good music(the solo pianist, then the Trio were great but we could barely hear them play.) I found myself thinking about Beethoven and his ear trumpet, since it was hard to have a conversation with our friends.  I barely enjoyed the food or music, just because of the LOUD TALKERS and TERRIBLE ACCOUSTICS.  Speakeasy? I kept wishing the principal would show up and tell everyone to SHUT UP and show some respect for the musicians.

While waiting for our car, one of the valets suggested Wednesdays were probably a better time for the likes of me.  We were there on a Saturday about a week from X-mas.  Silly me.
author: Monte C.

description: Fab-u-lous! Crab cakes, beau soleil oysters, and ceviche appetizers; sole and duck breast mains. Best duck I've ever had, paired nicely with a reasonably-priced Morgan Pinot noir recommended by our waiter. The live jazz in the background was excellent, too. It was a special evening, Bix delivered.
author: Stephanie R.

description:
I had high hopes for Bix. The dining room is impressive--high ceilings and soft light studded with the beaming smiles of attractive San Franciscans, all smartly dressed. If only the service and the food matched the ambience. Yes, Marin oysters on the half shelf arrived promptly. They were delightfully small and sweet, complemented by the yuzu mignonette. But the duck, which was recommended twice by the server, arrived on the chilly side of room temperature and bathed in this cloying, tacky barbecue sauce that tasted mostly of liquid smoke. Our server didn't take another drink order until half way through the meal and even then my wine didn't arrive until after the plates were cleared. Not once were we asked how our meals were, which would have given me the opportunity to offer some feedback. 

In San Francisco's hellish real estate market, I'm well aware that the bottom line is drawn by turning tables. But a $250 bill should follow a rewarding experience. Instead, I walked away hungry and disappointed.
author: Brian R.

description: Bix is consistently good.   This time we had the deviled eggs and potato apps both great.  My lamb dish was superb and the wine choices excellent.   But for the price and venue there were a few flaws.  First the bathroom was disgusting.  It seemed like a baseball stadium bathroom in the 8th inning (ok exaggeration, but it was gross).  Second, when we checked in we were missing one person.  We wanted to start ordering drinks but she told us we just could wait the few minutes until the fourth person arrived.  I can understand why restaurants have this policy but the hostess was rude about it.  Fortunately she was overruled by the manager and he sat us.  Third, it was a hot SF night and the restaurant felt like a sauna inside.  They should address this.
author: Ed J.

description:
Elegant restaurant with dim lighting and live piano, nestled in a calm alley in FiDi. The food is excellent. I've had better beef tartar, that said, but I very much enjoyed the tartar here. The strawberry daiquiri is seasonal. I was surprised by the smaller glass and the lack of purée, but this was a nice twist on the drink I enjoy in the Caribbean. We were checked on at least six times throughout the meal. I was briefly without a large fork for my spaghetti. That's forgivable.

Manhattan and dessert not pictured.*
author: Paulina F.

description:
Pork chop was excellent, top 3 I've ever had. Potato pillows way overpriced, dont order. Cocktails good. Wine selection respectable. That's about it. I feel bad for the service pros who work here--they should look for a better place to work due to the management. A place like... Wayfare Tavern, for instance.

Question: whenever you tip, do you tip on the whole, entire bill (including tax), or do you tip on just the amount WITHOUT tax?  I've worked in the hospitality industry for 12 years and I've never seen anyone tip on just the meal (without the tax). The suggested tip percentages on the bottom of the bill are intentionally wrong. They are calculated PRE-TAX so the wait staff, bartenders, and bus boys are all getting screwed out of 8.75% of their potential earnings when someone follows their recommendation because of a conscious decision of the management. That is absolutely not right. Brought this up to the manager to tell him and was arrogantly told off. The management is atrocious. A damn shame for an otherwise good restaurant.
author: Ian S.

description:
I can't breathe.... 

Stopped by here for a glass of champagne and an appetizer before our dinner reservations at Kusukabe. Don't let the ghetto alleyway fool you... the inside of this place is GORGEOUS. Super romantic feel with dim lights and different levels/floors. LOVE LOVE LOVE! 

Ordered the POTATO PILLOWS (Crème Fraîche, California Sturgeon Caviar). Seriously, if you love tator tots, this thing will blow your mind.... IT WAS AMAZINGGGGG! Best $18 I've ever spent. 10/10 would recommend and 10/10 would order again.

Service at the bar was not your typical casual bartender. They are super polite, professional, and attentive. 

I REALLY want to come back here to dine in and try everything on their menu. PERFECT date night spot :)
author: Anna M.

description:
I was very unwhelemed by this place, especially considering how expensive everything was.

I came here with three friends on a weeknight. The ambiance is uber romantic, perfect for a date night if you're super rich and don't care about spending a lot of money on mediocre food.

I got a strawberry dacquari drink because nothing else looked good to me on the menu. It was fine, but I'm sure the wine would have been better.

We started with some appetizers. The potato pillows- they were good and I would recommend them if you like tater tots. We also got the crab cakes which were also good and fresh.  Then we got the TRUFFLE CHEESE GOUGÈRES which were also good. Again, everything was good enough but in my opinion, not amazing considering the price. 

Then we got the CREOLE BBQ SHRIMP which were good but the fried green tomatoes on them were not.

Honestly the rolls that came out with the dinner were amazing though. Warm and soft and fluffy. I had 2.

Then I got the lobster pasta. SUPER unwhelmed by this. It was $34 and sooo plain. Basically no flavor. I tried both the steaks were were definitely better/ more flavorful, but also way more expensive.

I'm not a huge dessert person, but we got the banana rum ice cream thing, and bread pudding. My coworker LOVED them, i thought they were whatever, but again, i don't love dessert.

Overall, I wouldn't come here again unless someone else really wanted to and was paying for it. The food tasted good enough, but definitely not worth the price.
author: Jenna G.

description: Noisy if you sit up front by the band, but always a fantastic space with fantastic service.
author: drew n.

description:
This place is amazing!!! The atmosphere is quite swanky, and I loved that they had a live jazz ensemble. Definitely a great way to spend my birthday. 

The New York Strip Steak was the absolute best steak I've ever had in my life. It practically melted in my mouth with every bite. The truffle fries were amazing. The deviled eggs were also fantastic!

I had the huckleberry buttercream macaroons for dessert. There was a perfect ratio of buttercream to cookies. I enjoyed every bite. 

The service was wonderful, they were very attentive. 

I would definitely come back!!
author: Rachael D.

description:
What a great experience! Food, atmosphere, service and overall experience were all up to my standards. My boyfriend an I enjoyed his birthday dinner last night @ BIX. Our server's name was Chris. He was knowledgeable of the menu and professional and courteous for the entire meal. 
Our table was facing the live music. We truly enjoyed that. All courses arrived on time and everything was delicious. The only thing I didn't enjoy was the dessert we ordered. I didn't realize it had the taste of coffee. My fault for not reading the menu descriptors completely. Coffee desserts are not my style. I should have went for the creme brulee :/  
5 stars! I will return to try a few different items on the menu.
author: rebecca r.

description:
We recently celebrated our engagement with a trip to San Francisco and Bix was recommended by a friend. We absolutely loved the atmosphere of Bix! It's very charming, old school, live jazz music. The food is incredible. We sat upstairs, which was great for watching the musicians. Our server, Nicole Q, was terrific! Hands down one of the best servers I've ever had. Nicole is excellent at suggesting wine and the way she describes the dishes is a true art form. The cocktails are fun and yummy!

We had...

Potato Pillows - they sent these out as a congrats!
A La Minute Ceviche - very fresh, wonderfully paired with corn nuts
Steak TarTare - would get this every time, it was so good
California Lamb T-Bone - I stole a bite from my fiance, great lamb and cooked perfectly!
Massachusetts Day Boat Sea Scallops - heaven! the celery root was an excellent pairing
author: Mackenzie P.

description: My husband and I visited the city recently and always like trying to find quaint unique little places - BIX was fabulous!!  From the alley way entrance, live jazz, fantastic food (lobster spaghetti and peppercorn ny strip) and staff -- it was an all around wonderful experience!!  Neat little gem just off Gold street. We'll be back on our next visit!
author: Kim H.

description:
Tip: get reservations  
Service was great, meal was fantastic (pricy but worth it) I ordered  the burger and my boyfriend the lamb.  
 Would have got 5 stars if the patrons were not so up tight a rude. A group  of grumpy old men at the bar were very rude to me and my boyfriend for no reason.  Their money doesn't buy class, just booze.  Next time, I will make reservations so we can enjoy the live music, ambiance  and intimate feel.
author: Stephanie B.

description: The snack mix here is excellent. In town visiting for my girlfriends birthday and she wanted to go to Bix due to a friends recommendation. Thanks to a terrible Lift driver we arrived 20 minutes late. I gave Bix 2 phone calls explaining our situation. We arrived to be told that they had booked our table for another 8:00 reservation and that it was not enough time for us to eat now. So our table sat empty for the next hour and 10 minutes while we enjoyed snack mix at the bar while we searched for another place for her birthday dinner.
author: Ryan M.

description: We came here with some friends last weekend to celebrate my wife's birthday and we were pleasantly surprised. We knew coming in that the jazz music would be great but the food was equally outstanding! From the drinks to the appetizers and the entrees, nothing disappointed. Our favorites were the potato pillows with the caviar on top, the oysters and the truffle toast to start. For dinner I had the pork chop which was delicious and my wife's lamb dish was cooked and seasoned to perfection. Definitely coming back here!
author: Ravi G.

description: After waiting 45 mins to be seated for our reservation, the lobster spaghetti was very lack luster and light on the lobster and heavy on the sauce. Then my one martini ran dry early and no one came by or was available to get another. To top it off, the manager gave us attitude about our seating time when we mentioned it! Very rude and unprofessional. Not an establishment I'll be visiting again anytime soon! So don't bother or waste your time.
author: Nat K.

description:
Amazing food and atmosphere, an unsuspecting elegant hole in the wall that you can only get to by walking through an alley. The service was amazing, 5 stars for sure. The pork chop was to die for and the bartender made amazing drinks, not to mention the hand written list of the perfect night spots as the final suggestion. On the way out I noticed that my cloth napkin left lint on my coat and the staff found me a lint roller! 

Bix was one of the best experiences I've had in regards to service and amazing food with a live jazz band, and I recommend making a reservation on open table because they fill up quick.
author: Bryan L.

description:
Came here for a romantic night out with a recent person I was dating. We had a fantastic time. The first thing you notice is that it is on a random, unassuming ally which gives it a cool mystique. 

The ambiance is romantic and chill. Has a vintage and vibe without being too stuffy or pretentious.maybe 60% of the men were wearing a suit or sport coat. Others collared shirts and sweaters or something to that degree. 

I looked at the menu ahead of time and was not too impressed because there was almost nothing vegetarian. It really is much note omnivore friendly, so I would sincerely recommend looking at the menu if steak is your thing. The steak tartare. It looked fantastic. 

When the waitress came over (who was amazing) she said there were several veg options they could make. We ordered a few apps and drinks. The drinks were good but not amazing. The food was fantastic. Definitely did not disappoint. We said what the hell and got two desserts as well and again, fantastic.

The only bummer was the pianist was not there that night. That really would have made it perfect.
author: Sean M.

description: Excellent jazz club and top notch food! music was great and we had a wonderful time. dedsert great too! drinks stronggggggg! ;  )
author: Martin H.

description:
I went to Bix recently to celebrate a special birthday and it was a great experience! Made reservations in advance and had a great table on the 2nd floor overlooking the jazz band. The place is loud but that was part of our intent going there... to enjoy the music... and boy did we! 

The food is also quite tasty. Great selection of wines offered and what appeared to be a full bar too. We ordered a couple of the seasonal cocktails - Strawberry-infused drink - and it was both refreshing and tastefully made! 

Oysters are good but pretty standard. I would definitely recommend the following: 
- Skirt Steak
- Avocado Salad
- Chicken Hash (delicious but also needs a kick... maybe a side of pickles?) 

I will say fries were disappointing for every member of my party so I would pass on them, especially if you like french fries. 

I recommend making reservations at least 1-2 weeks before a week-end dinner plan to ensure you have a table. The place was packed on a Saturday night!
author: Anna M.

description: One star goes to Amy who answers the phone. I've been wanting to try this restaurant for a long time. With a lot of things happening in life things change. Well I sure was reminded of this by Amy when I asked to cancel our reservation she made she sure to mention that I have now canceled twice. Not to mention when she asked for my name, I was giving her two last name options and she cut me off saying one at a time. I will not be trying this restaurant thanks to Amy!
author: Giana B.

description:
Dinner at Bix. The chef should be named Mr. White because he cooked a meal that was addictive!

Our server Nicole was truly wonderful!!
author: A C.

description: Great find in San Francisco. 30s speakeasy vibe was perfect setting for a business meal. Wine selections and cocktails first rate. Appetizers perfect portion for sharing among four. Lamb, Steak cooked to perfection. Highlight was the amazing service from Alex. I'll be asking for her next time I go.
author: Frank Y.

description: One of the best dining experiences in a long time. Great wine list. Great menu. Great food. Great ambience. Exceptional service. The cauliflower bisque is perfect. The bay scallop crudo as well. My dinner companions loved their chicken hash and their duck. Save room for dessert... especially the bananas Foster!!!  Will be back!!!!
author: Carrie M.

description: Hard to find but definitely worth the wait. We went there last February. Old speak easy with lots of ambiance. The meatballs are a must. We actually ordered those twice. Steak and fish were delicious. Definitely going back. Make reservations ahead of time.
author: Julie L.

description: Nice place! Its un an alley but the place is really nice! Big bar, clean bathroom and great service. Food is good but not so much. I mean it's good but would not go back because of it.
author: Jami F.

description:
I like this place. i really do.

But the portions are damn small. Check out my picture of the banh mi. it's the size of my thumb. it comes in fours.... but seriously?! it's not going to fill anyone!

I ordered a burger to share, but be warned - it only comes with one "bun". it's not really a bun, more like a piece of wheat bread with no crust. but still tasty. and the garlic fries were good.

i would recommend this place for a first date. only because girls don't like stuffing their faces on the first date - and this is the perfect place since the portions are for ants.
author: Andy H.

description: Great Friday lunch at an iconically beautiful place.  All the food was terrific but the gazpacho was sublime and served with perfect avocado toast
author: Tom F.

description:
Food 4*
Service 5*
Atmosphere 5*

Good food, attentive service, great atmosphere. We had a party of five for dinner and ordered in a rather unconventional way. 

We first shared a number of appetizers, including the potato pillows and crab rolls, which were both awesome. 

The main course included: 
Two people ordered the lamb t bone, which was fine but portion rather small, 
Two people ordered the lobster spaghetti, which was awesome, 
One sea bass, which was good

Then due to the small portion size, we ordered another scallop to share, and a foie gras, and another lamb t bone. We ordered these one by one, but the waiter was very patient with us. 

This place should be 4 star due to small portion, but the solid service and the fun atmosphere are 5 star
author: Beer W.

description: I wanted to give zero stars but Yelp won't allow me to do so. Worst customer service I have ever seen from a restaurant. We had a Lyft driver who didn't have a clue and a traffic nightmare...so we (after 2 calls to restaurant) arrived 20min late. At first, they said we would only have 1hr10min at our table but then refused to seat us. As we waited at the bar, the hostess told us it would be another hour and a half. Meanwhile...somebody showed up for their rez an hour early and were seated. A TERRIBLE  experience and such a disappointment :(
author: Angel C.

description: This was a perfect night. The waiters were professional waiters; the food was refined and sophisticated and creative. The music, lighting and jazz music were perfect.you feel transported back in time. My group, thankfully, was commenting on what a great find this was that I made. This place is a hidden gem that my friends in San Francisco have never heard of but has been here for 29 years. Many well known cocktails originated at BIX.
author: Jennifer B.

description: What can you say. Historic place that has the same great venue and vibe where I met my wife at.  Class act!
author: David D.

description: I absolutely love Bix! So classy and delicious. The pillows W/caviar is to die for. The cocktails are amazing. Shall we talk about the amazing service? Love Adam. Adorable. The food overall is a 10!
author: Lynnet S.

description:
Bix was one of those restaurants that have been in my bookmarks forever where I didn't feel the need or want to try right away. And... I was right. I wasn't missing out for not trying Bix any earlier. The food was just OK, in my opinion. My friends and I came here on a Sunday night with reservations. And surprisingly when we had arrived, the restaurant wasn't even that full to be needing reservations. 

Food-
Foie Gras Torchon - Very tasty and smooth. Went perfect with the toasted bread. Probably my favorite dish of the night.

Potato Pillows - Pretty disappointed as it was nothing special. Bite size portions. It reminded me of the small hash browns that you can get from Burger King's breakfast menu, except it has caviar on top.

Duck Breast - Not the best duck breast I've had, but it was still delicious. It was pretty tender and the flavor was just right. I wished the skin was just a bit crispier though..

Warm Chocolate Cookies with Whiskey Cream - These cookies came out fast after we ordered. A bit sweet with a hint of whiskey taste. Not too memorable, in my opinion.
author: Philana C.

description: I read another review before we decided to visit BIX for our anniversary, which said the place has a mad men vibe. We felt the same way. Not a very big place and hence  has a cozy vibe. The jazz music was good . The  food was okay as well.
author: Arjoyita R.

description:
Last night was my first time at Bix and I'd definitely return. Beautiful decor. I had the Lola and yummy Chex-mix..super swift & nice bartender. 

Loved the piano & live singer! A table of 9 I got to taste most of the appetizers, the deviled eggs, ceviche & crab rolls were outstanding.

I wish I'd stuck with seafood because the scallops & lobster spaghetti were yummmm but my steak was mediocre. It had little flavor so I added salt & pepper. For $49 I was expecting more. 

But, the service was A+ and everything else was great so I'll return.
author: Kimm B.

description: Great atmosphere. Great service. Food is terrible!! When a high end restaurant cannot execute well on a simple strip steak.....disastrous!! Almost like homogenized meat, either instantly defrosted in a microwave or even worse, boiled before being grilles. Bread pudding was a microwaved brownie mess. Shame. Great potential. Terrible execution.
author: Shaf V.

description:
Food is good but not great. Service is horrible. Don't think I'll be back again...

First they refused to seat some of us until entire party arrive when the restaurant is not even full. Second they rushed us during dinner by taking my friend's place while she is still eating. Finally, without asking if we want any dessert they quickly dropped off the bill!? 

They really need to retrain the staff on customer service...
author: Wynne K.

description: Wow, every time I go there, it is awesome! Spectacular bar, great old school cocktails, great music, decor and stunning food. Nice service too!
author: David C.

description: kind of mixed impression. Nice venue and live jazz which really makes this place special however the dinning hall is packed with tables close to each other and is very noisy to really listen to jazz... Service was good, the host,  barmen, helpers were very polite and nice but the waiters were just ok... seemed lacking attention. Food presentation was excellent,  deviled eggs were good, ceviche wasn't great, the lamb was cooked really nicely, but didn't like the choice of  pardon peppers... sea bass was cooked very nicely as well but again the side wax beans not so interesting, deserts were good although the cheesecake's crust had strange taste, whatever was mixed into it - it didn't go well with ice-cream and custard (which by itself was amazing).
author: Andre P.

description:
Umm this place is amazing - too bad I went on a first date that I would not want to repeat, but at least I got to come!

The food was bomb - I had something of everything (might as well order a lot) and drinks were wonderful. There's a live band hat plays 1920s music and it's sooo cute! The service was awesome as well. 

Wonderful for a (good) date or an intimate dinner with friends. Definitely want to come back!
author: Mahsa T.

description: Absolutely phenomenal. Loved it. Like going into a time machine to the real glory days of Jazz and prohibition. The food was amazing!!!! The drinks were amazing!!! The music was amazing!!!  Great place to have a beautiful dinner.
author: George D.

description:
Great ambiance. But the men's room was - not filthy - but the floor was puddled with water... where did that water come from? A restaurant that doesn't keep it's restroom clean is a suspicious place. Before you eat there and drop 250, check out the restroom. Bix's looked liked a beer hall's. Mgmnt can contact me.

Update: Management did contact me and apologized.
author: Marc V.

description:
First off, the ambience is spectacular here.  Secondly, the waitress was excellent.  The food and the prices are what garnered a 2 star review.  We had an appetizer which consisted of 4 bite size grilled cheese tastes for $12.  It was laughable and in fact we laughed at our table at the presentation. The entree's were peculiar...chicken hash patties which seemed more appropriate at my kid's high school cafeteria.  The hamburger while juicy was totally nondescript and rather tasteless even with blue cheese which did not add anything to it.  Not surprising was the fact that the place was nearly empty which never is a good sign.  I'm afraid dear friends that the time may be up for our beloved Bix dinner house.  Look elsewhere.

I should add that a very surly looking gentleman at the entrance who brought us our wine.  looked like he would rather be anywhere but at Bix.  A shroud of gloom and doom followed him from the entrance to just outside while he took a cig break.  Oy gevalt.
author: Joshua E.

description:
What has happened to this iconic San Francisco location. I've spent plenty of nights standing at the bar or having late night dinners. 
BUT it WREAKS of human urine. Insanity. The men's restroom has historically had issues but this should not happen especially at Bix. Fix it. Until then. I'm done.
author: Ted C.

description: My boyfriend and I are from Las Vegas and came out to San Francisco for my birthday. He did tons of research and surprised me with a dinner at Bix on the big night. It's the cutest spot for people like myself who enjoy fine dining dishes without the stuffy atmosphere. The Jazz was perfect and the food was excellent. I highly recommend the steak and we will definitely be back.
author: Chelsea D.

description:
My husband and I were here last night for our 6 month wedding anniversary and the ambience was perfect for the occasion. The decor was classy and the live music was enjoyable and well received by the patrons. 
Now to the dishes we had. Going by both the waiter's and most Yelpers' recommendations, we ordered the Bix Fried Chicken and it was worth every dollar spent. The chicken was cooked to perfection and the portion was large enough to split between the two of us (although a tiny selfish part of me wanted it all for myself because it was so yum :D). We next ordered the Chicken Hash (another popular dish) but this time we ordered separate plates and were glad we did since the portions were small. Portion size apart, it did not disappoint and the dish was perfect.

Why not the full 5-stars then, you ask? Well, because we were not very impressed with the cocktails or the desserts. My husband had the House Cocktail and I ordered the Dougie fresh, neither of which were praise worthy. For dessert, we had the Bananas Foster and Warm Chocolate Brioche Bread Pudding and both of them were meh. 

All in all, the dinner was nice and we would probably return to try some of the other entrees and for the fried chicken. Duh.
author: Sneha N.

description: Great place to go if you're looking to splurge. I was visiting SF with some family and we visited this restaurant. Upscale service, style, flavor, and presentation. We went there on a Saturday night as a celebratory time for my college graduation and the holidays. We tried a bunch of different things from pasta, fish, oysters, etc. It's definitely pretty costly but not too bad and worth the experience. They had a greeter that took our coat, a host to walk us to our table, a waitress that was very attentive, etc.
author: Jesand A.

description: LOBSTER SPAGHETTI!!  Holy cow.  It's amazingly delicious... probably the best I've ever had.  The sauce is fantastically tasty yet light, the spaghetti is house made, and nice pieces of lobster.  I will definitely be back for this.  Get it!!
author: Clarissa H.

description: Pleasantly surprised! Delicious food, great service and swanky-retro ambiance. My only complaints: We had to wait almost 20 minutes after our reservation time to be seated, and the hostess didn't apologize, and they really need to put up velvet curtains during the winter to separate the entrance from the bar and dining room. The cold air funnels through the bar and downstairs dining area every time the front door is opened. It was very distracting and uncomfortable during the meal. The Lola cocktail was also a disappointment, but the Sidecar was fabulous.
author: Lisa M.

description: Think dark, cozy, lively, rat pack, jazz, art deco, delicious throwback food (PORK CHOP! DEVILED EGGS! BANANAS FOSTER!), Manhattans, good vibes, good times.
author: Andrew K.

description:
I can't say enough amazing things about this restaurant! My boyfriend took me here as a surprise and I was so insanely happy. The ambiance in this building is amazing, and the staff was so incredibly kind and non-judgmental. I've noticed in extremely nice restaurants a lot of the time we get looked at weird or treated differently being young, but they were insanely helpful and went out of their way to make us feel welcome. 
The food was AMAZING. I'm usually not one for truffles but I got the truffles and scallops, and I can't say enough great things about the taste. We also got the deviled eggs with truffle shavings and WOW. So incredible and creamy. 
The seating is beautiful and the bar is incredible. The live music also added to the whole feeling so well and the pianist was incredible. We'll definitely be coming here again, the entire experience was beautiful.
author: Shiries S.

description:
I feel compelled to write this review as last night I witnessed a very sad moment that could have been a memory for a lifetime.

I dined with my dad, stepmom, and an old colleague last night. We were there for at least 3 hours. Our bill and tip was well over $425. The food was fine. Just fine. My steak was not worth $49. I've had better ones for $25-70. Our waitress was very attentive and nice.

A large table was seated next to us. One man was wearing a tux. It was a Monday. After a while I realized that it wasn't the dress code (which I was told was fancy, but several polo shirts were seen), and it was because he and his new bride just got married earlier in the day probably at city hall. They chose to have their wedding night celebratory dinner with friends and family at Bix of all the 1000 restaurants in the city. They chose to start memories of this day at Bix. 

Last night Bix had a Pianist and a Bass player playing great fantastic music. The wedding party was quiet and respectable the entire night. Clearly their meal was over and people were starting to get up. The Bride and groom walked over to the musicians holding hands. Before they could even begin to mutter a word, the hostess comes racing over and I knew she was telling them that they were not allowed to dance. Still being polite, the new couple smiled and walked away.

Bix has maybe 20 tables total. 6 of them were full at this time. It was near 9:30pm on a monday. It was their wedding night and they were denied being able to simply have one dance together. It would not have hurt anyone, and I'm sure every single patron in the restaurant would not have cared less, but actually it really pissed us off. They looked adorable, seemed polite and respectful, chose to drop well over $1000 at Bix on their most important day of their lives so far. And Bix denied them this sweet memory. 

I can't and wont go here ever again.
author: Parker K.

description: This is such a cool place. Great jazz playing while you enjoy delicious cocktails. Super knowledgeable and friendly bartenders. Quintessential old school jazz club. You'll feel like you've stepped back in time. We came for drinks but will definitely be back for food.
author: Shelly W.

description: We came to Bix on a Friday night and make sure to have reservations because it definitely gets busy with the service and food was spectacular and the décor was reminiscent of fifties sixties like an old theater or something. The great place to come to celebrate a special occasion or for a date night!
author: Cheryl P.

description: Great ambiance, good service, food is good.  If you are a meat lover, this place is wonderful. Not so strong on the veggie front.  It feels very old school yet chic. It is a classic SF spot. Long live Bix!
author: David O.

description:
Gosh, I remember when BIX was THE 'It' place of the late 80's dining scene in San Francisco. Even back then in 1988 when it opened, the place had a classy, 1930's-era nightclub vibe that would have made it an ideal setting for a classic mistaken identity screwball farce with Cary Grant and Irene Dunne (photo: http://bit.ly/1a4NxT5). A quarter-century later and I was back just for a cocktail and some appetizers with my good friend Rene. Owner Doug Biederbeck still runs the place though he has since expanded his empire considerably with Florio, MarketBar and Zero Zero. But BIX looks pretty much the same all these years later. Its hidden location on Gold Street still evokes the same speakeasy vibe (photo: http://bit.ly/13x1Gou), and the bar bustles with suits in the early evening.

Rene and I managed to snatch a couple of seats at the bar where we immediately ordered a couple of the $12 BIX Negronis (photo: http://bit.ly/16ar3bU). A stylish house specialty, it's a potent potable with Plymouth gin, Campari and Carpano Antica Sweet Vermouth. I felt like I should have been wearing a tuxedo and saying, "Judy, Judy, Judy". We were in a nibbling mood as we were catching up, so we ordered a classic first, the $12 Deviled Eggs with Truffles, Radish and Chives, which basically meant we got an egg each, split and decorously topped with flourish (photo: http://bit.ly/12KqiE7). I do love a good deviled egg in the right venue, and these were so BIX. Next came the $10 House Mozzarella Skewers with Olio Nuovo and Prosciutto (photo: http://bit.ly/1cXBfYW).

They were savory Italianate lollipops that popped into the mouth far too easily. To finish off our stop at BIX, we had the $12 Duck Ham and Maitake Panini, a quartet of little protein-packed triangles grilled in butter and oozing with melted cheese (photo: http://bit.ly/16areUr). Throughout our meal of high-end hors d'oeuvres, we were grazing on the constantly filled bowl of Chex mix, a throwback of a different sort, at least for me as I used to eat this stuff a lot at dorm parties (photo: http://bit.ly/10D2Lso). The jazz music was playing in the background, and the suits were starting to get their dining tables. Dinner next time perhaps, but a soupçon of BIX will do me for now. Time for Rene and me to walk over to Mr. Bing's where we can experience how the other half imbibes.

DRINKS & APPETIZERS - 4 stars...still praiseworthy if rather pricey
AMBIANCE - 3.5 stars...darkness falls all the time at BIX
SERVICE - 3 stars...polite though lacking some enthusiasm at this stage
TOTAL - 4 stars...a classic San Francisco stop for an old-school cocktail with good friends
author: Ed U.

description: Although the food was good, the food was overpriced. Although our waitress was great, the male host was very disrespectful to our group. One of our friends was late as she was driving back from Los Ángeles. He kept on giving us a hard time because she wasn't there yet. The table next to us had some people dressed in pajamas and the ladies were dressed in pj "booty shorts". Part of their party was late also and the host didn't bother them at all. I had to tell him to leave us alone as we were eating appetizers and drinking cocktails while waiting for our friend. There was no reason for him to keep on bothering us as we were ordering food and drinks while waiting. We should have left by the third time that he came to our table to ask where she was. Ridiculous!!!! Three of us were seated already eating and drinking and he would not just let us enjoy our night. When our friend showed up, he came to tell us in a different demeanor, "oh, you're here!" By that time I was so done with him. The food was good, but very overpriced and it left a sour taste in our mouth because of the horrible service from the host. Again, the waitress was nice but the host messed up our night. I can't help but think that our ethnicity had something to do with us being bothered so much by the host.  We will definitely not be coming back here again.
author: Venecia M.

description: From the quality service, amazing food & exceptional jazz, this place is a MUST! We took my mom here for her birthday because she wanted to listen to some jazz & have dinner,this place didn't disapoint! We all enjoyed our picks, but the Lobster Spaghetti & Sea Bass stood out. The decor was lovely. Drinks were special & delicious. Just a perfect time all in all. a ten for sure!
author: CarlaFornia W.

description: Food is to die for!! One of the best places to eat Realllyyyy good food!!!! Nice ambience too! Good for both romantic date and a formal ish party. But the place is crowded, you don't get to hear the music there's so much chatter. Service is superrrr slow.
author: Urvashi G.

description: I did not feel like I stepped back in time as many of the other reviews had suggested. The music was really nothing special. It was there with out being intrusive or loud. We were able to have a conversation and to hear our thoughts. This felt like a 5 star restaurant and nothing like a supper club. The food was amazing. The quail was the most delicious I've ever had! The ceviche was fresh and so soft! My husband's lamb T-bone was just perfect. I came here with a party of 5. We had two bottles of sparkling wine and several rounds of cocktails. The dinner was by no means cheap but the experience was well worth the price. The service was impeccable. The waiter was never hovering but always around to get another drink. This is my new favorite restaurant in San Francisco!
author: Corey Jace W.

description:
Overrated by the hype.

Food: everything is extremely salty as though each meal is soaked in salt. I'm someone who drinks soy sauce kinda salt loving person in dishes yet I was blown away by how salty the food was. Bone marrow extremely greasy than usual, my plate was like oil soup when I finished bone marrow. The salad dressed next to it was super salty that's nearly weird taste and hard to swallow. Chicken appetizer was salty and no other taste to it. Lobster Spaghetti was my main course and was extremely disappointed by this signature dish, it's literally whole can of salt dumped in it, and I wasn't able to take another bite even when I was very hungry. When my gf saw that I barely touched my main dish ON MY BIRTHDAY, she commented that hers was super salty as well. She had the same order. The next day I had bad stomachache and diarrhea didn't help with this review either 

Service : horrible server. Stern, rude and crass, from the beginning to the end, he wasn't friendly to begin with and if we asked him for something, he replied with annoying tone.

Decor : very lovely and live music was great.

Drinks: good 

But for its mediocre food @ high price and unfriendly service , this place is totally not worth it
author: T C.

description:
*** BEWARE OF CHEATING BARTENDER ***

So our group drops almost $1,000 at this restaurant.  Food and service are fine.  

On our way out, I loop back to get change for a $20 to tip the valet. The bartender then does the "change for $10 trick" -- he gives me just $10 in change, instead of $20.  

Now PLEASE. . . .  I know that I handed him a $20 for two reasons.  First, I only had $30 cash on me before I arrived at the restaurant (I had tried to pay for my co-workers' drinks earlier, but didn't have enough cash).  Second, before I handed him the bill, I double-checked that it wasn't a hundred, which I had in my wallet last week.

When I protest that he's given me the wrong change, the bartender plays stupid and says, "Oh no, you gave me a $10."  Then his fellow bartender -- who was two feet away and didn't handle the bill -- tries to back him up, as does the hostess.  The manager then suggests that I MUST be mistaken and should just suck it up.

REALLY?  SERIOUSLY?  Sorry, but it is super pathetic that a place that purports to be a fine dining establishment like this condones its staff's cheating its patrons.  

To be clear, it's not the money; I spent $2,700 at Saison in November.  I can afford $10.  It's the principle.

(And yo -- smoker-breath manager dude who said that I shoudn't come back.  REALLY?  Thanks, BTW, for finally giving me the $10 to avoid the scene that your cheating bartender created.)
author: Rich H.

description:
Let me start of by saying a little something about Bix.
The service is on point, the food is of superior quality, the drinks are perfectly made, the music is fantastic at a perfect volume and the ambience is exquisite. Casual chic at its best. 

I am writing this review because the negative reviews on yelp of this restaurant have zero validity. I can say they are pretty much just ridiculous "I am entitled, hear me complain" load of garbage comments. 

I am  a SF native and have been dining in MY city that I was RAISED in for over 3 decades, which regretfully has been taken over by a bunch of self-righteous, entitled, spoiled, rude and oblivious group of tyrants that think the world owes them something. The only thing you are owed is a swift kick in the pants!

First of all.. Anyone who has given this place a bad review clearly lacks attention and was neglected as a child! if you look at the type of people who left the bad reviews, you will see on their entire profile, it seems as though it is their duty to leave bad reviews.. Maybe this makes them feel important.. I say you are TRAGIC!

Here are some responses for all the negative feedback left:

Yes, the place is hectic and busy but it's called being successful.. Yes you need to order your food and carry on with your dinner because there are other people waiting to eat with their guest, family and so on.. The "other people waiting for a table" could be YOU waiting to eat so don't freakin' linger and have some respect so other people waiting for their reservation can have the chance to enjoy dinner as well. Maybe you can try a bit of humanity or humility and go have drinks or listen to music at the bar if you are done.. STOP being a spoiled and entitled tyrant. It is basic Restaurant 101 and BTW: you are a complete P.O.S. if your entitled, self absorbed mentally is "I have a reservation and I have the table all night".. NO YOU DONT! NO YOU DONT because others have reservations too!!!

For those who "think" they are sneaky and don't get the reservation time they want and show up with half of their party: YOUR TABLE IS GOING TO BE GIVEN AWAY .. Why should another reservation or guest have to suffer because of you? What makes you more important?! YOU are being SELFISH & RUDE! How if someone did that to you.. made you wait an extra 45 minutes before you were sat because their party showed up at their convenience? Yeah I didn't think you'd like it! Have some RESPECT!

For the whiners who want a quiet or private place.. go eat elsewhere, it's a supper club HELLOOOOOO! 
Yes the tables are close but once again "supper club".. not "it's my date and I don't want anyone to hear me talk"...Whaaaaaaaaaaahhhh  .. go cry to someone who cares! 
Supper clubs are know for their tables to be quaint and close, where people sit to have food/cocktails, listen music and socialized with their friends they are dining with.. 
I know social skills and manners are a rarity in the 21st century but try to make an effort to be aware of reality and others around you..  NO ONE CARES HOW MUCH MONEY YOU HAVE.. Put the shoe on the other foot and remember Karma has NO EXPIRATION!

MOST IMPORTANTLY.. This place is a hidden gem! I am glad not every random knows about it!  The best part is that this beautiful establishment isn't infested with a bunch of tourist with zero manners who stroll into a place with zip ups, hats, jeans, shorts and tennis shoes.. Seriously people, dress accordingly to a nice restaurant.! It disturbs the groove, the vibe and ambience of the restaurant.. It's so tacky..AND YES TAKE YOUR HATS OFF! Since when is it okay to wear a hat in a nice restaurant.? Who raised you? 

Another good fact: This is NOT A PLACE FOR CHILDREN! So please leave them at home for the love of GOD..and yes I have children who are extremely well behaved and seasoned to dine out but yet this is NOT the place for them.. If you are offended by this: get over yourselves!

Every time I have dined here I have seen every single staff person in this restaurant trying to do the best they possibly can to make sure guests are having a great night with the people they came with (like taking 10 photos when they are busy as hell) and making sure all of the guests are properly taken care of throughout the entire time they are giving their service. 

What makes me cringe is that, in the 21st Century, using being NOT FROM THE USA OR CALIFORNIA to not to leave a proper 18%-25% tip as an excuse is basically A LIE and UNACCEPTABLE!! If you have never worked in a restaurant you have no say?! ZERO!
FYI: the money left for the server goes to the busser, the bar, the hostess, the people who bring the food out and the people in the kitchen, so don't think it all goes to the server.. every single person in any restaurant gets paid minimum wage and lives on their tips.. Yes that means no tip equals no food to feed their family, clothe children or pay rent.! 

On that note I leave you hopefully educated and little less entitle
author: Nina R.

description: Sexy, intimate spot. Quiet enough to have a conversation with your partner listening to light jazz music. Staff was very cool, letting us try certain wines and cocktails also. Food was very good, dessert menu needs a few more additions to the menu. Definitely a smitten , late night or end of night spot. Not sure where to go, can't go wrong at Bix.
author: Meghan D.

description: This restaurant is great. Excellent service, food is phenomenal and the live jazz music really sets a fun and relaxing tone for an evening out.
author: S G.

description:
I have a weakness for live jazz music. The romantic feel and the incredible high ceiling definitely put a smile on my face. There is always something about a restaurant with high ceiling and two story seating makes me jolly. Who would ever thought a nice restaurant tucked away from everything else. Located in an alley which took me forever to find. I seriously thought I had gotten the wrong address. 

Once I stepped inside the restaurant, the placed was packed. Since they were running a little behind, I headed to the bar and got a Caipirinha. The bartender was great and so was the bar itself.

I ordered:

-À la minute Ceviche with Chiles, Ginger, Avocado and Toasted Corn Nuts = fresh fish and the acidic texture was refreshing.

- Marrow Bones = first time trying this type of dish and I love it. Had a butter soft taste to it. Very succulent!

- Duck Breast with Whole Grain Mustard Spaetzle, Lacinato Kale, Hedgehog Mushrooms and Sweet Onions = duck meat was perfectly medium rare and tender. Delicious spaetzle!

- Lobster Spaghetti = generous portion. Loaded with lobster meat and plenty of cherry tomatoes. It had a sweet texture to this dish.

- Sorbet for dessert = refreshing with a hint of tartness.

Truly satisfied with my meal and the rest of the night listening to live jazz band. I could have not asked for a better dinner. This is why I love to dine in SF, always some spectacular restaurant waiting to be discovered. This one will be in my book of favorite place I love to dine!
author: Owie N.

description:
Stepping in here feels like stepping into a time warp.  A back alley dance hall is converted into the best of art deco and classic glamor.  The massively vaulted ceiling and two story seating is very dramatic.

The food and cocktails were good and predictably expensive.  The service was what I would expect from high-end dining.   It was a pricey experience that still left me a bit hungry.  The menu was good, but not too inspiring.  For the same money (or less), I think you can get better food in SF, however there is nothing that can replace this ambiance.  

Great to impress a date and satisfying for a newbie foodie.  As a veteran foodie, you might be underwhelmed.  That being said, my veteran-foodie-self will be frequenting this place for cocktail date nights for sure!
author: Susan C.

description: One of our downtown favorites for a classy romantic date night. I love the live music. The food is fantastic
author: Kimberly C.

description:
For us, this place is semi-fancy: it's not some place we'd need a fancy reason to go to, but it's also not terribly common for us to spend $150 on dinner for two on a regular old weeknight. My husband wanted steak tartar and I read this was a great place to get it. 

We had reservations, which we booked just a night or two before we went. 

The cocktails were great- especially the Manhattan. It was an incredibly smooth, very strong drink, that went down a little too easy. The Mister gave the tartar rave reviews. I also thought it was great- rich and tender-textured, with just the right amount of mustard, shallot, and capers. This was my first time having tartar, though, so take that with a grain of salt. 

Everything else was just meh. Not bad, nothing was bad. But everything was just sorta okay or maybe even pretty good. The caesar was alright, with nice chunky cheese slivers. But for $13, I could go for more than six little lettuce leaves. And, this is a pet peeve of mine that might not bother you: I don't love chopping up lettuce and mixing and tossing on that flat little plate. It's not like I'm going to pick up these leaves with my hands in this setting. When I'm eating out, I like when my meal comes ready to eat. The potato pillows tasted only of oil and potato. I mean, it was good potato flavor, but that's not why people are ordering this dish. I could see the caviar, but I couldn't taste it or feel it in the bite. And the oil flavor tasted a little burnt. That was a bummer. The chicken hash need some acidity and was just kinda weird. Giant crab-cake like things made out of chicken. 

But even then, everything was pretty okay. Except our server, who had been great, got all snippy out of the blue. We were ready to ask for our check, and she approached the table speaking to us. Before we could say anything, she tried to clear the table and, with a pretty epic side-eye, spoke to us in a way that made it clear she thought we were taking too long over our dessert/after dinner drink. And not only did she think we overstayed. She seemed like she wanted us to know she thought that, too. We actually didn't even get to ask her for the check at that point, because we were caught so off guard by the mood change and then she was gone faster than she walked up. To be fair, we'd been there for just over an hour and a half at that point. But, like I said, we were looking for our check already and we would've have gotten it sooner if we could have asked for it then.

So that's how the whole meal was. Things started out pretty nice. Then the parts that were a bit off congealed and made things a little sour.
author: M B.

description:
This review details my recent experience at the bar and it was fantastic. The service was exemplary, the martinis were perfect and the steak tartare was delicious and impressively prepared by the barman, who was friendly and professional. 

Certain places just have that "feel" to them, almost theatrical. Bix is like that. It just feels good being there. I cannot wait to return to SF and dine properly. I'm sure it will deliver.
author: Nigel T.

description: not too impressed. our waitress was nice, but the rest of the staff seemed annoyed being there. i wasn't impressed with the food, and because of it i feel like this place is a smidgen overpriced. nothing too special. it's a very dark atmosphere, not much lighting, which kinda fits the vibe of the restaurant. it was loud, couldn't hear the person next to you well. probably won't go back.
author: Ally H.

description: A favorite stop when I'm in the city. An ever changing menu always keeps the vibe easy, though I am a sucker for the deviled eggs. I'm always happy to sit at the bar and enjoy the legendary service by seasoned professionals.
author: Jim M.

description:
Since I was going to be in the city for a day, I decided I wanted to try something new and came across this place on Yelp.  When I called to make a reservation a few days before, I wasn't able to get anything earlier than 7:30pm on the day I was going to be there.  However, my class ended early and my friend and I arrived earlier to the restaurant... say about 5:30pm or so.  They were nice and seating up right away.

We were greeted about a min after we were seated by our server...and I must say, he is good at his job.  He always had a smile on his face which is always good to see on servers.  He check on us often and even make some jokes.  

Now on to the food:

Dungeness Crab Roll - Came with 4 pieces....all I can say is....ohhhh soooo YUMMY!  The right amount of crab for the roll.

Summer Corn Soup - there is a little spicy kick to this... just enough to tickle the tongue.  Creamy and yummy with a few corn kernels.

Duck Breast - Pretty tasty dish, but I wish the duck was more tender.  It was more on the harder/chewier side.

Snake River Farms Pork - mmmmmmm Yummy.  The pork was very tender and juicy.... cooked to perfection with the right amount of seasoning.  The only thing I don't like on this dish is the pickled Mustard seed aioli (because I don't like the horseradish taste).  Other than that, everything was yummy.

Truffle French Fries - Wish it was shoestring french fries, but it wasn't.  Not bad but I love the truffle taste =).

Overall, everything we tried here was yummy.  Will recommend this place for their yummy food.
author: Ashley L.

description:
They have Silver Oak wine by the glass!!  This is the first and only place I have ever seen Silver Oak by the glass.  Definitely a selling point for me!!  (Silver Oak is one of my favorite wines)

Steak tartar is amazing. Once you order it, your server comes to you with a cart and prepares it right in front of you, and customize it to your liking.  This is one of my favorite things that restaurants do!

The lobster spaghetti was delicious, however I did feel like it was very mundane.  I felt like this is a dish I could find at most SF restaurants.  

However, the Duck breast is one of the best I have ever had. Definitely will reorder this sometime in the future.  

The atmosphere is romantic, and a great place to take a date/loved one!
author: Rose Z.

description: Amazing! Atmosphere service & food! Do not leave without trying bananas foster!!! Hands down best dessert i've had in my entire life!
author: Kat B.

description: I almost always agree with my friend Janice C, but we definitely don't see eye to eye on Bix.   I enjoyed every bite of the Bix Burger, probably my favorite high end burger in San Francisco.  That burger was perfectly seasoned, juicy, and tender.  Bix is one of a few places that gets medium rare right.  The deviled truffle eggs are amazing as well.
author: Angel S.

description: Simply great. Great food. Great drinks. Great service. Great music. Great setting. 'Nuff said.
author: T. F.

description: Great location, food, and excellent service.  Went here last night for dinner with some friends.  First off the service was amazing.  Our waitress was friendly, fun, and knew everything about the menu with some excellent recommendations.  The food was very good, creative, and interesting.
author: Doug A.

description: One of the best steaks I have ever had.  The peppercorn crusted NY steak is a must try, usually NY strips are tough, rubbery and chewy in most places.  But this one was juicy, tender and had the crunch of the crusted peppercorn.   Great must try appetizers would be Potato pillows, deviled eggs, and the crab rolls
author: Stevezee C.

description: Friday night dinner date with the hubby and Bix has the perfect ambiance. Softly lit, live jazz band playing in the background and a really good wine list. My hubby ordered the NY strip well done, but it came back very pink. The manager quickly resolved the issue. I ordered the rainbow trout with the sautéed kale.....so delicious. The fish was prepared perfectly with a Thai inspired broth. So yummy! I would definitely return for this dish.
author: Kiyah G.

description:
Last night we enjoyed the oysters, potato pillows with creme fraiche and caviar, dungeness crab rolls, mozzarella with prosciutto, the NY steaks, pork chop, bananas foster, and panna cotta.  Drinks included Side Cars, vodka martinis, and Jameson/ginger.
The steaks melted in your mouth.

This dining experience is in the top 5 that I've had in SF.
What a gem.
Two thumbs up--way up.
author: Thomas D.

description:
The following conversation is proof that getting older really does mean you're getting wiser. 

Bf: your birthday is coming up! What do you need? Want? 

Me: Nothing really. 

Bf: Wow, honey! I guess all you need is my love. 

Me: Love? no thanks, I prefer gin. 

Their gin martini is all that and then some: ask for Plymouth gin for a smooth experience, because their house version is made with Gordon's. It's a small cocktail glass, but it'll pack a punch! The pimento stuffed olives don't really do anything for me as a garnish, I'd rather just have plain ones. 

I wish I can say our dinner was stellar, but the menu looked better on paper and I feel that the apps were all middle of the road: from their house made cucumber pickles, the duck liver "faux gras" and the bone marrow. The bone marrow was as expected, rich, beefy and fatty, but Wayfare Tavern's version is well seasoned and much better. The much raved about potato pillows were indeed good, but were super TINY. I'm tempted to say, "just order more booze instead!" 

Which brings me to the cocktail list. Hmm. Except for my martini, I think you're better off with wine. The Hibiscus swizzler is an ok choice made with gin and hibiscus, I do have to say it had a bit more St. Germain Elderflower than I prefer. Their Pisco Sour? Don't bother!  It tasted more like a Pisco Punch and a very bad version of it at that! Where is the foamy egg white? It was all pineapple and was too sweet, this was a cocktail all done wrong!

The duck breast sat on a bed of rice with sweet corn and peppers, but I've had much, much better duck recently at Terrapin Creek for the same price. Do get the insanely huge (and delicious!!) black truffle cheeseburger with truffle fries! You also can't go wrong with the bananas foster for dessert.

BIX's ambiance is great for those special occasions like birthdays or anniversaries, which is why I chose it. The restaurant sits in an alley in historic Jackson Square and is really beautiful with high ceilings, an open space and live music. Ask for seating on the second floor which overlooks the entire restaurant. 

But for the money we paid, I could've gone to a really solid place like Gary Danko or paid extra money for Alexander's. If you DO see me here again, I'll be at the bar, throwing back a gin martini. 

And. That's. About. It.

* 2.5 stars for the food, rounded up to 3 for the service *
author: Janice C.

description:
Three tries and your out. 

This last try was rude and lazy as always. Since the grumpy bitter bartender couldn't remember the name of the cocktail we explained, my friend decided to look it up.... he quips back with "Not one of those internet drinks!!" No old man, you can't drink the internet. 

Well, surely he can make a martini. So I ordered from grumpy old man, "one Kettle martini please" he returns after 3 second and only two shakes. I thought tp myself "Sorry to put you out of 10 seconds of shaking" and gee-golly, thanks for the room temperature warm martini! 

Small tip for you and I'm out for good.
author: Al A.

description:
Cocktails and apps! Two thumbs up.
I tried the Elixir No. 3 which was light and fresh tasting.  The combination of liqueurs worked in harmony. I definitely could order this again and not feel any remorse for not venturing out to try other interesting creations. For apps, the table got a 'combination plate' which was sold to us by the waiter (not sure if its on the menu) but it included ~6 servings of mozzarella wrapped with proscuitto, crab salad in toasted bread buns, deviled eggs, and banh mi sliders. Minus the mozzarella--which was sort of boring--everything else was well seasoned and not overbearing in flavors (which happens a lot to me on dishes like deviled eggs). I would definitely return again for a snack.

Appetizers and entrees. Okay and rather pricey.
Entrees were  ~$25-$35. Most of the table thought their plates were okay but weren't worth the price. I got the lobster spaghetti (spaghetti with grape tomatoes sautéed into a sauce) which although fresh, clean, and seasoned lacked two things: 1) lobster (tough time finding it and most were pieces the size of a dime) and 2) when I think lobster and spaghetti, I hope for something with a creamy or at least thicker sauce -- Here it was akin to a white wine sauce in consistency with too many tomatoes.

Dessert. Tasty but not memorable.
I ordered the earle grey panna cotta with orange sponge cake. The panna cotta had a wonderful silky texture and paired nicely with the freshly cut (slightly sour) strawberries and orange zest. The sponge cake, although good in its own right seemed like an after thought and didn't really add to the dessert.

Go here for cocktails and apps and maybe head somewhere else for dinner. The atmosphere almost has a NY jazz bar type feel but fancier which is a fun contrast from the alley outside. Service was very professional and without any issues.
author: Tammy T.

description:
Lobster Spaghetti: Pretty good...the lobster bits were large and plentiful. 

Deviled Eggs: Delicious! My friends could not stop eating these. We ordered another portion after finishing the first one...

Bone Marrow: I love bone marrow. Bix's version did not disappoint, and it comes piping hot too. 

Oysters: These were okay. They weren't one of the best oysters I've had but they are decent quality and fresh.

Potato Pillows: I loved the potato pillows. There is caviar on top of it and the small bite sized potato portions really make these look like miniature pillows. 

Ginger Gimlet: Refreshing and easy to drink. Don't order this if you don't like ginger...

Sidecar: This was on the stronger side for me but my friends all enjoyed this cocktail.

Manhattan: meh. Skip this.

Earl Grey Panna Cotta: Earl grey flavour is very subtle but that is why it works! Loved this dessert. Order this if you don't want something too sweet but are still craving dessert.

Warm Cookies and Whiskey Cream: The whiskey cream was very light and fluffy! The subtle whiskey flavour is what makes this dessert amazing.
author: Theresa L.

description: The fish was heavenly. Service was excellent, and atmosphere delightful. Definitely one of the best meals I've been able to enjoy in San Francisco. If you want to splurge, this should be at the top of your list!
author: Eimanne Z.

description:
I am amazed by this place. I am so glad I found BIX in San Francisco.
The place is just perfect, the classic decoration, live music, great atmosphere, service on point.The fact that people dress up to go out to BIX is already a star alone for me (not easy to find a "dress-up" place in SFO).

My dishes were just great. I had the devil eggs and Slow Cooked Lamb. What a choice. The wine was also great. Had a bottle of Duckhorn. The first bottle was completely off, a second bottle was given as a replacement. 

The reason why I didn't give a full 5-stars is because I felt the service very "pushy". I understand quality service, but one thing is been fast, the other is to "rush" you outside your table. That is exactly the feeling I had while eating at BIX. I felt very anxious at a point when the waiter would just be filling up my glass of wine above the "etiquette" mark and gave me the bill without me asking or even before asking if I wanted any dessert. 

Apart from it, I had a nice evening and will probably return.
author: Amanda G.

description:
Impressive Jazz Trio VS. rude service... all bets are off!



Originally booked this specifically for the Jazz trio, and those cats were amazing (almost wished people in the space were quieter so we could enjoy their seasoned presentation). Be aware this place is LOUD, not the Jazz, the people! 
The food was really good, we had a 4 people, 2-course meal, and they were all hits. The wine list was also a heavy hitter. 
Now when it came to the service, it all went downhill unfortunately. The hostess who greeted us was rude, the second hostess that walked us to our table was rude, and our waiter was rude (dude, you could crack a smile once a while you know?)! 

Unfortunately, that kind of killed the experience of Bix for us, specially the wait between courses, which was WAY too long. 
It's a shame, because the space itself is fantastic, after all, we are in one of the few San Francisco historical locations, so let shine god damn it!
author: M S.

description: A San Francisco must. Very busy place,  so make reservations...I have dined at the bar and at a table and love both areas. The upstairs has a nice view of the scene below and booths!
author: Jennifer E.

description:
For those who may not know 'Bix' takes its name from the nickname of its proprietor, Doug Biederbeck, who took the moniker 'Bix' from the legendary jazz cornetist Leon Bismark "Bix" Beiderbecke, a contemporary of Louis Armstrong. That era and jazz are foundations of Bix, and a big part of what makes the restaurant a San Francisco treasure.
