description: Live music, classy decor, and attentive service all lead up to average food.  The meal was not worth the hype nor the price, and neither is it worth any further review.
author: Zeus M.

description:
If I could give this place 0 stars I would!

I came here to celebrate an engagement with about 9 girls. The place was so dark we had to pull out our cell phones to read the menu. After we finally ordered, they brought out our appetizers. I ordered a potato soup, which by the lack of light, the waiter spilt the scalding hot soup down my friend's back! 
It took then almost 15 minutes to even bring her a towel and some ice. The manager seemed unconcerned and non-apologetic. He said he would "take care of us." When we got our bill (about an hour because they made so many mistakes on it) all they did was comp the soup they spilt! Our bill was almost $900 and they took off a whooping $10 soup! The next day she called the on-duty managed and emailed them a picture of the blisters that formed all over her back. He said he'd get back to her, its been almost 2 weeks with no response. 

Terrible management and customer service!

Boo Bix!!!!
author: Jenny T.

description:
Great food, service and value!

Food: 4.5/5 stars
Service: 5/5 stars
Value: 5/5 stars
Overall: 5/5 stars

Dinner with spouse on 29 October 2013.  

Custom cocktails prepared instantaneously and correctly.  

Appetizers: 
- Pork Belly "Bánh Mì" with Cucumber & Sriracha:  5/5 stars - well seasoned and prepared - delicious;
- Potato Pillows with Crème Fraîche and American Caviar: 5/5 stars - very nice.  crispy on the outside, creamy on the inside, contrasting taste of roe;
- Dungeness Crab Rolls, Meyer Lemon Aioli - 4/5 stars - good, fresh, on bland side

Main courses:
- Duck Breast with Chanterelles, Stuffed Baby Cabbage, and Fuji Apples 5/5 stars - outstanding - tender, well seasoned, delicious duck breast.  Cabbage stuffed with chicken mousseline is unexpectedly good.
- Lobster Spaghetti with Cherry Tomatoes, Jalapeños and Basil - prepared right al dente, seasoned right, delicious.  A little skimpy on the lobster for the prices but overall very good.  4.5 stars out of 5

Desserts:
- Sorbets of grape and pear - very good, not too sweet.  4.5 stars out of 5
- Chocolate Brioche Bread Pudding 5 stars out of 5  - somewhere between classic bread pudding and molten lava cake.  
- Espresso. Signor Moriondo, eat your heart out - this was delicious, subtle, done right, the best one i have had on this side of the atlantic.  

Service.  Our waiter Cristop (probably Cristopher?) was very good.  Professional, accommodating, knowledgeable. 5 stars out of 5

Overall, very solid restaurant - great food, service, and value.  Will become one of my staples.  

Many thanks to my son-in-law and my daughter for recommending.
##
author: A1 M.

description:
We had a great time here.  We were two couples enjoying dinner (family birthday).  

Appetizer - Octopus and Deviled Eggs - both great!

My wife had the Duck, I had the Truffle Cheese burger.  Both of us thought our dishes were under cooked.  I asked for my burger to be medium but honestly I think it was more rare/blue than medium - I mean I bet I could have milked my burger pattie!  But the Truffle flavor was out of this world - I will order this again but ask for it to be well done.  My wife enjoyed her meal but would have liked the duck to be cooked a little longer.  I will chalk this up to me and my wife being the issue and not them.

The seafood dishes (seafood lobster pasta and fish of the day) was enjoyed thoroughly by our family.

We shared dessert - Creme brûlée and the bread pudding - amazing.

The drinks are strong - we each had cocktails.

All this while Jazz music is playing off the hook!  

This is a place to go on a date and impress - we saw a lot of other couples enjoying the night.  

Would I go again - definitely.
author: Zack E.

description:
MY 300TH REVIEW!!! What's better than having the restaurant where I had my birthday dinner at as my 300th?? 

FIRST: Thank you Cherylynn N., for suggesting that I have my birthday dinner BIX, awesome suggestion!! =) 

APPETIZERS
POTATO PILLOWS w/ Creme Friache and American Sturgeon Caviar- OMG, this has to be the best thing I have ever put in my mouth (that's what she said). It reminded me of tater tots but it 100 times better than that frozen stuff. =X The creme friache added a nice creamy compsition to the crispy exterior and pillow like interior and the caviar added just the right amount of salitness. I NEED TO COME BACK TO BIX FOR THESE POTATO PILLOWS!! *DROOLS* If I could, I'd come here every single day for the rest of my life for these potato pillows!

MARROW BONES w/ parsley, shallot and caper salad and grilled durum batard- the marrow tasted exactly how bone marrow should taste, rich and bursting with flavor. Too bad there wasn't enough of it to spread on the batard, dammit!! The caper salad was a bit salty and if you put too much of it on top of the marrow, it masked the rich flavors of the marrow BUT nonetheless it was a very good dish.

DINNER
BLACK TRUFFLE CHEESE BURGER served open face on rye w/ truffle fries- Let me just say that this was a FREAKIN' GOOD BURGER!! I love black truffles and to stick it in between a burger and bun is just plain genius. The patty was juicy and cooked to perfection, I asked for medium rare and that's exactly what I got! The truffle added the perfect balance of saltiness to the burger and each bite of the juicy patty and black truffle was heavenly. The truffle fries were crunchy on the outside and soft and airy on the inside, they were seasoned perfectly and I think I may have gotten full as fast as I did all thanks to the fries (I could not stop eating them). 

THERE'S ALWAYS ROOM FOR DESSERT
BANANAS FOSTER w/ dark rum and vanilla ice cream- I love bananas foster so when we got our dessert menus, my eyes kept going back to this. The warm bananas and sauce was poured over vanilla ice cream table side and looked oh so good!! There's something about bananas foster brings a sense of comfort, it's like a home away from home. 

POLITE & FRIENDLY = A++
Our waitress was very polite, friendly and very well spoken. She was attentive and checked up on us every now and then to make sure everything was okay. The bus boy who I might add was very polite as well, he made sure that our empty plates were taken away and made sure our glasses were full. Also, he excused himself every time he reached in front and across us, thank you for being so polite!! =) 

CONCLUSION 
I will definitely be back and I'll make sure of it because I need to get my hands on those potato pillows again, those things are so addicting (it must have crack in it, it must)!! The service was excellent and as was the food, both aspects having me want to come back for more! BIX is one of my favorite restaurants in the city and anyone who asks me for a restaurant recommendation, will be recommended BIX. =)

YOU HAVEN'T SEEN THE LAST OF ME BIX, YOU AND YOUR POTATO PILLOWS AND MARROW BONES WON'T BE AND AREN'T SAFE FROM ME! =X
author: Heather C.

description:
It makes me a little sad to give this establishment 3 stars,  there were  some very wonderful things about our experience but the negative things were glaring. Because food was the main negative I'm giving Bix 3 stars.
The negatives- both our entrees were almost inedible. My cousin got the burger, requested medium well and it  ran with blood.  The rye bun is a poor choice for a burger the texture is tough and the taste is bitter. The truffle fries were borderline burnt, I don't meant crispy, i mean so hard you can almost not bite through them.
My meal- I ordered the duck salad the brought me lobster, I was disappointed because I love duck salad  but  I agreed to keep it. It was the worst lobster salad I've ever had!! Lobster was mushy lacking firmness and flavor. Additionally there was barley any lobster.  The couple sitting next to us were also disappointed in there entrees.
The positives - the potato pillows we're like a gift from heaven.  The deviled eggs were phenomenal The desserts also were Devine!
Service was great!!!
Maybe it just a place for anything but the entree
author: The Entrepid M.

description:
This is one of my favorite restaurants in the city, and one that I have been to multiple times, sometimes just for cocktails and drinks.  

From the moment you walk in you are transported to a different era.  It is so elegant and gorgeous inside, with the added bonus of live piano playing.

Service is stellar and so is the food.  I really enjoy how they make cocktails and the steak tartare tableside.

This is a very romantic and special occasion type of restaurant.  By special occasion, I mean, sometimes it's a Tuesday night and you are feeling "special".  Definitely a treat to dine here.

Keep up the good work, Bix!

P.S.  They also make one of my favorite burgers.  Yes, the truffle burger is good, but the classic is even better!

P.P.S.  I love a spot that offers bananas foster as a dessert.  Get it!
author: Jennifer H.

description: Great atmosphere, especially when live piano is part of the experience. It is on the louder side as there is an active bar area, music and quite a few people moving around. Staff is helpful and friendly, food is delicious and it is a wonderful place for a celebratory dinner.
author: Brian T.

description:
--------DINNER ONLY-------
3.5
Took the fiancé here for his birthday celebration this past Sunday. It's located on Gold Street (parallel and between Pacific & Jackson), which is easy to miss if you're not paying attention. I'm digging the set up here. Tall ceiling, open space makes for a great atmosphere. Make sure to ask for balcony/upstairs seating so you can enjoy the view of the entire restaurant.

Here's what we ordered:
Potato pillows - These were good but not amazing. I guess I was expecting a little more since so many people raved about these.
Steak tartare -Big portions, pretty standard but this could be an entrée in itself
Chilled foie gras- If you LOVE foie gras and absolutely must get it, then this is worth it. I love foie gras but I'm a bigger fan of seared so this was great but I probably could have skipped it.
Lobster rolls - The lobster bits were good and the bread was soft but it seemed a little standard.
Cheese burger - The fiancée tried this (I did not because I was full by this point) and said it was delicious but nothing spectacular.
Green chili apple pie - SO good. There is a slight kick to it but the crunchy texture added in with the savory apple pie makes this one of the best desserts I've had in recent months.

Overall, things are good but I wouldn't say "omg you HAVE to come here and order this" but I don't think you'd be disappointed either. I will say though, that the green chili apple pie is worth trying because 1) it's pretty unique in what it is and 2) it was damn delicious and an awesome way to end the meal.
author: Diana Y.

description:
I've been here a few times and the food and service have always been impeccable. The vibe is relaxing yet elegant. Finally, they have a stellar wine list. 

My favorites: Potato Pillows and Elixir No.3
author: Taylor M.

description:
Bad evening
We chose Bix at the recommendation of friends.

Our waiter poured broth from my veal chop plate down my shirt and on my cashmere jacket.
He then used my napkin to dab club soda on the shirt trying to hide the coat problem.

We asked he and the front door lady to have the manager visit our table to discuss the issue.

It took 15 minutes and he acted as if he was surprised with the issue.

In the end he did the right thing but the manager and the waiter brought the experience to a very low level.

Food was good but not exceptional as we had been led to believe.

This place may have been better in past years. 

The ambience is very good I must say.
author: Ron M.

description:
Excellent dining experience. The atmosphere is excellent, dark, and the music was brilliant. They had a jazz trio or quartet going for a good portion of our meal. We were seated soon after arriving for our reservation to a an excellent corner table for our party of 5. We shared:

Two orders of steak tartare (excellent)
1 order of deviled eggs (excellent)
1 marrow boen per person (decent)
2 bottles of champagne
1 large order of lobster spaghetti (excellent)
1 duck breast (delicious)
1 order of pork (didn't try it)

The service was high  class and courteous and our waiter was great. We had 2 desserts which were the chocolate bread pudding and home made rocky road ice cream, a few coffee and some port.

Overall I had an excellent dinner, great atmosphere and it wasn't THAT expensive.
author: Jordan C.

description:
Bix is like taking a step back into prohibition era bar in NYC,  with light jazz in the background. Maybe that's an overstatement, but it's got a great vibe that is like stepping back a few decades. Food and drinks are great as well. But it's best when hanging out at the bar with a drink or with a group of friends at the table. 

They do have valet parking as well. Reservations recommended.
author: H L.

description:
I've eaten here half a dozen times since moving to San Francisco ~3 years ago and have always had a very satisfying experience. The cocktails are original and creative, but the wine list and dessert wine lists are also extensive and not unreasonably priced considering the environment. The dinner menu is well curated and not overwhelming --- the specials are also usually intriguing whether I've indulged or not. 

The open-faced burger is an interesting take and I've ordered it at least half of the times I've visited ---- it's a simple dish, but it's delicious and quite filling. 

With respect to the music, they usually start at around 8p (on weekends, not sure about week nights), and, so as to prevent any confusion here, we are talking about mostly string jazz (piano, cello, bass guitar), not brass jazz, though I think they mix it up. And the music is great, just do not expect your request to hear the next John Coltrane over your steak. 

The service is very accommodating --- like an offensive line in football, the best restaurant service is the service you only notice if it's doing something wrong. I don't mean that in a negative sense, the attention is personal, but only to the extent that you want it to be. 

As a youngish looking mid twenty something I'd also like to give kudos to this place for not having an attitude about hosting "under 30" guests -- that may sound ridiculous but it's not. 

Last, major kudos to the service for finding a way, without a prior reservation, on a Friday evening in May, to seat my family and my fiance's family (8 total), after we had a mishap at another establishment earlier in the evening. Perhaps we got lucky but I will give Bix the benefit of the doubt here. 

Keep up the great work.
author: Adam H.

description:
I got so many referrals to eat here and it's even listed in 7x7's list of things to eat in SF. Unfortunately, it was completely overrated to me.

The overall feel of this place is cool, it takes you back in time in a good way. It's dark, very jazzy and reminds me of an Art Deco New York. It actually looks like you are in a theater because of the seating on the top and bottom floors - very cool. We were lucky enough to get seats on the second floor and overlook the entire restaurant. It was actually very nice.

While the ambiance was quite nice, I just felt the food was overpriced and not memorable. We ordered the obligatory and highly recommended tuna tartare. Someone comes by with a cart and assembles it by your table, it's fun to watch because it's a whole production. It was the best thing we ate that night, but I've had better tuna tartare at other places. The best part about it was watching the host assemble it. We ordered a few of the entrees and they were overpriced and fell flat to me. They just aren't great. I just didn't understand what everyone was bragging about? 

It is, indeed, a nice place to eat. The service is top notch and the ambiance is elegant without being so "beige". But the food, which is obviously an extremely important factor, was not memorable.
author: Stella C.

description:
WE HAD HAIR IN OUR FOOD...and the service was HORRIBLE.

Let me start off with the location. We went at night, and this place is in a shady little alley. Sure it may be a fancy place,but for a couple of petite girls walking there at night alone was pretty scary...

We had reservations, and we still had to wait 35 minutes to get seated which is crap, because it completely defeated the purpose of even making reservations

It was definitely a fancy place, people were very dressed up, so we definitely felt under-dressed, but anyways we finally got seated upstairs. The lights very dim and they were definitely trying to create a date night/romantic ambiance.

Anyways the waitress came, gave us some bread, asked if we wanted anything to drink. As soon as we declined any alcoholic beverages, it seemed as if our waitress disappeared. She only came back to take our order.

We ordered the potato pillows, truffle fries, and this lobster pasta thing. 

About 20 minutes later our waitress finally brought out our food. 

The truffle fries were PLAIN FRIES, like there was nothing special about them, they weren't even good fries, they tasted bland and i regretted ordering them.

The potato pillows were pretty good.

The pasta was okay, like it tasted like something from red lobster, and it was definitely not worth the price.

and not once while we were eating did our waitress come back and check on us, yet we saw her flitting about all the other tables around us.

BUT IT GETS WORSE, THERE WAS HAIR IN THE BREAD. (we continued eating the bread from earlier). 

we asked the guy who was refilling our water to get our waitress, and she still didn't come and check on us. By this point we were completely fed and went to her ourselves. 

She barely apologized, seemed like she didn't care AT ALL that we were upset, and brought our check. They had taken off the potato pillows to "compensate' for the horrible service and the hair in our food.

ANYWAYS THIS PLACE WAS AWFUL. the food was mediocre at best, and the service ABSOLUTELY HORRENDOUS, plus it was ridiculously expensive. I don't mind paying good money for food, but the food has to be good, and trust me, this food was not.

It was really disappointing because we were very excited to try this place, and it completely bombed :/
author: Saniya S.

description:
I was in SF for a work seminar, and my colleague really wanted to visit this place.  Since I love jazz music, and am a fan of trying out new places, I was in.  Reservations are the way to go--we had a table ready for us when we arrived. We stopped by the bar before being seated to allow the rest of our party to arrive. I have a lot I can say about this place, but will try to keep it short.  

1. Atmosphere--Don't let the alley like entrance fool you... the small neon sign marking the entrance to this place is like a beacon to times past.  The venue is small but not stuffy, with an elegant staircase leading to a balcony/terrace second level of intimate tables which wraps along the edge of the restaurant just high enough above the main and slightly crowded lower floor. A corner of the first floor by the kitchen was reserved for the live jazz group--which began to set up as we arrived, and was in full swing before we left.  I had the feeling that Frank Sinatra or Rosemary Clooney would have been at home here. 

2. Food--the ingredients and presentation stole the show.  This meal was my first time trying caviar or black truffles.  I wasn't as fond of the caviar as I was the black truffles... which was nestled on creme fraiche and potato pillows (which was eerily like fancy tater tots with sour cream), and just added a jelly-salty consistency. But they were very pretty tater tots... For dinner, I had the black truffle cheeseburger (I know..I know..ordering a cheeseburger here, but I was very happy with my choice) with garlic/black truffle flavored french fries. The earthiness of the truffle and the sweetness of the perfectly caramelized onion on the burger was a divine combination. And I have never had better fries(especially paired with their house aioli)!  Most of my colleagues ordered the lobster macaroni--which greatly impressed them.

3. Service--impeccable. The wait staff was knowledgeable about the different menu selections, attentive to beverage levels and service needs, and charming as well.  They made the beautiful atmosphere, great music, and delightful food come together to create a wonderful dining experience.  

I look forward to taking my husband here the next time we're in town--but I'm definitely going to request a table on the upper balcony next time. I drop this place down one star ONLY for how crowded the first floor tables feel when the place reaches capacity.  Everything else was wonderful.
author: Tashara H.

description:
Snazzy jazzy place. The ambiance of this restaurant is its differentiator. Tucked away in an alleyway of SF, this jazz-themed hip restaurant makes you feel like you're in a 1920s film upon entrance. 

It was hard to decide on what to order, since I'm guessing the menu changes often. I really wanted the bavette steak, but I only found the steak tartare on the menu. Between two people, we shared the provolone wrapped in prosciutto, deviled eggs, steak tartare, truffle fries and the bix burger. The highlight was definitely the deviled eggs. Simply delectable and so well-executed. Anyway, this was WAY too much for two people to handle. Lesson learned. 

Each dish came out one after another; the time between our appetizers first course and main course were so widely spread out that we had fully digested by the time we got our burger. Though the burger was good, it was torturous just trying to finish half of it. 

Tip: Don't order more than you can handle. Favorites of the night were the deviled eggs and truffle fries. Yum.
author: MyLinh P.

description:
Nice old school restaurant. Try the lobster spaghetti, bone marrow and truffle fries! Also, get the chocolate bread pudding-- it's to die for!! Drinks are pretty good here, too!

However, the hostess isn't friendly and service is subpar. Maybe an off night.
author: Mai G.

description:
I will never come back to this restaurant --not because the food , that was actually quite good, but the service. The host was extremely rude to me. I was there for my 40th birthday celebration and had reservations for  9 people. Most of my friends had to travel up from the penisula, and they were a bit late. The host was extremely rude and not at all professional about this. He did not make us feel welcomed, telling me we would have a problem if they didn't arrive soon(and not in a nice or gentle way at all). This was at 615. Most of our party was sitting down by 625 or so. 

When I walked out of the restaurant I smiled at him to try to make peace and leave on a good note, and he snickered at me. There are many, many restaurants in SF in which you can pay a lot less, and have a much better vibe from the staff. The Waiter was fine,but not at all warm or funny--just all business. Sorry Bix, but for trying to portray a classy and refined image, your staff falls way short.
author: Jess B.

description:
Great atmosphere. Friday nights there is
Live jazz. Which is always a plus. The lighting is pretty dim, but it makes the vibe... The food was pretty good. I got the lobster spaghetti, which was simple, but good. The bread was fresh and amazing. The wine list is extensive and decently priced.
author: Rosie N.

description:
Our group of 4 made a 7:30 reservation on a Monday night.  We weren't seated until 8.  Boo. 

BUT WAIT!

It's the way that Bix and the man in charge, my boy Blake, handled it that gets the 5 stars.  

Blake came to us at about 7:45, apologized to our group for the wait, and brought us a small appetizer for us to share.  This was a nice gesture.  A lot of places just leave you hanging. like psh whatever, y'all can wait.  Not on Blake's watch.  

Another 10 minutes pass by - Blake apologizes again, brings out another appetizer, one that's even on the menu.  Mozzarella wrapped in prosciutto.  After he left, we decided to order another drink.  The bartender informs us that Blake wants to buy us a round. 

Well damn, maybe we should just keep waiting!  Hah.

Anyway, shortly after that we were seated.  The rest of this review is pretty par for the course.  Food was good, server was knowledgeable and attentive.  Crowd is on the older side, atmosphere is classy.  It's a nice restaurant, but I guess you knew that already.

Blake is that dude though.  That's how you take care of your guests.
author: Louie M.

description:
My quest for the best burger in the Bay Area is never ending. I keep waffling between Nopa and BIX. After last nights early dinner here, I am now handing the crown back to BIX.

BIX also offers one of the most unique dining atmospheres in the City. Tucked away down a tiny ally, the dining room is a throw back to the prohibition era. A classy bar stretches along the entrance where master bartenders whip up some of the best cocktails around. 

Last night the service was a little hit and miss, but it was an off night and they may have been a bit short staffed. We discovered a new dish, the chicken hash is amazing! They resemble crabcakes, served over a light cream sauce and a side of cherry tomatoes, this dish is truly mouth watering. We also got a side of creamed spinach, which I must say is the best I have ever tasted, not overly creamy and does not weigh you down. This dish also makes a nice starter/appetizer. 

I booked our reservation off my Yelp app, but discovered that I was not awarded any opentable dining points. Not the restaurants fault, but keep this in mind when booking your future ressies.
author: Rene C.

description:
I actually had a very fun dinner here.  I also appreciate that this is a throwback to the 20s as far as decor, tablecloths, well-dressed servers, and with the grand piano, live music, this is a classy restaurant so it's got good ambience for a special occasion.  But a couple of my friends have raved about this place for ages and say it's one of their favorite restaurants in the city, so my expectations were set high.  While the highlights were the decor and drinks (and the fact that they have a valet given the neighborhood), the meal seemed overpriced since the food wasn't as good as I'd expect for a fine dining restaurant.   It is also quite hard to have a conversation because the live music is loud.  I had the pork belly buns and the lobster spaghetti, both of which were pretty good, just not great.  Friends ordered the lobster bisque, potato pillows, and dungeness crab rolls for appetizers and the steak and several orders of salmon and their other fish special.  With a couple of bottles of wine, it ended up around $100 pp.  I'd try it again to see if it was just an off night, although based on some of the recent Yelp reviews, maybe it wasn't.  

The bar was a great place to meet up before being seated - I can see why this is a popular hangout for the financial district crowd.
author: Vivian W.

description:
This is a rare moment when I give 5 stars to any restaurant but if Yelp had the option of more than 5 stars, I'd definitely give more. Let's start by saying I'm a very very very picky eater. I'm allergic to a lot of foods but I also don't eat many kinds of foods. Having said that, this place has won me over with their simple menu. There's a few entrees, a few appetizers, and salads. Their wine list is very long and I'd love to try all of the wines someday :) 

The service is amazing. Robert helped us and he was so accommodating and helpful. We gave our car to the valet but didn't have the exact change. He actually gave the money out of his own pocket and we definitely returned the favor by tipping well, which he deserved! I'm allergic to crawfish, so he was very skeptical about letting me order the Lobster Spaghetti (which is the best spaghetti I've ever had) and kept warning me about it multiple, which was a very sweet thing to do. I went ahead and ordered it, and I'm sitting here with hives on arms but good food in my tummy. I'd eat it again any day despite my allergy! It's that good. 

Other than that, we had Potato Pillows, Bix Fried Chicken, and Chicken Hash. The food was THE best and I'd definitely recommend this anyone.

Oh, and the decor is very nice and intimate. The live music is the cherry on the top! Lovely lovely place!
author: Nanditha G.

description:
Very swank and evocative. Close your eyes and imagine you're back in time -- the '30s to be exact. Food so scrumptious (divine lobster spaghetti!), cocktails expertly made, service attentive, live music playing in the background. There's a reason they've been around for so long. 

A perfect place to enjoy an elegant evening with your honey!
author: E. G.

description:
Overdue review from March 2013.

The pluses: good live jazz music, delicious duck entree, melt in the mouth salmon tartar (definitely a must to try), tasty garlic fries...

The minuses: table too close to the music, too loud.  Difficult to have a conversation. If you have an option to reserve on the second floor (overlooking the main dining area) - do it.  Coats require checking.  Manhattan cocktail was too strong, not good.  Potato pillows and lamb mini burgers were just okay.
author: Elly R.

description:
Had the Pork Chop and it was great. There was a pear relish on the side that we exceptional.  Finished it off with the warm cookies and whisky cream that was very good.

A bit loud but great!
author: Chuck E.

description:
This place has always been a favorite! It's classic San Francisco, and has that old jazz club vibe. It super cool to pull down Gold street, have a valet waiting, and slip behind the velvet curtain.

This place also has a lot of history, as they filmed some movies here. But it had gotten somewhat tired. The menu was stale, and never really added the excitement the venue had to order. Honestly - I think it was the same 5 appetizers for 5 years. I think I ordered potato latkes with sour cream and caviar every time over 5 years.

Now - it's a whole new swanky story! Same fab atmosphere, with updated menu to boot. We tried all the new small plates and there wasn't a bad one in the bunch! Stuffed eggs, crab cakes, sliders, wontons - all super tasty.

Our dinners were also fantastic. We had steaks, chicken and pasta - all great.most notable was the service. Instead of a snotty guy, we had an Asian goddess. She was fun, knew the menu and made our night superb. 5 stars for taking a tired beauty and reinvigorating great food and service.
author: Maureen B.

description:
We Celebrated my husbands Birthday at BIX. This was a beautiful restaurant that took you back to early 20's Manhattan during the times of Frank Sinatra. There was live jazz and the ambiance was romantic with dim lighting. As we entered, it seemed like we went back in time to that era. 

Now for the food! BERKSHIRE PORKCHOP!!! OH EM GEE!!!! I can't believe porkchop could be that good. I ONLY got it because I'm pregnant...But if every porkchop tasted like this--that would be a must for me in restaurants.
My husband who got the $44 ny steak (in fine print in the bottom of the menu) even agreed that he liked my porkchop better. But he still liked his entree, yet he still asked me for a piece of my porkchop Twice. Get the deviled Eggs (its 4 pieces-savor each taste) and have a martini cocktail shaken at your tableside. 

I give it 4 stars only because noise level can be a bit loud but not too bad. 

The place has live jazz starting between 7:30-8pm depending on the days. Great romantic ambiance. A stilleto hangout where the woman are nicely dressed and the men are in Suits---thank goodness I'm doing this now before the baby :)
author: Q A.

description:
Pros: Dreamy interiors. Old-school service. Decadent small bites and cocktails.

Cons: While Bix is a San Francisco institution, it's now facing some really stiff culinary competition from a growing number of world class, Michelin starred restaurants in the city. As a result, Bix's entrees come off as a bit forgettable and expensive for what they are.
author: Tai N.

description:
I had the burger and it was just ok. I would not order it again. It was flavorless and the cheese was the only thing I could taste.
Overall the food was a little too salty.
Crab cakes were good, but the chicken  appetizer was salty.
The staff was very attentive that's why I have them 3 stars.
I will question the referrals from this friend in the future. 
Will not be back!!
author: Al T.

description: The flavors of our dinner last evening was awesome. However, the music was WAY too loud. We could not hold a conversation without shouting, and we missed half of everything said. Great conversation, and fond memories will always trump a great tasting meal, especially where great food in a city like San Francisco is redundant. We won't be back.
author: David T.

description:
We had a party of 8 which they were happy to accommodate (we did make a reservation.) The lobster spaghetti was AMAZING and nothing seemed overpriced for how good it was. Make sure to get their bar mix (chex mix thing)

The jazz was phenomenal as well. 
Minus one star because there is absolutely no light and I could feel a migraine coming on from that.
author: Lizzi E.

description: Old school, classy, timeless local establishment one must explore!  It's hands down my favorite hidden gem in SF!  Food, staff & drinks are world class!
author: Heidi H.

description:
Best meal I can remember!

Came here for my birthday dinner and it was incredibly special. They sat us at a very roomy corner booth on the second level. There was a card at the table that said "Happy Birthday", and they even remembered the candles on my dessert. Great service and even better food.

The Negroni-  perfect balance of bitter and sweet

Boxcar- smokey and delicious 

Gin St. Germain cocktail- can't remember the name of it but it was refreshing and lovely

Truffle deviled eggs- I could eat a table of these (we got another order they were so good)

Potato pillows- like perfect hash browns with creme fraiche and caviar!

Ceviche- good but I'd pass next time (probably for another order of deviled eggs)

Oysters- perfect size and tasted amazing and fresh

Caesar salad- not as good as Slow Club's but exactly what I was looking for

Chicken hash entree- not was we were expecting but was cooked perfectly...tender chicken with crunchy bread crumb crust

Chocolate bread pudding- best dessert I've had in the city...fluffy like a soufflé, but had a gooey center like a lava cake...served with fresh whipped cream

I have dreams about that meal!
author: Sami L.

description: Bix was back their excellent form last night.  The service attentive and our meal was outstanding! The floor manager made a point to assist in attending to our table and brought us a complimentary amuse bouche and even an extra dessert! I have been dining at Bix since 1990 and it continues to be a favorite. We make a point to make time in our schedule every visit to San Francisco.
author: Caroline C.

description:
Highly recommend Bix if you want a classic old school SF dining experience.  It has a speakeasy and jazz club vibe, partly due to its location in the middle of the Gold St. alley.  Went here for a Saturday night and sat in the balcony area.  Everything was top notch.  

Started with cocktails, including martinis shaken at the table.  We brought a 1997 Caymus Cabernet and the cork broke. Not their fault and no problem. The sommelier brought a filter type device and perfectly decanted the wine.  They gave us a comp deviled egg appetizer that was fantastic.

For starters we shared the beef tartare and heirloom tomatoes.  Excellent with the cocktails.

For entrees we had the lobster pasta, chicken hash, trout salad and steak.  Every plate was wiped clean.

During the meal we listened to the jazz combo.  Tunes from Miles Davis, the Duke and others.

Things were going so well we shared deserts.  They brought us a comped bananas foster.  (We never did figure out why they comped a dessert, but who cares.)  The chocolate bread pudding and cookie deserts were fantastic.

Probably the best part was the service.  Our waitress was friendly and knowledgeable and patient.  Nothing pushy or phony.  No canned spiels, but very natural and friendly.  The busboys would ask before clearing plates or glasses and were very attentive.

This place is total CLASS.
author: Zin M.

description:
The night we went I had a really good time.
We sat at the bar and started with the asparagus soup with a poached egg and saffron aioli....so so so good! I couldn't get enough of this heavenly stuff.
We drank a half bottle of Honig Sauv Blanc...I love half bottles of wine so we could continue with another.
We also enjoyed the Halibut Cerviche which was pretty terrific. We also had Oysters, yum, taken care of pretty well, and the Beets salad with gorgonzola pannacotta, delicious!!!!!!!
My favorite thing I ate was the Veal Chop with mushrooms...I know naughty, Veal, deliciously naughty veal...and creamed spinach....HOLY SMOKES! I left feeling very sated and happy.
25 years this place has been here, go and be snobby and they will love you too.
author: Violet J.

description:
Bix has managed to do the unthinkable; they have managed to take something as unfavorable as brussel sprouts and turn them into one of my favorite foods.

Between those lovely little veggies and the potato pillows, I don't think I've ever eaten so well in my life!
author: Casey S.

description:
The food is a well deserved 4 stars but our service that night was 2 stars at best.

What we ordered: 

Steak Tartare - DELICIOUS!
Shallots, Capers,Parsley & MustardBlack Olive Toasts
Prepared Tableside $14.00

REVIEW- I loved it! i saw all the reviews raving about this dish and it was mouth watering. I also enjoyed watching it be prepared at our tableside by our snooty server. 

American Kobe Bavette Steak with Pommes Puree- DELICIOUS!
Roasted Cipollini Onions and Natural Jus 39.00

REVIEW: Little bits of heaven cooked rare. It was perfect, juicy, red and flavorful. Seriously, it couldnt have been made better. The pommes puree was whipped perfectly  and the shallots on the side was a nice touch.

Alaskan Halibut with Asparagus, Peas, Baby Carrots-  OKAY!
Broccoli Di Ciccio and Basil-Mint Broth 34.50

REVIEW: This was good but nothing too special. I liked the peas and veggies more than the fish itself. 

Now onto the service!

We had a young female server that mentioned that it was her 1 year aniversary there. I think she may have been the only female server that was there that evening. Anyways, Elease and I did not like her attitude. She was not welcoming and seemed rushed to take our order. We were not ready the first two times she came around so she seemed annoyed. As a result, we were annoyed to have to put up with her attitude. After she took our full order and poured us our wine she never came back to check on us even once. Later, she offered us the dessert menu but we just wanted to leave due to the lame service provided by her. Even the gentleman that came around with the bread seem warm compared to our buzz kill server.

Im sure the service at Bix isnt horrible and it was just our particular server so I would like to come back again and be delighted to stay for desserts and extra drinks.
author: Jeanne L.

description:
Bix definitely has it down.  It is quite elegant but not in a snobbish sort of way.  Even a reformed Chinese coolie like me did not feel out of place dining here and that's good for me & the establishment.  
I was impressed with the hostess' hospitality/sensitivity. My friend had to go to the ladies room and instead of sitting me at my table, she asked if I wanted to wait until my friend returns.  I thought that was a good touch.  Often the hostess just leads me to my table then my friend had to look for me.  So I complimented her on this.  She politely nods her head & said it was her pleasure to be of service.  How's that for sophistication?  
We ordered our drinks, appetizers & dinner courses.  I had the popular lobster linguine.  It was an exquisite dish, not too heavy, just enough to leave room for dessert.  The perfect martini was a strong one. I'm glad it was not watered down.  The wine list was less opulent than expected.  
The live jazz ensemble was a nice touch.  That's always a plus in my book.  This is a nice place for date night.  I will bring my girl here for a surprise romantic dinner...
author: Michael L.

description: Bix has been a pleasure to visit. Though it's front doors and alleyway to go in might intimidate you, once you go in, you'll be wanting to go back for more. The food is outrageously delicious. The servers are awesome and the environment gives an impression of a New York - broadway show kind of feel. Definitely worth of a try.
author: Kevin L.

description: Okay, so the place was packed and we had to make an early reservation.  Went there because we wanted some live music during dinner. So FYI, piano player starts at 6:00 but combo isn't until 7:30.  Dinner was real solid and plentiful.  Wine list was extensive.  Only small negative was the hush-puppy like potato crisp appetizer with a dollop of sour cream and caviar they call a "potato pillow" was light and fluffy. Caviar was a little lacking for my taste.  I like the Russian sturgeon with a nice pop to the eggs.  Oh well, my preference.  They did take it off the bill and the customer service was delightful. Over-all a real nice experience on a back alley of San Fran.  Very shii-shii-fon-fon.
author: Daniel F.

description:
In my opinion, this place used to be much better back in the day. It's super pricy, and the food just isn't that amazing.  The burger was soggy and and hard to eat, but the beet and goat cheese app was great.

The atmosphere is pretty stuffy and stiff, since the crowd is a bunch of financial district, suit and tie dudes wine and dining clients.

The service put a cute "happy anniversary" card on our table to help celebrate us the occasion, which was sweet. In my opinion though, go somewhere with more personality, like SPQR, Beretta, State Bird, or others.
author: Kira M.

description:
Classy.  Dimly lit.  Romantic.  White-coated bartenders that make excellent drinks. Excellent food and service.  Historical district of San Francisco.  

Check it out.
author: Lisa M.

description:
SO DISAPPOINTING 

Few months ago: My friend and I wanted to catch up over a nice dinner and picked BIX based on its Yelp rating. We made reservations and even dressed up to make it extra fun. 

All our excitement was crushed as soon as I walked in.

After waiting for five minutes for valet and not seeing anyone around, I went inside to ask 
Me: hi, I have a reservation but I wanted to valet park our car
Man host: well didn't you see someone outside? 
Me: no, that's why I came in
Man host: you need to just wait outside
Me: um okay......

So after waiting some more, we get our car parked and walk in. my friend gets her coat checked and we get to our table in the corner next to the bathroom. 

Woman host with someone else's coat check tag in hand: I think this is your coat check tag 
Friend: no, you already gave me mine
Woman host: are you sure? 
Friend: yes
Woman host: this one has to be yours
Friend: you already gave me mine before we sat down
Woman host: well where is it
Friend looks in her clutch, doesn't see it 
Woman host: see told you this was yours 
Friend looks under her clutch and finds her tag on the table: see here it is
Woman host: oh (walks away) 

After the interrogation and unpleasant interactions, we just felt exhausted and wanted to get through dinner. Thank goodness our server and runners didn't drink the same haterade as the hosts and were actually nice. We ordered the starter sampler, steak tartare, bavette steak, and two side vegetables (i think one was peas) and cocktails. We hoped the food would help us forget about what happened beforehand but everything was just a little bit above average but not exceptional. The best thing was the steak tartare. Skip the sampler, nothing special. 

The hosts should work at the DMV, they'd be perfect. i'm never coming back.
author: Leslie P.

description:
Does anyone else find themselves asking why of why did I choose another french restaurant?  More often than not i find they are the most expensive places to eat.  The food is always so so to me ( I may lack the taste buds for this stuff) and when I get a plate many a times I have to think of an attack plan for approaching the dish. 

All in all still a good experience.  Been here twice and the service is just ho hum to me.  Nothing special in my experience. The food was good and the quality was there.  You'll spend a few bucks and I would say it's worth a try.
author: Robert Z.

description:
I am giving BIX 3 stars solely for the food quality. 

While BIX uses good ingredients, each dish tastes like one homogenous mass. I prefer the taste to be more defined and each component of my meal to have a distinct flavor. 

I had pork shoulder and belly and had to think a bit before I could tell which was which. Both cuts tasted pretty similar. I also tried the duck breast. Once again the taste was homogenous and the entire dish was mixed. Peppers and Creamed spinach as sides were simply that. There would be nothing different between having these at BIX and having them at any other dining establishment.

Trout tartare had orange zest glaze on it which did not complement the fish at all. 

The setting is great. Beautiful building, just the right amount of light and great live music. This is also one of the few places in the city were people dress up.
author: Marianna P.

description:
Was here yesterday, celebrating a co-workers anniversary. All of us, did the Prix Fixe.

I enjoyed the squash soup, it was flavorful and the parmesan topped crouton's that were slightly charred was a nice touch.
I opted for the seared ahi tuni with romano beans and cherry tomatoes; masterfully seared, delicious sushi grade ahi- very sweet tasting, soft as butter! layered on a bed of romano beans and tiny cherry tomatoes sauteed gently in some buttery sauce.

The Prix Fixe used to be $35 and included dessert; now the price is $25 with no dessert. Get skinny !!!

Shared a Banana Foster too; it was very good too.

Decor: upscale

Tip: this place is hard to find and in a quaint alley; head down Montgomery street, just past Columbus Street. Look for a side alley named Gold.
author: Bert K.

description:
Visited this restaurants to celebrate my wife's birthday last week and everything about this place is classy. Perfect drinks, great service, lighting was low and romantic and on top of that live JAZZ (perfect combination)
We loved the food to death and ..yeah great ambiance with 1930's art deco decor
Must visit according to me and yes we will be back
author: Jitender S.

description:
After reading all of the great reviews, I was hoping that I would be giving BIX a higher rating than 2 stars.  However, when I look at the rating definitions, between "Meh. I've experienced better." and "A-OK", I have to go with "Meh.  I've experienced better".  Here are some reasons why:

We had a reservation for 7 people at 6:00 PM on a Friday.  Two of us showed up a bit before 6, and grabbed a cocktail at the bar.  One Sidecar and one BIX Perfect Manhattan cost over $30 with tax and tip, which normally I would be fine with.  However, the drink glasses are tiny.  I literally could have taken 2 sips and my drink would have been gone.  After a while passed, 2 other guests showed up right around reservation time.  I had heard from the additional 3 guests that they would be arriving about 30 minutes late.  Given the amount of time it would take them to arrive, I approached the host to discuss options.  The host immediately stated that he would not be able to seat us until the entire group had arrived.  However, if they would not arrive for 30 minutes, he would not be able to seat us at all.  I told him that I understand their policy, and that if he was worried about revenue, that all 7 of us would be ordering drinks, appetizers, and entrees, and if he was worried about timing, I let him know that the 4 of us would order appetizers, and the remaining 3 guests would catch up when they arrived so that we would not take more than the normal amount of time.  To this the host replied that there is an "implicit agreement" when you make a reservation that the entire party will be there on time to be seated.  I agreed, but stated that "life happens" sometimes, and people become delayed.  He finally admitted that the reason he would not seat us is that they had a hard reservation at 8:30 PM.  I told him that we would have to leave by 7:30 / 7:45 at the latest as we were attending a show at 8:00 PM.  After this, he agreed to seat the 4 of us.  In the long run, I wish that he would have just stated from the beginning that we would have to be out by 8:15 for his hard reservation at 8:30...the entire conversation would have ended there as we had to be gone by 7:45 at the latest.

The food:  We really loved the appetizers.  The truffle deviled eggs were so good that we ordered a second plate so that all of our party could try them.  The mozzarella / prosciutto wraps were delicious with a hint of olive oil and cracked pepper.  The fried chicken was tangy and spicy, and very tasty.  I did not try the Arancini, but the table enjoyed them.  For entree's, 2 of us ordered the $28 truffle burger, 3 ordered the lobster spaghetti, 1 ordered the chicken hash, and 1 ordered the New York strip.  The hamburgers were underwhelming to say the least.  The truffle flavor was powerful and rich, which was nice, but my meat was overcooked.  The other guests's burger did not taste much of truffle at all, and for $28, he had expected more.  Reviews on the lobster spaghetti and chicken were "meh",  The steak was delicious, perfectly cooked, and totally worth $42.

The service at the table was great.  The server was aware of our time constraints, and helped us get out the door when we needed to by giving us queues on when we should order, taking early orders, etc.  I would go back to BIX to give it one more try, as I never like to completely give up on a restaurant for one experience.  Hopefully at that point, I can update my rating.  Also, for the out-of-towners who claim that this is the "must go to" restaurant in San Francisco, you are sorely mistaken.
author: Nick T.

description:
Exquisite. 

What I loved about this place:
- Fancy. Girls, wear your dresses. Fellas, wear your collared shirts and slacks. 
- Coat check 
- Dim atmosphere with live pianist makes for a romantic setting... probably the nicest restaurant I've been to in SF.
- I noted in my reservation that the occasion was my boyfriend's birthday and they gave him a card when he sat down. I appreciated the nice touch. 

Food:
- steak tartare: 5 stars- yummmmmy! I loved the flavors... and didn't taste so "raw". must get this appetizer. They prepare it in front of you. 
- chicken hash: 4 stars- pretty good- had cheese inside and flavors went well together.
- duck: 4.5 stars- I loved this! Probably the best non asian duck I've ever had. The meat was tender and flavorful and I loved the sauce that went with it. 
- coconut cream pie: 3.5 stars- the filling was good but the crust was too stiff! Made it hard to eat and the crust tasted a bit stale. 

Service:
- We came here at 6:30p on a Saturday when it wasn't very busy, but by 7:30p it was poppin and filling up. Service got slower as a result and we had to wait longer than I would have liked to order dessert. However, the server was friendly and service overall was good. 

Tip:
Make reservations in advance! I made reservations 2 weeks in advance and wasn't able to get the times I wanted (7:30-8pm) but was able to get 6:30p. I think theres a live jazz band around 9 so 8-8:30p would probably be ideal times. Not a restaurant you can make reservations at the day of (at least not on a Sat night) as only 10p was available when I checked the day of.
author: Emily C.

description:
Great ambience - and based on the last dining experience - the live music and the decor would be the only reason to return for another visit.

Been to Bix previously and enjoyed my experience then, but this last dining experience was mediocre. Our wait staff was fine and the return of foie gras to SF was enjoyable, but the rest of our meal was forgettable. The requested "medium" truffle burger arrived well done. And although we were offered a free bread pudding, for a birthday, it was burnt. 

Lastly the host lacked a bit of diplomacy dealing with my party's slight tardiness a bit too passive aggressively - which cannot make for an enjoyable meal. So I'll spend my $250 elsewhere next time.
author: L W.

description:
Bix has a great atmosphere. It has a very New Orleans-y feel what with the live music and funky decor.

The food isn't awesome, but it's pretty good. I recommend the lobster spaghetti and bone marrow. The chocolate bread pudding is also good, especially when you get the bits of sea salt (they could spread it more evenly). I'd skip the potato pillows.
author: Liz L.

description:
Our party of four ate here for a Friday lunch.  I left Bix full and happy.  That said, I think I would prefer to come back here for dinner over lunch  (the ambiance seems better suited for dinner).  

It's a two-story restaurant with very dim lighting, dark corners, a 1940s/ "old boys club" feel (dark-wood paneling, drinks shaken at the table, and jazz playing in the background) -- somehow Bix's ambiance seems more appropriate for dinner or if you want lunch, then maybe some covert rendez-vous (business deal? affair? who knows).  

In terms of food, our table of four shared three appetizers: half dozen oysters, steak tartare, and bite-sized gin-cured trout blinis.  Our oysters, while fresh, had rocks in them; the tartare was good; the gin-cured trout literally tasted like gin (I guess I should've known) - regardless, the taste of alcohol was too overpowering for me.  I'd be interested in trying the bahn mi appetizer.  For my entree, I ordered the swordfish (while the fish was cooked well, the flavors were lacking and dish overall was kind of bland).   In retrospect, maybe I should have ordered the chicken hash (it's what everyone seems to be raving about, but I wasn't craving something fried).    

For dessert, the banana foster with dark rum was phenomenal -- not too rich, perfect portion size, and something I would definitely order again.

I wavered between three and four stars, but rounded up because the server was great and I think a dinner adventure here would deliver at least four stars.
author: Kimya P.

description:
A must if you're visiting SF! 

We splurged on our visit here. Drinks consisted of Bellinis, which were great, and the deviled eggs were AMAZING! I don't even like deviled eggs usually but these were delicious. I tried the chicken hash as my entree and was not disappointed. The butterscotch cookies and whip cream dessert was literally the icing on top of the cake. 

The ambiance is classy, but I saw people from casual attire to suits and dresses as well. The setting is cozy and warm. We even had live music to enjoy. Overall, a wonderful experience!
author: Kara E.

description:
Pretty sweet spot. Love SF for restaurants such as these. Not glorified but popular. Food was exceptional but drinks at the bar was a bit on the expensive side (if you were expecting anything cheap in spots like this you're crazy). Only negative I didn't like was that there was no place to stand while waiting for your reservation yet if you come late, you lose your res. 

Would def come back again as it's great for a date due to its intimate setting.
author: AQ N.

description: Came here for group birthday and was disappointed by the food. The ambience and setting was nice. However, for the price, the food should be much fresher and better prepared. The fried food was way too oily. The potato cushions are like sonic tater tots. The bone marrow was nonexistent. My party scraped the bone and got nothing but bone dust. We basically paid for Crostinis. My Porkchop was okay and the sides were dull. Maybe the food caterers to senior citizens because that was the demographic in the restaurant. I will not return and will take my dinner parties elsewhere in the future.
author: J. W.

description:
Off beat location, and odd set-up, makes this fancy pants place asurprise all on its own.

My intern chose this place, after we had a long week in the office. I said pick a place, and we'll just go.  Yes, he picked this place, its its expensive grandour. I thought we were going to the same Tokyo Express place we always go to.

This place belongs in a different era. After seeing Gastby recently, this clearly is from that sorta era. Fancy lights, booth seating, and very formal dining.  Perhaps, a nice formal occasion would be appropriate, instead of a simple business lunch.

 - Ceviche: The ceviche appetizer was fresh, and very delicious. It had a nice overall seasoning to it.
- Crab Pasta: The pasta allegedly had a "chunks" of dungeness crab, but it seemed like it was more like strips.  It was good, but very overlyhyped.

All in all, this place is beautiful without a doubt.  It seems like a place to take a girl out on the town, but it has a stiffness to it.  Perhaps, this place has better vibe at night, but a business lunch, I would opt out.

***6/7/2013 UPDATE:
The manager reached out to me and explained the different ambiances of the evening scene and lunchtime scene.  Specifically, the evening scene is more whimsical, fun, and has live music. I commend them for reaching out and explaining the menu too as it changes seasonally.
author: Natalie G.

description:
I was looking for a ritzy, romantic and delicious restaurant experience, and Bix certainly delivered. We got a lovely booth seat near the band, lots of cocktails and appetizers and dessert, too.  Try the deviled eggs, they're really good. Everything was really good, actually.  And excellent attentive service, needless to say.
Parking can be a pain- try parking at Portsmouth Square garage and walking over. Or, if you can find the alley to drive down to get valet parking, that is probably worth it, but I did see a lot of people waiting for their car. I'd rather just walk over and get it myself.
author: Jessica O.

description:
I visited this place on a Tuesday. To my surprise there was a sweet lady singing while a pianist played through dinner. It's romantic ambiance makes for a great dinner. The bar gets pretty full, but you are able to have dinner there if you snag a seat. 

Beef tartare, was excellent. Cocktail menu is impressive
author: Charliena B.

description:
The food was fabulous! I'd give the food 5 stars. I had the duck which was duck-perfection served with the perfect duck-complimentary veggies. Taste explosion and the duck was tender and moist and fabulous. My bf had the dorade which he said was one of the best meals he's had in a while! Oysters were good, and the mozzarella and prociutto which is made in-house was beautiful. 

The ginger gimlet was very, very subtley gingery. The melon sorbets were a great way to end. The music was lovely and the atmosphere was noisy, crowded, but what can we expect? 

The only down tick was our waiter who seemed rushed and impatient. When we asked questions about the menu, he answered quickly and offered us more time to decide (read: call me when you're ready to order). He also tended to swiftly put our food on the table and rush off to his larger tables where he spent more time (and of course, would get a larger tip). I'd give the service 2.5 or 3 stars. I've been in restaurants where service is smooth and attentive, but in the background. You know, where you feel welcome and what you need magically appears and you don't have to ask. That is not this. 

Bummer because the food was really, really good!

So crowded on a Thurs night. Our 9 pm reservation got us seated around 9:15. The music didn't stop till 10:30 pm. Great food!
author: Thalia F.

description:
This was my third visit to Bix over ten years and my last.

It's 6PM Saturday night and the noise from the bar below to the upstairs dining level has already become intolerable. 

Server approaches and although professional, appears either inexperienced, or he would rather be elsewhere. When asked about vegetarian options for my dining companion (nothing on the menu) , his reply was "um..."

To start, we decided to share an appetizer. He places the dishes down in front of us with his thumb in the centre of the plate - EEK! we have to eat off of these.  

Food was unimpressionable from start to finish. Careful Bix, Michelin star restaurants are creeping up all around you. 

Wine: terribly overpriced.

Dessert: If you are going to serve Bananas  Foster in what you call 'five star dining',  please flame it at the table. 

No doubt they were busy and trying to turn over the table as while sipping our after dinner drinks, the check appeared on the table without asking "is there anything else you would like?"  

The most memorable thing about the evening was the fabulous piano player.
author: Bobby J.

description:
Bix i fine.  But, if you're dropping around $100 a person, you want better than fine.  I do, at least.  The food was pretty good, but we were going for the atmosphere.  The music was a nice touch and we sat up on the balcony which gave us a great view of the restaurant.  The service was really weird, though.  The waitress asked us for our drink orders as soon as we sat down, but, clearly, we hadn't decided yet.  She took almost 30 minutes to come back.  Then, when my boyfriend expressed annoyance at her long disappearance, the rest of our meal came out REALLY fast. She couldn't seem to get the timing or the attitude right.  I'm not usually picky about service.  I've worked in food service and I know how draining it is.  But, again, for a check that came to almost $250 for two people, there are certain expectations.

The food:
Chicken hash - pretty good
Potato pillows - tasty, but pretty much tater tots w/ caviar on them
Brussell sprouts - solid
Duck - solid
Coconut cream pie - solid

And the drinks were good, if small. 

I think if we'd had a different server, this would have been a much better experience.

UPDATE:

Holy classy establishment, Batman!  My boyfriend called the manager after our so-so service experience and they sent us a very generous gift card and asked us to give them another chance!  We did and they did not disappoint.  Had the deviled eggs and truffle burger this time.  YUMMMMMMMMMMM!
author: Jessica M.

description:
Impressive dining experience! Bix is an institution. The service was spot on. My dinner companion and I shared a steak tartar, it was good but not great. Though I have heard others have loved it. Personally I would have preferred the steak to not be as minced, but that is a personal preference. 

I had the veal chop and my companion had the American Style Waygu Beef. The gravy and mushrooms on my veal were done very well, though I preferred his beef. Next time I will order that. Dessert was panna cotta and creme brulee, both were well done! Though I could have eaten a creme brulee to myself.  

Overall I was very impressed with my dining experience and will be going back.
author: Brandi b.

description:
Nice dinner here. The potato pillows and deviled eggs are TO DIE FOR!!! Order these appetizers...you won't be disappointed.

I had the duck which was good, but not exceptional. I've had better. And the spinach on the plate was overly seasoned with large spicy cloves. There were too many cloves. 

My husband ordered the cheeseburger which was served like an open faced burger except that the beef rested on one piece of bread at the bottom (no top). It was good, but he said he was expecting much more. The truffle fries that were served with the burger were good, but again, not exceptional. The wine we ordered was good--a nice borolo. 

The ambiance here is old school San Francisco with a classic jazzy element. A piano player played while we dined....such a nice touch. They have a great bar and the room takes you back to another time...one where people had the "three martini lunches" and then went back to work. It's a nice spot and they just celebrated their 25th anniversary, so they are doing something right (especially in the appetizer department--yum!)

Would come back and try other entrees. The appetizers and the ambiance were the highlights!
author: Rosie S.

description:
Wei K. had warned me that Bix would be hard to find because it is hidden in an alley. Thanks to the tip, we were able to locate the restaurant with no problem! 

Walked in about 15 minutes early before our reservations. The house was full and the bar was crowded with patrons who are waiting for their table. Squeezed our way through the crowd and ordered two glasses of champagne to start. It wasn't long til the hostess came and told us that our table was ready. We were seated adjacent to the live band, and though the environment was very noisy, we found our experience to be pleasant and entertaining. 

For starters: 
-Potato pillows 
-Steak tartare 
-Chilled Fioe Gras 
-Bone marrow 

Everything was divine! Bone marrow was slurping fantastic! The potato pillows (tater-tots topped with caviar) were yummy, crispy and appetizing. Steak tartare could have been the best I've had, the chilled Fioe Gras was creamy and savory. 

For entrees: 
-Maine lobster spaghetti 
-American Kobe bavette steak 

We informed our waitress that we would be sharing the entree and she had our entrees come out in split plates. The lobster pasta was very inviting after the appetizers we had a few minutes before. The savory cream sauce, the sweetness of the lobster meat and the tangy taste from the tomatoes really accommodated each other. The well seasoned Kobe steak was tender and mouth watering. 

For sides: 
-Truffled French fries 

Could have done without. We were so into our entree that we neglected the side dish. Our eyes were, as always, bigger than our stomach. 

For dessert: 
-Warm chocolate brioche bread pudding 

Very chocolaty and rich. We should have chosen a dessert that would have been more refreshing on our palette after the hefty meal we had. 

Had a very nice experience here. Will definitely come back for more.
author: Jenny K.

description:
Liz Gilbert, I think I love you and I hate you.

How dare you defy the indisputable tradtional cultural norms as set by America and our ancestors by guiltlessly travel halfway across the world to selfishly appease your individual needs?

How dare you heedlessly abandon your heavily desirable two story home, complete with a wonderfully doting husband, without consequence?

And lastly, how dare you guiltlessly gorge on an undeniable plate of pasta without experiencing violent waves of guilt crashing heavily upon you, mid-bite?

Liz Gilbert, you are my hero.

As fabulous as Liz's life may be, nothing can equate the unsurpassed edible bliss Bix's Maine Lobster Spaghetti brought me.

Pure unequivocal ecstasy.

This rich, albeit well-proportioned dish was surprisingly teeming full of fresh chunks of Maine Lobster, daintily flavored with bright cherry tomatoes, spicy cut jalopenos and dressed in a creamy light sauce.

Every single bite was reminiscent of the time when complete and utter jealousy overtook  my body as I read of  Liz's epiphany as she guiltlessly devoured one of Italy's tastiest culinary offering, the spaghetti.

Dining sans guilt is nonexistent for American women, especially for those who are exposed to the seemingly perfect photoshopped images we all have the privy of witnessing on every single advertisement we come across on a daily basis.

But in that one perfect moment, I was Liz.

I, Lisa W, dined sans guilt on the world's*  best plate of spaghetti, ever.

I can finally die happy.

*Disclaimer: I have never been to Italy, yet.
author: Lisa W.

description: I have to say this is a beautiful restaurant with a fun vibe and good drinks and wine list but the food is pretty bad and crazy expensive. Had the duck which was very gamey and flavorless besides that. The lobster spaghetti is a joke. The waiter was good but didn't offer to do anything about my completely uneaten entree. May go back for drinks but that is it. Very sad experience
author: David H.

description:
Took my family here for dinner one night... Simply NOT impressed!

First off, we ordered some drinks... And tell me why it took the lady 15mins to get my lemonade. The cocktails did come on time, but why took so long on my lemonade?? Did they need to harvest some lemons for it or something?!?! Geez...

Then came the appetizers. We got the potato pillows and crab rolls which were both amazing. Very pleased with the appetizers. 

BUT! The worst part of the night came with my main course. I had the special catch of the day, swordfish. I found what looked like a bone in my fish and asked if it was supposed to be the fillet of the fish, which shouldn't have a bone. Our server took it back to the kitchen, then came back out to tell me that it as actually a piece of PLASTIC!!! Are you kidding me?!?!? For the overpriced dishes that I'm paying for, it is totally unacceptable. Though I didn't request, the manager did take the dish off the bill. This was a nice act of him, but my appetite was ruined and needless to say that I'm not returning there again. I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone either.
author: Khin H.

description:
Delicious dinner and a beautiful atmosphere.  I wanted to take my boyfriend to a very special place for his birthday somewhere in the city, so I spent many hours on yelp searching for a place with tasty food and a romantic atmosphere.  After searching for so long, I'm glad I made the final decision to go to Bix.  

Walking up to the restaurant, I was wondering where it would be.  We turned down the alley that read Gold St and it was very clean and made the location special compared to other spots.  Inside it is dimly lit but filled with many people, even on a Monday.  The bar is long and beautiful, and there is a grand piano on the ground floor.  We were seated right by the piano, which was a nice touch for a special birthday treat. 

We ordered the potato pillows, steak tartare, the duck and the lobster spaghetti.  The lobster spaghetti and the steak tartare were the highlights of the dinner.  If you come to Bix, I strongly suggest you try them both.  My cocktail was shaken and poured right at our table and tasted smooth and delicious.  

Our waiter was decent, but nothing special.  Overall, a great place for a romantic dinner.
author: Lauren V.

description:
Far too overpriced for what it is. They try to be something that sadly they cant pull off.

Portions are insulting for what they charge and that taste is not anywhere near what it should be at that price. I dont mind spending a few bills on dinner but dont leave me unsatisfied.  4 tiny peices of fried shrimp for about $20... for get the price but not even original or delicious.  If you set the bar high, you need to deliver considering you are in a city with over 3000 restaurants that do.

Skip this one. The reviews are misleading unless your looking for bad music, worse food and an empty wallet and stomach.
author: John S.

description: This place is a bit dark and too loud. The  live jazz is sorta hard to listen with all that noise! You'd probably have to sit by really close to listen to the band. The Staff was very friendly, Food was good, but the desserts and prices...not so much.
author: Shweta M.

description:
First time I went to Bix, was in 1996 when I was pretty new in SF Bay Area. It hasn't changed much since. Hidden in an alley in a nice area of financial district, away from the tourist traps, elegant, with certain old world charm, classy but not suffy, with great art work on the walls (i love the painting of the clown kissing a ballerina), a bit dark, with classic jazz (live or otherwise) and a touch of romance. Great food and presentation, awesome bartenders / mixologists (try a classic martini or one of their cocktails) and excellent service.

I've visited Bix a few times over the years since, sometimes just for drinks. It's generally always been a positive experience. The last was in June 2014 for an early mid-week dinner with a friend. For appetizer, we split an A la minute Ceviche (with halibut). It is not like a traditional ceviche, but it is visually beautiful and a perfect blend of fish, greens/herbs, avocado, and nuts for a little crunch.

For entree, I had the duck breast with stuffed morel mushrooms and fava beans. It was light and perfectly cooked, pink with a little skin. The morel mushrooms were divine. My friend had the king salmon which was also perfectly cooked with crunchy skin and semi-raw center, and delicious. For dessert, we shared a banana foster -- a big scoop of creamy ice cream with warm rum syrup and banana bits poured over it.

We also tried a few of their wines -- The Gruner Veltliner was a great start for me, but I was disappointed with Barbera del Monferreato. My friend enjoyed the Malbec and stuck with it.

The service was excellent and they were considerate that we were on a tight schedule. Overall a great dining experience. I highly recommend Bix -- for dinner or cocktail, away from the latest fad and the hustle and bustle of what is hot and in. A restaurant that has stood the test of time.
author: Farshid K.

description: Phenomenal. Sit at the bar- super kind bartender obliged me with a little amuse bouche of dessert and  some vintage port, sur maison. A prince. Had the foie gras and a burger and didn't regret a bite. Went alone and left alone. Had a great time.
author: Robert P.

description:
This place is completely not worth it - there are so many other wonderful gems you should be going to! This place gets a 3-star because the food was disappointing, service almost disastrously slow, and hostesses preoccupied.

Mostly based off of Yelp recommendations, we got:
Potato Pillows - pretty much a hashbrown, very mild flavor, almost didn't notice the caviar
Steak Tartare - void of flavor except for black olives
Duck Breast - very very sweet
Chick Hash a la Bix - described as a chicken crab cake, I'd say that was a pretty accurate description. the dish desperately needed acid, and came with some tomatoes to balance it out. while not a bad dish, not worth $22. At least give us some greens!
Duck fat potatoes - all we tasted was large amounts of garlic
Bottle of Barbera - had to pour ourselves after the initial pour after waiting around for the waiter. Also should mention it took about 30 minutes for the waiter to come take our order.

For dessert:
Bananas Foster - presented as a bowl of ice cream, and the waiter pours the bananas foster on top. Reminded me of melted ice cream soup. Though the very tiny pieces of bananas were good, the dish left a lot to be desired
Chocolate Mouse - very good consistency but no flavors to write home about

For such an expensive meal, we expected much more. We did like the ambiance, but it was the food that left much to be desired. For some great food and service, go to nearby Firenze by Night, Bocadillos or Roka Akor.
author: Cristina M.

description:
Here's the good, the bad, & the ugly:

The good: 

1. you know what they say, "it's all about Location, location, location!" And this place has it for sure. It's  right down an alley, and no i don't mean one of those shady, fear for your life, mean streets of New York type alleys either, we're talking about a nice, clean, pan handler free, straight out of a movie type alleys. With a few candlelit tables outside the door, no windows just a neon sign that says Bix.

2. Atmosphere. I mean if you want a quiet, peaceful, "champagne wishes & caviar dreams" type of atmosphere then look no further.

3. The bananas fosters dessert was GLORIOUS!

THE BAD:

1. Now I hesitate to say that the food was BAD, however, for as much as it cost I expected it to be a WHOLE lot better. I ordered a $30 truffle burger, and in all honesty I expected it to change my life for that that kind of money. Needless to say, it did not :( in fact it was nothing more than average at best. The truffle fries however were pretty good, I will say that.

2. The prices were pretty steep, so in my opinion, unless you are willing to pay that much money for the things listed above, it's not worth going there for the food alone.

THE UGLY:

1. Our server was kind of a douche to put it quite bluntly. He was very condescending anytime we asked a question, so finally we just stopped asking. I got the feeling he made up his mind that we were not going to leave him a good tip before he even took our drink order. Having been a server and a bartender I realize that it is not uncommon to do that, but you should still provide the same quality service regardless. Funny thing was we actually left him a 20% tip just to prove him wrong, and managed to wipe the smug grin off his face long enough for him to apply his, more exceptional, service skills in thanking and bidding us adieu.

That's it, and please note that this was only MY experience, I do not claim to speak for everyone. Hope this is helpful.
author: Meighan D.

description:
Atmosphere: A+... 

The photographs speak for themselves. This is very important to me when choosing a restaurant too, especially depending on the occasion. This was an important one and the atmosphere was exactly what I was looking for. Slightly smaller than what I expected, but that's not necessarily a bad thing. Live music was excellent also. Not overbearing at all.

Food: B

Nothing to write home about, but it didn't disappoint either. I had the duck which was good, and my girlfriend really enjoyed the chicken, it just didn't leave a lasting impression. Their house Pino Noir was excellent. The Chocolate Brioche we had however was phenomenal! 

Service: C-

Here's where Bix really lost points. The server we had was just lousy. I won't go into gory detail, but he was just a let down. The bussers did a better job than he did quite frankly.
author: Brian W.

description:
I was fortunate to have a friend recommend this place to me, as I was visiting San Francisco for work. On a Monday night, they had a piano player & upright bass player in the dining room. What a way to hold my attention! The artwork is wonderful, and the ambiance is romantic and warm. 

I started with the potato pillows with creme fraiche & American caviar. These were fried, with a nice crunch outside and a fluffy pillow of potato on the inside. The creme fraiche & caviar were pleasant accents atop the potato. I also had the pork belly Banh Mi with cucumber & siracha, and they were so yummy! Crunchy, buttery, and spicy all in one bite. Yum! 

I ordered the duck breast with stuffed morel mushrooms, fava beans and kumquats for my entree, and it was divine. Great combination of flavors. Drinks were enjoyable, and included the ginger gimlet (nice balance of tart and spice), and the Aviation (a little sweet for my taste, but the creme de violette was interesting).
