I've been here 4 or 5 times now and it's amazing every time. It's one of those experiences where you unintentionally laugh/smile because the food is so amazing. I'm honestly not that much of a foodie, but this place I can appreciate. Even the texture is perfect.

Potato pillows, beef bavette & short ribs, truffle fries and bananas foster. Get all of those and you will be a happy, happy (wo)man. Seriously. Get them. 

The bananas foster is the best desert I've ever had.

Great service, ambiance, and cocktails. Great for a date. 

Just great.
author: Ian B.

description:
It's been a number of years since I was here and enjoyed dinner.  The  experience this time was not what I would have hoped for.  Very mediocre appetizers, fair main course.  The bus boy was  terrible.   He grabbed the plates and silverware  as fast as he could as though he was going for the best possible time to set a record.  He was totally oblivious to us.  When he cleared the second time after dinner, he actually showed up to the table with used plates from another table.   I have never seen that before!

I would never return except perhaps to sit at the bar and drink.
author: Michael L.

description:
I have been to BIX multiple times for lunch and this is my first time having dinner here.

Food: 4/5 stars. We ordered two house specialties as appetizer: steak tartar and bone marrow tartar and they were both super delicious. The steak tartar was very rare and perfectly spiced. The bone marrow was very satisfying although slightly saltier than what would have been perfect. For main course, we ordered the black truffle cheese burger and the lobster spaghetti. We ordered the burger to be cooked medium well - it came very juicy and there was a very generous amount of black truffles hidden inside the beef patty. The lobster spaghetti was overall average - no surprises (good or bad). We had the infamous bananas foster for desert - it was a very generous portion, I would definitely recommend sharing it in groups. I unfortunately don't have too much of a sweet tooth so I thought it was pretty okay (maybe above average). We paired our meals with red wine by the glass and the wine was high quality and very delicious.

The ambience at BIX was classy and pretentious. Most of the customers were dressed up in suits/dresses. You might feel somewhat out of place if you showed up with Tshirt and shorts. The decor is very classy - with paintings, carpet floor, dim lighting and a grand piano. My favorite part about the experience is having live jazz music. They seem to only have live music for dinner. There was a pianist as well as jazz singer performing jazz for customers. The music was very pleasant and lively. Making this spot a perfect place for romantic/date dinner.

Overall I think I'll definitely come back for dinner/lunch again.
author: Cindy L.

description:
Appalling!

Bland food and then as we were handed the dessert menu at 8:45 we were told: "By the way you need to be out by 9pm."

Needless to say: no dessert and no tip!

That's no way to treat the Vice President of one of your suppliers!
author: Margot G.

description:
Being a dirty old man, BIX is a staple in my life.  There's nothing like dark wood, jazz, old school bartenders and great food.  Kinda has the old east coast feel to it and I love that it's located on a narrow alley.  

Must Tries:
Potato Pillows
Truffle Croquet
Lobster Spaghetti
author: Suz L.

description:
Hard to complain about this place.  The ambiance, the staff, the food...all amazing.  Came here for a birthday dinner with reservations at 9pm.  Our table wasn't ready immediately, so we enjoyed a drink at the bar.  High quality drinks.  

The only downfall is that it took 25 minutes to seat us, with reservations.  However, with that being said, they were extremely attentive to the matter and even offered us a complimentary hors d'oeuvre.  We sat in THE best corner booth with a clear view of the piano and the entire restaurant.  It was perfect.

As for the food, asparagus soup and lobster spaghetti were the highlights.  Absolutely mouth watering.  At the end of the evening, they managed to make a candle in a scoop of sorbet look classy.  Good people.  Definitely an experience.
author: Lindy C.

description: Our birthday was done here this year at the bar and lots of food and drink were ordered by myself and my six girlfriends.  My ish is that the bar man was totally unfriendly and I /we got no candle or anything that resembled birthday cheer.  I think the bar was a mistake for my friends and I as we should have just gotten a table ordered as my previous experiences at this local were spot on.  Oh well.
author: D B.

description: Staff was a bit aloof, portions were pretty tiny, drinks were good, prices high. I like the piano player a lot and the location is neat. Will try a nice dinner here at some point.
author: Khalid N.

description: Fantastic dinner. Hidden gem. This a classy place is great. Perfect for celebrating birthdays and anniversaries. The have a pianist playing classics which really adds to the ambiance. Entry is off the alley. Highly recommend the pork chop and lobster spaghetti. Do yourself a favor; get am über black car and make a night of it.
author: Anthony R.

description:
Talk about all hype and no substance. We were excited to go to Bix after reading all the reviews and talking to local friends. Our experience was far from expected. We were seated at a great table in front of the fantastic band but that's where the good ended and the disappointment  started. 
Our server was rushed and never available. Meet had to constantly ask other waiters to find ours which was very annoying. Once we were finally able to put our order in we were served the wrong wine. When we pointed out the error to our server we were served the correct one but still paid for the wrong glass. The meals were slammed on our table by the servers who took no time to explain what was being served or answer any questions with zero eye contact.  This was the same for our bread, butter and water.  Both my meal and my girlfriend's were over done and dry but yet again our waiter was nowhere to be found. The evening was such a disappointment that we decided to ask for the bill and head back to our hotel once we were able to find our server.  Shame we chose this place to spend one of our three nights in San Francisco when there are so many better options available.
author: Farsh K.

description:
So for the longest time I've wanted to come here. We had the option to come here during recruiting for dinner, but I was only on one or two dinners. Damn. Instead, I decided that I was going to take my boyfriend out to dinner for Christmas so what better place than I place I've always wanted to go to. Yes, a bit selfish, but he's not picky. He would rather eat at a dingy place anyways. 

We ordered some Apps for the two of us and each ordered a Main and a dessert.

Pillow puffs - were really good. They were like little tastes of heaven with a bit of creaminess and caviar on top. Delicious!
Croques - they were like little grilled cheese sandwiches, they weren't too special but delicious with the cheese and onions. 
Beef bavette - this was really good. The short ribs were delicious and the bavette was so tender. the potatoes and creamy spinch were delicious as well!
Duo of pork - both of the pork portions were tender and delicious.
Truffle fries - anything with truffle and fries has my love.
Chocolate Bread Pudding - my least favorite part of the meal. Not chocolate enough.
Bananas Foster - DELICIOUS. I loved it. Ice Cream plus rum sauce = deliciousness. 

I'm really glad that I cam here. It's a really nice and cozy place especially sitting in a corner booth. The music was nice and festive and it had a really good vibe to it. It's not too far from the bart station, but taking the bus because of heels is definitely a good option. There is a parking garage somewhere near by if that's better.
author: Nina Y.

description:
I just reread my old review for BIX and the funny thing is....  I was just there with my Husband (if you read the review I pretty much was asking anyone out and no I did not meet my Husband through Yelp).

Anywho.....

If you didn't know that what was about to happen to your mouth and taste buds was going to be mind blowing there is no way the alleyway where it is located would look so amazing...  But OMG once you get inside your senses are locked and loaded.

Went on a Monday night, had reservations, and even decided to drive down and let the valet due his thing.  The Valet was kind and quick which was fabulous.

You enter into a giant room where the lights are dimmed to the point of seduction and the night we were there had a piano player jazzing out creating a delight for the ears.

Our Meal:

Sweet Onion and Truffled Cheese Croques -- Little tiny grilled cheeses that make eating a grilled cheese worth it.  Finger food to perfection. Oh and yes actual bits of truffle floating inside each little sandwich .... YUM

Salmon Tartar on Rye Toast with Dill and Crème Fraîche -- Perfect temperature and buttery rich fresh salmon with the perfect amount of creme fraiche and Dill. .... absolutely light and lovely

Black Truffle Cheese Burger served open face on Rye with Truffle Fries -- Slices of truffle found amongst soft juicy perfectly cooked meat was a mouth-gasm. Oh yeah... that good.

McFarland Springs Trout with Bacon, Brussels Sprouts, Cippolini Onions and Sunchokes -- Tender and juicy with the perfect accoutrement's.  Light and filling leaving you feeling delightfully happy.

No room for desert!  Between wine and dinner we were ready to roll on home with smiles on our faces and amazing food in our bellies.  

I can't wait to come here again!  Thank you BIX for being a part of my city!
author: Kylie L.

description:
Can't say this place is for foodies actually. My boyfriend and I decided to celebrate our anniversary here after hearing good things about them. We started off with the truffle devil eggs, which were good. The egg filling was fluffy and flavorful. The truffle shavings gave it a nice hint.

For my entree, I ordered the lobster spaghetti. I was really looking forward to it, I really wish there were more lobster (obviously), but there wasn't a lot of lobster flavor. That part was unfortunately since lobster stands out. This dish had WAY TOO much scallions and heirloom tomatoes. The sauce was awesome, but the scallions really covered the actual taste of the dish AND too many heirloom tomatoes made it a little sour and acidic to enjoy.
I did like the al dente pasta. It's hard to find good pasta in SF for some reason and they did a good job with it.
author: Stephanie Y.

description: Recently dined at BIX for dinner with co-workers and we had a great time! The ambiance is great as was the service. Everything we ordered was delicious as well! While my visit was work related, BIX would be great date spot! Traditional and classy. Love it!
author: Tasha I.

description: I have to unfortunately give this place a bad review. The atmosphere is amazing but the food was lacking and a diet coke is $4 no refills. The fried chicken was on par with orange chicken from Panda Express. I did get the rib eye and it was decent. Overall for the cost I would find other options.  It's getting 2 because the live piano was nice.
author: Aaron S.

description:
If I could give this restaurant NO stars, I would. Our dining experience was horrendous.

A group of 8 of us went for my girlfriends bachelorette party. One of the wait staff spilled a bowl of piping hot potato soup all over my back and hair (wrong night to wear a backless shirt...) While our waiter was very apologetic, the manager on duty (Will) was a total douche about it. After taking a look at one of the burned areas on my back, he proclaimed "Its not blistered, you'll be fine" I held an ice pack to the burn for the entire duration of our dinner and realized when I got home that I did have a blister on my lower back from the soup. When our bill came, we were comped the soup that had been spilled on me...and 20 dollars worth of cookies and creme brulee (we refused dessert several times) One of the women I was with is a general manager of a restaurant herself and was HORRIFIED at how they chose to take care of the situation. She spoke to Will for several minutes and his response was "I feel I did what was appropriate for the situation"

The situation was that your staff caused me physical harm and due to this,I had to go home early-missing the rest of a bachelorette party that I planned.

I emailed the general manager, Blake, and explained the situation. He assured me that he would look into it and get back to me. It's been 2 weeks and I have yet to get a hold of him(phone tag for a while...Im still waiting for him to call me back). I did, however, get to speak with Will again. He let me know that Blake would be issuing me a gift certificate for BIX. I would not return to this restaurant if you paid me. Nor would I pawn the certificate off on someone else. The obviously careless management of this restaurant is disgusting.

Oh...did I mention they overcharged my credit card by 150 dollars? When I brought this to the waiters attention, he re-ran the card and assured me he had voided out the other charge. I had to call my bank and have them challenge the charge when it did show up on my statement...
author: Mary B.

description:
It is very rare that I give 5 stars, but this place definitely deserves it.  I came here with my boyfriend for his Senior Prom dinner and it was amazing.  

We got there a bit earlier than our reservation because our pre-shoots took much less time than me we had thought, but they were still able to seat us right away.  Service was quite friendly and helpful.

For our appetizer we had the mini-lamb burgers.  I had never tried lamb before so I can't say much.  They weren't bad, but they weren't amazing either.  Then we split the lobster pasta (they even helped us put it in two plates without us asking).  Boy oh boy.  This might be the best pasta I've ever had and it was a lobster overload (in a good way).  Pricey for sure, but fine if you split it and I definitely recommend splitting it because it can be quite rich and filling.  Pasta with decent sized lobster pieces in a lobster bisque sauce with lobster butter?  Yes please.  We didn't get dessert because dessert was provided at prom, but I'd love to come back and try some.

As for the decor, the restaurant was very classically decorated and the tables were a decent space apart that you could carry on your own conversations.  I actually think it's cute that this place is located in an alley.  Like a good find where you least expect it.  

I definitely coming here at least once if you live in SF or if you're visiting.
author: Vy L.

description:
After reading glowing reviews from all these fellow Yelpers, I felt compelled to try this place. "UNEQUIVOCALLY MY FAVORITE RESTAURANT IN SF!"??  Must try!

So I went to a Bassnectar concert last night, don't ask me why.  But it reminded me of BIX.  Every time the volumes got loud enough to send my heartbeat spiraling out of control, I lost my sense of touch and ceased to notice the hundreds of disgusting, tweeked out, sweaty bodies writhing around me.  Not wanting to believe that BIX has such good reviews but such mediocre food, I must conclude the music was so loud, my taste buds must have died.

Dinner: steak tartare, heirloom tomato cart, albacore tuna, and truffle french fries. 

Verdict: Tartare was good but I've had better, heirloom tomatoes were delicious but not outstanding, the albacore tuna and it's funky white sauce is something I'd never order again, and the fries were sucky...just a small dish with no distinct truffle flavor and a ton of broken short fries that were probably sitting under the heat lamp for days.  

Don't recommend BIX unless you actually want to go deaf.  :I  Too much good grub in the city to come back here.
author: Sandy T.

description: This place is absolutely incredible, one of the best restaurants I've ever eaten at, and that's saying a lot considering I've had the pleasure of eating at some of the greatest restaurants all over this country.  The potato pillows topped with caviar had a delicate crunch to them, the crab rolls were divine.  The lobster bisque was rich but delicious, but the star of the show was the ceviche for sure, it was the best ceviche I've ever had in my life.  I can't wait to visit this incredible city again and dine at Bix again, Peter The bartender, was an incredible host and guided us through our six course adventure effortlessly.  To anyone living in the bay area or planning to visit the bay area you need to treat yourself to this incredible restaurant.
author: Bryce M.

description: We loved this restaurant. Came here for a girls dinner.  Their appetizers and entrees were all great! Service was exceptional.  The server even threw in a free dessert for us! For appetizers, we ordered truffled deviled eggs (i'm a huge fan), steak tar tar, bone marrow, and fried chicken.  I say the steak tar tar and bone marrow are must gets!  Main dishes, we got sea bass, the wagyu bavette (AMAZING), duck breast, a vegetarian pasta, and pork chop.  We were all very happy with everything we got.  THought the sea bass was a bit salty though.  I loved the wagyu bavette. I'd definitely come back here. It is a good spot for a date as well. It is located in a cute alley way... the inside has a jazzy feel and dimly lit.
author: Stephanie C.

description: This place is phenomenal. Definitely on the pricey side, but the ingredients and quality of food were top notch. I ordered their bellini to start off to drink and it was definitely delicious and fresh, couldn't even taste the alcohol. We started off with the potato pillows that basically tasted like fancy tater tots. Delicious. She had the truffle burger which is AMAZING and a must for me to order next time I go. I had the duck. It was good bit nothing too crazy yummy. it only had 2 pieces so needless to say I was still hungry after lol. For dessert, we shared the chocolate bread pudding. 2 things about it. If you're a chocolate fan, you must order this. It's delicious. However, I am like a big bread pudding snob and this looked more like a deflated souffle than bread pudding. Didn't have the consistency or taste of bread pudding at all. However, like I said-delicious nonetheless. The only reason it didn't gain 5 stars, is because I had a reservation for a party of 2. I was stuck in traffic and my date for the night was there on time for the reservation. She checked in and they said that they could not seat her since the party was not complete. But then a 2 different groups came up to the hostess right after her and said "our party isn't complete but some of us are here" and both parties were seated with an incomplete party. So that did not make sense what so ever. But I will still come back and get the burger.
author: Heather S.

description: Great find. Feels like an exclusive restaurant since it is hidden on gold st. Service was spectacular. We had potato pillows, deviled eggs, oysters, duck, lobster spaghetti, roasted cauliflower, sorbet and creme brûlée. Manhattan's were a bit strong.
author: Grandy J.

description:
For months I had been craving a burger.  Sometimes I would wake up in the middle of the night, reveries of juicy burgers jolting me out of sleep.

During work, I would see burgers dancing in front of me, twirling like little ballerinas.

After making sure I was not pregnant, I heaved a sigh of relief and got to work seaching Yelp and food blogs for the scoop on where to savor this burger.  See, this is a singular craving for me; I don't crave one often so I wanted to gratify my urge before it vanished.  

Several venues were considered.  I consulted friends, strangers, and the lovely ladies at 7x7 doing the top ten SF burgers list.

Before I knew it, my birthday rolled around, and I was given carte blanche by my special someone to choose a restaurant for the occasion.  Knowing that the window for my craving for a juicy burger was soon to close, I jumped on the opportunity to combine the experiences.  To boot my special man was keen to see a classy, sexy, wellheeled lady chomp into a big burger.

Thus ends the prologue, and Act I finds us at Bix.

I chose Bix because I figured there was no going wrong with the truffled pecorino cheese burger! And right I was.  Replete with truffled fries, my half year wait for a burger was justified at the first bite.  I loved the addition of the perfectly braised onion, and the buttered rye bun.  Perfect, perfect.

I'd never been to Bix; I think it hovers gracefully under the radar, nestled on a Battery Coast side alley.  Besides the burger, the dungeness crab toasts were lusterless, but for dessert, the bananas foster with rum was amazing.  Drinks were good but not amazing, but I did enjoy the ginger gimlet.

Like I said in my B&B review, if this is a speakeasy type joint, maybe prohibition was not such a bad amendment!
author: Joanna M.

description:
I will say that Bix is reasonably good, but not worth all these 5 star reviews it's getting on Yelp and not worth rankings with the best of SF.

Our party of 4 was seated on a tiny little table in the middle of the downstairs dining room and after ordering our bottle of wine were promptly ignored for a good 20 min.

Positive points:
-Potato Pillows: DELICIOUS! But very small. One order shared between the four of us was definitely enough so I would recommend one between two people at least! Reminded me of the Potato Puffs at Gregoire's all grown up with some caviar!
-Lobster Spaghetti: The hype on this one is real! One of the more pricey items on the menu but totally worth it because it was, as a general consensus, the best thing we ordered!

Negative points:
-SLOW and RUDE service!! Our reservations were for 8:00 pm and we ended up staying past 10:00 pm when they were closing up shop. 
-Duck Trio: Mediocre. Once I got it I immediately knew I had made a mistake in not ordering the lobster and proceeded to steal from the bf's plate for the rest of the night...
-Lamb Shank: The one my friend ordered was completely overcooked yet when we told the Waitress she was extremely condescending and informed him that the outside is more cooked than the inside. Uh... no kidding... So why is the inside overcooked too? After much explaining she finally offered to take it back and bring him a new one. Honestly I've never sent anything back before but this one was well justified - it was chewy and virtually inedible. Gotta say, the replacement one was not very impressive either...

As a result of the lamb incident we had to endure attitude from our waitress for the remainder of the night, even SLOWER service up til closing. I would love to have the potato pillows and lobster spaghetti again but all I can remember is the horrendous service so I will not be back.
author: Christina L.

description:
Excellent food. Great wine list. Very good service. Great decor. I had a vegetarian plate which they always have but is not on the menu. Great combination of a bean dish some curried cauliflower he potato and mushroom dish and corn salad really really excellent. Our group got 2 desserts. The chocolate brioche bread pudding was great, and bananas Foster was amazing.
One of the best restaurants in SF, and that is a hard thing to do.
author: Bob P.

description: Bix is definitely impressive with it's old-school but at the same time classy ambience. It feels like from another era and i like the fact that they have live music. For the food, i can't say it's interesting and it might be because of the swordfish that i got - it was OK,  no bells & whistles kind of taste or experience. They have a good wine & cocktail menu.
author: Beril Y.

description:
One of the more uptight places we went to in San Francisco.  Bix is tucked into the heart of the financial district and they serve many suits and corporate clients there.  It reminded me more of Chicago than laid back San Francisco but that's ok.  The food was spot on along with the service. I ordered the NY strip and my wife had the duck.  My steak was tender, juicy, and lightly seasoned and the duck was crispy and went well with the risotto it was paired with.  You'll quickly see that they are into showing you action.  At the table, the waiter will shake and pour your martini, mix the steak tartare, and pour caramel over your desert.  Well, you get the point.  

After doing a little digging, it's one of those corporate chains and you can tell.  It's a solid place but doesn't give you the unique San Francisco food experience that you are craving.
author: Kevin C.

description: The food was good but it wasn't cheap. It was a decent meal but nothing worth the $150 we paid for drinks, entrees and dessert. Four stars because the food was good, the ambiance was fun but it's not the BEST.
author: Mike K.

description:
It's a pricey place but you do get your money's worth. Getting there was kind of strange. The entrance is in this narrow alley although I think they do offer valet parking. Even still, you can't even see the sign unless you're actually facing inside the alley.

Once you get inside the ambiance is very nice. The ceilings are high and there are large columns. Kind of makes you feel like you're in some vintage building. There's also an upstairs though from what I could tell there wasn't too much seating up there. The restaurant is decently sized but still somewhat cozy.

Food: delicious. A deviled egg is pretty much hard to F@#% up but they make a mean deviled egg. I ordered the fish of the day, which, to be honest, I can't exactly remember what it was. What I do remember is cleaning the plate. Maybe that's why I can't remember what was on it...I also tried some of the lobster spaghetti and that was super delicious. Kind of wish I ordered it actually.

Bix is definitely a place to check out sometime. The food is good, the place is nice and the service is very professional.
author: Kathryn B.

description:
cool and classy ambiance.. it is a bit loud for dinner though.. my wife's drinks were made pretty well.. food is over priced though and portions are small.. 

the dungeness crab rolls were decent.. my steak was overcooked and pre-sliced.. and their roasted beet salad was boring and uninspired..
author: Stan L.

description:
Just ok - I really expected more after reading reviews for BIX.
Ambiance was nice, dark and romantic, a hideaway restaurant, although the crowd itself was a bit 'old and stuffy' for my specific taste. 

I had the black truffle cheeseburger which by name inspires drooling but by taste was mediocre. $28 for that bad boy...wtf? Ah well, lesson learned, sometimes fancy ain't always 5 stars.
author: Rachel R.

description:
Ok not great not bad.
Atmosphere and ambience are AMAZING
but food does not match with it. 
My dinner tasted like my meal on my flight over
Read into it however you want. 

I will go back but just for the experience not the food. 

Food 3
Service 4
Cleanliness 4
author: Foodie C.

description:
I can't possibly say anything that hasn't already been said in 900+ reviews, so I'll consider this review more of a reminder to myself of what an incredible night we had (so I can make sure to come back) rather than a real review.

Truffle croques: yum!
Salmon with white beans special: actually worth the price
Truffle burger: best burger my boyfriend has EVER had
Truffle french fries: BEST FRIES EVERRRR NO SERIOUSLY I DROOLED
Brownies with whipped cream: heavenly
Swanson Merlot: superb, smooth, lovely

I was so stuffed when I left that I told my boyfriend not to touch me for an hour. Like, not even an arm around my waist. That stuffed. Good thing, too, cause it was a hefty bill. Still completely worth it :)
author: Julie T.

description:
We stumbled upon this place after hearing they were known for their mixology.  I was pleasantly surprised.

The atmosphere had a jazzy, modern, early 1900's feel.  

The staff was wonderful and not stuffy like some of the other restaurants we experienced in San Francisco.  The food and drinks were amazing.  I loved the truffle deviled eggs and lobster pasta.  I could have done without the chicken but everything else was amazing.  The ceviche was excellent as well.

I look forward to coming back to this restaurant very soon and HIGHLY recommend this place if you are in San Fran.  Definitely a treat!
author: Brea B.

description: What a gem of a place - it's like you're back in the 30's.  This restaurant used to be a 'speak easy' and definitely the charm has lingered of this swanky, artsy and opulent venue.  The food was excellent - from the pork chops and California sea bass to the potatoes fried in duck fat (shhhh...so yummy).  Romantic, great signature cocktails, piano in the background, fabulous service and drive-up valet parking. A must visit if you're traveling to San Francisco - reservations a must.
author: Ester C.

description:
After taking in the foggy view over cocktails at Empress of China, a craving for the lobster spaghetti at Bix was expressed. We braved the cold temperatures that characterize summer in San Francisco and arrived on Gold Street to find the wait for a table clocking in at one hour. 

Not long after, we snagged seats at the bar. The only downside was getting periodically poked by the oversize bags of the women standing in the bar. Eventually I gave a healthy nudge to a giant Balenciaga tote and the poking ceased. I say this only because you may find yourself battling a similar issue should you choose to dine at the bar. Two pieces of advice: hang your own purse from one of the hooks beneath the bar and be prepared to judiciously defend your personal space from purses that threaten to invade it.

Upon receiving a split portion of the lobster spaghetti, I quickly understood its allure. This dish alone makes Bix worth visiting.
author: Miriam W.

description: The food is awesome, but the whole experience is special! Ask for Stu or AJ. The building is one of the most unique venues in the city....and Jazz too!
author: Michael B.

description:
BIX has a very intimate yet lively setting. We came on a night with live band music. DON'T walk in, chances are you won't get sat. DO make a reservation; a month in advance is highly advised.
Venue has two floors, bottom floor is right next to the live band and is a little louder. Maybe for bigger groups? Upper floor is definitely more intimate. Most couples or smaller groups were sat upstairs I believe.
The service was impressive. Highly attentive, professional. For a dinner this price you are getting the service you deserve and more.
Can't remember exactly which items we ordered when we went, it's been a month since our visit. I just remember that the tartare was so amazing. From presentation to delivery, and taste, each blew us out of our minds. Bill was about $150 plus tip for two people, which was pretty reasonable.
It is a pretty upscale place, and located down a sketchy alleyway. Parking is a pain in the @$$. No parking lot so you have to drive down the street and hope you get a spot within five minutes' walk.
Will definitely be back though.
author: Vicky H.

description:
Love the feel of this dark and classy restaurant.  It's something you'd expect to find in NYC.  Though the service was lacking (our waiter sucked), the food more than made up for it.  

Our favorite dishes were the appetizers.  Make sure to order:

-Chilled Foie Gras
-Deviled Eggs- not your average deviled eggs
-Marrow Bones St. John
-Dungeness Crab Rolls- served on a moist brioche
-Mini Lamb Burgers
-Steak Tartare

If you're in the mood for heavy, but delicious meal, this is the place for you.
author: K V.

description:
the food here is a little pricey but the food is good and its a swanky and cute place for dinner dates. the live piano player we had the night we dined was a nice touch but the restaurant was too dim for me

for appetizers, we tried the:

-steak tartare: i dont remember what was mixed in with the tartare but it was really fresh and i liked eating it with the little baked crostinis. it was a little on the bland side however, but nothing a sprinkle of salt cant fix

-mini lamb sliders: i love lamb, but there was nothing too special about these. 

-sweet onion and truffle cheese croques: pretty much a fancy grilled cheese sandwich. the sweet onion wasnt too overpowering and i love truffle!

my two friends and i all got the open faced truffle burger with fries on top of a rye bun. 

it was tasty but i dont like my burger's open faced... too hard to eat. and even thought we all asked for our burgers medium rare, it came out pretty much done.

for dessert we tried the lemon panna cotta and olive oil cake with huckleberries

the panna cotta was really light, can barely taste the lemon. the cake tasted like a pound cake soaked in olive oil but it was strangely good and addicting.

i dont think i woujld go out of my way to come back here again, but i would recommend this place to other first timers for the experience.
author: Katherine C.

description:
I've had a few drinks at Bix before but never dinner until recently. This was the place my current BF and I had our first kiss. So it made sense for us to come back on our anniversary. 

I made reservations here for Saturday at 9:30pm. We arrived at 9:30pm and were told to go and enjoy a drink at the bar. We waited for about 20 min and kept asking the hostess when our turn would be up. We were finally seated in a booth upstairs. By the time we were seated I was so sleepy! The great thing was the Jazz band which kept me awake and the girl with the ginormous boobs who dined right behind us. I would have been asleep head first into my food if it werent for them. 

Once seated we tried the blood orange salad as an appetizer. I had the lobster spaghetti while the BF had the lamb chop. My lobster spaghetti started off really good. The lobster chunks were plentiful and the grape tomatoes were a good balance. But after a while it was super thick and creamy. I couldn't finish it. The portions were hefty and by the time we were done with dinner we were so full dessert was a no-no. 

Good place for drinks and live music. I'll have to come back and try something else off the menu.
author: Katie Anne N.

description:
Bix swept me off my feet.

The experience at Bix starts with walking down Gold street and finding its dark sultry entrance tucked away from the hustle and bustle of North Beach. You walk in to beautiful music, an exquisite bar, art deco and find yourself miles away from where you started.

My meal was fanastic. We started with mozarella wrapped in prosciutto and I opted for the Duck Breast and quinoa salad, which I really enjoyed. They have such a great menu and wine list and it was so hard for me to decide. Dessert was necessary and I fell in love with the vanilla semifreddo with stone fruit.

Fabulous food and beautiful jazz in a romantic upscale environment. Everything you ever wanted.
author: Denise S.

description:
BIX is situated in an unassuming alleyway empty of any other businesses. Once you step in you realize you're in another world. The interior really reminds me of Gotham City. I was expecting Batman to jump down from the second floor. A huge mural hangs over the bar where an old-fashion white suited bartender works. The atmosphere is quite modern and on the verge of being gothic. It's great for romantic couples, business dates, or anniversaries. The feeling is somewhat stern and serious, almost cold, but it clearly knows what it wants to be.

The food is like a contrast of the interior. All of our appetizers were good. The only issue I had with the appetizers, that being there was only one textural element -- soft. That being said they executed the dishes very well and the softness felt luxurious. Our main dishes carried along the same richness and quality. Usually the appetizers turn out much better than the main course but I felt it was just as good. The desserts are good as well although the selection is tired and uninspired. How many places serve creme brulee, bread pudding, and bananas foster? It's good if you're looking for a traditional selection.

I recommend BIX if you're looking for a high end experience with consistent quality food that makes you feel like getting a luxurious experience. You will certainly leave full. This isn't light fare. The service is accommodating.

The only negatives would have to be the french fries and men's urinal. The french fries are over fried so they're super crunchy, almost like potato chips. They're really oily too. My mom got a bad stomach ache from them. And the urinal... They built the urinal so close to the wall that they have a problem with "spray back." So they've installed a drain board, which looks like a titled plastic cutting board. GROSS.

_____

We ordered:

Starters:
-Deviled Eggs with Truffles, Radish and Chives
-Dungeness Crab Rolls in Brioche with Meyer Lemon Aioli
-House Made Mozzarella wrapped in La Quercia Prosciutto with Fiordolio Olive Oil
-Chilled Foie Gras with Spiced Kumquats

Entrees:
-Louisiana Flounder with Broccoli Di Ciccio, Butter Beans, Preserved Meyer Lemon and Espelette
-Maine Lobster Spaghetti "alla Chitarra" with Cherry Tomatoes, Jalapeños and Basil
-Angus Short Ribs with Marble Potatoes, Spring Vegetables, Bone Marrow and Pickled Mustard Toast
-Black Truffle Cheese Burger served open face on Rye with Truffle Fries

Dessert:
-Bananas Foster with Dark Rum and Vanilla Ice Cream
-Warm Chocolate Brioche Bread Pudding
-Vanilla Crème Brûlée
author: Michael H.

description: I couldn't find a single thing wrong with this place, food, drinks , music from A-Z perfect. Waiter even shook our drinks to the rhythm of the bass player lol!!
author: Lance K.

description:
The SOLE highlight of Bix is the gorgeous interior and live Jazz--the food and wine are mediocre and overpriced.  We live in Menlo Park and were meeting friends from out of town, who made the reservation at Bix.  We love eating out and cooking and we ordered the lobster spaghetti, a special seafood dish and steaks.  The lobster spaghetti was just o.k, my steak was a 1/3 fat and covered by a sauce and the only decent dish was the seafood special (halibut?).  We ordered wine by the glass and they were horrible--cold, tasted like syrup and in cheap basic glasses.  We ordered the Syrah and another Spanish wine.  The service was fine-I felt like the server was going through the motions.
I might go here for a late night drink at the bar to listen to the jazz, but not for dinner :-(
author: Renee S.

description: Great lunch on Friday. Sat at the bar, Blake, the mgr, was on his game. Bartender, Peter, was a real pro. Good banter, excellent food, cozy location.
author: Steve G.

description:
The only word I can describe this place as is "swanky"! Love the decor and ambiance; the live piano player is a nice touch. I do wish it wasn't so dark inside!

Came here last night with katherine c. and Julia S. for a catch-up dinner. Street parking was pretty easy on Sansome, but they do have valet parking for $10 if you get tired of trying to find parking. We were a bit late for our reservation, but we were seated immediately upon arrival.

I had the Presecco and the other two ordered Pear Margheritas. The presecco was light and bubbly, but the pear magheritas didn't even taste like pear!

Appetizers:
- Sweet Onion and Truffled Cheese Croques - Tasted like a high class grilled cheese sandwich. Delicious!
- Mini Lamb Burgers - The bun was interesting as it was like the cream puff/profiterole. Overall, so-so
- Steak Tartare - Delicious! I would def order this again!

Main dishes (we all got the same thing):
- Truffle Burger with Truffle Fries - I love truffle, so of course I loved it. I do feel like the burger was on the Medium side even though I ordered Medium-Rare. The grilled onion was delicious on top, and I can't complain about the truffle fries! 

Dessert:
Lemon Panna Cotta with Olive Oil Cake and Huckleberries. - The panna cotta wasn't too lemony, which I was a bit disappointed about. The Olive Oil cake on the bottom was a bit odd, but not disgusting. Overall, the dessert was odd, but addicting at the same time. 

I would come here again for the overall experience. I would love to try the Lobster Spaghetti next time!
author: Tien P.

description: Best place to sit by the bar enjoy a expertly crafted drink and enjoy unintrusive music on the weekends. Elegant decorum for memorable dates.
author: Victor L.

description: Good meal, well prepared. Difficulty timing the dishes correctly, but we were a large group. Would have been a good experience except for the terrible maitre d' (or manager?) He made the entire experience quite unpleasant. Admittedly, we were quite late on our reservation, but the whole experience was handled without the grace I would have expected given the purported value of the restaurant. I would not reccomend.
author: Janne O.

description:
This place really earns about 3.6 stars, but Yelp doesn't allow me to give that rating. I couldn't go all the way up to 4, because that's reserved for really exceptional restaurants. Bix is really nice, though; it has a nice, reserved atmosphere and decor, and a jazz piano trio plays at 8:30pm (we went on a Friday night). We ordered four of the small plates, including the ceviche with corn nuts (very good) and the steak tartare (excellent). They have a small menu, but all of the selections looked promising. They also have some good, creative cocktails; their Manhattan is particularly good. Service was good; our waiter described the artwork in the restaurant to us in some detail.

Check it out!
author: Wesley H.

description: Best birthday dinner EVER!  My boyfriend took me here for my birthday dinner on Saturday and it was incredible!  I loved where it was located on Gold Street - hidden from all of the other nonsense on Columbus.  For starters, I had the Pisco Sour, and it had to have been THE best Pisco Sour I've ever had.  I could have thrown back at least 3 of those.  Anyway, Greg's favorite dish here is the Steak Tartare, and being that we both loved the two at Chez Papa Resto and Wayfare Tavern, I was really looking forward to this.  The tableside presentation of the mixing of the tartare was a GREAT touch, and I'm a huge sucker for those types of things.  The little toasts they gave you, combined with all of the strong (but not overpowering) tastes in the tartare really blew me away.  I don't always say this, but I really mean that if it were socially acceptable to lick a plate, I'd do it.  Every last morsel of this was incredible.  We got wonderful bottle of the 2006 DuMOL Syrah (Greg always remembers that my favorite wine when we first met was a syrah) and it paired nicely with our incredible CHEESEBURGERS.  Yep, the Black Truffle Cheese Burger served open face on Rye with Truffle Fries.  DELISH. DELISH. DELISH.  The one thing I will say about the dish is that, be prepared for truffle oil in the fries.  It was incredibly strong on the fries, so I found myself going to ketchup/mayo sauce to balance out the intense flavoring.  To round out the night, we both shared the Creme Brulee over a cappuccino and an apple brandy.  The whole experience was great, and our waitress was incredibly helpful (she went back and had a number of people from the staff look for the cork from our bottle of wine).  We never felt rushed during the meal, and hung around just until the live jazz band started.  Everyone at the restaurant was so nice, I can't wait until we make it back here again!
author: Lisa I.

description:
I really wanted to like Bix. I really did. My curiosity about Bix had been piqued since the bf came home raving about their bread, saying that it was the best bread EV-AH. Since I am a firm believer in the notion that you can tell a lot about a restaurant by the quality of their bread, I was excited about finally getting to try Bix last Friday. 

I had briefly perused the menu online and the potato pillows with creme fraiche and caviar had jumped out at me so I ordered that. We also ordered another starter for the table to share: the steak tartare. 

We had a nice variety of entrees at our table: I had the truffled cheeseburger with truffled fries, the bf had the Maine lobster spaghetti, and the other couple that we were dining with had the beef stew and the fish of the day which I believe was rainbow trout. 

Sadly, the potato starter was quite disappointing. The pillow itself was bland and mealy. So much so that it covered up any richness that the creme fraiche and caviar might have imparted.  Quelle horreur!!  The steak tartare was unmemorable as far as I was concerned.

However, the converse was true about my cheeseburger--unfortunately, it was memorable for all the wrong reasons. 

I ALWAYS order my meat medium rare and have never EVER gotten sick. However, this time around, I ended up with the nastiest case of food poisoning that I can remember... and from a freaking cheeseburger! Who gets food poisoning from a cheeseburger??? (This is a rhetorical question...)

Perhaps I should've waited a little while before writing this review as I am still in the process of recovering and have barely eaten anything for the last two days... so obviously my review is a little biased...

On a more positive note, the lobster spaghetti and the beef stew were quite good. Their desserts were decent as well (the table shared an order of bananas foster and the chocolate brioche bread pudding). 

Another negative: our waitress was M.I.A. a lot of the time... which wouldn't have been so bad, except that we noticed that she seemed to be VERY attentive to the two tables that were nearby. Could this have had anything to do that those two tables had ordered two bottles of wine a piece while I was the only one at our table who had ordered an alcoholic beverage? You do the math... 

So yes, the bread was good. Everything else, meeeehhhh... not so much...
author: Angelica J.

description:
Went this week as a first timer. Incredible establishment. Food, service, and music was great. Great environment of a 1940's hidden bar.

I had the steak taretare and the truffle cheese burger (which was not a burger by any means). Both were fabulous. I look forward to going back with my wife.
author: David W.

description: My date and I went on a Saturday night at 5:30 ... the only reservation we could get. We looked nice and planned to have a nice expensive dinner for two. The badgering to get us to hurry started almost immediately. It was fairly relentless and soon involved not only the waiter but the maitre d as well. In the 20 years I've lived in SF I've never felt such hostility to get me to hurry up. The food was 2-- 3 stars. The ambience was great. But I would never return again. BTW... we were finished with dinner within 2 hours. Maybe they should install parking timers on the tables.
author: cosmo c.

description: What a gem! I just moved here and a friend of mine was visiting. It was my first time there. I'll definitely be back!  We found out about this place from an Uber driver. No reservation but a cute blonde hostess seated us right away and told us the table was reserved for 7:30. In my experience most hosts would say they were fully booked and we wouldn't have been seated. That definitely set the place apart from the get go. Our waiter (a tall male brunette) can't remember his name unfortunately, was lovely. The decor was awesome; I felt like I was back to the 30s. I haven't even mentioned the food which was mouth watering. Keep it up Bix!!!
author: Caroline K.

description:
Rude, incompetent, insufficiently trained staff and specially bar tenders who actually think this is a classy restaurant. Let me tell you, Maxims of Paris this is NOT. 

I would not waste 1 cent in this pretentious wanna be. Sadly most SF crowd would not know the difference hence the survival of this restaurant and their ability to continue abusing the ignorant masses with thier substandard and vastly overpriced food served by extremely sustandard staff and bartenders. 

This place actually used to be good when Luigi was the host but those days are long gone.
author: Dee B.

description: Love this bar. Very old-school NYC feel. Not trendy or douchey. I had the ginger gimlet and it was bomb.
author: Phoebe V.

description: Had wonderful dinner there tonight before attending THE BOYFRIEND at the 42 Moon.  The hostess was extremely nice and helpful and our waiter Alex was the best even if he did not know who Julie Andrews is.  My, I am getting old.  We had the fish special which was excellent.  I would also strongly recommend the creamed spinach almost worth going back for that alone.  Our waiter had us in and out on time and brought us some cheese bites to nibble on while waiting for our main course.  This restaurant is hard to find and was completely booked on a Wednesday night so I would make sure that you have a reservation.
author: C.Michael T.

description:
So, my boyfriend surprises me and takes me to Bix for our first New Years Eve celebration together. Dinner reservations at 5:30pm .. we arrive at 5pm and had to sit at the bar to wait until our table was ready.. no prob... I order a lemon drop and him a mojito.. bill was $27 and trust me each serving was micro mini tiny for the price:-( I hadn't eaten a thing all day so decided to have some of the crackers at the bar.. looked like the standard chex mix, but had a spice to it.. gross really! But had to eat something before my drink.. finally our table was ready, it was extremely dark, so dark that he had to use the lamp at our table to view the menu! I do have to say the wait staff was attentive.. got my share of hot bread and butter. I ordered the Chicken Pate, Lobster Bisque and the Branzino entree (European Sea Bass) .. when my fish came the first couple of bites were too salty..barely ate the sides.. they were not that great! I've never had this fish before so I thought perhaps that's the way it was supposed to taste.. long story short.. by 11:22pm on 12/31/13 I found myself in my bathroom puking up everything including my stomach lining!! I suffered at home until 1:30am everything coming out from both ends - SO MISERABLE!! Happy New Year?? Finally decided it was time to go to emergency as my stomach muscles felt like they were knotting up inside! I was sweating all over and had the shakes really badly:-( We were there until 5:30am and to no surprise it was indeed food poisoning. 

I phoned the restaurant the following day, left a message and followed up 1/2/14. I got connected to Blake (the manager) who repeatedly emphasized that there was NO WAY to prove that it was from the fish..but was somewhat sympathetic... nevertheless, my entire meal was compt'd which was nice considering the other complaints/bad reviews.
author: Cheryl R.

description:
Call it 4.5.  A near miss.  Closecloseclose to 5 stars.

With Bix, you get both very good food and delightful atmosphere.  A smaller than you would expect restaurant, literally hidden in an alley, with live jazz music and people-watching aplenty.

The bartenders are knowledgeable and make very good cocktails and can also offer suggestions.  Step out of the box and let them guide the way.

The food is almost always excellent.  Although the heavier, creamier dishes will bomb your belly, I would still recommend them because they are so outstanding.  For example, I'm talking Truffle Cheese and Sweet Onion Croques.  You get 5 of these little sandwiches and they are finger licking delicious.   I could have eaten 20 of them and called it a day.  

Steak tartare is prepared tableside and, again, I could have eaten 5 plates of this stuff and have been totally satisfied.  Tomato soup with a mini grilled cheese sandwich--again, homey, creamy, excellent and a belly bomb.  And I mean that in the nicest way.

Lobster pasta--does that sound heavy to you?  It is but it is both heavy and heavenly.  It is served in a heavy cream sauce and you'll want to lick your plate.

The only disappointment was the Kobe steak.  I know we are all supposed to swoon over "Kobe" (both the beef and the Bryant), but not all Kobes are created equally.  This one is mostly tasteless and that is a shame.  Skip it and go for something else.

Overall,, Bix is excellent in almost every way.  But to be hold yourself up like this restaurant does, everything needs to hit the mark, and the service at Bix does not always match the high standards of the food and the drinks (and the music). And that is also a shame.  

Bix is still an excellent restaurant in nearly every way and well worth a visit.
author: Craig W.

description:
I came here on Saturday, 9/15 at 5:30 p.m. and had a reservation.  I have to admit, I was underwhelmed based on the reviews.

My friends and I shared:
Appetizers:
* Truffle Deviled Eggs:  Very good. The black truffle did not overwhelm the eggs.
* Pickles with Ranch:  Disappointing.  It's basically Vlassic pickle spears with ranch dressing.
* Tomato Cart:  Okay.  The fresh mozzarella was fantastic, but the cart was them just adding oil, vinegar and basil.  The demonstration wasn't anything great.
* Oysters:  Yummy Miyagi's.

Entrees:
* Truffle Cheeseburger:  Nothing great.  The burger was dry for medium.
* Lobster Spaghetti:  Again, nothing great, just what you think.
* Chicken Hash:  Delicious!  Very comforting.

Desserts:
* Bananas Foster:  Delicious!  Tons of the syrup to eat.
* Chocolate Chip Cookies and whipped cream:  Not that great.  Nothing bad to say, but not that gourmet either.

Drinks:
* Bellini:  Good.  
* Gin Martini:  Excellent.  The local gin used was very smooth.
* Vodka Dirty Martini:  Good and was happy they have blue cheese stuffed olives

Service was very good.


Overall, I'll probably not go back.  There was nothing special.
author: Valerie D.

description:
I came here for my birthday and really enjoyed it! It's very tucked away down an alleyway and you would never know it existed. It's an old soul, art deco, 1940s kind of place. Very interesting layout, felt like I was in a mobster movie! I loved our table upstairs, good people watching and could see the whole floor. There was a nice jazz ensemble playing which added even more to the old school vibe. 

The food was excellent, try the bone marrow, open face cheeseburger, lobster spaghetti (could have had a little more lobster), and their salmon (special of the day) was great also. The chocolate bread pudding dessert was to die for. Nice to see a real-deal restaurant like this still doing well and alive with a good crowd. The service was excellent.
author: E. R.

description: Swanky, sexy, great for a fancy date when you're willing to shell out some cash.  Not so great for a business meeting perhaps, but the food and drinks were solid, and the space is simply art deco gorgeous - except for that weird clown painting.
author: Jennifer D.

description:
Was looking for a nice lovely american restaurant to dine with my hubby for lunch and Bix came up in my list of searches in the FiDi.

No regrets for it for sure! The menu is extensive and everything looked so delicious. I had to go for the chicken hash and my hubby had the Bix burger. They were marvelicious and delicious. No doubt about that. Service was great, ambience was decorated in a 1930s theme. Soft music which doesnt overpower your voice. Loved the cosiness of this place. Im looking forward to try their dinner menu. Im sure it will be as good as lunch!

4 stars is already considered near perfection for me. Highly recommended.
author: Rachel L.

description:
Here is the run-down:

Potato Pillows with Crème Fraîche and American Sturgeon Caviar: It's even better than it looks (see my photo).  You only get 4 of these, but they are really good, and the fried "pillow" balanced perfectly with the caviar.

Appetizer special for 7/29: fried green tomatoes with garlic sauce.  Skip it.  The texture wasn't interesting, the sauce wasn't interesting, and the flavor wasn't interesting.  In general: not interesting.  Burned by the special again!  Will I ever learn !!??

Brûléed Vanilla Semifreddo with Blossom Bluff Nectarines: very good.  Great combination of semifreddo (sort of a frozen yogurt), with a crunchy brulee topping, and perfectly ripe nectarines on the bottom.

Warm Chocolate Brioche Bread Pudding: excellent, with an innovative top crust of chocolate dust/crumbs (see my photo).  However, it's really, really heavy, and needs more than the scoop of whip cream to help lighten it up.  I recommend ordering it with a scoop of vanilla ice cream on the side, to help "dilute" the super-dense pudding.

The only major disappointment: the espresso is really bad.  I had a decaf double macchiato.  It tasted stale, burned, and metalic: basically, the worst dreck imaginable.

One issue: the restaurant is really dimly lit, to the point where it's a safety hazard.  It's so dim that the waiters were dropping things.  It was so dim that my camera couldn't auto-focus.  I took a flash photo at the table, and I think I blinded half the diners in the room.
author: Scott F.

description: Bix has an intimate ambiance that hits you as soon as you walk through the door. My boyfriend and I went in on a night where a live jazz band was playing during dinner. The beautiful and famous painting "butlers in love" hangs center stage and is the focus point of the restaurant. Our server was very attentive and prompt. The food was delicious and they had a very large selection of wines. I would definitely recommend this place for a night out!
author: Linda A.

description: Excellent food, good service and nice ambiance. I only wish they would have seated us at a better table since I specified while making a reservation that it was a special occasion, but this did not spoil our experience.
author: EG P.

description: Nice atmosphere, with great live background music! Beautiful atmosphere and a very nice bar! Now, about the food - potato croquettes were bland and uninspired; pork chop was raw at the bone and could have used some salt and seasoning;  petrale sole tasted very fishy and was served with the tail (YUK!) and was otherwise bland; roasted brussel sprouts were a tad burnt and just too citrusy. Our server was very dry, not passionate at all ~  simply  efficient. Overall, just not impressed; never going back. Small portions, hefty pricetag and unmemorable food.
author: Sasha R.

description: Delicious food, divine surroundings, excellent service. I also enjoyed the most perfect Manhattan and the most exquisite corn bisque. YUM!
author: Nicole P.

description: The lamb shank looked delicious.  But beneath the surface it was cold, refrigerator cold.  I thought it must be a fluke until the diner next to me returned his truffled cheese burger because it was very cold in the center.  Not under done, just cold.  The chefs need to brush up on their micro-wave skills?  Great venue.  We have loved this hidden street treasure many times before.   But now the truth comes out: it's just theater.   Have a drink at the bar, enjoy the atmosphere and music.  Go elsewhere for dinner.
author: Stan S.

description: My customer loved it. I loved it. Great service. Great food. Great drinks. Awesome place for business entertaining.
author: Olin H.

description:
Bix was excellent.  Their signature app, the marrow bone, was AMAZING.  I was there on business and ate at the bar and I still had a great service experience.  

The food was fairly priced considering the quality and I would visit again.
author: Ali S.

description:
Just plain wonderful.  There. Short and simple.

Wonderful, magical room.   Wonderful, magical food.

The summer tomato cart with house pulled mozzarella dressed tableside showed me why I love the bay area.   Perfect tomatoes, each showing it's own pedigree, matched with wonderful cheese.  And the pepper, basil, balsamic and oil were all perfectly balanced.  Great food.

Lobster spaghetti with cherry tomatoes, jalapeno and basil was another wonderful plate of food.   The tomatoes and sauce was so wonderful you could have left the lobster from the plate and still had something wonderful.  

Two plates of food and two big winners.
author: David D.

description:
Was looking for a place to go for our company annual Christmas dinner. Searched on yelp and came across this place. Perfect! This little restaurant was conveniently located a block away from our office and they can accomodate large parties. Check!

Looked at the reivews and checked out their pre-fixe menu for large parties. Food looked decent and reviews were all positive. Check!

Came for dinner on a Thursday evening and was seated right away. Waitress was very nice and attentive. There was also a couple vegetarians in our group who, by the end of the night, was very satisfied with the vegetarian options that the restaurant offered.

I requested for the 4-course pre-fixe menu for our group. The 4 course also include hors d'oeuvres, and I think this was the best part of the meal. LOL The hors d'oeuvres consisted of prosciutto wrapped mozarella, smoked salmon tartare, and deviled eggs, ALL were delicious!!! 

For my 4 course meal, I ordered:
First course - Potato Pillows topped with caviar - I thought this appetizer was ok. It seems a little overpriced for fancy tater tots topped with caviar. It was a bit dry, would have preferred if there was a dipping sauce or something similar. I would have preferred to order the steak tartare instead (the bf's first course - of course I had to try this along with all his other courses! :) ), as that was probably more flavorful, and I love tartare!

Second course - Salad - simple dish comprised of the long lettuce and croutons. I requested for vinagrette dressing instead of the original dressing (don't remember what salad dressing came with the salad).
The BF had the soup of the day which was a butternut squash soup with mussels/clams. The soup was actually very very tasty! Typically, I've seen butternut squash soup with either large cubes of squash, or melted and mashed into the soup. This bowl of soup had small diced up pieces of squash, bite-sized. Delicious!

Third course - Chicken Hash - First off, I'm not a fan of bleu cheese. This dish was sort of like a crab cake but instead of crab, its shredded chicken shaped into a pattie infused with bleu cheese then seared to get a crispy exterior. If you aren't a big fan of bleu cheese, like I am, then I'm not so sure you would like this dish as much. My other coworkers ordered the NY Steak, which looked very tasty. The BF ordered fish, which was a bit plain. Meh..

Fourth course - Vanilla Creme Brulee - This is probably my second favorite dish of the night, the dessert! The creme brulee was not overly sweet, but was made just right, with a caramelized layer that I broke through to get to the vanilla creme brulee underneath. Delicious! I would definitely recommend this dessert over the the chocolate bread pudding (what the BF ordered). The bread pudding was a little toooo chocolatey for my taste. If you're a big big chocolate lover, then the bread pudding might be for you. I've had better bread pudding, and the bread pudding at Bix just didn't hit the spot for me.

Overall, 3.5 stars for the food alone, plus one star for the attentive service for a total of 4.5 stars!!

The next time I come, I would like to pick stuff off their regular dinner menu instead of being limited to a pre-fixe menu. I really want to try the truffle burger, so this won't be the last time you see me, BIX!
author: Tiffany T.

description: We were in town in late February to celebrate our 30th anniversary and looking for a special place. We were not disappointed. Everything was fabulous; food, ambiance, service... It was perhaps one of the top five dining experiences we've ever had. Highly recommended if visiting San Francisco.
author: Kevin J.

description: Terrible service as soon as we entered the restaurant. We had reservation but still waited for so long. The asian lady was very impatient and giving us attitude!!! We ordered 6dishes, 2 of them were too salty, 1 of them was over cooked!!!
author: Sarah B.

description: Great atmosphere! Loved the entrees, ambience, and music.
author: Dan M.

description:
Definitely a hidden gem!!  Hard to find, but really worth the wait.  We waited outside on the little chairs with the tables in an alley underneath the neon sign, and it made me feel like I was French, sitting outside a cute little cafe (Bonjour!  Bonjour!  Baguette?  Baguette!).  Then inside, there was pretty good jazz music playing and the atmosphere and decor of the place was so cool and fun and inviting.

We only came for desserts and drinks this time, I got the warm chocolate brioche bread pudding which I had eyed on the menu, and it was really good, but sooooo rich that by the end I almost felt like I had had TOO much chocolate which never happens!  I would recommend sharing with someone if you get it.  I also got the Bix Rickey, which has strawberry juice and some other stuff, and it was just the right amount of sweet and sour and amazing, mmm.

I definitely wanna come back for actual food and test that out!!  Pricier than your average place, but awesome and makes me want to come back everyday.. love love love this place!
author: Alice M.

description: Salty Ribeye  rude hostess, over rated place.. Been to much better that cost less.. this place is wanna be full of wanna be hot s### financial types
author: Andy N.

description: The ambiance in this place is absolutely great.  It's got such an old San Francisco feeling (think 1930's).  They have a piano player and a jazz singer performing while you eat and lots of fun cocktails in martini glasses.  The food was good.  I ordered the beef bavette which was good but the short rib that accompanied it literally melted in your mouth.  I would have loved to have a whole plate of just that.  The ginger gimlets were delicious and a couple of us got them.  I might just come back to have cocktails, sit at the bar and listen to the awesome music and singer
author: Amanda K.

description:
I'm usually not one to be seduced by ambiance, but BIX has done it!  A speakeasy like entrance on a secluded, but not sketchy, alley leads into something of a supperclub from days gone by.  High ceilings, high society paintings, live music, actual table cloths.  The food is a great offering of decadent classics.  My only want would be for later hours because most of the clientele here was not actual born in the era that this place tries to replicate!

Steak Tartare: My favorite in San Francisco.  Bloody and hand cut.  All the traditional preparations (shallots, capers, mustard) mixed table side, plus some Brandy!  The olive crostinis were a nice touch because they added more personality than plain without taking away from the tartare.

Truffle Burger: An open face burger with a moist and juicy patty.  Sadly didn't pick up on the black truffle that much... was hoping for something Earth shattering.

Chicken Hash à la Bix: Came in the form of two patties, like crab cakes.  Was expecting something that would look like stuffing so I was thrown off a bit.  It was ok, but could have been better if there were more crispy chicken confit bits.  The non-chicken section was a bit bland.

Truffle Fries: More truffle-y than the Truffle Burger.  Crispy and tasty with some nice cheese shavings.

Warm Chocolate Brioche Bread Pudding: What a great way to end the meal!  A warm gooey bread pudding that is reminiscent of chocolate volcano cakes.  There was some cream or ice cream on top, but I barely noticed because I was in a chocolate frenzy.
author: Adam B.

description: A 3.5 in overall experience. With exception of the bone marrow, I would completely skip the appetizers and go straight to the appetizers. The entrees, however, were all great, particularly the dorade. Crispy on the outside and moist on the inside, flavorful throughout.
author: Hang B.

description:
Classy, elegant and the food is A+.  One of the oldie but goodie places in SF.  I love that they have a live jazz band on Fridays, but it does get a bit loud.  I love the decor of an old school jazz club with black leather booths and dark mahogany walls.  My absolute favorite thing are the photos upstairs on the wall.  Its blank when you look at it with your naked eye, but use your camera with flash and see what appears!!!

Now the food is amazing!  I've been here at least 3 times and its been consistently yummy!  My favorite are the caviar potato pillows with creme fraiche, lobster pasta, and of course the truffle burger!  I'm drooling as I'm typing this review. lol  And I must say, they're dirty martinis are one of the best in the city!
author: Gina S.

description: LOVE this place! I've had better food elsewhere, but this is a restaurant you go to for the ambiance. The restaurant has an older crowd and kind of makes you feel like you're in Mad Men, especially with the live jazz in the evenings. It's dimly-lit, and great for work events or dates.
author: Lena Y.

description:
The jazz, the roaring 20s, the swing old school vibe...I love this place.  The smoked trout salad was superb and apparently the ingredients change every quarter - can't wait to try the different ones.   

My date and I sat next to a regular at the bar and she recommended a Gorgonzola burger that's not on the menu...man was it spectacular, I'd say the best burger I've ever had.

The cocktails are excellent and if you get wine, they don't pour a glass they pour half a bottle ;-)
author: Adonis V.

description: Business casual trendy restaurant with incredible ambiance including live music from the grand piano and vocalist. Friends had the lobster spaghetti and loved it. I had the duck and thought it was very good as well. My only knock is that service was somewhat slow and they kept forgetting who had ordered what. But if you aren't in a hurry, that shouldn't matter.
author: Scott B.

description: A delightful flashback to the glamour days of supper club ambiance. A wonderful experience!
author: Jeff B.

description:
We chose this restaurant for our recent vacation to San francisco based on recommendations and the reviews on yelp. We met some friends there and our group burgeoned up to 9 people- an easy feat for a waiter in Chicago or New York, not so for SF. We arrived promptly at 6pm and upon entry I sensed a negative tone from the hostess. Despite her attitude, we headed to the bar and ordered a drink and off to the table.
It was obvious upon sitting down that he was already plotting our departure to make room for the next table. The company and conversation was good until the waiter, after asking us for the second time for our appetizer order, told us harshly that we had 2 minutes to make a decision and stomped off to tattle to the manager that we weren't moving fast enough. To add insult to injury, the manager then hovered in an attempt to convince us it was time to order.

I am sure you can tell where it went from there- downhill. The food was marginal, the service continued to slip and unfortunately the only thing that escalated was the bill. 

And to add to the misery, ( there is nothing worse than bad food and service at meal where you pay a babysitter and pay $75 a head), as we were exiting slowly into the cold rainy night, the group ahead of us stopped to open their umbrellas, a log jam ensued and my brother in law had to hold open the door for 45 seconds. The manager then told him angrily to shut the door as he was "air conditioning" the restaurant. Well, this comment led to my brother in law responding with explanation of why the door was open and then a statement in reference to his negative attititude. The  manager ended the conversation telling him was an ass.  

Now, that seems inappropriate for a manager at nice restauarant to respond.

I would never go back to this restaurant and will pass on the referral just for the closing comment but the food and service didn't live up to the overall rating.
author: cortney d.

description:
Delicious! Try the gimlet. 

We had four or five different appetizers as our meal and couldn't imagine anything tastier. Absolutely delicious. And the live music was a fabulous touch. A great place for a date, an anniversary, a celebration, or anything else in between.
author: Anna G.

description: Amazing food and services. I came here for my bday on 7/29. This was my 2nd time here and I would eat everyday if I could. I highly recommend the Lobster Spaghetti and Banana Foster for dessert! Everything is good here!
author: Jangalina J.

description:
Bix is my absolute new favorite restaurant in San Francisco. I live in Los Angeles and I have already been there three times so far this year. As everyone else has noted, the atmosphere is brilliant; jazz supper club meets prohibition-era speakeasy. Getting past that, the food is simply a perfect expression of traditional American classic gastronomic fare interpreted through the lens of chic, modern foodie sensibility. Not a single item on the menu comes off as pretentious, yet every single dish seems fresh and exotic while also being deeply satisfying, comforting and familiar. 

The last time I ate there our party enjoyed a ridiculous nine course meal that included Mini Lamb Burgers, Dungeness Crab Rolls, Potato Pillows with Créme Fraîche and Caviar, Bix's Summer Heirloom Tomato Cart with House-Made Mozzarella, Marrow Bones "St. John" on Grilled Durum Bread, Seared Local Albacore, Grilled Veal Paillard with Rock Shrimp, Truffled French Fries and Creamed Spinach followed by Farmer's Market Plums with Almond Ice Cream and Warm Ginger Madelines. I complemented my meal with a number of traditional Sazerac Cocktails, while my wife enjoyed a glass of Champagne and a couple of Bix Manhattans. Afterward, our party vowed that we would never eat again (having so thoroughly stuffed ourselves in such a decadent manner). Of course, that sentiment barely lasted till the morning. 

In the interest of full disclosure, I think it is only fair to mention that the newly appointed Chef de Cuisine is my wife's cousin, but that in no way changes my perception of this fine American eatery. Her cousin is sure to move on some day, and when he does I will most certainly continue to treat myself to one of San Francisco's great epicurean establishments.
author: Thomas M.

description:
I wish I could give this place 3.5 stars. Really enjoyed the vibe (we sat on the second floor) and the appetizers (deviled eggs and crab sandwiches). We also got a salad on the house because our entrees were taking a little longer than expected - a sign of professional, attentive service.

However, the entrees themselves were a little disappointing.

Truffle burger: I LOVE burgers, and for $28 I was expecting greatness. The burger was good but a little overcooked.

Chicken has: Again, good but not great. Needed more spice.

Desserts were mixed: sorbet was ok, creme brulee was yummy.
author: Amy F.

description:
This place was way better than I expected.  A bit pricey, but the food is good and fun.

I started with the beef tartare.  I don't even eat this type of stuff, but I really enjoyed it.  Next I had the crab rolls which were extremely delicious.  My wife had the pork chop which was perfectly cooked and very juicy.  In addition, they made great drinks.
author: Anthony M.

description:
High assurance.

Learned many things during dinner at my latest favorite San Francisco restaurant. For instance a 6-log reduction is about as sterile as you can get:

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sterility_assurance_level

Other learnings and recommendations I can share with equally high assurance:

- Smoked trout with lemon on a cracker is outstanding

- Entire duck ham and cheese panini would be too much. But bite sized for an appetizer is perfect in more ways than one.

 - Lobster is good. Spaghetti is good. Together as a lobster spaghetti is unique, delicious and surprisingly not as heavy as one would expect.

- Kale is a super food. Kale with whole grain mustard, mushroom and onions is superbly amazing.

- Flounder does not flounder when combined with carrots, asparagus and yogurt. Quite the opposite.

- You must make room for dessert. Otherwise you might miss the rich, decadent and brilliant warm chocolate brioche bread pudding. 

Don't forget you had kale already. This makes it a balanced meal.

Additional learning include retro touches (font, oversized murals, live jazz bands) can really enhance an atmosphere and enthusiastic service is contagious.

Offering to split plates and glasses of wine so we can try more of everything was an unexpected and classy move.

Last but certainly not least learned that 20+ years of friendships are what five stars is all about. Actually I already knew this. Tonight served as the latest reminder.

6-log reduction tutorial from said friend was just the icing on the conversation cake.

author: Jason B.

description:
To all my fellow Bix lovers, more importantly those that LOVE the lobster spaghetti - there's a new chef in town and he's opposed to the creamy delicious dish that we all come here to savor.. I just got back and I'm depressed to say that this dish is no longer creamy, not only that but it sits in an oily mess of what this chef calls "sauce" I don't know that I can recommend Bix any longer and on that note ever come back. This is a sad day indeed. 

The ambiance and the service is impeccable, but my dish brings the stars down to a big fat 1!
author: Monica S.

description: We stopped by here after dinner for a drink before heading over to Cigar Bar. I loved the decor at the place. The drinks were a bit on the pricy side, but the live jazz band made it worthwhile. Would love to try out the food here one of these days.
author: Alice W.

description:
Yawn.

I'm snobbish.  Only because after dating out and about in this busy little city where the continuous supply of men and women are easily updated by the push of a button, the proclivities of this erratic hobby are starting to affect me.  "Been there done that."  "I'm not impressed" to "WTF kind of car is that" (meaning please don't pull up in a Mustang.  Ugh.)  And "are you out of your f***ing mind?"

In so saying, I love Bix.  I've loved it from every non-date visit/date visit aspect available to me.  Perhaps it is the sense of walking into an old school establishment with the live band at the center and tables centered around and above.  Perhaps it is the leaner feeling one leaves after dropping a several $$$ tab on the table but feeling quite Nouveau Riche.  I did not love the Houndstooth Sportcoat my one date wore years ago and the age of the crowd here made him look older.  How old are you again?  

The prices here are reasonable for the area.  Just don't come here to order the hamburger.  I had the Sea Bass that came accompanied with potatoes and broccoli rabbe, topped off with a citrus relish.  I know it was broccoli rabbe, because a good friend of mine is on the prowl for this delectable green at the Berkeley Bowl when the season strikes.  I have to confess, that one can do no wrong with Bass if it is prepared correctly without overpowering this delicate fish.  They did a fantastic job in that it was soft, tender and not overly flaky.  I normally do not order fish but this was superb.

Another time here found me in the company of many good friends and we split a dish (hello, it was around $45) so he was happy to oblige.
