But the upholstery was giving my companion acid flashbacks and the bare walls with strange mitochondrial shapes pasted on them looked dated. I wouldn't tell people to stay away if this is their type of place but I don't think I'll be beating a path back anytime soon.
author: Allie D.

description: One of the best dining experiences I've had in a long time.  Is it cheap? No.  Is it overpriced? No.  The food is excellent, the service is great, the location is spectacular and the ambiance is like no other place in San Francisco.  You will not be disappointed with this place.
author: Corey V.

description:
Had dinner here a couple years a go. I just remembered! It was actually a wedding reception and the food and drinks were fantastic!

I have to come back and sit down for a delicious meal here soon.
author: Art A.

description:
Whether I'm in the mood for a perfectly made drink or a full dinner, BIX is my go-to spot. As a native San Franciscan (5th generation born to be exact) this is the place I always take (and refer) those visiting from out of town for the ultimate SF dining experience. I have fond memories as a kid sitting at the bar doodling in my coloring book as my Grandfather sat with the good ol' San Francisco boys sipping on lowball cocktails.

Aside from an always fabulous menu, great Jazz musicians, and superb service, the bananas foster is pure HEAVEN! I recently split the deliciousness with my BF and almost stabbed him with my spoon for coming too far on my side of the plate. He quickly learned his lesson not to mess with my bananas foster. Next time, he will be ordering his own.
author: Meredith R.

description:
Everything but the food never fails to impress me at Bix. The atmosphere has a glorious throw-back-to-golden-age feel, the live jazz is a treat, there's always a healthy buzz (even at 6 pm on a Tuesday), and their service is top-notch. I love their cocktails, their decor, and their painted location, just set back from the antique district.

But the food never blew me away. Admittedly perhaps my expectations were set too high: this place is PRICEY and their tuna tartare is included in 7x7's 2010 Big Eat list. The food is good, but not amazing, and that tuna is certainly not the best I've ever tasted. The dishes are a tad too pricey for their simplicity - at roughly $30-35 an entree, I'd like to try something a little more interesting.

Nonetheless, the atmosphere is pretty special, and it's a good place for a date, business dinner, or fun little sit-down.
author: Amanda F.

description:
This review is biased in the fact that I was here for a wedding reception and that party took over the whole restaurant. One of the bride and groom's favorite restaurants, we were in for a treat. 

As we crossed from North Beach into the alleys of the Financial DIstrict, we noticed the neon sign that signaled that we were at our destination. The restaurant is hidden off in a small brick alley and as you walk in, it opens up to a two level space of 1940's glamour. A jazz trio was in full swing and people we socializing around the open bar. My drink as of late has been the Rob Roy and the bartender her sure crafted up a solid one. We briefly went back out into the alley to greet the newlyweds and noticed  a handful of appetizers make their way around the guests. After our brief greeting, we moved our way upstairs into one of the booths overlooking the restaurant.

The appetizers that we saw earlier all made their way by us and of course we tried them all. Multiple times. Some of things that we got to sample:

Tuna Tartare on Olive Toast
Potato Pillows with Creme Fraice and Caviar
Firecracker Shrimp with Chile Aioli
Chick Pea Puree Crostini
Mini Lamb Burgers

In addition to the deliscious appetizers passing us constantly, the wait staff also refreshed our cocktails constantly. Service definitely was top notch and they were there to impress. It doesn't get much better than that. 

I know this isn't going to be your usual experience here but it definitely has me intrigued on what the full dining experience is. I'm certainly returning going to return and find out.
author: Kim N.

description:
Worst dining experience ever!!!!! My friend came here from out of town and we were celebrating her birthday at BIX. We were expecting a great restaurant with great service and food from the reviews. 

We made reservation for 4 but we were about 10 mins late because we couldn't find the place since it's in an alley. When we arrived, the hostess made us feel really bad for being late. I felt like we were late for a class. Then she made the four of us wait for at least another 30 mins for the next available table when there were quite a few open tables. 

We ordered the bone marrow, potato pillows, lobster spaghetti, truffle fries, and a dessert which were all very good. Our server wasn't attentative at all and didn't bother asking if we wanted water or anything to drink. They gave us a really small table which seems like it's a table for two. The table was wobbly and didn't feel comfortable at all. It was my friend's birthday so we only wanted to take a picture of her and the dessert with a candle on it. But the manager (a guy with a suit) came by and basically told us no pictures. My friend wanted to take a picture of the marrow bones with her phone, again the same guy came by and told us no pictures. Then he told the server to remind us not to take pictures. They were watching us the whole time we were at the restaurant. We felt really uneasy and unwelcome. 

I would definitely not come back here again!!!
author: Christina K.

description:
We picked Bix for a date night in the city. I made sure to book the reservation a week or two in advance. We were sat upstairs, which I was happy with. Our server was very friendly and helped us pick our meal choices. We started from the cocktail menu and order the Nicolo martini and the Perfect Manhattan. Both were excellent drinks. We started with the Ceviche which tasted very fresh and had a nice kick to it. We split the Little Gems salad which was nothing special. For dinner I ordered the the kobe beef tips with mashed potatoes. The beef was cooked perfectly and was really tender. My wife ordered the slow cooked pork which was rather dry and lacking flavor. 

I felt the food over-all was just "okay." It was nothing special which was dissapointing. The worst part were the tables on either side of us. It says clearly on the menu "Seriously enjoy your meal. No laptops/Ipads Please silence your cell phones." The couple to my right were playing angry birds (fun game) the entire dinner and taking cell phone pictures of each course of their dinner. They sat a party of 6 on the other side of us (late 40's early 50's). They were completely wasted when they arrived and proceeded to yell to each other and take a million flash photos with their giant Nikon camera. They were yelling about putting the photos on their FB pages. I am in my late 20's and love to have a good time, but this was beyond annoying. Clearly I did not "Seriously enjoy my meal." We will not be returning.
author: Lind Z.

description:
The tuna tartare was very tasty although very onion-y.  I went to Bix with some girlfriends and enjoyed a gin martini at the bar. The restaurant has a very older generation charm...made me nostalgic for some of the steak houses in my hometown. A 3-piece band was playing. Very nice.

This place was a solid 3.5 ~ and may have been a 4 if we'd had an easier time getting a seat.

I'd love to bring my hubs here for a romantic dinner.  It seems like a great venue for it.
author: Christina K.

description:
My boyfriend and I came here for dinner to celebrate his birthday. 

First of all, this has nothing to do with the food, but location and ambiance was lovely. I felt like I was no longer in SF. Nice romantic place to escape to for the evening. 

Starters: I ordered the Steak tartare and the bf ordered Hamachi drizzled with a light citrusy pistachio dressing. 

Entrees: I ordered the Lobster spaghetti and the bf ordered the Truffle burger.  For an exorbitant price tag, you'd expect your meal to be excellent.  The lobster spaghetti was okay, nothing to rave about. The bf didn't seem to drool over the truffle burger as well.  The food was mediocre. (I think he LOVEs the ambiance more than anything, haha) 

Dessert: Warm Chocolate Brioche Bread Pudding was heavenly!! This entirely saved the meal... I was most happy with the warm gooey chocolate and the smooth ice cream, mmmMMm, so good!
author: J C.

description:
I had dinner with group of coworkers at Bix two nights ago.  The food and service were great.  The dungeness crab rolls and potato pillows were fastastic hors d'oeuvres.  I had a pork shoulder entree that was delicious, and very tasty bananas foster for dessert.  Everyone in my group seemed happy with their food.

Only two quibbles - the hostess wouldn't seat us until everyone in our group arrived.  That left nine of us standing body-to-body in the doorway, since it was pouring rain outside, and already very crowded inside.  I think it's a little much to expect a group of ten to arrive all at the same moment on a Friday night in San Francisco, and common sense would suggest that a large group should be seated as they come, to keep the doorway clear.  Also, as we were seated about 20 minutes late, the hostess informed us that we would need to vacate the table when the next reservation arrived.  That was two hours after our actual reservation, and the service was snappy, so it didn't end up being a problem - but that's just downright tacky.

Also, the cocktails were oddly small.  I had a gin martini, and it was just fine - shaken at the table actually, which is a nice touch.  But, frankly it was small.  If this is an effort to prevent drunk driving, I can respect it.  But, if it's a cost saving measure, or worse, a statement about the size a cocktail "should" be, I have a problem with that.
author: Andy M.

description:
************* REVIEW 182 ****************

Nice, elegant, & intimate spot on the alley that popular with the financial guys & the lawyers. You can drive right by the place & wouldn't know this cute place exist. It's dark inside, hard to read the menu sometimes, but up stair can be very private & intimate, it's a great date spot.

I prefer the bar with much more actions. We used to dine here quite often when we were working on a case at Arnold Laub Law Firm, just a few steps away. We came back for a few cocktails & food at the bar, after our fitting. 

The lamb slider, the Chilean sea bass are super good here. So does all the cocktail, raspberry lemon-drop with Chambord &  Martinis are delish here.

The place still has it charms & classy as ever.

P.S. they do have valet parking = perfect!
author: Manda Bear B.

description: BIX is a restaurant I had on my list for some time, and when we arrived the service was great.  It has a traditional, yet hip ambiance. The food was decent, I suppose I had higher expectations given how much I had heard about this place.
author: Pooja S.

description: Went there for our anniversery and had a great time.  The food was excellent.  Tried several dishes, our favorite was the Lobster Spagetti.  The ambiance was great, we were seated on the second floor and had a complete view of the resturant.  Can't say enough good about the place. It is a little expensive but worth every penney.
author: Nick D.

description:
Such a cool place! The ambience was perfect for me and my fiancée to celebrate our new engagement. It was a really great blend of cool and classy without being stuffy.
The food was superb! We had a few appetizers, I highly reccomen the potato pillows and steak tartar. Everything came out at a good pace where it let us enjoy the live jazz and not feel like we were being rushed. 
The desserts tasted great but lacked in presence and flare compared to the apps & main course. 
Thank you Bix for a very memorable evening!
author: Daina G.

description:
The band is usually pretty good, the food is usually good though they have been having some misses lately. The lobster salad that was so praised was not fresh. The wait staff and manager were really rude to us, made obvious mistakes and blamed us for those mistakes. They insisted they 'showed us a good time.' It seemed like a coke induced haze that the server and the manager were in.

The bar staff was marginally better in that they were mostly stand offish and deferential. The drinks are pretty good here, however, with places like the orbit room, rye and all the Bourbon and Branch like establishments it's not worth going here just for that.

I used to endorse this place, I no longer recommend it.
author: Sumeet P.

description: My wife and I made dinner reservations for a booth but when we arrived to a nearly empty dining area at 6pm we were denied a booth.  The staff in general are burned out and would rather be anywhere except serving diners.  But the worst, is that we ordered no wine but the waiter put a $50 cork fee on our bill! I think the waiter was trying to put one over on us. Of course, he apologized as did a person identifying himself as the manager, but in the context of my overall impression of the place, it was probably intentional and likely not a mistake.
author: Paul W.

description:
A cool, classy place.  I went here in a party of eight for a friend's birthday.  I came early, sat at the bar, and enjoyed a nice glass of Riesling (pricey at $11, but I we're paying more for the classy decor, the pretty people, and the piano and vocal duet).

The entire party showed up on-time at 8:30PM on a Thursday night, but we weren't seated until around 9:00PM.  The staff confessed to the mis-management with the tables, which was fine by us.  Once we were seated we were given delicious appetizers on the house.

Food was very good, with some notable exceptions going both ways.  The oysters were very fresh, my kobe steak was cooked just perfectly at medium-rare, and the arugula salad won universal approval with great greens and wonderful fruit.

On the flip side, the one vegetarian in our group pretty much got shafted.  There wasn't a single veggie entree on the menu.  After asking the waiter for a vegetarian option, my friend was promised a "special dish" prepared by the chef that was served "all the time to vegetarian customers."  What he got was a plate composed of all of the vegetable sides from all the other entrees.  Ultra-lame.

Service was good, though our waiter alternated between treating us as if we were first-time restaurant goers and as if were hardened Bix vets.  Very strange.

Total bill came to about $100 per person given appetizers, salad, entree, wine, drinks.  You could definitely spend a lot less.

Overall, I was impressed with the ambiance and decor and very happy with my meal and service.  I'd definitely come here again.

Dudes, dress nicely.  Jacket definitely, tie maybe.  If you come in a t-shirt (as two of our party did) be prepared for some weird stares from the other patrons.
author: Bill H.

description:
Excellent food, good service, nice decor. Bit noisy but I did not have trouble speaking with my beau as we leisurely ate dinner. We shared an h'ordeuvre and a salad (which they kindly split into to separate bowls w/o request) which were both superb. I had steak for dinner which was cooked to my liking and came with a delicious pomme whip (fancy talk for mash). 

I was slightly frustrated that the waited did not ask me how my wine was, I suspected it was because I was female but cest la vie, 

All in all great place for a fancy occasion, or dinner out if you happen to have the money to drop as it seemed other patrons did. :).
author: Bronwen H.

description:
Some business partners joined me here on a recommendation from a fellow foodie.  When you arrive, you are struck by the decor here.  It appears to be from the 30's, and has been tastefully renovated.  We had excellent martinis to start and were seated promptly by a very friendly hostess.  

Our waiter was frighteningly tall and spoke with a loud, booming voice to describe the specials and take our orders.  We had the heirloom tomato salads, which were made table-side, foie gras and steak tartare for apps.  I had a delicious pork tenderloin here as well (it's my latest addiction), and we washed everything down with several reasonably-priced Napa reds. 

You know a business dinner is going well when the conversation gets loose (martini's and wine always help), and this was no exception.  However, it was the first time I can recall having a dinner conversation about the costs and pain involved in hair removal (and this was a table full of guys by the way)!  My company did not detract from the otherwise classy spot and evening.

Everyone gave the place two thumbs up.  Were it not for the noise level (it's very loud inside, probably due to the tall ceilings, which made it difficult to converse), I would have given Bix five stars.
author: Will T.

description:
Heard lots of great things about Bix from a friend who has come on 3 different special occasions so I was excited to try it out. Came for my 10th anniversary. The front door staff was really polite, when we arrived, table was not quite ready so off to the bar we went. Bartender was more focused on the "regular" crowd than the fact that we dropped 50 bucks in 3 seconds. Barely acknowledged us while we were sitting there. 

Table is ready and we get put in one of those long bench seats, not exactly romantic (and they knew it was our anniversary)... Server had the personality of a wet mop, I would've preferred the much more bubbly one who was busy telling his customers about the history of the restaurant, all about the SF health care tax, and he only works 3x's a week. 

Took our appetizer orders (crab rolls AMAZING!). Then he comes to take our order, we had to ask him what the specials were. He apologizes for forgetting, we place our orders. 

Husband was pleased with his dinner. My burger I thought tasted amazing. The fries were a little old tasting though, very hard and dried out. 

Dessert, Bananas Foster with a couple of candles thrown on it to recognize the day. The Bananas Foster was awesome, too bad they can't do that table side! 

With the 1,000s of places of San Francisco to eat and to explore we have no qualms about leaving this one behind.
author: Rochelle J.

description:
I'm giving a tre for the location and the ambiance even though we were too early for music and for the 'professional' waiter with his lock-step jive. Was supremely shruggy with the vaunted lobster pasta...there was a teaspoon-and-a-half of lobster...well, maybe not quite a half teaspoon of lobster - make that one teaspoon...I don't remember the rest of the meal. Came here for a birthday while in town. We was letdowns.

Come here earlies for a drink and an app, sit at da bar. Think some good hot jive jazz, Bix Beiderbecke would approve. Tell somebody preferably not the hostess to get a connection in Maine.
author: Gonzalo B.

description:
Adding to my friend Veronica P's Review. Terrible service. Spoke with Manager after I left him a message. He claims he doesn't care to read yelp reviews, and didn't offer to make it up to me AT ALL... We had a horrible dining experience when we went for my birthday. 

Manager thanked me for calling to complain & that was it?!!!!!!!!

Horrible! Maybe they should start reading their reviews!!!!! You couldn't pay me to go back.
author: Carla d.

description:
Oh you are kidding... I've never Yelped Bix?  WTF.  Maybe because it was such a naughty evening full of outright mad escapades did I delete my evening and therefore didn't review Bix. 

First off, Bix is my dog's Bixby's nickname... you are thinking... no shit sherlock.  Thinking of him because I'm pet sitting him (he lives with my Mom while she is in the Motherland) and it took me 15 minutes to get him in the car with a makeshift doggie ramp.  I'm almost cried, he's about 15 years old and 110lbs.  I know... I know... fat bastard.

Anywho, my experience started off with me and my best friend's Mom... yep I have no qualms with hanging out with people older than me or younger than me as long as they get me.  (aka don't judge me... haha!)  And she is a hoot!  We sit at the bar order some beverages and then the next thing we know we are chatting it up with these older (compared to me) men who are now sharing their bottle of Dom and I'm pretty sure we went through another bottle too... 

That was the beginning... I don't really recall much of the rest of the evening due to my toxicity level but it sure was fun, at least what I can remember.  

So Bix, classy and elegant atmosphere.  Only experience the bar so not familiar with their dining but slighlty upscale and reminds of scene from Who Framed Roger Rabbit... again random... but it does... not sure which scene but it was one that had Jessica Rabbit in it too... 

Funny, my friend that I went to Bix with, her name is Jessica and I love the Rabbit... the animal that is...
author: Shiho F.

description:
Pros
Very tasty food
Good atmosphere
Polite service
Great cocktail 

Cons
Very pricey 
Ridiculously small portions
author: Tri U.

description: Great night out! Live music, good service, enjoyable food.
author: Vicki L.

description:
Came here on a Friday night with some friends - I would've never knew this place existed if it weren't for them (or yelp) since it's nestled in an alleyway.

Definitely make a reservation, especially if you plan on coming in on the weekend.  We were seated upstairs, which was nice because there was a live band playing there and none of us would've been able to carry a conversation with each other if we were sitting downstairs; it would've been too loud.  So if you plan on coming here and actually want to speak with the person/people you come with - request to sit upstairs when you make your reservation.  The service was great and our server was extremely helpful and knowledgeable when it came to helping us decide on what to eat/drink and was accommodating of the portions (i.e. ensured that we had enough to share for each appetizer).

The food was delicious.  After we had our appetizers, I was stuck on everything with truffles...I must say, I was all truffled out by the end of our meal.

What's good?
Appetizers:
*Truffle Cheese and Sweet Onion Croques
*Steak Tartare
*Chilled Foie Gras
*House Made Mozzarella wrapped in La Quercia Prosciutto with Fiordolio Olio Nuovo

Entree:
Black Truffle Cheese Burger served open face on Rye with Truffle Fries
Check out their specials...the night we went they had a duck pasta, which was delicious - half our table ordered it.

Drink:
I don't like sweet drinks, but the Rum Punch Happy Jack was okay - our server had them ease off the Grenadine, so it was good.

Long story short - I'd definitely come back here again, but probably only for a special occasion since it is a little pricey.  There were 5 of us and it came out to about $80/each after 1-2 drinks, a few appetizers, an entree, 1-2 desserts and coffee.  Great ambiance, great food, great service.
author: Cherylle Q.

description:
First let me start by saying Bravo to Bix.  Everything about this place screams jazzy smooth elegant romantic evening and believe me romance poured through this places veins.  Everyone upstairs was enjoying the romantic swooning through the place.

Fortunately, my newly fiance and I were seated upstairs in the best table which is directly in the center overlooking the bar; allowing you to look down and it also assisted with the noise level which I assume would get very loud if we were seated downstairs.

Is this place on the pricey side YES! Is the food and service and ambiance worth a magical "dining experience" YES! Living in LA we are surrounded with wonderful restaurants, but this place takes the cake.  We reserved our entire day to indulge in Bix's creations. 

First Course: Crab Roll: Delicious with a hint of lemon poking at your taste buds and the buttery toast surrounding the cool sweet Dungenous Crab.  A+
Marrow Bones: Absolutely amazing, these we nice sized marrow bones they do not skimp it's well worth the price even the crostini has a slight garlic flavor which really added to the rich buttery marrow.

Main Course: Chicken Hash:  Good not my favorite, I do not think I would order this again, it reminded me of a high end chicken pot pie in the form of a patty and pan fried.  The meyer lemon sauce with tomato medley served underneath was very delicious.  NY Strip with Sliced Potato Frite and small salad hands down the best steak I've EVER had my fiance agreed who is an avid meat eater.  The lemon infused herb butter atop is irresistible.  Let's not forget the potato slices alongside a garlic aoili simply divine!!

Dessert:  Chocolate Brioche Bread Pudding : AMAZING nice and crunchy crumbles on top and underneath was chocolate warm pudding.  The Peanut Butter Cookies w/ Chocolate: Sweet, Salty and creamy as it's served along side some fresh cream.  So, amazing as these thin peanut butter cookies and quality chocolate lay atop with flakes of sea salt.  

Our server was fantastic and you are really taken care of there we have zero complaints.  We even had a mishap as we ordered the NY strip Med Rare and it was More Med Well, immediately they apologized and were very attentive.  You want customer service here you have it...their policy is if your steak is cooked improperly and you have to send it back...It's FREE! Not only did the server apologize profusely, but the GM came by the table and made sure we were comfortable several times and even brought our steak out.  Customer service as it should be!  

Also, the cocktails were nice and strong they did not disappoint.  This is our favorite restaurant and will return on our next trip to San Fran without a doubt!
author: Melanie P.

description:
BIX is the quintessential San Francisco restaurant/bar/jazzy piano/deco-classical place to dine!

First, can't believe I've left them off my all time favorite, can't miss recommendation list, but BIX has amazing mixologists concocting martinis to whatever drink you desire.

Service has always been excellent and recommendations are believable.

Even if BIX is not on your bucket list, the LOBSTER SPAGHETTI has to be added to the bucket...it is that good!  Rich in lobster and flavor and it may also get you to the bucket faster, but they say you live only once.
Will set you back $40, so that's my only criticism to BIX....they try at $39.95...but really!

Piano player and singer come on around 8 pm...dark, deco ambiance.
Alley location gives you the Barbary Coast feel and perhaps a little of the Speakeasy era.
author: Randall F.

description: One of my favorite after work lounges. Elegant, friendly, and comfortable. Friendliest bar service in the city. A supper club ambience that hails from days of old.
author: Michael G.

description:
I've eaten dinner here 5 times.  Every meal has been excellent and a pleasure. I love the Gold Alley location for the romance factor, and then to window shop the Jackson square antique stores after dinner. 

This is a higher end dining experience price wise for me. Even though I tend to be a bargain shopper, I find Bix is always worth the higher than normal dining bill. I usually drop $240 plus tip on a dinner for two here, but never regret it. 

Probably the best bar in the city for a classic Martini. The glasses chilling in the mountains of shaved ice is eye catching. Make reservations, Dress up! Then go to see, and been seen. You'll love the food.
author: Tom S.

description:
This place was awesome! It was our big dinner out while visiting San Fran and it exceeded our expectations. It was like straight out of a Mad Men episode, drinks and all. The best part is its located down this dark alley, and it seems to be the only thing down there! Its a Supper club and right when you walk in you feel the energy. They had a jazz band playing all night and we were seated upstairs where we (and by that I mean I had a nice view, my boyfriend had his back to the band) had a nice view. It was a tad noisy in there with the music and the people,  but it was definitely worth it. 

We started off the homemade mozzarella wrapped with prosciutto and we found it to be very light and delicious!! My boyfriend then order the lobster bisque, which was VERY good, but was a little light on the lobster and I had what seemed to be a play on a wedge salad with romaine lettuce instead of iceberg. The bacon and blue cheese with tomatoes was delicious, although they seemed to over salt, the tomatoes were salted when they didnt really need to be with the bacon. I still at the entire thing.

For our mains, I had the special, which was albacore tuna with green beans and tomatoes and my boyfriend had the truffle burger and fries.   Mine was very light and the mixture of the beans and the tomatoes and the tuna was delicious! We also split an order of the creamed spinach and that was absolutely to die for!!! It was SOOO good! I didn't taste my boyfriends, but he said it was only OK, not worth the $27! His fries were very good, I thought ;) Once again we were both too full for dessert! 

The drinks were very fun here! We saw another table down order the absinthe and the waitress brought out two glasses with the absinthe in it and a sugar cube balanced over the top of the glass and a huge water carafe, which melted the sugar into the absinthe! I have never seen anything like this before! I definitely looked cool. I stuck with the prosecco and white wine, but my boyfriend had the GBL to start with, which was Tanqueray Gin and English Fever-Tree Bitter Lemon, it looked tasty I didnt try it and then he had a Gin Martini, which was excellent. 

If you 're looking for a fun place out, stepping back to the 50's and 60's Mad Men Style, then definitely try this place out! It was a very fun experience.
author: Kori E.

description: I went to Bix for my 21st Birthday with my family the other day, and it was perfect! I was nervous it wouldn't be the fancy restaurant i wanted, or it would be really fancy and then i would hate all the food. But like i said it was an amazing time, live music, great food and service! It is a little hard to find as it's entrance is hidden in a very narrow alley, but once you do find it it's a GEM!! We were all talking about how it reminded us of some speak-easy lounge/ restaurants we'd been to in NYC! Will definitely be back.
author: Alex H.

description:
Went here last Saturday night on a double date with my best friend and her husband. It was fun to get dressed up and take a car over from the Fairmont. The vibe and the ambiance had an old fashioned New York or Chicago feel. We were seated in a corner booth and promptly ordered a round of vodka martinis. My friend suggested we just order a bunch of appetizers to share. She was raving about the Pillow potatoes with creme fraiche and caviar, and after popping one in my mouth, I could see why! Here's what our group ordered:

Sweet onion and truffled cheese croques - good, but didn't blow me away

Dungeness crab rolls in brioche with lemon aioli - tasty, but not my fave

Roasted brussels sprouts with lemon & olive oil - great flavor, but a bit over-charred

Pillow potatoes with creme fraiche and caviar - out of this world. MORE, please!

Salmon tartare on rye toasts with fresh dill and creme fraiche - absolutely delicious! Fresh, buttery and the dill was the cherry on top. 

Mini lamb burgers with cucumber, dill and harissa -  these puppies STOLE THE SHOW! Incredibly flavorful, I wished they made a regular sized burger!  

My boyfriend was still hungry so he ordered the Trout entree, which was good, but I couldn't get over the lamb burgers! The pillow potatoes and salmon tartare came in a close second. YUM!

Unfortunately we left just as the live jazz music was starting, which would have made our experience complete. Highly recommended; great date place.
author: J T.

description: Dark and loud with good cocktails. If you're looking for old money - you are probably not alone. Great live jazz! And try the cosmo.
author: Linn L.

description: I've eaten at Bix about 4 - 5 times with my husband.  We went there last Saturday to celebrate his birthday.  He had the salmon tartar and the grilled shrimp and I had the ceviche and Kobe steak.  His meal was great but mine was perfection.  We were still raving about it a week later.  I also had a ginger gimlet which was great.  Nothing about the dessert menu caught my eye so I didn't want to risk the let-down after such a stellar meal.  The service is also terrific - but with food that good - that's really  just the icing on the cake.
author: Madhuri K.

description:
I loved the venue, the live music (piano and jazz), style, and table set up. The food was great too. We split the appetizer tasting ($12/person for 4 of their main appetizers) and got the truffle burger (SO GOOD). 

One bad thing was we found a bug in our beer...at least they didn't charge us for it.
author: Tif L.

description: If I had a restaurant, mine would look  like this one - classic, simple, warm but not over crowded.  I love the old-fashioned SF style of shaking martinis tableside - it is a nice touch.  I would say that everything was great; service and food, but the food was moderately over-salted (mostly older customers).  I would also like to note the tastey little surprises - like with the duck - there was duck sausage stuffed morels - OMG, delic!
author: Jenn D.

description:
This used to be one of my favorite restaurants in the City.  However, the last time I was there the food was mediocre for a pricey upscale place.  On the positive side, the service was impeccable and the atmosphere was awesome.  I definitely like it that you walk down the alley to get into this restaurant.  For those that like eclectic decor this is a place to see.

The previous time I was here with friends we shared our food as we tried the foie gras, marrow, oysters, and truffle fries.  Our main dish was also great.  However, this last time we tried the oysters were not as great and the entrees were not spectacular.  However, the salad was probably the best part of the meal.  Perhaps it was a chef off night.
author: Patrick Y.

description: We had oysters, appetizers and cocktails at the bar and the service and food were top notch.  We stopped in on a busy Friday night without a reservation and the host was gracious and accommodating.  He checked on us twice while we waited, offered us drinks, and then ordered them for us since the bar was crowded.  Later, he waved us over when 2 seats opened at the bar.. all on a busy night to 2 walk-ins off the street.  I will be back soon!  GREAT oysters, too!
author: Katherine C.

description:
I cannot say anything remotely negative about our recent dining experience at Bix... Well, maybe the dent in our wallet, though definitely worth it!!!

SERVICE - We arrived early and sat at the bar, then were sat when our table was ready (early, score!).  We got the table we requested (upstairs) and our server, Douglas, was amazing.  He gave us amazing recommendations, provided great conversation, and was attentive to our needs (especially in refilling the vino).

MUSIC/AMBIANCE - We thoroughly enjoyed the music and vibe of this place.  And my husband is a musician, so he's particular about live music.  Everyone is well dressed and 

THE FOOD & DRINKS - We had previously planned on getting the beef tartare and lobster spaghetti pre-arrival.  Our server recommended the deviled eggs, which I was already eyeing the hesitated since it is a fancy restaurant, and the pork chops in addition to confirming our thoughts on checking out the other app & entree.  He also reccomended the DuBol Pinot Noir to match our entrees... Boy were we pleased w/his recommendations! ALL of them were delicious.  The deviled eggs had this truffle excellence, the beef tartare was scraped off our plate, the lobster spag AMAZING, the pork chops juicy (wtih some flavor on top my husband loved!), and the pinot paired perfectly.  Before the meal, we enjoyed a couple of cocktails and to top off the meal,  we enjoyed the bananas foster with a couple of dessert drinks, a 20-year tawny port and one my husband got that I forgot which one now. :P  I think the only complaint was the size of the cocktails pre-dining; otherwise, all the drinks were also awesome.

LOCATION:  Be aware that the restaurant's entrance is in an alley (speakeasy style) and could be hard to find.  Luckily, our cab driver knew the way.

I'd say prepare for this dining experience by getting dolled up, having the big money prepared to be spent, and ensuring you get the right directions (or have the address for the cab) ... then have an amazing evening!
author: Jennifer M.

description: Great service, delicious food & drink as well as a really lovely atmosphere. The location is really fun if you're bringing someone new to the city to dinner. Always ask about the specials & save room for desert.
author: Melissa O.

description: We went to Bix in early March on a Saturday night.  You must, must, must have reservations.  This place was well worth every effort it took to get there.   They have valet parking for $10 - I recommend using valet, because parking in the area is rough.   When we walked in, I was really impressed with the service and atmosphere.  I loved the old speakeasy feel of it.  I loved the old school bar.  I loved the jazz feel and art.  The food was exquisite.  We had the oysters as an appetizer - they were fantastic.  My better half had the lobster spaghetti - I received a good report.  I had the swordfish with Roasted Sunchokes, Baby Chard and Charred Blood Orange Vinaigrette - It was amazing!!!!  Nothing could have prepared me for the fabulousness of the Warm Chocolate Brioche Bread Pudding - It blew me away.  I regret sharing it with my man.  The pianist was a perfect touch, and the service was A+.  One of my top three of all time anywhere.
author: Maggie B.

description:
Capitol P Perfect! My girlfriend and myself have been to a "fancy" and expensive restaurants. Bix takes the prize of having the BEST dining experience. 

We got there and we had to enter through a back alley, which we thought was pretty cool. Upon entering its obvious that this place has a nice speak easy vibe to it. Did I mention they had a Jazz pianist playing!

While they only had a few cocktails on the menu the alcohol selection was huge so they could make you pretty much anything and it will be delicious! My girlfriend wanted a sweeter drink and our waiter gave her 3 options of their cocktails that could be sweetened.

The waiter staff was extremely attentive and knowledgeable. We received some kind of crab cake on the house to "awaken" our pallets and it was extremely tasty. I ordered the lobster spaghetti and my girlfriend ordered the salmon and they were to die for! For dessert our waiter recommended the sticky date pudding and it was divine, my girlfriend was debating between the sorbet and the sugar cookies and someone must have overheard us because a waiter came out and gave us little sorbets on the house!

I can't say enough how much we enjoyed our time at Bix! The next time at we are in SF Bix will be one the first places we visit. Highly recommend this place
author: Eric M.

description:
birthday dinner #1

made reservations a wk or so before and requested to be seated upstairs.. the upstairs booth had the perfect view of the band downstairs

appetizers:
-potato pillows w creme fraiche and american caviar: perfect one biters
-marrow bones: order as soon as you sit down bc it takes some time
-deviled eggs w truffles: deviled eggs are good but the addition of truffles made it better
-steak tartare: good as well

entrees:
-lobster spaghetti w cherry tomatoes, jalapenos, basil: had the small size and this was already too much for me to finish after all the appetizers
-wild pacific salmon w erbette chard, fingerlings, onion sauce: had a bite and was good
-chicken hash w mascarpone and tomato sauce: i liked this too

dessert: 
as much as i wanted dessert, i was way too full to enjoy a full dessert so they were kind enough to bring out complimentary strawberry and merlot sorbet with a candle  

side notes:
-located in a alley so it's a blink and miss st
-parking can be hard to find but there's $10 valet
-can be a bit loud to make conversation bc of the live band but they were good

i'd come back soon! =)
author: Raquel T.

description: Solid but expensive. Great atmosphere with live piano and singer. Journey through the alley way helps with the juke joint feel.
author: RadicalNewTherapy M.

description: I've only eaten here once, but the chef that works there now is the chef that I used to work for. He is extremely talented and has a wide knowledge of Italian and Japanese cuisine. I really enjoyed everything he sent us, well executed and thought out.The appetizers were so fun and delicious, went well with our cocktails. If you haven't tried this place out its definitely worth your time to try.
author: Carrie P.

description:
Damn.  I walked in & fell in love.  This was the spot.  The band, decor, atmosphere.  Magical.  I was very excited for dinner.

Dinner, unfortunately was unmemorable.

Ginger Gimlet - delicious
Manhattan - weak
Dinner rolls - something the convalescent cafeteria would serve
Potato pillows - mediocre caviar, glorified tater tots
Foie Gras w/fig - lightly toasted wonderbread that tore, not holding up to the density of the chilled foie gras.  lacked flavor & decadence.
Bone Marrow - mostly fat. lacking savory richness. served with crostinis.
Black Truffle cheeseburger + fries.  Disappointingly, the fries were the most flavorful item tasted - seasoned well, texture perfect. Cheeseburger was only decent.  At a minimum I would expect a "just decent" burger at a restaurant like this.  Cooked medium rare.  Even with the truffle, the meat lacked seasoning.  

*I prefer Absinthe's knock-out burger.  Hands down.
*The most amazing foie gras is at Bushi-Tei on Post.

5 stars for the service - they were on point, thoughtful, accommodating.

Overall, the meal ingredients tasted fresh but every single dish lacked savory taste & seasoning.
author: FancyPant S.

description: Went to the restaurant 2 nights ago and had a delicious meal. The service was very good, however the blond hostess is HORRIBLE! Almost made us give Bix 3 stars, but why punish the other employees for a woman who clearly should not be employed in the service industry. Same rudeness on the way in the restaurant and on the way out.
author: Patrick S.

description:
Great ambiance! Was here for 7x7 but decided to go with the chicken hash instead. So far, I've been in love with Ella's chicken hash but Bix's wasn't bad... They have a good wine selection too. I want to go back for the live music performance. Man, isn't that baby grand piano looks a bit lonely without anyone playing it?!

ps: You can easily miss the place since it's located in a small alley
author: Cliff T.

description:
Bix is great! It has a refined elegance about it that makes YOU feel refined just for being there.  It definitely has that nostalgic 30's 40's feel to it not only because of the decor and the attire of the staff but because of their etiquette.  The decor is just beautiful, the lighting is dim yet just bright enough to allow you to soak in the great detail that surround you. 

I was there on a Saturday night so there was a Jazz trio which was great, the bar was packed and it was a lively yet sophisticated crowd.   Bix isn't just a place or a restaurant to go to because it has great reviews, it's an experience, a feeling which makes you feel like you have escaped the city and for a moment it's you whomever you are with and Bix
author: Oscar O.

description:
I always want to make friends with places, I yearn to love and to be loved, last few places I have been though have been underwhelming, not bad exactly but either trying to hard or not hard enough, too much make up not enough, leading to a bit of enuii about eating out.
Especially since unlike the rest of you I dont plan ahead and so can never get into the 'hot places' unless I want dinner at 5 or midnight.
Anyway the mrs and I had a no kid evening last night, obviously I couldnt get into Range, Nopa, RichTable etc - Bix has tables though and at 8, even though it gets pretty glowing reviews - you cant help thinking someting must be terribly terribly wrong, awful trourist trap Taditch style hell hole
Its was with a sense of grim forboding that we stalked in about half an hour early - just in case it looked and smelt like a charnel house and we could head home for takeaway and the walking dead.
Anyway turns out its quite quite splendid.  The bar is genuinely beautiful, the space is perfectly lit, there isnt a duff table in the house.  The cocktails were precisely mixed, the menu is really really well considered - full of non show offy deliciousness.
In truth the starters were a bit better than the mains but I was still pretty happy with my table side mixed steak tartarre - nice touch that
The wine list was pretty good, not generously priced but not a mugging either.  The hostess was charm itself and sat us straight away and the waiter was a cracking professional - doing good work for the restaurant and the guests - which is a pretty rare balance.
I havent given any 5s yet but this was v v close
x
author: Max A.

description:
My girlfriends took me here for a birthday I was trying to ignore.  Yes, that one.  It had been a restaurant I had wanted to try for years but somehow hadn't gone to.  Big Mistake.  Huge.  I mean it was a huge mistake to have wasted so much time not eating BIX's amazing food.

The ONLY reason this is not a 5 star review is that we had to wait 45 minutes for our reservation and that they took over an hour to bring our food after we had ordered it.  This was made up for by many free dishes including the AMAZING Potato Pillows and Truffle Fries.  YUM!

Here is what I had and I daresay I got the best meal which was appropriate because it was my birthday and all =)

Potato Pillows
Truffle Fries
Tuna Tartare 
Tomatoe Cart - aka caprese salad
Cerviche
Melon Sorbet

The restaurant is beautiful (the music is a bit loud though and we were glad we were upstairs instead of down near the live music), the bathrooms are really pretty, the food is DIVINE and the service pretty great as well!  I will absolutely be requesting this for my next birthday meal and I am NOT a creature of habit so that is quite the recommendation!

Bon Appetit!
author: Julie H.

description:
I've been coming here for years. Bruce (senior) bartender makes one hell of a martini. Perfect chill, perfect amount of dirty (if you prefer). I'm hooked on the truffle fries and potato pillows. I've had the steak. Which I think if your going out for steak. Your an idiot. You can cook them the same at home for far less. But needless to say its good. Their salads are awesome. I love the wine list. 
If the setting and location of this place alone doesn't win you over. I'm not sure what will. But it really is like a speak easy/gentleman's kinda place. With jazz playing (at a reasonable volume). It's a nice place.
author: Deejay K.

description:
Totally mediocre and did not live up to the hype.

Menu is absolutely ridiculously pretentious.  Who eats marrow bones?  

Service was VERY snotty.  I said to the bartender, "I've heard you have great champagne cocktails".  He shrugged and said "it's a champagne cocktail".  No suggestions for something else. What was i to do with that?

Waiter was noticably impatient.  Did not want to answer questions.

My table ordered a mess of appetizers to start with.  One was a potato creation that tasted like a McDonald's hashbrown - greasy with tasteless caviar on top.  Deviled eggs that were warm.  Get the picture?

Heirloom tomato salad - WONDERFUL.  Worth dealing with the snot staff and crap menu just to have that!

Had 4 bites of my $44 steak.  It was fine but odd with a citrus butter.  Waiter cleared without asking if there was a reason I left 10 oz of my NY strip behind.

Restaurant is down an alley.  Make sure they call you a cab if you want a hope of getting home.

I won't return.
author: Alexandra D.

description:
The big neon sign in the alley will let you know that you have found this 1930's prohibition speakeasy establishment. Dark with live piano jazz, this swanky restaurant has excellent service and food. We had:
Drinks:  bix manhattan and belini. Both are tip notch especially the manhattan. 

Ceviche- light and excellent. 
Lobster rolls in brioche- even better with rich flavor yet balanced. 
Creamy spinach- rich and zesty. Better than most. 
Entrees:
Spaghetti Lobster- signature dish. $40 but well worth it. Rich, heavy and a must-have. 

Bix Cheeseburger-open faced with a caramelized onion over a truffle infused ground beef. Decadent and another signature dish. 

Dessert was the semifreddo. Think of custard with a creme brûlée top. Excellent. 

Great for power lunches, dates and late night cocktails. Valet service is a plus too!
author: Moses G.

description: This place is cool, but not pretentious. The food was great. Really good wine list. Great service. Definitely give it a try.
author: Steve T.

description: Great place for drinks and dinner.  Offers a great location and top shelf drinks and mixers.  Got a kick out the band!
author: Joe Frazzano- Frazzano Team ..

description:
Pricey but worth it.  If I had money to blow, I'd probably come back here quick.  Got the steak tartare, which seemed scary with the raw meat and raw egg but was delicious.  The black cod practically melted in your mouth.  Also got the steak, which was good but not altogether memorable.

For cocktails we tried the Perfect Pear (vodka with pear puree), Ginger Gimlet (gin), and Huckleberry Fizz (huckleberry juice with gin).  All delicious.

And enjoy the clown paintings.
author: Ken L.

description:
At the time of this post 885 reviews, 4 stars.
Enough said.
The cut above: Live Jazz band, great bar, great decor, and if you're lucky it's "dine about town week". This place has the distinguished honor of "my favorite restaurant in the city"......for now. 
It's a great date spot, deep in alley, phenomenal live jazz band, great food, and cozy atmosphere. If I were single, I'd take my ladies here.
author: Bob Y.

description:
Bix has a speakeasy atmosphere, it's uber-classy.  The entrance is located in an alley and it's hard to find, which adds to the mystique.  All the waiters & bartenders are dressed in 1920s waiter clothing.  

I got the Seared Ahi with Peas & Truffled Leeks & Chanterelle Mushrooms (that's just one dish).  It was truly the most AMAZING thing I've ever eaten in San Francisco.  The mushrooms were meaty, spicy, and salty; the peas & leeks were buttery & sweet.  Together they complemented the seared ahi very well.  

My colleagues ordered the cocktails, which apparently have rave reviews.  The waiter shakes the cocktail & serves it at your table (it's not pre-made).  The cocktails are quite small (about the size of one shot) and are ~$10-15.  

I give this place a solid 4 stars.  I took off 1/2 star because it's very expensive (my meal came to ~$45 overall, just for the one entree).  I took off another 1/2 star because it's really hard to find, which is tough if you are driving there and are not familiar with SF (like me).  

It was very crowded, even though I went on a weeknight (Thursday).  I strongly recommend making reservations in advance.
author: Bee M.

description:
Went here to celebrate my girlfriends birthday, had to wait 40min for our table even though we had reservations.

Really liked the place, food was great, so was dessert, so definitely a great place for a special evening.

For a student it's more on the pricy side, but I've encountered worse!
author: Martie K.

description: The manager (mid 30's, wore glasses) of this restaurant has horrible manners.  He was incredibly rude to me and my friends.  I would never go back just because of him and his horrible demeanor.  We had reservations at 9:00 pm and after me inquiring of the status and him telling me another table was more important we were finally seated at 9:45.  The food is expensive and is just average in taste and small portions.  The only nice thing I can say is the hostess and our waiter were nice.  But that is it.  If you want to waste your money here go ahead and see for yourself, but just to warn you someone else may be more important.
author: Elizabeth H.

description:
This USE TO BE one of our go-to restaurants for birthdays, anniversaries, people visiting out of town, until today.  My wife and I have eaten here at least 5 times over the past few years.  I would have reviewed the whole experience a 5/5 in the past.  There have been some big changes in their food.

Their lobster pasta USE TO BE 5 stars, but is now a 2, if that.  The pasta in the past was al-dente, just the right amount of light cream/butter sauce, cherry tomatoes, and a good portion of sweet lobster (5-7 chunks).  The dish WAS memorable and desirable!

NOW their pasta was stuck together in a clump in my dish, the sauce lacked light cream/butter sauce that went so well with the lobster, they added about 70% more halved cherry tomatoes, and decreased the crab to 3 small flaked off pieces.  The flavor and balance was way off.

The four of us that dined all ordered the lobster and made a negative comment in the change.  We were all disappointed.  I hope BIX takes this review to heart.  It is honest and true.  

We asked the very nice waitress if they changed the recipe and she said they have a new chef that made it lighter and made some adjustments.  Unfortunately for the worse.  BIX should call the Lobster pasta a different name on the menu, since it is no longer what it was.

PS bring back the lamb sliders!  

If I weren't with my in-laws I would have sent back me and my wife's dishes.  Bix please announce when you bring back a better chef, as I will not be dining with you until then.
author: Elio P.

description:
Cute, tucked away little restaurant. I honestly can't remember what we ate but I know it was all good! We ordered several appetizers to share, and the waitress was very helpful in determining what would go well together and then bringing them out accordingly. We ate every last bite of everything.

The restaurant is really beautiful and would be great for a date night. My fiance and I sat tucked into a corner table and had I had a great view of the singer, whose voice was lovely.
author: Courtney W.

description:
Both good and bad with my first visit to Bix.

Love the location off the beaten path, and the space is beautiful.  A nice bar upon entering on the right, as well as music on the lower level.  The tables on the second level add a bit of mystic and romance to the experience.  The room reminds me of a Cotton Club era resto/club, and I like that!

Unfortunately, the food let me and my taste buds down.  We ordered the truffle fries, lamb sliders, steak tartare, foie gras, pork chops, Bix burger with bacon, and chicken hash.  For dessert, the chocolate bread pudding.

Of those dishes, the only one I would excitedly order again is the chicken hash.  It was marvelous, a 5 star dish.  The others, not so much worthy of mentioning.

The beautiful room and ambiance set up  a 4 or 5 star caliber expectation, however the food delivered only a 2 or 3 star performance.
author: David D.

description:
I ate here, but really cant remember what I ate.  Oh yea, the bone marrow.  The bread that came with the bone marrow tore the skin in the upper part of my mouth.  Trust me, that didn't stop me from finishing it...... I'm back, had to check the menu to see what  I ate.. I had the lobster spaghetti.  it was my first time having lobster spaghetti and it was pretty good.  very flavorful and delicious.  This place is pretty dark, had to wait for my eyes to adjust then i noticed how beautiful my date/wifey is.   
The only reason I gave it 3 stars, nothing really made my mouth go hmmmmmm.  you know? the same sound you make when you smell bacon.
author: Reese D.

description: Amazing food and service. The oysters and deviled eggs are ungodly and Peter was a fantastic bartender. Yummmm :-)
author: Lisa A.

description:
Hubby and I recently had a double-date at Bix .The food was excellent... the service was second to nothing... but at those prices, we will have to find some way of taking out a second mortgage before returning.

I loved our server for his candor. I asked about the sturgeon and his response was that it was a fish 'without much flavor'. Still, it didn't disappoint because it took on the flavor of the cedar plank upon which it was cooked.

Tuna tartare: The sliced bird's eye chilli peppers added a zing to each bite. delicious.

Our friends ordered the lobster pasta and crab cakes... oohs and ahhs all around from them.

Loved that the jazz singer was low-key. Her music was an accessory to the dinner, rather than the star of the show... perfect.

During the night, the poor man in the table next to us passed out cold on the floor and then proceeded to spew his dinner on the floor. We were impressed with how quickly and quietly this was managed by the staff. They moved with such ease and professionalism -- I'd be surprised if anyone else in the restaurant caught what had happened. We did only because they were in the table next to us. An extra star for that level of service!
author: Corrinne L.

description: We went for a special occasion last night and for 4 people spent almost $600. We were still finishing dessert when the manager/ maitre d' informed us that he needed us to leave since he needed the table for other customers. He did this to other tables around us as well, in my opinion diners should not be rushed because of a restaurant's poor planning. The manager was extremely rude and unprofessional. We will never return.
author: Marilyn S.

description: Went here for a romantic Valentine's date. Great atmosphere and service. The boyfriend and I shared the potato pillow and bone marrow appetizer. The potato pillows were nothing special but the bone marrow was delish! Only complaint was that its a really small portion. I had the duck breast, which was really moist and savory. It tasted and felt like a rare steak. Highly recommend! The boyfriend had the pork chop and he really liked the citrus, salty, and sweet combination. Great place for a date!
author: Stefanie K.

description: Have not been here in a long time.  Place is still classic San Fran but it feels less local.  In it's hey day, it was the place to gather and be merry.  What a scene it was back then...when the alley was even fill with partygoers!  The food prices have really gone up as starters range from high teens to mid twenties and portions were small.  The mains are high 30's and the special veal loin was overlooked substantially.   Service was excellent as they can read the table and make everyone not too worried about the food.  The hot rolls remain a favorite as something still remain part of the fond memories.
author: Gregory C.

description:
BIX remains my favorite overall restaurant in SF. Love the ambiance, the service - in general (read on) and the burger (best burger in SF!). Over the years, BIX has been our choice for numerous celebrations, and we could think of no better place to celebrate our recent engagement. We even took some engagement pics in the alley!

However, I do have one key complaint to call out this time around - and it pains me to do so, given everything I love about this place. The manager definitely put a damper to the evening with a super rude comment when friends of ours (who incidentally had sent champagne to our table, unbeknownst to us) stopped by our table to wish us congratulations and goodbye.

Our server AJ was awesome and did his part to make things right. I have to say, though, the manager's rudeness has made me question whether the otherwise typically classy BIX will be the venue of choice for our next celebration.
author: Carolyn C.

description:
I selected Bix as my work holiday/end of year lunch location. I waited a bit long due to scheduling issues to make a reservation for our small staff of six, but I was pleasantly surprised when I called and they said they could accommodate us. I had tried open table, but it was a no go. Desperate, I called the restaurant and heard the glorious word... YES!

I had wanted to go here before but had not had the chance. I read the reviews here and wonder, was I at the same restaurant I was just at? I have nothing but good things to say about Bix. The service was great and this was even during the lunch rush. THE Food was absolutely spectacular. I even had desert and that too was to die for. 

I had the following:

Steak Tartare with Angus Beef - Shallots, Capers, Parsley and Mustard (prepared tableside) 13.95 
   - - I had this minus the shallots due to a food allergy, but it was the tasty dish ever. Some folks aren't into the rawness of it all, but there is no other way to have this dish! I absolutely recommend it hands down. 

Local Sword Fish Paillard with Baby Fava Leaves
Roasted Potatoes and Lemon-Caper Butter Sauce 22.95
   - - I wasn't too sure about this dish, but when it arrived and I started eating it... each bite was heavenly. You need to get a bit of all of the ingredients on the plate to get the fabulous flavors come out with each bite. 

Milk Chocolate Semifreddo
with Citrus Salad & New Olive Oil 9.25
   - - This combination of blood oranges with the ice cream and chocolate is a burst of deliciousness that must be had by all! I think after seeing the selection of desserts my colleagues order, that mine was the best of all! 

Barbera, 2009, Renato Ratti, Torriglione
Piemonte, Italy 12.00
    - - I am a fan of Barbera and this glass did not disappoint. It has full flavor, bold with a hint of spices that complimented my meal.  

The decor is something straight of of a 1930 era film. I was expecting to see some of the greats from the silver screen walk on by. This is a loud place, so do not go if you are seeking a romantic setting. Unless your idea of romantic is a loud backdrop, then I guess you are ok. I have no issue with the noise level, it is just lively so if you are ok with that during a meal.. you are good to go. 

I will definitely return for dinner to make sure I was not dreaming about the deliciousness I encountered while here.
author: Amelia M.

description:
I made a reservation for 4 people at 7:30 p.m. We arrived early and waited at the bar. 30 minutes had passed, and our table still wasn't ready. The hostess at the front, and the manager personally apologized to us many times for the delay. The manager even gave us complimentary appetizers to tide us over while we waited. This is incredibly generous and so appreciated! The appetizers were delightful, and I really felt that he was giving us genuine samplers. Not just leftovers or reject appetizers. 

The food was fine. Portions typical to an upscale restaurant. The ambiance was nice - some kind of retro feel. We were definitely the youngest folks in the entire restaurant, but that's okay. The staff made us feel welcome. 

Oh and the specialty cocktails were delicious and strong! Yes!
author: T L.

description:
Host: 5
Food: 5
Ambiance: 5
Service: 3

I went to Bix last week with some colleagues from the city and from NY and we were really impressed by the restaurant. The decor reminds me of something you'd find in NY with the dark wood, multi-floor layout, large, tall bar and mural. The food was also outstanding. We tried a bunch of appetizers: deviled eggs, crab rolls, potato pillows and the tableside made heirloom tomatoes with homemade mozzarella. We all enjoyed a variety of entrees: lobster spaghetti (YUM), chicken hash and pork...then it was on to dessert. We ordered cheese plates, wine and a bread pudding. All were fantastic.
The one downfall we experienced was our server. She seemed to find my friend invisible. Strike #1: When my friend ordered an appetizer (the deviled eggs) they never came. When we reminded our server, she claimed she didn't hear the order -- which was surprising since it was the first thing we asked for. It finally came after our entrees. Strike #2: Again, my friend was first to order dessert - - the bread pudding and a coffee. The coffee came, but no bread pudding. It was about 20 minutes before our server came and checked in on us again until we were able to ask her about it. Again, she hadn't heard my friend other than the coffee order. Strike #3: We asked for our check, she ran it on our credit card. When we went to figure out the tip, we were re-reviewing the itemized bill only to find out it was not ours. Clearly - - she lacks some major attention to detail.
The service won't stop me from going again, but if I were to sit in this servers area I would certainly ask to be reseated. Everything else is fantastic.
author: Anne-Marie S.

description:
Bix is as overrated as it gets in SF.  That said, I can see the appeal from a tourist's perspective: the alley, the bar scene, the piano  

The food isn't bad, but it just isn't very good.  The service is mediocre too.  Everything is just average, but the prices rival the best spots in town.  The atmosphere and room are pretty neat, although it gets quite loud and is hard to have a conversation with more than one or two people.

I don't make reservations here but rather get dragged by people who don't know any better (usually not from SF) and think Bix is a great, hidden jewel.  (But it isn't!)

They clean up with tourists and business conventions in town, but there are much better places in SF than Bix.
author: LA Kings L.

description: I love Bix!  I've been coming here for years:  great food, great service, great location.  I brought clients here last night and the service and the food was perfect.
author: Oliver B.

description:
The restaurant is tucked away in an alley, walking distance to north beach, the financial district and chinatown. As you walk in, it opens up to a glamorous two level 1930s décor. To the right is a full bar with bottles and glasses on the shelves that sparkles like shining crystals. The place is chic, intimate with tall ceilings and soft cozy lightings throughout. Candles are lid on every table covered with white tablecloth. In the middle of the room is a baby grand piano. Large pictures on the wall that feature the days of Cunard. 

They offer valet parking even a coat check. This is definitely one of my favorite place for a romantic dress-up dinner outing.

They have impeccable service and attentive. They have a great wine selection and a great dessert menu. The food never failed, it is always delicious and prepared well.

We are returning again very soon.
author: Jeannie C.

description:
I actually can't believe that I haven't written a review for Bix before!  It is my absoulte favorite restaurant.

I first came to this restaurant with my then boyfriend because his brother had found it online and gotten him a gift certificate for Christmas.  We were hooked right away.  The atmosphere is 1920's speak-easy, and there is usually a jazz combo playing on the weekends.  We had the house mozzarella with prosciutto (which we always start with) and the firecracker shrimp (sadly, this was not on the menu that last time we went).  We each had a dinner special, and then had my favorite dessert, Bananas Foster.

We have been back many times, mostly for special occasions.  On March 13, 2009, that same brother proposed to his girlfriend in Ohio and flew out to spend a romantic weekend in wine-country, but stopped to have dinner with us that same day he proposed.  Of course, we took them to Bix!

On April 2, 2010, my boyfriend took me here the night before we were leaving for a trip to New York he had given me for my birthday.  Little did I know, that Bix was going to become an even more special place.  After ordering, we started talking, and before I knew it, he was on one knee, asking me to be his wife!

He had actually walked into Bix the day he bought the ring and made a reservation for "our table", and told the restaurant what was going on.  They brought us Champagne and the jazz combo played us a song.  It was magical.

Bix better stay open forever so that we can always come back on our future anniversaries!
author: Ashley K.

description:
I so loved this place but its kinda lost its 4 star rating for me.  Still has a cool feel to it, but you know they should spruce it up a bit, been the same look and feel for a LONG time.

Lets see, the menu is the same old, the steak was good but not much jumped out for us.  

the +++++ is the bar, very old school, they have bartenders not mixologists, they know how to make a good drink, the martini's at this place are among the best in the City.

So go here for the bar, enjoy the old school feel and have yourself a neat martini.

Drink Up
author: G R.

description:
Sandra and I went  about 3 years ago when I was trying to get her to be my lady friend and I took her there to knock the socks off her t's and it did. Fast forward 3 years and we went for Valentine's Day. We had the worlds GREATEST waiter, Stew. This guy is straight out of the Great Gatsby folks. 

What makes this restaurant so amazing is that it was almost exactly the same as it was when we went 3 years ago. I know, I know some of you have a difficult time with things staying the same and I get that. But, when you have a great thing, don't change it. 

We walk in and the Maitre d' greets us (same dude as last time) tells us to sit tight and our table will be ready in two shakes of a lambs tail. He didn't really say that but I always have Pulp Fiction on the brain. Stew comes over to order our drinks and I tell him no adult beverages for this cowboy. He comes back with Sandra's martini (filthy, extra olives of course) and tells me they have a non alcoholic beverage that I might like, so he brings it out. Ginger syrup and cranberry or something and it was much nicer than just having water. We ordered oysters, Kushi's, our favorite, they were very sweet and have such an ultra clean flavor, shrimp with chili aioli. Shrimp were perfectly cooked AND Stew brings out some truffled croques (on the arm which is always great) that  were "not your momma's grilled cheese sandwich" as Stew warned us. They are made with this amazing cheese from Italy that is laced with white truffles. Truly amazing little suckers. I had the new york steak, bloody (another shameless Pulp Fiction reference) and Sandra had the day scallops. The steak was cooked properly and topped with a smoked paprika hotel butter, a bit too much of it b/c it started to make the dish a bit too greasy for my taste and the scallops were gushing with flavor. Toward the end of our meal Stew comes walking over, wine glass in hand and swooshes it around a few times before he sets it in front of me. Pinot grape juice from the Nevaro winery which was to die for or maybe even kill for!! Such an amazing flavor and another great  gesture. 

Superb service, quality food, wonderful music and just an all around great experience makes this one of my favorite restaurants in the city. It's a bit pricey but well worth it.
author: Hector G.

description: My boyfriend and I planned a trip for the 4th of July in San Francisco and wanted to go out for a fancy, romantic dinner in the city. Read yelp reviews and was excited to try Bix. The manager greeted us immediately and was great, took us to our seat which was right by the door to the kitchen but was still romantic. The decor was dark and contemporary which was great. Started with champagne and wanted to take the night slow and try lots of different dishes. Our server lacked enthusiasm and interest in is right away, and was visibly put off that we were taking our time. It wasn't until we hit the $400 mark that he started to pay attention to us, and even then the service was subpar. The food was great and perfect sizes. Couldn't give this review more than 3 stars As both my boyfriend and I have worked in the service industry and know how much the server dictates the evening. Would highly recommend and hope you get an energetic, non pretentious server to deliver a 5 star experience!
author: Sarah W.

description: Quaint alley entrance, nice open feel to the restaurant with live entertainment when we went on a Wednesday night.  Excellent food, creative selections to choose from.  Good for romantic night out or business dinner as there are a variety of different kinds of tables on the two levels to choose from.
author: Frank L.

description:
BIX is a classy restaurant hidden in an alley in SF financial district (right?). ..if you like live jazz (not exactly a full band but a pianist and bass player when i was there...excellent music nevertheless), 1930/1940 vibe and good food then you got to check out Bix.

BTW get yourself one of those Michelin Red Book...they have spot on reviews of all the best dinning jewels in major cities like San Francisco
author: Kevin P.

description: Solid cocktails, solid food, good atmosphere.  Been 2x now and was happy both times.  truffle deviled eggs and crab rolls are good appetizer choices.  and although there is some decent ambiance, you can also have a conversation, which is increasingly rare in SF restaurants as they are out of control loud.  on the cocktail front, very good rob roy, martini and manhattan, although they too seem to think that shaking is a sport not a necessary evil to chill the booze.
author: John B.

description:
This pains me to write as Bix has been terrific & special for years...but not now.

We went last night as a treat expecting the usual wonderful food an excellent service. Things started badly and went downhill.

The food: I'll stretch and give three and a half stars. The salmon tartare was good and the crab roll good, but nothing to write home about. I had the truffle burger which was excellent. My wife had the lobster pasta which was tired and bland. The prices are skyhigh, which if the food is fresh and inventive, is one thing. The menu is the same as fifteen years ago, and is obviously coasting on past glory. Someone does not have thier eye on the ball, here - At these prices I expect to be blown away.

The service ruined the night. The front of house people ignored us after we checked in for 40 minutes, although the place was barely half full. When we were finally seated, they gave us a table that was rickety. When we asked to simply move to the next table (empty, as was all of the upstairs), talk about attitude!

OK, we re-grouped, and wanted the night to be special. Not possible with our server. Again, it wasn't like the restaurant was busy, but this guy was pressing us to order entrees as he gave us menus. We felt like all he was interested in was moving us along. Once we ordered, food appeared in bullet fashion, the entrees coming before we were done with appetizers.

Not once did our server check if we had everything and if the meal was OK. We were abandoned. We had to get up and chase this guy down for water, side dishes, desert, and coffee. Not once but over and over.  This is just not OK in a premier SF resturant with a pedigree like Bix. Service should not be slapdash, indifferent, and sloppy. And with these prices, we felt like chumps - we'd been had.

Take a pass on Bix until and unless they re-group, and re-invent themselves. This is a place going through the motions and charging premier prices for ok food and an awful service experience.
author: Bill G.

description:
Have you ever watched the show "Best Thing I Ever Ate"... well Bix would be one of my top places. My boss suggested that I come here when I was in town and thank goodness he did:) We had the tuna tartare and devil eggs. I have dreams about them sexually (not really... where was I). It was a little expensive but really it was some of the best food I have ever had so I did not mind. Since I was traveling I was not wearing the most appropriate clothes but they were very accommodating. 

Any time we come back this is always a place on our list!
author: Katie C.

description: Love the ambiance at Bix!  It's like stepping back in time to 1920's.  The balcony seating overlooking the scenery below was romantic.  The food was so-so for the price.  I will definitely return to enjoy cocktails at the bar and soak in the atmosphere, but probably dine elsewhere.
author: S L.

description:
NOT impressed.

While I don't normally write negative reviews on Yelp, this one cannot be avoided. Our experience last night was something no one should have go through (let alone pay $200 for).

The food at Bix is good enough, but the service is severely lacking. I came here with my cousins to celebrate a mini bachelorette night out. My cousin arrived for our reservation while the rest of us were running a little late. The host (manager?) at the front approached my cousin and told her, "Did you know your party is running late? That is NOT Ok ." He proceeded to telephone the bride-to-be. Here's the jist of the conversation:

Host/Manager:  You're late for your reservation.
Bride-to-Be:  I'm really sorry, something came up.
Host/Manager: Don't be sorry to me. Be sorry to the business.

Wha?? Are you SERIOUS? Guy acted like he'd never dealt with a late reservation before. Not to mention, it was a TUESDAY NIGHT and the restaurant was HALF EMPTY. What an awful start to our special night out.

After we were seated, our server provided better service. The food was decent, but nothing to swoon over. Potato cakes and lamb burgers were good. Our lobster pasta was tasty, although the noodles themselves weren't anything special (tasted like supermarket spaghetti noodles). Out of everything we ordered, I liked the seared ahi tuna with mussels the best. Dessert was good, but not spectacular.

For a restaurant that has been in business this long and charges three Yelp dollar signs, they should really re-evaluate how they treat their customers. If we wanted poor service, we would have gone to a one-dollar-sign restaurant in Chinatown.

(-1 star for service + 3 stars for food = 2 stars)
author: Kel S.

description:
My husband and I came here twice on our 7 night honeymoon. The potato pillows are to die for.  Seriously, so good! We both had the beef bavette and short ribs tonight, delicious! You can't go wrong with bananas foster for dessert either. 

We sat at the bar both times and we absolutely loved it. Chad was awesome! He treated us superbly, both nights!  We definitely recommend it to anyone visiting the city!
author: Meredith M.

description:
Bix has two burgers on the menu but it's the Club Cheeseburger that 7x7 reviewed in their Top Ten Burgers list and it was what our triumvirate had as we continue down (err, up) their list...

So how did this burger fare?  Well, I almost couldn't put it down once I picked it up and it was literally good to the last bite.

The beef patty was extremely well-made - not packed too hard or too loose, and the meat was so tender and juicy.  Having ordered it medium rare, it came out just as expected.

Now this burger is not fancy, coming with a side of fries, and the usual partners in crime: pickles, lettuce and a couple tomato slices, but damn that beef is nice.

The poppy seed bun fits the burger perfectly physically as well as stylistically and as I mentioned before, eating the last few bites was just as satisfying as the first few, except for the fact that I knew it was the end.
