- MARROW BONES $11.75: This is a first for us as well, at least in ordering it at a fancy restaurant. I didn't really know what to expect but when it arrived it peaked my interests. I scooped out the marrow and put it on the bread and topped it off with some of the parsley/shallot salad. This, too, requires a more sophisticated person to judge it.. as trying it for the first time I can't say whether it was good or not. What I do know is that I would pass on it the next time around.
- KOBE BAVETTE ENTREE $34.95: My husband ordered this dish and was very satisfied with it. The kobe beef bavettes were flavorful and juicy, cooked to perfection at medium rare. The pommes puree it came with was good. I ate one of the roasted cipollini onions which was good with a slightly sweet taste. He was very happy with this dish and I agreed it was well cooked and flavored. 
- AHI TUNA WITH BLACK MUSSELS ENTREE $29.95: At this point in the meal, I was full. I had a glass of chardonnay waiting to accompany this dish and I could only enjoy both slowly before I would burst. The ahi tuna was tender and perfectly seared on the outside. The black mussels were a great accompaniment to the ahi tuna as well as the green olives and toasted bread pieces in the dish. I also enjoyed the butter beans and the syrah sauce of the dish. I ate it all even though I was full. It was packed with little goodies but nothing that was too filling to prevent me from finishing it. I would order this again.
- 1 2007 SILVERADO CHARDONNAY $10.00: Good pour on the BIX chardonnay. Went well with the ahi tuna dish.
- 3 ADDITIONAL HEINEKENS $18.00: Drank it straight from the bottle. Classy.
- BANANAS FOSTER $8.75: Cold vanilla bean ice cream with warm dark rum syrup and bananas poured on top. Perfect end to our dinner. Very sweet, but delightful. A must share! Thank you BIX for treating us to this on the house :) Very generous and unexpected!

TOTAL: $200 including tip.

Pricey but worth the experience and trip. We had encountered traffic upon entering the freeway, upon leaving the freeway, and upon entering the freeway again! On a SUNDAY evening! Yikes.. talk about bad luck with traffic.. but this experience made up for it.

Come hungry, leave happy.
author: C C.

description:
Since I don't work in the FiDi, I'd managed to miss this restaurant off the alley until last night.  I went with some friends who were throwing down corporate cards, so we got to do it up.  
Atmosphere...very nice.  The staff was pleasant, the Art Deco vibe is fun, and we spent half the meal trying to figure out if two booths over was Gavin Newsome or not (it wasn't, but it did look alot like him).  
Food...eh.  I mean nothing was bad per se, but I really just wasn't too impressed.  The crab roll apps-sorta bland.  Somehow they managed to take all the crab flavor out of the crab.  The wine list was good & we had a nice bottle of Hess.  My halibut was fine, but forgettable.  

So all in all I had a lot of fun, but I'd take the advice of where many of the reviews for Bix go on this one...come for a drink or two and enjoy a swanky bar experience.  For me, if I'm going to drop a little bit on dinner, there's more flavorful stuff out there.
author: Meaghan K.

description:
I will go ahead and pile it on some more....Bix is the best restaurant in San Francisco.  It's certainly my favorite.

The foot and service are outstanding, even if sometimes it is hard to get a table, but the thing that makes this place just awesome is the place itself.  It's an old speakeasy with the best looking bar in the city.  There is great art on the walls and the whole scene evokes the speakeasy scene during prohibition.

There is jazz at night and if you get a seat at the bar, they serve there, so you can have dinner even at the last minute (when  you cannot get a reservation).
author: Jason H.

description:
Decor:
Great feel to this place.  Walking down the alley, you get the feeling you are heading into a 1930's circa speakeasy.  Once inside the decor does not disappoint.

Service:
Good service both times I have dined here.  Knowledgeable and friendly staff.

Food:
The main reason anybody goes to a restaurant.  I though the food was good, but nothing to die for.  This is the main reason for the 4 stars, as this place is probably somewhere between 4 and 5, though I must save the 5's for that next tier of food.
author: Bill W.

description:
Best Valentine's Day Ever.

Our experience here was perfect (well, we had to wait for our table to open up, but I can't blame its previous inhabitants for lingering).

Not only was the experience great, but the food was divine.
author: Alyssa W.

description: Excellent decor and art to compliment excellent food.  Definitely try the heirloom tomato appetizer when it's in season, and the chicken hash regardless of the season.
author: James B.

description:
Very impressive. 

I havent had a dining experience this good in quite some time. We showed up with no reservation and got the last spot at the bar. Bradley the bartender (who was great)kept an eye out for better seats and snagged us two great ones. 

Food was excellent, had the tuna tartar, and lobster spaghetti for dinner. Pineapple upside down cake for desert.

Across the board this place was top notch. Having a server/bartender like Bradley made it all the better. I will without question be back soon.
author: Jeff W.

description: Would love to return and get something other than the burger, but if you have read any of my other reviews, you will have realized I go to most of these fancier restaurants to try their burgers. Anyway, went with the bacon burger and it was fantastic. Buddy of mine got the truffle burger which is served open-face. It was also fantastic. The rest of the menu looked great as well. Can't wait to go back.
author: Alfredo A.

description: I took my husband here for his birthday.  I have to admit, I wanted to like it more than we did.  The ambiance was nice, being in the financial it's definitely a "boy's" club with some couples sprinkled throughout.  I could see this as being a good place to grab an after work beverage but I wouldn't go out of my way to dine there again.  All-in-all it was nice.  Glad I tried it and we did have a nice time.  The service was a little off and the prices a little high for the overall experience.
author: A A.

description:
Bix is a hidden surprise in the ally ways of the SF financial district.  Good.  Keep it that way.  The less number of tourists maintains the local feel.  

My wife took me here for an early birthday dinner.  It was an early dinner on a Sunday, but still had a good growing crowd.  The piano man started up half way through the dinner and completed the ambiance.  I recommend you sit upstairs and you'll get an "old school" feel while dining in the booths and looking over the railing into the bar.  

We had the day's selection of hors d'oeuvres, which came with tuna tartare on toast, firecracker shrimp, house mozzerella wrapped in prosciutto, and truffle chess and sweet onion croques.  The sampling was decent sized and good (nothing too special).

I had the pacific halibut with savory clams for my main.  This dish was definitely the highlight.  The dish had a basil butter sauce with white corn, cherry tomatoes and king trumpet mushrooms.  The halibut was soft and at perfect temperature.

The menu was full of dishes that sounded interesting and tasty.  We'll definitely be heading back sometime to try other dishes and enjoy the atmosphere.
author: Jeff L.

description:
Took my BF here for his 25th.  He had the Bix Fixe, and selected the Onion Soup which came out as a puree with some bleu cheese creme in the middle, the pork which was basically a piece of shreddy pork wrapped in some some type of bacon over polenta and greens, and the chocolate bread pudding. It was a good deal but the food didn't blow me away. 

The mozzarella/prosciutto appetizer is 4 little bite-sized skewers of delish fresh mozzarella wrapped in prosciutto; they would have been better with some sea salt and crostini and olive oil, but the quality was great. The firecracker shrimp were good too--tempura style with really flavorful aioli. 

All in all, Bix was good but for the teensy portions vs. not teensy price I was skeptical of a return visit. You can get a much better deal elsewhere.

$10 valet parking though---not bad at all!
author: Abbie B.

description:
Most expensive burger i have EVER had. And guess what? It was worth it. Damn it was good. I keep eying it and it keep teasing me from the neighboring table. Okay i admit it. it didn't sound that good (what the hell is truffled pecorino) but i was in the mood for a burger and nothing was going to stop me not even the $26 price tag. I figured there was no way in hell it could live up to that price. WRONG. it was awesome. cooked just the way i asked and the truffle fries were excellent. Now i'm not going to make it a practice to get $26 burgers but i shall return periodically. 
Still not sure what turffled pecorino is but whatever it is, it's damn good and damn expensive.
author: Stephen K.

description:
BIX is one of the great tucked-away bar/restaurants in the city.  The oysters are amazing, as is the beef tartare they make are your table.  The ambiance is pretty killer but it does seem to be crawling with the i-banker types.  If that's your thing or you're on the hunt for your next meal ticket, stop by the bar after work and you may just find him.  

Surprisingly, given the bar situation downstairs, the mezzanine dining level is quiet enough to have a good meal without having to shout your conversation across the table.  

Just one cautionary note: if you drink too much, grip that banister tight as you descend to the bar area.  Your life (, reputation and ego) may just depend on it.  

And no, i'm not saying that from experience.
author: Carol T.

description:
Soo high expecations and very dissapointed. I feel that lots of the Yelp Reviews tend to be fake. There was ie. a recoomendation for the ginger gimlet cocktail: I tried it and it was the worst ever and tasted like chemical! 

Bluecheese Burger, Ceviche and Salads were - for high price - pretty disappointing too. Mix Starter Plate was good though - u have to expect that for 25 USD. 

Would not go again! Music is nice and location too - but there are better places in SF out there - especially if you wanna have good food too.
author: Johana S.

description:
I went here a while back for a Valentine's Day dinner. 

The good: The host at the door was a true gentleman and was extremely polite. He certainly made us feel welcome. The $25 truffle burger was very worth the price tag. I've had 2 $25 burgers in my life this one tops it. The burger practically melted in my mouth. The brownie desert was good enough, but make sure you love chocolate. The significant other wasn't having it. The drinks can be special, but make sure you order one that doesn't sound too far off your palette. The place is a classy joint.  

The kinda bad: From what we read on the website there was supposed to be a jazz band playing. Due to the lack of music the crowd from the bar was roaring! I'm talking Giants stadium Bonds splash hit status! Romantic dinner wasn't happening. Make sure when you make your reservation to account for the band's presence to get the full experience.

The highlight: THE BANANA FOSTERS. OH MAN!!! Good stuff!!

3 stars until next time.
author: C G.

description:
The food here is amazing, I loved it!  Crab rolls, to die for!  The salad.. baby romaine and they served us 6 small pieces, you cannot exactly call that a salad.. but ok. Steak is always good. I had a miso halibut with parsnips and turnips in a porchini jus: Yum!!  The server recommended the Malbec from Argentina with it.. I would not listen to him if I go again, I should have gotten sparkling!  
The restaurant is very large and the service is friendly and warm.  I really enjoyed eating here and will recommend it for sure.
author: Jess P.

description:
they couldn't accommodate our large group for dinner so we only stayed for cocktails and bar bites. 

drinks, service, and bites were lovely. i'm sad we missed out on dinner.

next time, bix!
author: Ellen O.

description:
My dearest FoodSlut arranged for dinner and drinks here. The food was amazing! The drinks were delish. The live band was off the hook. And the art provided us with very interesting convo! The Sea Bass and Kobe were yummy and buttery. 

What is not to love? 

FoodSlut...when are we going back??
author: MiYong E.

description:
If your idea of a great dinner is spending way too much on below-average to average quality food and waiting 25-30 minutes between courses, then this place is for you. I was pleased and had high expectations when we walked in, geared up for a fancy dinner in a place with reasonably good atmosphere. But the experience didn't live up to that, nearly. While this place could probably be a 2 in my book, I am going with the oh-so-harsh rating of 1 for the following reasons:

1- simply put, when you pay this much for food it should be really good. Or at least good. This wasn't- below quality meat (according to my meat-eating friends) and poorly executed seafood. That's really 'nuff said but I'll continue...

2-despite having a reservation, we had to wait 20-25 minutes past that reservation time for our table, something I'd be willing to overlook due to being busy if the rest of the experience had gone well and/or if the host had been friendly about it and not look totally annoyed with me the two times I checked in with him.

3-Although our waitress was friendly, she pretty much ignored us. We had to wait a good 10-15 minutes before she even came over, then another 10 to order appetizers, 15 to order dinner and so on.... it took 25-30 minutes before our apps came out, and they were only ok. 

4-I RARELY get scallops or any other type of seafood since I'm picky about the types I like and what I actually eat. But I figured this was an expensive place with nice atmosphere, it's supposed to be fancy, so they should do things right, right? Wrong. The scallops were undercooked to the point where they could have been described as raw and wriggling. I tried half of 2 of the four on my plate and forced myself to take a couple more bites (since I have never sent anything back in my life) before I wanted to vomit and resigned to (after an hour and a half of being starved past the point of a crazy skinny model) eating only the butternut squash puree that the dish came with (actually quite good). When one of my friends sent back her $27 burger because it tasted nothing better than something from McDonald's (she explained politely but dissapointedly to the waitress that this was simply not high quality meat and did not taste good), I also returned my scallops and turned down the offer of replacement food. My friend got her burger taken off the bill, but I did not - either I didn't complain enough or they figured they were throwing us a bone by replacing the price of one out of two. Too bad I still wanted to vomit.

To their credit, the waitress did bring out a complimentary dessert, because she said she didn't want us to leave with a "bad taste in our mouths" (TOO LATE!) - unfortunately, the dessert wasn't very good either. 

Again, 1 star is admittedly harsh but given the price for quality and the extremely painfully slow service, I would NOT recommend coming here for dinner.
author: Kristen L.

description: Take a seat at the bar and enjoy yourself.  Great food and friendly bartenders.  Those truffle egg things are amazing.  Reservations are in high demand for seating, so plan ahead!
author: Heather M.

description: I came here on Sunday for dinner and it was just as I remembered it. The last time I came here was about 5 years ago. This time, I got a table downstairs instead of the ultra chic tables upstairs where you can watch all of the activity below. We ordered the bone marrow appetizer and it was as tasty as I remembered but several of the bones were filled with way more fat than I remembered last time. We ended up ditching 2 of the bones instead of eating the fatty stuff inside. As for the main course, we ordered the pork chop special and the chicken hash. The pork chop was very flavorful but I was impressed with the chicken hash. I would definitely order the hash again. It was the cheapest main course but I thought it was more delicious than the pork chop which was a bit salty for my taste. Unfortunately, we did not have room for dessert, although the dessert items were so enticing. On food, it gets 4 stars. On ambiance, it also gets 4 stars, but only because I was at a small two-person table scrunched in the corner because the middle tables were put together for a large party. I would definitely recommend eating here and definitely request an upstairs table. I am still a big fan although I don't come here that often as it's a bit spendy.
author: Joe K.

description: Had the truffle burger and was good. very hardy for dinner plate Cheese puffs was good. This place is very pricy, but was a company dinner, so didn't care.
author: Phillip K.

description:
San Francisco food is really starting to bore me.  Having gone out on 10239832787432 dates in the city, everything is starting to taste the same and bix was no exception.  Slightly bland fish, super salty filet mignon, and the appetizers, which the waiter promised would be memorable, were pretty much mediocre. The ceviche was slightly better than average.  They also serve weird green stuff before your meal, which is just freakish - its some sort of cold green cream soup.  

However, the martini's were delightful, and I liked the ambiance.  So going for after work drinks might be an option :)
author: Sloane R.

description:
I met a group of friends here for a drink to start off a Saturday night.  Wow, Bix is a really cool, up-scale restaurant and bar.  The location on Gold makes it more of a locals place with most of the tourists staying in N. Beach. The bar felt "substantial" and was well attended by the more sophisticated, well-healed types.  The look and feel does not seem stuffy, but comfortable and easy.  I will be coming back soon for dinner. 

If I was single, I'd definitely take a date here.  As a matter of fact, my wife wants me to take her here on our "date night."
author: Eric D.

description:
The last meal I had here ended in tears but you can't blame BIX for making life full of ups and downs. 

Even as I held back the tears, I was thinking to myself, "I have to come back to this restaurant again and in better spirits--soon."

Every dish here has always been great. Rotating menu so you'll never get bored of what they have to offer. 

My love affair for this place begins with the great bar though. Classic. Timeless. I will join you at the bar any time and you'll find a martini sitting in front of me.
author: Cindy P.

description:
Heaven at last...or maybe Heaven can wait.
Bix is the BOMB, no need to be quaint.
Why I haven't been in so many years I simply don't know
I will be back, sunshine, rain or snow.
Stu was our waiter, he has been there for years
The food he brought us nearly brought me to tears
Who knew tomatoes with olive oil and vinaigrette could be so good?
If I could afford to eat there every day, I would.
Stu recommended the scallops, and they did not disappoint
With the creamed spinach I think I actually OINKED!
The truffled fries left me speechless
It was as if they knew those were my weakness
The food, as you can see, was simply sublime
Worthy of "the last supper", I'll be going back in no time
author: Matt H.

description:
Maybe it was the champagne. Maybe it was the company. But I think the food must have had at least a little bit to do with it. I had one of the best lunches ever here, and I can't wait to go back.

The Bix Fixe is a great deal. I started with the tomato bisque, which comes with the BEST grilled cheese sandwich ever (tiny sized though). That alone would have warranted five stars. The chicken hash was also good. We ordered several different desserts and this is where their weakness is, but their food overall was so good that I still think they deserve 5 stars. Did I mention how good the grilled cheese sandwich was?

****updated 10/12/07

TOMATO CART. Do not miss it. It was sooo soooo good - heirloom tomatoes with drizzled EVOO, black pepper, balsamic vinegar and basil, topped with two discs of soft mozarella. The combination of flavors - amazing. I would eat this every single day if I could.
author: Deb I.

description:
Having drinks earlier in the night and this place comes up in conversation. I had never been here, nor had I heard of the place at all.

In a surprise cab ride, we show up, sit at the bar, and have a stiff martini (I guess all martinis are pretty stiff) with a twist. The perfect drink for the occasion. 

For me the best part was the atmosphere. Although Jazz doesn't show up on my top 25 list on my ipod, I happen to really enjoy it live. 

The art on the wall was nice too. Captured a mood, and a feeling. 

Thanks C for showing me yet another place I have not been to.
author: Danielle V.

description:
For my 21st birthday my family, a few friends and I went to BIX for dinner.  In addition to a reputation for solid fare, BIX is rumored to serve one of the best martinis in the city.  

We arrived and were greeted by staff so friendly that my mother stopped for a short chat. We were immediately taken to our table and seated.  Our waiter was extremely attentive and gave us very personal service.  

To start I ordered the Pacific Oysters, which were terrific.  I also tried a bite or two of the Steak Tartare (prepared tableside!) which was similarly phenomenal.  

The waiter gave me a martini on the house as well as a free appetizer for our table to help us celebrate.  The martini was pretty damn good.  My ONLY criticism is that is was shaken, and not stirred as ordered, but  that's not so much of a big deal...especially when it's a free martini...

I ordered the Kobe steak Bavette for my main course, as rare as possible.  It was nothing short of amazing.  The edges were perfectly crispy and flavorful, the center of the meat melt-in-your-mouth soft. It was cheaper than the special (NY Steak, $49) and better too.  The mashed potatoes were nothing special, but that's alright: it was ALL about the beef!

After dinner the waiter brought over the warm chocolate brioche pudding, which was heavenly, and we ordered the Bananas Foster and the El Rey Chocolate and Butterscotch Brownies.  I am typically NOT a banana person, but I came close to licking the plate when we finished the Bananas Foster.  The chocolate brownies were pretty typical, but the butterscotch ones blew my mind!

Overall, it was an amazing evening.  We never felt rushed, the service and the food were both outstanding.  BIX is a great place for that big, special dinner (graduation, anniversary, etc.)
author: Zachary S.

description:
Everyone seems to like this place!  Including Gavin Newsom apparently!  I thought this place was ok but partially due to the fact that we only got one piece of bread and that the food wasn't as good as I would have liked.  The environment was nice, the lady singing had a lovely voice, our service was bleh.  The waiter didn't come to our table often, and when he did it took so long to bring our order/fulfill our request.  I'll keep this short and simple.  The smoked trout salad was definitely a recommend.  While the food tastes good the service definitely took out from the overall rating.

Total 3.5 stars (I still think we should have the option of rating with half stars)
author: Yosie G.

description:
Ohh... Steak tartare... 

I will never go back to being a vegetarian. You hear me?! Nevah!!

Um, the rest of the food was yummy and the atmosphere is classy. live jazz band. stiff cocktails. good service.

(Sorry. The memories of the steak tartare are eclipsing everything else.)
author: Sylvia C.

description:
Holy crap! If I had known we were going someplace that was so absolutely glamorous that it looks like the dining room of the QE2 in the 30s, I  would have worn that satin bias cut gown. 

Love the bitter lemons and bar staff in half jackets.
author: Krismet C.

description: Bix was fantastic holding my reservation as we were all late due to the rain, but we got our table and had a great time. My steak tare tare and pork shoulder was out of this world.  Bix is a standing favorite in my list.
author: John L.

description: My husband and I dined at BIX during the week of Oct 14 and LOVED the service, the main course, and the desserts were fabulous.  If we get back to SF, we will happily go again!
author: Honey L.

description:
Amazing! 

This is a SF gem! You feel like your in the 40's with the Jazz music!
author: V b.

description:
Ah Summer.  What more is required than Potato Pillows, Steak Tartare and the heirloom tomato salad?  Besides the excellent Manhattans?  Very little.

The atmosphere is elegant-gin-joint, the service is great and the bartenders, par-excellence.  Live jazz and a cool location.

Bix; Bix; I love Bix.
author: Joe N.

description:
While the ambience is kinda cool ( enter from Gold Alley) if your going there for the martinis..don't. They have somehow found the smallest martini glasses ( or perhaps have had them especially made). It is about a 2 ounce glass tops. That's what you get for 12 dollars. I politiely asked the bartender for an adult martini glass and not one resembling a martini "sippy cup". Strange looks was what I got in return. 
If your looking for a cool place to meet the friends. Order beer in the bottle and avoid the pre-school martini experience.
author: Anthony P.

description: The host laughed at me when I tried to make a reservations for 9 on a friday night.  dick!
author: Fatty A.

description: Come on yelpers!  How can you be serious rating this so high?  At $100 a head, I was expecting some magic.  What I got was ONE bite of tolerable food.  The rest was so overcooked, under-seasoned and just generally boring.  The service was so stiff and stuffy I felt like a hidden camera was going to pop out at any moment.  Also, the by-the-glass options were beyond disappointing.  This is supposed to be one of the best in SF?!  So sad.  I know the city has better to offer.
author: Foodie J.

description:
Get the Martini made with Plymouth Gin.

Did I say that clearly enough?

Get the Martini made with Plymouth Gin.
Get the Martini made with Plymouth Gin.

Great old school style staff who treat you right and give the place another layer of class while you're having the Martini made with Plymouth Gin.
author: MJ M.

description: BIX:  A swanky interior. Professional service.  Sweet, succulent oysters, tender and smoky baby arugula salad and a duck breast to sigh for.  So good you savor small bites to make the meal last.  An expansive wine list to please a range of budgets and palates. And they DO know how to make and serve a martini. (A word of caution: Go easy on the cocktails if you are dining on the mezzanine level. Them thar stairs could be tricky!)
author: Miki L.

description:
My brother and I took our mom here for Mother's Day and she was enthralled.  Live music, great food and service, fun location and a fabulous mojito.

She was impressed with her kids... for about a day.  ;)

Can't wait to go back.
author: Lm C.

description:
Pros: Delicious Black Truffle Burger, great (dark) atmosphere, attentive service, tasty cocktails.

Cons: Less-than-amazing appetizers (tomato cart and trout salad), overpriced.
author: Jacob M.

description:
so after asking a few friends what would be a nice dinner place in SF, most people said BIX.  after a bit of hesitation over going here or 5A5 for a date night dinner, we decided on BIX and were quite happy.  the food was great, the music added to the swanky restaurant lounge feel, the pricing was reasonable (remember, you pay for what you get), and it's a GREAT DATE SPOT.  jackie was our waitress and was very attentive and accommodating, even ensuring that all my dates' many dinner requests were fulfilled.

i had the duck and he had the salmon.  to my surprise the duck was pan fried, yet coupled with the squash the taste was amazing.  for appetizers, he had the mini lamb burgers and i had the crab rolls in brioche.  the burgers were definitely mini - most men would pop the whole thing in their mouth if not at a nice restaurant.  the crab rolls were unexpected - the look was pretty yet a bit awkward b/c they're square.  they tasted great though and I couldn't help but to finish them.  oh, and the butter was soft which rarely happens.  i know it seems trivial, but when you go to a restaurant, they bring out the bread & butter, you grab a piece of bread, put the butter on the knife and it's not spreadable.  i hate that!!!!  so this was just a small perk for me.

there were a few things that i was dissatisfied with though:

- a bartender grabbed our attention to offer a bar menu, yet when we were ready to order no one was available.  my date then found an empty/open space at the bar and every time he said excuse me to get an available bartenders attention, he was ignored.  so we decided not to order anything there.

- if on a date and wanting a picture (with your own camera), don't ask the staff.  they're not photographers and are there to work, so the pictures don't come out the best.

- my bourbon cherry smash was good, but i don't think there was any bourbon in it.

- it's in one of SF's many allies.  we past by it 2 times before we realized that the alley was Gold St.  and an alley obviously means no parking, yet there actually was valet parking.  there was street parking, but no spots and walking down a dark alley doesn't really sound like a great idea.  the valet parking was $10 but definitely worth it.  THEY SHOULD PUT A SIGN AT GOLD & MONTGOMERY SO PATRONS KNOW WHERE TO GO.

overall, it was a great experience and i'll be going back.
author: Randi W.

description: It's been more than a month since I went to Bix, and my mouth still waters when I think about the truffle burger and truffle fries, not to mention the Brussels sprouts.
author: Brooke H.

description: I've been here a handful of times and each time I have a wonderful expereince. The last time I was there was back in August and me and a few friends sat at the bar. Service was great, crowd lively, and live piano- can't go wrong with that! Had some great cocktails, bar bites and an overall good time. I'm never diappointed when I visit.
author: C W.

description:
Had a great time here. Cocktails were awesome. 

We split the mini lamb burgers and arugula salad. I thought the salad was great and the burgers just ok, my friend liked both. 

I ordered the Bavette steak and she ordered the Sea Bass. I felt like these were both head and shoulders above the apps. Wanted to order the pork chop and was jealous of the table next to me that did, but frankly the dishes we did order were spectacular. 

Should note that they sat us upstairs, great view of the jazz band yet not so loud we couldn't talk. Service was impeccable, great date spot.
author: Pierre C.

description: My husband surprised me with this place on VDay.  Even though we got smashed and the manager had to escort us to our cab (LOL)  This place was "heaven on earth"  I cannot wait to go back...The ambience, interior, decor, piano, bar, just overall an insanely beautiful place.
author: natasha z.

description: Very romantic, wonderful jazz pianist on some nights (make sure you bring more than your Amex so you can tip him accordingly, and call ahead to get a table/booth near him or just above him on the balcony).  The bar has an incredible selection and the presentation and taste is unmatched.  Their wine selection is almost foolproof (I've gone with several of them, nothing exorbitant, and every one was enjoyable, the sommelier's recommendations were flawless as well). The service is  impeccable, the decor is soothing, and the food [for steak fanatics the Kobe beef and steak tartar (prep'd at the table)] are top-notch.  With wine, drinks, two courses and an appetizer, plus tip, think somewhere around two bills. PS: if you order the steak, it comes with these incredible potatoes (to prevent disappointing yourself, order and extra side. And I don't even like potatoes!)
author: Mike V.

description: A classy, jazzy scene with a live singer and piano accompaniment to soothe you for a relaxing meal. It's also a first date motif for some men because the Bix twist in the food will float the gal onto potato pillow cakes with caviar and melt her in your arms with the simplest things, such as the truffle burger or chicken hash.
author: Jenny L.

description:
ok, we went bar hopping on saturday night with my friends who are locals. she absolutely adores this place and insisted that they have the best martinis here. so we went. it's in this alley way, you probably wont find it unless you are a local. the place is pretty big, very chic, and roaring 20's ish. there was a live jazz band playing. the restaurant part seems like a very romantic place to have dinner. it wasnt crowded at all when we went. the crowd there were mostly 30+.

anyway, we had the infamous martinis and it wasnt too bad. i really wanted a pomogranet one, but they didnt have it. so i stuck with what everyone else ordered, dirty martini. not bad. the drinks were like $11 each or so. very cute place to try once in your life. =)
author: Sara C.

description:
I am a big fan of BIX.  I've been there as an event professional and a patron.

The service provided for my clients' wedding was some of the best I've seen in San Francisco.  The staff at BIX went above and beyond to make the entire night enjoyable, not only for the bride, groom and my staff, but for their guests, as well.  They were so on point that when someone would walk outside to smoke and ask for a cocktail, 3 hours later, they [the staff member] remembered exactly who ordered what the first go round.  It doesn't get much better than that and I've seen it all.  The food was phenomenal, as well.  Certainly not your typical wedding food.  The quality was outstanding!

I had such a wonderful experience there during my clients' wedding, that I decided to go back and enjoy dinner on my own.  I couldn't decide between the sea bass and the rack of lamb, but ultimately chose the lamb.  The chef was nice enough to make a special sea bass appetizer for me so that I'd know how it tasted for next time. 

I've also had the mini lamb burgers; notice a pattern!  While they were tasty, I'll stick with the rack of lamb.  

Whether you decide to sit in the restaurant for dinner or at the bar for cocktails and appetizers, you should fully enjoy your BIX experience.
author: Jonette J.

description: On occasion, my wife needs a dose of class and swankiness.  It's harder to find than you'd think, but I can get her that $10 cocktail she requires here at Bix.  The alley location with no parking just adds to the allure of this "secret" spot.  It was also very popular for a special anniversary dinner.
author: Jim M.

description:
Elegant financial district restaurant and bar with great cocktails and late night dining.  

I love Bix!  From the fist time I went I loved it.  The atmosphere is so comfortable (and comforting), the service is smooth and professional, the food is delectable and they always pour a great cocktail.  

Plus, you have to love the late night dining. Bix is perfect when you don't get a chance to eat before an event that lets out after 10pm or 11pm.    

Bix can really be a comfort when you thought you were going to get a chance to eat earlier in the evening and you don't or when things run late and you miss your other dinner plans etc.  When I get in a situation like that I call Bix and see if they can squeeze us in. Late at night, it usually isn't a problem.  Of the many times I have done that they have only denied me once. 

Once you get to Bix, even if you have to wait at the bar for a bit until your table is ready, all the hassles of the earlier evening seem to melt away.  Your hunger is no longer making you irritated and frazzled, it has become a slight tease that is adding to the anticipation of your meal.  

I would love Bix even if every time I ate there it was 8pm and I had held reservations days in advance, but I adore Bix because it has so often been the turning point - take a hectic or otherwise imperfect evening, have a late dinner at Bix and then go on to have a fabulous night!
author: lisa g.

description: I went there with my husband and was not disappointed . Food was great, the waiter was very accommodating.  They have live music (jazz) ,which I wanted to stay for, but they start around 8:30 pm, and we had an early dinner. The only thing that we didn't like was the very low light.  I almost couldn't read the menu ...  Even so,we want to definitely be back for some live music !
author: E D.

description:
Get your Nick and Nora on at this swanky joint. It feels both classy and seedy at the same time - like a restaurant where gangsters take their molls. After all, it's in an alleyway, and they're known just as much for their cocktails as their food.

Service at the bar can be difficult on a busy night. I've had better luck getting a table without a reservation than a drink. The menu changes, but the food remains first-rate.

I've come here with friends on a whim, with co-workers to discuss business, and on dates. It's not easy to find a restaurant for all of those scenarios. Here's to Bix!
author: Timothy O.

description: Gravely Disappointed! My husband chose Bix for my birthday dinner since he read good reviews about it. I was happy to see a beautiful, classy designed place as we entered . We got a cozy corner booth. Started with margarita for drinks, best one that I've ever tasted. We had oysters for appetizer, another good choice. Since we don't have huge appetites, we ordered straight for the main course. My husband had Breast Duck. Verdict: Nothing special. I had Roasted Fish of the day, which was halibut. The waiter explained that it's roasted, (obviously) and with some ravioli. I was imagining it to be very tasty since I love roasted fish. When my food came, it was roasted indeed swimming in a half bowl of soup with the ravioli nestled below. Verdict: Bland like hospital food. I swear I can cook a soup fish, which I'm not fond of anyway, if needed , so much better than they do. Why they had to immerse it in a soup, I've no idea. It costs us $30 per dish, plus drinks and oysters, total $136. We were not actually concerned about the price since it's stated in the menu and we were aware of it, except for the horrible fish. And hey, it's my birthday. I would still be disgusted  though spending that much for something that I didn't enjoy eating. I ate it because we didn't want to make a fuss out of it so as not to ruin our night. I did tell the waiter that I was disappointed. He took the dessert off our check.  Appreciate the gesture, but our evening was  totally ruined.  I guess the only safe dish to order there is their pasta, chicken and hamburger. If you are not sure of what to order or  how a dish is prepared, don't hesitate to ask the waiter. As for the ambience, it's like a market place. Something's wrong with the acoustic of the place. If you're looking for a quiet or less noisy place to dine, Bix is not for you. The jazz pianist was good. We felt bad for him and the singer,  because nobody paid attention to them. Or maybe they're just there as a background music. They might as well have a pipe in music if nobody cares about live music. Verdict: we are never going back!
author: Eve J.

description:
They kept us waiting for 20 minutes for out reservation but comped us some prosciutto and melon. 
The place is SOOOOOO dated. I felt like I was walking into a Brett Easton Ellis book. 
I ordered the $12 tomato salad and it was worth every frickin penny for those four slices of tomato.

I wouldn't ever go back, but I am glad I can cross it off my list...
author: kristen l.

description:
I was in the neighborhood and this place was on my Yelp bookmarks so I decided to give it a try.  It's in an interesting part of the FiDi, in a small brick-lined alley between historical buildings.  Small tables and chairs were set out in the alley.  I walked in and asked if I could get a table; they were all booked up but said I could get full service at the bar.  Maitre'd was very friendly and unpretentious.  In fact, all the service was friendly.

Ordered a Grey Goose vodka with extra olives - the bartender gave me 4 olives.  Bonus points!  My only gripe was that the martini glasses were a bit teeny for my taste.  

The potato pillows with creme fraiche & caviar were heavenly, and the grilled pork chop with braised greens & chutney was divine.  I was truly impressed by it all; the food, the service, and the setting.  I'm definitely going back to try more things on the menu that looked good, such as the steak tartare and crab spaghetti.
author: Asteridae A.

description:
After all these years Bix still holds a special hold on me....something about this place makes me nostalgic. I love the jazz and wine selection is perfect. It's cozy and has that old school feel...and the allure and glamor and other associated accountraments. I love the tables upstairs...it just adds to the experience of it all. Remember to shine your wingtips and press your pinstripes because this would be the place to wear them.
;D
author: John-Michael C.

description:
Kobe Beef and Dirty Martini's.

Need I say more?
author: Steve S.

description: Every time I come to Bix with friends or when I'm flying solo the staff has always taken great care of me. The food is Delicious and the drinks are amazing! When I bring my friends to Bix everyone leaves impressed! The live music in this classy joint makes me feel so happy and relaxed. The  manager, nick is always so patient and accommodating when it comes to my high maintenance girlfriends! Try the lobster spaghetti with a glass of champagne and then the chocolate bread pudding! Heaven on Earth!! Of course there are so many other great dishes like the bix burger, the fresh mozzarella starter and the mini lamb burgers. Yummy! I can't wait to go back! Thanks, BIx!!!
author: ramy d.

description:
Thoroughly enjoyed the art deco atmosphere, the food, the service, the wine, the bar, and the live jazz band.  There was absolutely nothing wrong with this restaurant - well, nothing with the exception of a few older women trying to look young by dying their hair blond and sporting Bebe with fake fur.

Food was all excellent, but it was one of those places where I can't quite recall what I ate exactly because I was too drunk when I left.  I know there was something involving an amuse bousche appetizer and fish for dinner.

Still, I remember the key point, this place was delicious.
author: Lauren G.

description:
Bix reminds me of a back alley mobster hang out.  The alley is so quiet you think you might have come to the wrong spot, but as soon as you enter the restaurant you are in another world.  Lite jazz music and chatter and laughter abounds.  There is an upper seating area that looks over the lower level seating where i picture the mob boss sitting and enjoying a Manhattan.  The mysterious paintings that adorn the walls add to the seductiveness of this joint. 

On to the important part, the food.  The food was very good no complaints.  But i was not blown away.  Regardless, the atmosphere of this place is enough to make you want to relive it.
author: Alexis M.

description:
This is, without a doubt, my favorite place in the city. Bix was recommended by a couple of friends when I asked "Where should I take Des for our date night in the city?" (we visit from SD). "Bix, Bix, Bix, they told me. Words can't explain it, you'll get it when you see it." Were they ever right.

1st off, gotta say I love the whole "down an alley like street (Gold) in the Financial District, which is a ghost town at 9 PM. As you approach, you notice town cars / limos / cabs stopped beside a building with nothing but a little neon "Bix" sign affixed to the building. Okay, this seems pretty cool...then you walk in. The high vaulted ceiling, the loft above looking down, the live piano...my friends were right. You can't explain it until you go.

Though I can't remember what I had to eat (though I had a few dirty martinis) the food is plenty good that I come back whenever we are in the city.
author: Kelsey G.

description:
delicious.  i want an apartment in jackson square.  i swear I'll always live in the TL, i don't know.  

alex is the most superb waiter.  professional, direct, timely, courteous, all i want in a man.

food is consistently good.  love the white bordeaux, brussels sprouts and little mini grilled cheese sandwiches with sweet grilled onions.

bathroom is always clean with the most beautiful orchid or fresh arrangement.

love the live music with a divine pianist and melodic singer.

i am pleased with bix.  i can hide at bix.
author: Noel J.

description:
Last year - the day after thanksgiving we headed over to the city via ferry. We ended up walking all over and found ourselves near Columbus Ave. Not having reservations and not really hungry - we found a nice place for dinner - but had to wait for a table. So the fiance said "let's head down to Bix" for a drink. Okay! I said. He used to work in SF and knows all the "cool spots" this definitely lives up to cool! It is hidden away down an alley that reminds me of the heritage of SF - I envisioned swarthy sailors and miners making their way to a brothel or other shady spot for some fun. Since my grandfather actually was in SF and stationed at Fort Point durng the 1906 earthquake - I had visions of him as well. But I digress... 

We got to Bix and sat at the bar - immediately we were waited on and served some tasty bar mix. We ordered our standard Manhattens with Makers - we ended up chatting up the bar tender and he offered us "tastings" of the other high end whisky's and Bourbons - for FREE!!! Wow...we tasted some that were $50 a shot! a bit rich for our blood but DAMN to be able to taste without further committment was awesome. He got a nice fat tip.
author: Ping P.

description:
This place have a total atmosphere.

It is remind me some of the Bistro went in Paris. 
Also somehow make me remind me of hidden night club/ restaurant  in Roppongi or Ginza Tokyo.

I love this place layout. The large staircase lead to upstairs dinning area, large light fixer hanging from high up ceiling dim the huge wall art.

I am not sure who designed this place. But the someone who design this place certainly have a good taste


The service is impeccable  even though place is packed and very busy.

Jazz band was play old Jazz number endlessly. 

This place have a good old time class.

We sat on the bar counter order  mini lamb hamburger and some chicken dishes.

Actually food was very ordinary or less but the I just enjoy the place. 

Mean while , My companion that night try to teach me the whatever the "High class Manner &etiquette" during we eating.  It was little annoying but  the fact  it is very much ok after all.

Because he is the one thought  me San Francisco have such a cool place like BIX.

All I did was runaway quick as  possi8ble after he finish the bill and before he try to grab my ass.

Anyway, Gochisosama!
author: Faith I.

description:
We recently celebrated our 40th anniversary here while visiting from OC, and could not have been happier with our choice.  We needed a spot for a Sunday evening and I wanted some live music and this place hit all the right notes.  We had reservations and, per the prior reviews, I asked to be seated upstairs, which we were, after a brief wait at the bar (enjoyed the gimlet!!)  Tables upstairs are arranged along a u-shaped balcony offering a view into the open dining room/bar area below.  (I was glad to have been seated upstairs, but, actually, there's nothing wrong with the main floor dining area.) This night, the music was provided by a single, very accomplished piano player who played lovely old jazz standards.  I understand the music on Friday and Saturday nights is much more lively, but we were very happy with a more relaxed ambience that evening.  We shared the heirloom tomato plate--a dish I would return for alone (plenty for 2, though I could have eaten it all up myself since it was so delicious).  If you are a tomato lover, these are heavenly; I assume it's a seasonal dish but I highly recommend it if it's on the menu.  I had the sea bass (beautifully prepared and presented) and my husband had another fish [can't recall name :(] which he also enjoyed.  Waiter was friendly and professional but not pushy or intrusive; did not inject himself into our conversation whenever he served the table--my kind of waiter.
Glad to have been there and would definitely go back.
author: Julie H.

description:
I have been at BIX two times.  The first time I remember being sat near the in/out door to the kitchen.  My girlfriend did not realize that she ordered the 'seared' tuna and sent it back to be fully cooked.  The waiter was very happy to return it and did not make a funny face (though I think I would have had a hard time if I were in his shoes).  We each tried some cognac for the first time and decided we would never do that again -- not into it no matter how much it costs!  That is all I really remember; I don't even remember what I ordered.

The last time I was there a friend recommended we go to BIX for drinks and appetizers.  We had something along the lines of a sampler appetizer and each thing on the platter was delectable and daring...I wanted another platter since I had to share!  We had this at the bar and the service was excellent, even though the bar was so packed we were all rubbing bottoms.  My friend ordered martini's, which he refers to as 'liquid clouds'---I think I had some special concoction of the bars.  After our appetizers and drinks we called a cab and took Bart home.  It was a very nice experience.

I don't think I would go for the dinner again though.  I think BIX has become a bit too much of a 'see and be seen' type of establishment and that is really not my style.  I like to pay for food that is high quality with high quality service -- the items on the menu are not that extraordinary to deserve the high prices -- though I have been impressed with the servers.  I am also not into throwing away my money on something that I can go somewhere else and get for half the price.  Hmmm...what's all this mean?  I would definitely do the drinks and appetizer activity again...well worth it!
author: Wendy B.

description:
Great service.  Expensive.  Good food.  Nice ambiance.

The menu does not have a huge selection....but the food is very tasty and good.  There is even a hamburger on the menu for over $20!  What sets this place apart from other restaurants is the ambiance and setup of the restaurant itself and the friendly and knowledgable staff that are here to greet and serve you.   I felt very welcome here by everyone and was treated like a king.  The thought that came to my mind after leaving this place was that......this was a very classy place.
author: Armen B.

description:
Nice classy joint snuggled in an alleyway that spans Sansome and Montgomery streets, in the financial district.  You could easily miss it as you're walking past.  While the entrance may be somewhat modest, the interior is quite spacious, with a two floors of seating, low lighting, and a host of paintings and murals along the walls.

You don't get a whole lot to eat for $120 at Bix - just  barely enough for two - and that includes appetizers and drinks.  The quality is pretty good though.  I ordered their firecracker shrimp with the chili aioli sauce, and I was very impressed.  The seared ahi with crushed peppers was very nice as well, and perfectly accompanied by a glass of Spanish red wine.  For dessert I shared one of their flakey strawberry things with the paper-thin filo dough crust and the sugary mousse filling, along with a glass of one of their white dessert wines.  

I like the atmosphere here, as well as the decor.  That firecracker shrimp was one of the best fried appetizers I can remember having in recent years.  Since I don't really go through this part of the city that often, I'd be happy to go out of my way to come here just for the chance to walk around the neighborhood a little more.
author: Gopal R.

description:
Simply amazing.  Bix is one of the best restaurants I have been to in SF.  I came here last Friday with a couple friends and joked to them that I didn't want to Yelp this because I just wanted to take in the experience and not have to worry about writing about it later.  I couldn't resist so I will just make a few comments.

You definitely have to make reservations.  We arrived around 10pm and the place was packed.  Luckily we were able to dine at the counter.  To start, we ordered truffle fries, steak tartare, marrow bones, and ceviche.  All three were terrific.  For the entrees, we tried the truffle burger, regular burger with blue cheese, and the chicken hash.  The regular burger was ok, but the chicken hash was soooo good.  Definitely a memorable dish.  I am a truffle fanatic so naturally I loved the truffle burger and fries.

Overall, the atmosphere is terrific and the food is outstanding.  I was so tempted to go into every nitty gritty detail, but I really just wanted to enjoy the night.  I highly recommend checking this restaurant out.  I can't wait to go back!

P.S. - Coincidentally, this is my 100th review and I am glad it was for a place I absolutely loved!

Update - went back for a second visit on 10/18/07 - The steak tartare  was a bit under-seasoned this time, but still very good.  The butternut squash soup with crab was amazing!  Lobster brioche rolls are great, too.  The chicken hash was better than ever!  The cream sauce with tomatoes was fantastic and I absolutely loved it!  There was a 20 minute wait even with reservations and the hosts seemed to be scurrying around the room even with open tables, but overall it was a great evening and I look forward to my next visit.
author: Karen K.

description:
Superb! The old school feel and the art deco touches make this a real throwback to the speakeasy era. Once home to the "Gold Club" in the former Barbary Coast,  the architecture, stiff drinks, live jazz, great service, and divine food make you feel like a million bucks. 
The hand cut steak tartare is the best I've ever had...and trust me - I've eaten a lot of raw meat. The mist of cognac is so key. The mini lamb burgers, oysters, kobe beef, and crab salad on buttery brioche makes my mouth dance with delight. I felt like a fat lard after I left, but it was so worth it. To top off the indulgence I suggest the mini ice cream sando. DIVINE. 
The waitstaff is very efficient and professional. You have to adore their white little jackets. So classy! Check out the art in the bathrooms too! Tons of Mark Stock Butler pieces.
author: Stacy T.

description:
Who: Rents, Myself, and Girlfriend

When: Last Month

Drinks: Dirties for myself, lemon drops and other flavored for the ladies, and scotch for the father Score: 9

Atmospher: Hip but great to take the girlfriend to meet the parents for the second time.

Service: Awesome. The waiter was very informative and interactive

Food: I had the pork chops and the chocolate was to die for

I wish I had more specifics but it was last month
author: Bryan M.

description:
I was fortunate enough to be wined and dined here for my birthday dinner and I have to say this was one of the most pleasant experiences I've ever had.

The food was delicious (sorry it was a couple months ago so I can't give details) and the service was impeccable!  I would rank this among one of the best places for service in the city.

Not only did they make me feel incredibly special during my celebration, but they made sure to seat us at a very nice table (we had to wait, but the staff came up every few minutes to chat with us, offer us some snacks, etc).  

There was a company party dining there and for some odd reason, they left their area to come over to ours to sing impromptu songs  (drunkenly of course!).  A couple servers came out, including the manager to attend to our needs, apologize for the disruption, and quickly ushered the drunkards back to their side of the restaurant.

The ambiance doesn't hurt either.  As soon as you step in from the alley, you feel whisked back to the '20s.

This is a place I definitely plan to visit again and again!
author: Melissa L.

description:
I was treated to a belated birthday dinner at BIX last night.. I love that whole part of town, and especially the little alley that BIX is on, which gives it a bit of a secret feel. Martini at the bar was good but not as good as the one I had two weeks ago at the Presidio Social Club. 

We started dinner with steak tartare and I have to agree that it's the best I've had... Now, I haven't had much tartare but it was mighty tasty, and they do a nice little presentation right at the table. Fried oysters on the other hand were not really hot, nor anywhere near as luscious as those at (again) Presidio Social Club, the only other place I've had fried oysters recently. 

The cheeseburger was GREAT - sort of a fancy patty melt, open face with a big slice of grilled onion on top and thick rye bread underneath. I think the burger was stuffed with mushrooms? Hot stuff. Side of ceviche was also very good, and a very nice bright, fresh contrast to the meat, juicy burger. Dessert was a sort of chocolate thing that was tasty, but the best part was what G. did to it with her tongue. That I will remember for quite a while. We had an '02 Burgundy (french Pinot, right?) which was really good and a good match for the meal. 

Classy joint, and an SF classic, no doubt, but I do wish that martini had been a bit better. Back to PSC for that, I suppose.
author: Bowen D.

description:
Bix rox.

hahah.

get it - like prix fix?  

Anyway - I recently went with my two favorite men (my dad and my love, Mr. Suze C) and we had a fantastic dinner.  The service was close to impeccable - very polite, attentive and courteous without being overly solicitous or hovering.

I had the chicken hash.  Yum.  Mr. Suze C. had the truffle burger - and the burger was great but the fries were like - the perfect boardwalk fries that you can never get anymore.  Daddio had the gnocci - it was all fantastic.

Of course, someone had to try the Marrow St. John - so I did.  It was good.  I'm glad I tried it.  I probably won't order it again because I didn't absolutely love it, but I was very curious about it and it was very satisfying (albiet a bit messy).

Dessert was incredible.  The bread pudding is most excellent.

Go go go - it's wonderful.  Perfect.  Lovely.
author: Suze C.

description:
You can't beat the ambiance!  Wonderful place.  Arrive a little early and sit at the bar with your date.   Appetisers are yum yum and their wine list was awesome!  Dinner was not as good as the app (for me, I ordered the duck) but had some of my husband's Kobe beef and it was sensational!  Wished I had ordered, but the gentleman that he is, he let me eat most of it. :-) 
Service too is excellent, can't go wrong for a special occasion (or more often if you can afford it) place.
author: Michelle E.

description: I love this place.  I always go there when I am in San Francisco.  They are so accomdating. We had a reservation last week for 3 people but I called a few hours before to change it to 2.  Still had a fantastic table overlooking the first floor, defintiely big enough for 4 people.  They have a piano player and a vocalist and it's so romantic.  The bar is hopping.  If you don't know this place, I'm kind of glad because that means I won't have to wait ahead of you! Awesome spot.  Thanks to the GM who gave me tips on where to live in SF when I relocate.
author: Matt S.

description:
Still excellent after many years - a model of consistency...  
Stylish and refined.
author: Mick G.

description:
The husband planned a romantic date night on Saturday and we ate here for dinner (after drinks at The Wilson & Wilson Bar). Since he planned it, I had no expectations and therefore I was spared the let-downs that some other reviewers experienced. 

First, the entrance is tucked away in a forgotten alley so just walking in you feel like you're one of the privileged few that knows about this place. Second, the live music sets the tone--you're here to be entertained and taken care of. Third, the food is really good.

For starters we had the Little Gems salad and the Truffle Cheese Croques and both were delicious. For our entrees we stuck with what they're famous for--he had the Bix Burger and I had the Chicken Hash. The burger was definitely the best I've ever had, and husband said it was top three for him. The chicken has was unexpected but really good too. We were too full for dessert but nothing on the dessert menu struck my fancy anyhow.

In reading the other reviews the two main negatives are price and service. For me, the food was worth the price but then again, the husband footed the bill and we chose the lesser priced entrees. Though we didn't have any service issues of note we did notice that our waitress seemed to want to keep our interactions as brief as possible. The manager came by and said "hello", but it was kind of odd that he did that without inquiring as to how everything was, how was the food, etc. 

All in all, the music and the food were worth a tenuous 5 stars. I will definitely be back for that burger, and will hope that I am further spared any let-down from this place.
author: Rhiannon M.

description:
Really a 4.5

The apps were great, don't miss the tuna tartar and the crab roll.  The second course was good.  Everyone got something different, but everyone enjoyed their meal.  The final course was good but the best was the $27 burger.  Yes $27 Burger!s!!  Truffle filled burger topped with phenomenal cheese I can't remember and sauteed onions.  We were all too full to try dessert, so they definitely have good portions.  Try their specialty cocktails, there's a limited choice but they cover the wide range of alcohol from rye to rum.  Don't forget to order the Burger!!!
author: Bhavesh M.

description: My mother and I treated ourselves to dinner at BIX and it was definitely a highlight of our trip to San Francisco. When our waiter found out my Mom can't have alcohol (medical reasons) he went above and beyond. He brought us a tea cocktail to try and a taster of the two types of wine grape juice (unfermented wine grapes bottled by the vintner). My mom opted for the red. I ordered two cocktails. Both were perfect! Our waiter was attentive and had great menu advice. We started with the heirloom tomato plate as an appetizer. My Mom ordered the steak. She was worried the peppers with the dish would be spicy but the waiter assured her they were a special kind with 'zero-heat' and he was right! The steak was delicious and the peppers added wonderful flavor.  I decided to try the dorado. It was cooked to perfection and the accompanying salad added just the right citrus tang. We finished our meal with semifreddo and fresh nectarines. I'm headed back to San Francisco to spend some time there with a friend from Australia. BIX is already on our "must do" list.
author: Terra H.

description:
BIX is where my husband took me to dinner the night he proposed. =)  He didn't propose there, he proposed AFTER dinner at the bow and arrow on Embarcadero, but I do remember that the food at BIX was delicious!  The servers were so attentive, and you can tell the ingredients were fresh.

A "con" would be the location.  If you're not from the area, you will probably circle the financial district a few times before you find Gold Street.

Worth the effort in my opinion.
author: Patricia B.

description:
I had agreed to meet friends of mine from TX ,who were visting SF for the first time, for drinks - a friend of theirs from Houston suggested BIX.  When they mentioned this, I asked if they had informed the restaurant that we were only planning on having drinks and appetizers.  They called BIX and stressed that we did not intend to have dinner and that we were dressed rather casual (jeans and sweaters), they were told that would be no problem as they were "not very busy" on this Monday night.
Five of us arrived together (my partner was coming from work) we informed the host that the rest of our party would be arriving a little bit later.  We were seated and ordered drinks while we waited for the rest of our party ( he arrived about 30 mins later because the cab driver did not know the restaurant was in an Alley).  It took them 20 mins to bring 3 Apple Martini's and one Scotch on the rocks.  
After about 30 mins I got up from the table to go outside to call my partner ( I think it is rude to make cell phone calls inside ANY restaurant)- on my way out I ran into my partner being belittled by the host because he did not remember the last name of the person the reservation was listed under (because he had never met them before).  The host implied that he did not believe that he was in fact meeting anyone and that their clothing did not meet the restaurants "standards".  I was suprised to see my partner and more surprised by the attitude of the host.
We went back to the table and everyone continued to order appetizers and drinks, every twenty minutes the waiter asked if  we were ready to order our "meal"-each time we reminded him that we were not having a full meal, we were just having drinks and appetizers- I should mention that the place was dead, there was only two more tables of customers in the whole joint.
So after that it was truly painful trying to get the waiters attention- before you feel sorry for the waiter I should let you know that our bill was $365 dollars just on small plates and drinks!  When the check came they had included an 18.5% gratuity - I mentioned to the waiter that it was a shame that he didn't trust us, and that he undervalued his own service, because I realized we were a slighty difficult table due to the fact that we did not order dinner I was going to tip him %25 and his reply was "you still can".  We didn't and we will never be back.
author: Brian C.

description:
Sexy time in the city!  Small, intimate, and incredible music.  A martini tastes "more better" at BIX!   A hidden location, and fun to find.  Makes it feel even more special. Small, yes....thats ok, its to cool to pass up!
Not a hip baby crowd!
author: Martha O.

description:
Bix is won-der-ful! 

It's a bit challenging to get a reservation on short notice, but the staff are friendly and great at accomodating. 

I went to Bix without a reservation as they said they were all booked. However, after a few drinks at the bar, the staff were uber friendly and gave us a cancelled reservation. 

The food was beyond amazing. 

This is a great date location or after work drink spot.  The atmosphere is fantastic!
author: Natalie C.

description:
The kinda place you wanna take your mamma, or those visiting suburbanites from other states who will 'oooo and aaaahhhh' at the high ceilings decorated with copper tiles.  Located on Gold Street, a tiny alleyway which doesn't allow for parking or trucks higher than 12 ft.  You can miss it entirely if you're not careful - head down Montgomery Street as the street sign isn't visible from Sansome Street.    

The restaurant is separated into two stories connected by a plush carpeted staircase.  The second floor overlooks below diners, the long mahogony bar, and on most nights - a live jazz band.  Ask to be seated up there, especially if you're on a date.  Beware though, conversation can be tough above the din of the music and diners.

I'd definitely come back for martinis and desserts.  Some entrees were good but definitely nothing to rave about.  Try the steak tartare, smoked trout salad, chicken a la bix, and the chocolate bread pudding.  Avoid the ceviche which was too salty, and the potato pillows were flavorless in my opinion.
author: Kimmie N.

description:
I'm updating my reivew and lowering it to 4 stars.  Just went again this week and the service was terrible.  We had and 8pm reservation - were seated at 8:25 and didn't get out of there until 11:15.  We only has salad, entree and desert.  We waited forever for our salads and main.  Below is my prior review.  

Another great meal at Bix.  I've been going here for years and the food is consistently great.  I took 2 friends from NY and they were very impressed with the space.  We started with the firecracker shrimp with chili aioli.  The shrimp were huge and the sauce was really tasty.  The blue cheese dressing on the hearts of romaine was a little bland.  The chicken hash yet again was great.  I always try to save room to use that great bread they give you to mop up the yummy sauce.  We tried 2 deserts and both were awesome - the bananas foster was great...didn't want to share.  The ice cream was rich and creamy and the sauce was fantastic.  The warm chocolate brioche was really rich.  It is definitely something to share as I can't imagine taking more than a couple of bites since it's so rich.  

On the downside, we didn't get great service this time.  It took forever to get out first drinks, water and to put an order for apps in.  At least 30 minutes.  It was very unusual for Bix.  Once our apps came after some time then things began to run smoothly.  

The space and decor are top notch.  Great place to bring guests.
author: Gina T.

description:
I really really really love squash blossoms. If you have never had them you might think it sounds strange, but they are deeeelish! I hadn't had any since Italy so I was quite excited when I saw them on the menu at Bix. They were soo yummy! 
It looks like a big restaurant, but it's really not. It's open and airy and when there's jazz it's so nice. I also really like the cute alleyway that it's in, when you walk out the restaurant you feel like you're in Europe. 
It's great. Totally recommended.
author: Shelley M.

description:
Good atmosphere.  The place was nice for hangout with friends.  We went for a birthday dinner for a group of 8 last year.  Space was tight for the table they gave us.  Our waiter was clumsy that evening.  He knocked over one of our water glass at the table and wasn't very polite about it.  For a moment I thought was our water glass was at fault for being at the wrong place at the wrong time, hehe...

Food was pretty good but not great, we thought.  It was a little pricy for the quality and portion they serve, especially the side dishes.  It was one of our venture and I don't think we'll return.
author: Adrienne K.

description:
Went for my birthday and the staff was so attentive. There was a hand written happy birthday note. Our waitress was really sweet and did not try to up sell us at all. (Which is refreshing) She actually suggested a bottle of wine that was less expensive than the one we were thinking about, (And it was quite good). Dinner was delicious started with Steak tar tar which was made at the table. (Nice entertainment.) Then we had an arugula salad followed by Bix chicken hash for me (over a cream sauce) and dunganeous crab with pasta tossed in a light lobster cream sauce (for my boyfriend). I was full after our entrees. But had to try desert, a chocolate brioche bread pudding. It tasted like a delicious brownie mixed with the texture of bread pudding. (The waitress even comped the desert because it was my birthday!)

I really enjoyed the ambiance with the pianist and jazz singer. The lighting was great and the eclectic design was cool yet sophisticated. Definitely a place I would go again!!
author: Courtney R.

description:
Hidden away in a non-descript alleyway lies the art deco supperclub-esque gem named Bix (I think that I was channeling zagats on that line). The food is delicious, the wait staff attentive and friendly, and the decor wows you with large oil paintings like a ballerina making out with a clown. Oh yea. Its pretty swank. And so is the jazz music that plays nightly. And they really do make a Perfect Makers Manhattan. 

I ate my very first ever bone marrow here, it was a little bit scary, devilish even, but sorta good at the same time.

Highly recommended.
author: Alison P.

description:
Great place; we only had drinks in the alleyway but it truly felt like a hidden gem. The servers were very courteous, the atmosphere was laid back and relatively casual.

I would definitely recommend Bix to anyone looking for a great place to eat and drink.
author: joe i.

description:
You know how sometimes when you're eating outrageously delicious food you just have to close your eyes and ears and focus on taste? The perfect lamb burger uncoiling between your teeth, the steak tartare melting on your tongue. Flavor so good it's all you want to know.

I had to close my eyes reflexively FIVE TIMES during my trip to Bix. That, folks, is a world record. Awesome drinks, outstanding wine, swank ballroom feel, plus a jazz band. 

Bix is the best!
author: matt s.

description:
I've been to BIX a couple times.  The first time was for a birthday lunch.  My friend made a reservation and told them it was my birthday so they even had a little card for me which I thought was just great.  The food was delicious, the server was hilarious, and I simply just loved the set up of this place.  

I went back a second time for a drink after a dinner at Myth.  I think my boyfriend really over did it.  First, dinner at Myth was divine.  Then, on a Saturday night, the atmosphere at BIX was incredible.  There was live jazz music, so we got cocktails and stood around the bar since it was that crowded.  People were dancing, laughing and having a good time.  I definitely am already looking forward to coming back here.  It's a great place!

Atmosphere- 5 stars, I simply don't think it could be any better.  The set-up and dynamic of BIX is fabulous.

Food-  4 stars.  No Complaints

Service- 4 stars
author: Rachel S.

description:
Wow... thats all I can say. We went here on a whim (good thing I made reservations) and walked straight into the 1940's. With its art deco decor, Ella Fitzgerald - esk piano singer (thursdays)
[According to my female companion, the singer just oozed sex appeal with her voice and if she was a 50+yo male she would hop down off the balcony and show her some of her own tunes... because "anyone with a voice that good, must be awesome in bed".], 
fabulous drinks, divinely tasty food and ridiculously knowledgeable wait staff; this is the place to take anyone and everyone out for a night on the town. 

It is a little pricey, but anywhere you'd expect Sinatra or Billy Holiday to come walking in at is definitely worth it.
author: Brennan M.

description:
We entered the restaurant from a small alley and were greeted with an awesome luxe ambience bringing you back to jazz clubs back in the 50s or so. The restaurant was a bustling crowd of professionals. Kick started the evening with cape cod and a Sazerac...(this was too strong for me!)

For Hors D'oeruvres, we had the hand cut steak tartare on olive toasts. This was totally delish, the raw meat concoction slathered on top of nicely toasted bread was absolutely heavenly. This kinda blew me away followed by the Roasted Summer Tomato Soup with a midnight moon grilled cheese sandwich. You can't imagine how something so basic like tomato soup and grilled cheese sandwich can be such a match made in heaven. Ooo La La!

We also had the pacific oysters - small, succulent, sweet. For mains, we had the Grilled Rack of Lamb with a Zucchini Parmesan Tart, Cherry Tomato & Olive Relish, Black Garlic Yoghurt Sauce. The lamb was done beautifully, tender and a slight pink but I did not really enjoy the yoghurt sauce. I think something a bit tangier might have complemented the lamb better. And the Zucchini Tart was just so so. We also had the sauteed alaskan halibut with sweet corn, cherry tomatoes, hudson ranch helga beans and basil butter. Wow the fish was really nice and flaky and went nicely with the basil butter. However, I felt the load of sweet corn in there was overwhelming and kind of cheapens the dish.

The saver from the main courses was the dessert. I don't know the exact name but it was pure decadence of a couple of almond waffles slathered with fresh cream and nectarines in between the layers and it was totally awesome and the nectarines were just sooo sweet.
author: Topazskye L.

description:
We had a very positive experience at Bix. My family had a going away dinner for my brother before he heads off to Quantico for more military training. 

If you want to get there for the live jazz, I would suggest making a reservation ahead of time. Since our party was on the larger side (8 people) we could only get one at 6:30, long before the music starts.  

I didn't even feel bad about missing the live music because the service and food were amazing. Our server was extremely knowledgable and well prepared. He even had a flashlight on hand when my mom was trying to figure out how to work her camera...then he proceeded to take our table's picture, one from the side and then one aerial shot from the balcony.

On to the food.  We started with the seasonal heirloom tomato slices served with fresh mozzarella and basil. If it is still on the menu, I would definitely recommend this dish. We each got half of a serving and it was perfect as a first course.  Also, we ordered the chicken hash entree as an appetizer so that we could see what it was. That was a big hit, especially with the guys. The patties were a mixture of chicken, grits and one more ingredient...I think it was onion.  It was tasty and came on top of a cream sauce with halved grape tomatoes.  As an entree I ordered the halibut. It was really simply done and was nice and light. It was good, but I had to save room for dessert. We got a few so that everyone could try a little of each. My favorite was the chocolate bread pudding...however, the napoleon seemed to be a big hit with the family.

Everyone seemed very satisfied with the experience...I just feel sorry for all the running my brother has to do to burn those calories before he leaves.  It was pricey, as expected, but the perfect place for a special occasion.
author: Lindsay B.

description: I really love this restaurant.  The bar scene is lots of fun - and it's a good place to eat. Service is always spectacular.  It's noisy however....so if you're looking for dinner and intimate conversation, this ain't it .. but it's a fantastic bar/restaurant, perfect art deco interior.
author: Richard F.

description: Atmosphere and live jazz was great, food is just ok
author: Tom T.

description:
I've been here with friends a few times.  We always sit at the bar, order something to nibble on, and enjoy the whiskey and scotch collection.  

Food: I've only had the desserts, but they were delicious.  

Drinks: They've got a great selection of liquor.  

Service: The bar service is great.  The bar staff has always been efficient, unobtrusive, and able to give a good recommendations on food and drink.
author: Steve B.

description: A perfect, classic bar with bartenders who have been doing this for 30 years and can make anything. I have to learn to make the Meyer Lemon Collins now, and there is no way I can survive without it's lusciousness in my life.
