For the main course I went with the lamb and was completely blown away. It was the best lamb I've ever had. Period. Tender, perfectly rare (as I had ordered it) and with delicious and relevantly paired sides; I was thrilled. Everyone who ordered the steaks and pastas seemed to love those as well but I focused all my attention on the lamb.  When dessert came around most of us opted out but I went for the cheese plate. It was decent but wasn't noteworthy and the coworker that ordered the brownies liked them but they weren't outstanding. Her husband had the bread pudding and I had a bite and found it good but, again, nothing fabulous. I asked for a double B&B and think I only got about one and a half but the glass was warmed which earns a nod.
My only real complaint with BIX is that they had somewhat spotty service. We had a hard time reaching a waiter and when one diner inquired of a server (who was serving her main course) what temperature her steak was cooked she was snapped at that "I don't know! I know it's the right temperature you ordered because you are place three." It would also be helpful if the valet (you would most likely need to use due to the heavily congested area) took cards and not just cash. If BIX polishes up those few areas they will have an extra star from me. I DID get lots of kudos from everyone in the office though so I'm pretty happy and will most likely return.
author: Jill D.

description:
I had my graduation dinner at Bix and everything was perfect. We had a party of 9 and they sat us at a round table so it was easy for all of us to talk to one another which I loved. The service was very accommodating to all of our needs...even handing my grandfather a flashlight when he was having trouble reading the menu because of the lighting. 
The drinks were delicious and the food...well lets just say we all cleaned our plates. 
Things to try: the truffle cheese and sweet onion croques (AMAZING), kobe bavette steak, and the chicken hash (dont be scared away by the word hash)
This is a great place for a celebration. The ambience is great and they have live music (check schedules on this if its a must for you).
CAN'T WAIT TO GO BACK!!
author: Christi B.

description:
this review is gonna be short and sweet.
steak was great.
seafood (fish) was meh.
appetizers were awesome, if a bit expensive for what u get.
wait staff was attentive.
drinks were ok, on the lighter side.
valet parking.
located in a little alleyway. weird.
author: Simon C.

description: Went here for dinner to celebrate my boyfriend's birthday and a major career accomplishment I had recently achieved and we couldn't have been happier with our decision to come to BIX! It was some of the best food we have ever eaten, and the ambiance was perfect. They sat us right next to the live jazz trio in a very comfortable booth, and when we arrived there were little place cards with our names on them. On the back of my boyfriend's it said "Happy Birthday" and on mine it said "Congratulations". It was such a special touch, our waitress was so attentive, informative, and amazing, and everything about it was perfect. One of the best date nights we've ever had.
author: Natalie K.

description: So we had a table for 8 with about 10 people sitting at it, we still had a blast. After all these years they still got it. The food & service, top notch............
author: A. B.

description: Chose Bix last minute because of location--couldn't have been more pleasantly surprised AND mad for not having discovered Bix a ling time ago. Let's start w/cocktails -- DH had three of the best Manhattan' s ever and this boy knows Manhattans. They were able to fix my fave  cocktail and it was divine.  Loved the atmosphere, noise level, live music, wait staff's attentiveness without intrusions. Dinner was delish and we will be back. Really. Really want to try brunch along with my fave cocktail next time. Thanks, Bix for an amazing experience.
author: Jane V.

description: Dinner 8 PM on a Sunday night (Memorial Day weekend). Nice atmosphere, with two levels of seating. Location was a little hard to find as the entrance is in an alley. Wine list was nice, ordered Terra Valentine, $80. Pretty good for the money. Started off with delicious lamb burgers that had cucumber and dill. Great taste infusion. Wife had Kobe bavette which was good, but small for the $35.00 price tag. I had the mustard encrusted pork which was delicious, easily the best tasting pork chop I've ever had from a restaurant. Finished off the meal with the brownie plate that had a couple different types of brownies which was the perfect size for a dessert, not too big, not too small.
author: Matt R.

description:
forty foot ceiling, not a single window, and gorgeous art deco decor that makes the space look like an authentic speakeasy or the set from the film, 'Victor Victoria'.  No windows as the building was once an 'assay office' (ah, right, i didn't know either--that means a place to count and test the purity of gold).  Hence the street's name.

oh, there's the restaurant...
food and service are exceptional.  the menu is broad innovative and can get quite expensive with its $28 cheeseburgers and $40 Spaghetti (with Maine lobster).  But you can dine with a more recession oriented ethos.  I did.  Sweet Onion Soup and Chicken Hash were my selections.  Both were very rich and out-of-this-world. 
And I dined at the bar (where they warm your buns (no euphemism intended)) and the service was friendly, knowledgeable (see 'assay office') and efficient.
author: Ned S.

description:
Friday Lunch at BIX...If there is a better way to start the weekend, please let me know!
We sat upstairs and our waitperson was just perfect! She was knowledgeable + welcoming + made us feel comfortably well taken care of.
Started with Bloody Mary's -- short, strong and spicy and then the Bix Fixe--what a deal for under $22!:
Summer Corn Soup with Bacon + Bix's Chicken Hash
Hearts of Romaine w/Bleu Cheese & Albacore Summer Style
Everything marvelous and in that dark cave of a restaurant it really feels like you've gotten away from everything.

Friday is their ONLY Lunch Day but then who could handle such perfection 5 days a week?
author: k k.

description: one of my favorite places! Bix is tucked into a little side alley located in historic jackson square. its always filled with a cool sophisticated crowd. there's valet parking too if you have a car. once you get inside this classic SF restaurant, you will notice they have a great wine selection. its also known that they have mastered the art of the perfectly-made cocktail. if you're dining, the food is excellent and service is impeccable... i've come here quite a few times on dates, and also for after work drinks since its near my office. its just always really good.
author: Michelle I.

description:
Bix has decent food and decent drinks. The decor is luxurious and sometimes has live music. I used to be a fan of Bix until my visually impaired friend celebrated her birthday there. My friend is blind and works for the lighthouse foundation for the blind. She invited 8 of her friends to celebrate at Bix. Most of them had some type of visual impairment and there was a guide dog present. The host and waiters were confrontational to my friend about the dog and were displeased with it in the restaurant. They refused to allow my friend and her friends to be seated in available tables because they were unsure whether they would be reserved for people coming late for dinner - it was 10:30pm at this time which was highly unlikely for more diners to arrive. They forced the group to stand by the crowded bar and gave every impression they wanted them to leave. When my friend confronted the manager on the phone a week later he yelled at her for 10 minutes until she mentioned that she worked for the city's accessibility group. Only then did he start apologizing and trying to make it up to her. Like I said, I used to think Bix was ok, but now I consider it a sleazy place intolerant of people with disabilities and refuse to patronize it..

(0 * stars)
author: Brady K.

description: This one was good.  I went with Ed and Anne Marie for Dine About Town.  They let us bring the friggin' chex mix upstairs with us. The food was good. Hearty. Substantial.  Not all frenchy and (enter non-offensive adjective of your choice) ___ like Rubicon was.  The wait staff was not feelin' us. not at all. She was kind of a pissy (enter your own explitive) _____ actually.
author: Rick H.

description:
I went to Bix way back in July for my birthday.  The menu has been sitting on my desk and it's taken all this time for me to write a review.  Feeling ambivalent . .. sort of like the restaurant itself.

I've been going to Bix for years.  Back in the day, it was a great restaurant.  The decor was lovely, the service excellent and the food great.  For sentimental reasons I chose this restaurant as a celebration spot for a milestone birthday.  People who know me well were surprised . . my taste for birthdays usually run towards La Folie or Cyrus. . more destination restaurants but I just wanted something familiar and also the friends who would be celebrating with me had spent many an hour over chicken hash and martinis with me at Bix.

Bix still looks gorgeous.  I love the room with the balcony and the long bar.  The cozy booths in the corner and generally how clubby and dark it is.  We were a party of 8 people and were seated promptly and on time for our reservation.  Service was efficient.  It was good but not very warm. . . we ordered lots of drinks, spilled a drink (could have been 'cause we were ordering too much) and seemed to be working out waiters' last nerve.  When you feel like you're getting on your waiters nerves, that just is never good.  It was nothing he said but his general air. .. as warm as an ice cube.

The food was solid.  I love the steak tartare - even the sort of cheesy table side preparation is fun, especially if the person doing it has a sense of humor. . .our guy did so it was nice.  We ordered lots of Hors D'Oeuvres - standouts were the Crab Rolls, Truffle Cheese and Sweet Onion Croques and the best was the Mini Lamb Burgers. . .I didn't order those, my friend's husband did but they were so good I almost pulled the birthday girl card and demanded his plate.  Since I was raised right I didn't but I sure wanted to!  

The entrees were good but not as good as the Hors D'Oevers and First Courses.  Here's my beef (pun alert!). . .I don't mind paying $30.00 for a Kobe Bavette steak. . .well, I sorta do, but I can overlook it 'cause I like some red meat. . . you get about 6-8oz. of sliced meat over a tablespoonful of potato puree.  Mind you, I am already paying a sick amount for some steak. . but it's Kobe so I know I gotta pay for the massages, etc. but don't insult me and my pocketbook by putting a tablespoon of potato puree on my plate.  That is just wrong.  It made me feel ripped off and that is something you don't ever want to do to your patron at a restaurant - I mean, how much does potato puree cost to make?  How much does your profit percentage need to be on this?  Throw on a lavish amount of potatoes (which were DELICIOUS btw) so your guest doesn't feel gypped.   All in all everyone was generally happy with their food and the sides, which are gorgeously seasonal,  quite good although quite expensive.

Desserts were good.  I really don't judge dessert on presentation as I've found that the fancier they are, the less luscious they are. . .I know some restaurants have battalions of pastry platers who's sole purpose in life is to smear your plate artfully with a huckleberry reduction and quenelle your ice cream to within an inch of it's life and some restaurants have some poor, overworked pantry guy plating salads, frites, cheese, AND desserts .. that seems to be the case at Bix. . .the plating is simple so the flavors should pop. . and for the most part they did.  Everyone really liked the bananas foster and the chocolate bread pudding.   

Bix has been doing what it's doing for a long time and I think it's become rote for a lot of the staff.  While we had a good time, it was mostly the people I was with as opposed to the place we were at and  that's sort of sad because Bix used to be so fabulous.
author: Lainie L.

description:
Bix is one of those places that you'd envision Frank, Dean, Sammy and their posse having some cocktails here with a bunch of "broads" back in the day!  It has that kind of old school charm and class.  The bar and stairs and décor seem to come straight out of a different era.  It's hard to even find, btw.  You need to know where it is or else get very lucky.  It's down the Gold alley somewhere in north beach.  I like the location really since it's very close walking distance to the bubble lounge and the rest of the north beach fun.  I had the lamb and a maker's mark Manhattan - both of which were dead-on great.  the place is really all class.  They couldn't even take a reservation till 9pm which tells you how small and how popular the spot is and when it was 9:15pm, we were sipping our cocktails at the bar still waiting.  When I was about to go ask how much longer the wait was going to be, I saw a guy holding some tuna tartar fighting his way through the crowd.  Apparently, the hostess sent him to give us a free snack and tell us that our table would only be a few more minutes.  Very nice touch.  The 3 piece band was just loud enough to insure that no one else could hear your conversation but not loud enough that you'd have to shout to your dinner friends.  

The big things on the menu, we did NOT order.  We didn't get the signature beef tartare, which you should get because I got it before and it was outstanding but apparently, we had some queasy stomachs on our team and raw beef wasn't going to be working for us.  We didn't get the interesting burger entrees either even though they looked AWESOME.  My friend got the Kobe steak which, from all accounts, was amazing. And my lamb was probably the tastiest (is that a word?) dish of lamb that I can remember ever having.  I would recommend it although, wow, I do regret not trying the truffled burger!    btw, our ceviche with jalapeno chilies was definitely the right appetizer choice.  Very good and a good balance to all that red meat that we were going to order for entrees.  I'm sure it has an excellent wine list but come on people, it's Bix.  You have to have cocktails!  Up.
author: dan h.

description: Had my friends birthday there.  It was great.  They took great care of us... the food was awesome... the staff was friendly.  I recommend the sea bass.
author: Laura B.

description: Loved the food and ambience.  The music was nice as long as you were expecting background/lounge style jazz.  Had the impression it was going to be a little more center stage before going.  But I would absolutely go back as I enjoyed both the dining and musical experience.
author: Alex C.

description:
BIX's reputation definitely precedes itself--4 stars on Yelp, on Michael Bauer's 100 Best Restaurants in the Bay Area...and several friends giving it the thumbs up.  I had my reservations, but, I suppose I  wasn't surprised that I thoroughly enjoyed my experience at BIX.

Firstly, ambiance is  classy without trying too hard.  From the outside, you'd think you were entering a Speakeasy Bar, but the inside is this effortlessly classy 1930's, Art Deco venue.  Think booths, dark reds and greens and yellows and velvet.  We were seated upstairs in a booth, perfect location to soak all the aforementioned up.

Food was delicious and near perfect.  Shared the ragout of sweet corn with red pepper and fava beans with the bf and while we enjoyed it, it wasn't anything we couldn't make at home.  In fact, the corn tasted like canned corn not fresh at all.  As an entree, I  ordered one of the specials, the NY steak with french fries and a some greens that they called a salad (just some weed like greens lightly dressed with olive oil).  The 11oz. piece of meat was charred to perfection on the outside and cooked just as I liked it, medium well.  I ate every last bite.  The bf ordered the cheese burger, as I mentioned in previous reviews, he is somewhat of a hamburger connoisseur.  Meat was good quality and well seasoned, cheese was far from ordinary, but wait, only a bottom bun?  Apparently, it's an open faced hamburger...I think they should have described it as such on the menu.  For dessert we ordered the chocolate tart with strawberry ice cream.  It was not memorable and will not be the thing I recall fondly about the restaurant.  

4 stars for quality food, time period ambiance and exceptional service.  The bartenders are friendly too, and can apparently mix up a decent Manhattan.
author: Marie B.

description: Fantastic!  We had a 10 pm reservation and were pleasantly surprised to see that Bix was hopping and filled with attractive young people.  The service, attention, drinks, food and atmosphere was A+++    We go to Bix frequently and are always totally satisfied.  Only one time did we dine there and had a very unfortunate waiter.  He was terrible and he was fired the next day.
author: Rana and Allen K.

description: Great place to take the man!  Cool ambiance--located in an little alley in downtown/financial area, great decor inside, very jazzy, smooth, masculine.  We started off with delicious oysters and great cocktails.  Surprise of the evening was the amazing trout salad--sliced trout, broccoli, potatoes, caviar--yum!  Steak was great too.  Definite recommendation for your man's birthday or any special occasion.
author: M. C.

description: Haven't been here since I was younger and "on the prowl"  Nice venue for a couple drinks and apps.  I love the lamb sliders and the potato pillows with caviar-pricey for dinner, I think-but nice place for a guy to wine and dine you!
author: Gina G.

description:
top contender for SF best burger + fries....my husband got 1/2 the burger (we were also sharing the fish+chips) but I really wanted the burger back

and the roasted tomato soup with midnight moon grilled cheese was swoonable....
author: Mariangela S.

description: Once upon a time, you could count on Bix to provide a consistently superb dining experience. But now that Herb Cain can't monitor their present day performance it seems management changed their service model to one resembling Chevy's.  On my last two donation occassions, MARTINIS were warm and watery and the seafood pasta entree was based "Mainely" on lies.   More specifically, their "Maine Lobster" pasta with langoustines had NO Lobster meat, it's only "the broth" made from boiled Maine lobster shells" that is used to make the stock-   Bad move Bix- rename your "Maine Lobster" fast before the ice melts my next martini!
author: John C.

description:
food was okay, but i guess you pay for the ambiance. 

I brought my girlfriend for a night out with good food and wine. I hate it when you are the youngest people in the place, and you are treated like it. The waiter was a bit more attentive to the larger party and the other two couples sitting around us.

Food was decent. We had the potato pillows (best dish of the night), steak tartare (subpar), duck trio and chicken hash. The duck was good but the chicken was a bit too much. I couldn't finish the whole thing because i got sick of it. 

The piano playing downstairs was a plus. 

Rating:
Service- 3 stars
Food- 3 stars
Atmosphere/Decor-  4 stars
Overall- 3 stars

Sorry, i think i'll spend my hard earned money elsewhere for a little better service.
author: Patrick M.

description:
This restaurant is a classic example of a place that rides on reputation and fails on delivery. If the service were a little better, the prices less expensive, or the food just a little better, I'd happily give this place a higher mark, but I've got to ding it. 

I was excited when invited to this "classic San Francisco" establishment. Indeed, the little alley it's tucked into and the big front doors and dramatic, front - hall feeling bar are all nice. But the bar was hard to enjoy when upon arriving right on time for our 8pm reservation our hostess nonchalantly told us to go over and wait by the bar. We waited for half an hour, basically unable to get out of other people's way. It was tough to even get a drink and the bill for 3 cocktails pre tip: $43 bucks. Yikes. When we finally got to our table our waiter was quite good. I'll give the place credit for that. (Tall guy, grey hair). However, the ambiance was lacking. We were near the jazz band, which while good, meant we had to scream across the table to hear each other.
On to food: the cheese and truffle "croques" were really good, I admit. Like mini perfect grilled cheese. My friend got the ceviche and he said it was delicious. But it was also like 3 tiny bites. For entree I got the scallops which were very disappointing. You know I used to joke that my dad was weird because he went to really nice restaurants and ordered scallops, but I've come to love them. I order them all the time. These really did not live up to any of the scallops I've had in San Francisco (best probably being Starbelly). They weren't crispy on either side, weren't tender, the broth they were in was boring and the butter beans and weird accompaniment. These were scallops the wrong way: kind of rubbery and unappealing. I think I ate more bread than my entree... I don't expect all restaurants to serve the best food of my life but this place felt like somewhere that charges a ton just so you can feel like part of SF's old school elite for an hour or two.
author: Molly D.

description: Great place on an expense account but I wouldn't pay my own money for it.  I obliterated the black truffle burger with truffle fries in about 15 seconds despite the generous size.  The burger is thick, juicy, messy, and lathered with truffle and garlicky goodness.  The bone marrow was also a winner, a bitter, meaty spread for crispy toast.  Vegetarians would recoil in horror at what I ate.  The desserts were rich as expected and I left feeling guilty and satisfied.  Come with a group and a corporate card.  This place is LOUD and expensive.
author: Tom R.

description: I absolutely adore Bix!   My husband and I ate here many times when he lived in San Francisco and, in fact, he proposed to me at this very restaurant in 2005.   I wish I could eat here every week.  And they have the best mint juleps this side of the Mississippi, too!
author: Jen O.

description:
Bix is an awesome experience. From the moment you walk in you are having fun. The music is lively, the place is beautiful.

We were here again for dinner recently. The food is great as ever, with good free-range organic meat options (though it would be nice if they ditched Fois Gras from their menu!). Some have complained that it's pricey, etc, but I find the price is right in line with my expectations, and the portions are definitely enough to fill me. 

Great, great restaurant.
author: Steve H.

description: As good as it gets! Always great food and service after all these years! One of the best looking restaurants in the City after all these years. It is just as good now as the first time we went there ten or twelve years ago. I stress years of operation which is so rare for a restaurant anywhere. One of the best bars in the business also. Ten stars if was possible!
author: Gean T.

description:
Okay, so I had heard great things about this place. Great drinks, great atmosphere, great food, etc. etc.
When I found out that my parents were coming to town for a visit, I thought we should check it out. So this is how it went:
We arrived at 7:50 for our 8:00 reservation. When we pulled up, the valet was nowhere to be found. We stood there for a few minutes and eventually he came running around the corner. Parking was $10 - he had no change for a $20 bill. "No big deal," He said. "Just pay when you leave."
When we entered, we were warmly greeted and told to have a drink while our table was prepared. This was no easy task as there were twice as many people in the small bar space as in the restaurant itself. There was a VERY obnoxious group of 30-somethings pretending to be fashionistas ( I know cheap shoes when I see them, that's the tell ) in the way. I said "excuse me" at least six times and they still didn't step aside so that I could get to the bar. I wedge myself between one of them and the bar and he actually had the nerve to turn around and say "excuse me!" Thats what I've been saying for 10 minutes! Anyway, I ordered drinks. The bartenders do have an attitude, as referenced in earlier reviews. It was manageable, however, and not too irritating. The drinks were good. One of my party highly recommends the strawberry rickey.
Then we were seated. This is where it actually improved quite alot. The service was outstanding, attentive but not stifling. This to me is the standout reason to go to Bix. The cute waiter kept putting his hand on my shoulder. He knows how to make the tips flow.
The food was good...not great. At these prices, the food should be better. The night before, we had eaten at Garcon on Valencia - half of the tab and twice as good. The potato pillows were good, although the pillow it self was a little too "McDonald's Hash brown-like" for me. The crab rolls were outstanding, as was the foi gras. The chicken hash was really silly. I mean, it's fried chicken salad. Why it is the signature dish, I do not know. The crab linguine with lobster cream was, again, good, but not great. I suppose the best way to describe the meal was forgettable.
Desserts were okay. Bananas foster was good. Chocolate brioche bread pudding was better. Ginger  ice cream with fresh plums was unnecessary.
Another annoyance was that  the Jazz trio did not start until almost 9:30. One of the draws for this place was that my dad loves jazz. If I had known that the music didn't start until later, I would have made the reservation later. This info should be on their website. 
4 stars for the service and decent, if overpriced for the quality, food.
The interior is a bit shopworn and the banquettes are in desperate need of re-upholstering.
author: Jamie M.

description: Another fantastic meal at Bix...but this time our waiter was a bit of a snob...I'll assume it was an off night for him. Tried the Bix Hash for the first time and it didn't disappoint.
author: Alex A.

description: Old school charm and lively jazz. The truffle deviled eggs were out of this world and the cocktails were spot on.
author: Jimmy B.

description: I was sorely disappointed, especially having heard Bix's well-regard.  The soup was, in one word, SALTY.  I've never been one to satisfy the requisite 8 glasses of water a day, but on that day, I was the poster child.  I thought, "This must be a fluke!  Surely the fish entree will redeem."   No, alas, no.  It was unfresh, along with its wilted bed of sauteed mushrooms.  The dessert, however, brought a chocolate-laced light into what could have been total culinary darkness.  And with that, I slithered my waterlogged body out of the place.
author: M A N I K.

description: Being at BIX makes me feel like I'm in a scene of "The Maltese Falcon", and Humphrey Bogart is gonna be sitting at the bar nursing a whiskey.
author: Van Ness D.

description: The food was incredible...the server was snotty and did nothing to make my experience a memorable one. I believe it was this one server as the other servers appeared to be smiling and helpful to their guests.
author: Kevin V.

description: Enjoyed a magical birthday dinner here several years ago, and no other restaurant experience has come close.
author: D. S.

description: Bix is probably my favorite overall restaurant in SF. The food is excellent and the wine list is solid and not overpriced. Possibly the best part is the ambiance and the beautiful room that allows you to relax and enjoy the company of your group, without being drowned out in noise or feeling crammed in cheek to jowl with other diners. I have always found the service to be polite and refined without being snobby. Strongly recommend for any occasion.
author: Greg H.

description: Boyfriend took me for my birthday.  I really liked the space and the atmosphere.  The watermelon cocktail was super yummy.  Nice touch with the birthday card when we got seated.  The bone marrow was really yummy, it tasted like butter!  I thought the firecracker shrimp was good but nothing special.  Had the porkchop and truffle burger for entrees.  The porkchop was really moist, I'm not a huge fan of tomatoes so that was the only drawback of the dish.  The truffle burger was good, lots of pieces of black truffle.  The fries on the side has some kind of sharp cheese that was tasty.  The one thing about this place is that they aren't all about service and presentation like some of the other nicer restaurants in the city.
author: Jen C.

description: The streets to Bix are rightly paved with Gold and you'd definitely need some in your purse if you have the fortune to make the visit. No doubt that this is a world class institution that will be going strong long after the hipster-supperclub moves out of town. High sophistication matched by an unparalleled selection of spirits and libation makers. A true classic.
author: Maureen M.

description:
I want to love this place. 
Have dined here previously and thought it was very good. 
Tonight was disappointing. $162 for a dinner for 2 (no wine) that I could have easily improved upon. 
Overcooked steak was replaced with raw strangely unjuicy piece of meat. Everything was skimpy and just OK, not great. 
Expensive and not worth it.
author: carol l.

description: Honestly, I thought it was overpriced and not that great. There are better places in the city.
author: Monika M.

description: BIX was recommended by a friend .  It is like the best-kept secret from tourists!  The only way to get in is through an alley, so it feels like a speak-easy.  Inside, there is a swanky bar.  Up some steps, there is a floor filled with tables.  Looking up, there is a balcony that is at the perimeter of the second floor that also has tables.  We were seated at one of the tables on the second floor at 8:30 pm on a Friday night.  We had a great view of the jazz band that began playing at 9pm on the main floor!  It wasn't too noisy so we were able to talk quietly while we ate.  The menu isn't very big but we were both able to find dishes we loved!  We also had appetizers and a couple ginger martinis.  The waiter was very nice to offer his opinion on the dishes.
author: Kristin T.

description: Bix offers a great ambiance, good cocktails, and live music. But the food is extremely expensive (read: tourist prices) and mediocre, the service is blah, and the overall experience is poor. We live in the city and went to Bix because our first choice couldn't get us in. We shelled out almost $200 for dinner and walked away resentful. I wouldn't come back, unless it was for cocktails at the bar.
author: Heather W.

description:
Come here, sit at the bar, buy an expensive but well made drink, take in the speak-easy, jazz inspired interior, listen to the jazz and feel like you are somewhere else!

Even before you enter Bix it seems special, the brick wall-lined alley smack in the middle of FiDi. It can be a little hard to find, but persistence will pay off. Walk into Bix and you are in an amusement park for adults.

On a late Saturday night this place is great, not many people, when we were there. Quiet and serene with a three person Jazz ensemble playing. Bartenders were friendly and made some of the better drinks I have sampled. From our party the Dirty Martini and Gimlet were awesome. I never fail to order a beer, even in the nicest of places.

Recommend coming here for drinks, on a night on the town.
author: David B.

description: After hours of online research in search of the perfect dinner for a special occasion, I settled on Bix.  I couldn't have been happier...or more full!  Bix exceeded my expectations in every possible way.  From the moment we walked in the door, the staff made my date and I feel like VIP.  After a few quick drinks at the beautiful oak bar we were whisked up to a balcony table overlooking the downstairs dining room.  They sat the two of us in a wrap-around six-person booth, on what seemed like a busy night.  The food was some of the the best I've had in San Francisco.  The fillet mignon was perfectly cooked.  The beef tartar, made right at our table - perfection.  Sure it was pricey, but not nearly as much as any of the tasting-menu types.  The live jazz put the finishing touches on a perfectly romantic evening.
author: Todd W.

description: Incredible.  Sat at the bar, had the best dirty Martini's I have ever had by one of the most professional bartenders I have ever been served by.  Snacked on grilled cheeses (heaven), oysters (double heaven) and other snacks.  Beautiful atmosphere, impeccable service, best cocktails and most fabulous "snacks" around.  Best high class bar experience in the city.
author: Em S.

description: Bix is a great restaurant. The service is always good, and so is the food. Love their lobster pasta. After 8pm they have piano music and a singer. I have eaten here a few times, and I go back every time I'm in San Francisco. It's romantic for dinner, and hip at the bar. I must add that on my last visit here,  found the music to be louder than usual, so asked to be seated upstairs.
author: D G.

description: Lots of fun, especially if you misbehave a little.  Think Jack Nicholson sitting at that beautiful bar in "The Shinning".
author: Ron O.

description:
Love the location...small alleyway right in FiDi that transports you to a speakeasy surrounded by men in suits smoking cigars and chugging beers outside.  Inside there is a piano with a real live person singing, and if the mood catches some people right (and by "mood" I mean booze) they can get up and show off their best dance moves.  

I came here last week with some friends and we were seated in probably one of the best booths in the house.  We were downstairs right next to the piano (I guess maybe it was a little loud, but we just talked over it).  I hear the best table actually is the corner table to the left of the stairs, in which you can see the entire restaurant.  They unfortuanately do not take reservations for this table, though.  On to the food: I got the heirloom tomato cart for an appetizer which ended up being huge and so delicious.  I could eat it every night.  For my entree, I decided to go with a couple first courses: the midnight moon grilled cheese and tomato soup, and the squash florentine.  Both were delicious, but I was overzealous and didn't leave enough room for dessert.  I saw a couple cookie sandwiches pass by me, so next time I go I will need to take that into consideration.  The only reason why I deducted one star was because our server was pretty unattentive.  There was a point where we actually thought he forgot about us.  Other than that it was an overall great dining experience and I hope to go back soon!
author: Michelle L.

description: BIX reminds me of the kind of restaurant that I used to like! For the past few years I have really gotten into the whole in the wall + neighborhood joint kind of restaurant. So, I don't enjoy the financial district + suits + their groupies anymore! The food is very good, the service is great, the live jazz music is awesome but the people are really a turnoff for me. This place deserves more than 3 stars except for my prejudice...
author: Reza E.

description: Nice decor with nicely done food. The menu is a little hard to read and a bit confusing but that's all I really have to complain about. Prices are on the spendy side, but you get what you pay for. Drinks were good and when I went they had a jazz band playing which really adds to the atmosphere.
author: Sean D.

description: Swanky place, jazzy music and fantastic food. The outside of the restaurant looks very nondescript, but the inside decor is old-fashioned sophistication. Came here with a large group and were seated upstairs overlooking the restaurant and bar. I had the steak which was cooked a perfect medium rare. The food  definitely did not dissapoint! Also, wonderful for a romantic evening.
author: April Rose D.

description: I LOVE LOVE LOVE this restaurant!  It is easily my favorite place to dine in all of SF.  The live jazz music and art deco decor sets the mood for a relaxed evening that's great for a no pressure date or a gathering of friends.  I prefer to sit on the second floor so I can look down and see the action at the bar and hear the acoustics of the music strumming in the background.  As for the food, if you have a curious pallet, I would stick with the small plates so you can try a few different delectable Bix dishes.
author: Angela D.

description: This weekend my loved ones and I walked down a wonderful Financial District alleyway and then sat in a booth at Bix overlooking a large dining room and a slightly-outdated but very visually amusing mural. Then a funny, laid-back but very efficient waiter came and proceeded to be excellent at his job from start to finish. Then I had an underwhelming, but not bad cocktail. Moments later I ate the shit out of some fantastic pancetta wrapped mozzarella drizzled with olive oil. My mouth was then assaulted with the mind-blowingly ridiculously exciting taste of a burger stuffed with truffles. Big, huge amounts of truffles. and cheese. and grilled onion. and truffle parmesan fries. this brought tears of joy. $27 hamburger-fueled tears of joy. Thank you hogs for rooting those bad boys out of the ground.
author: Sara M.

description:
Maybe my expectations were just too high, but the meal ranged from okay to meh. The truffle cheese and sweet onion croques were the only thing to really write home about. The french onion soup was REALLY REALLY salty. The kobe beef was tender, but it just tasted like it had been soaked in a vat of butter. The pork chops with apple something and greens were pretty tasty, but ridiculously tiny for the price. Also a little bit overcooked for my taste. The bananas foster and creme brulee we had for dessert was good but nothing special. 

All in all, I've had much much better food at this price point. The reviews were all so good, maybe it was just a bad night...
author: Jennifer C.

description: Good food and REALLY tasty specialty drinks.  Get a booth on the balcony upstairs.  On busy nights be sure to show up on time since they have only 2 hour sittings so you get booted from your table if you're there too long.  I recommend ending your night with a walk down the street to Bubble Lounge.
author: Allison K.

description: Perfect meal: tomato and mozzarella salad, made tableside, mac and cheese (so, so good) , truffle burger, fries, and banana foster. Amazing.
author: Noelle Q.

description: What a wonderful "Old San Francisco" experience.  Everything about Bix effuses class and superb service.  The drinks are great and served by skilled and attentive bartenders.  The food is outrageously good.  I would recommend starting with the appetizer sampler.  I went with a few friends, and all of our entrees were wonderfully tasty and thoughtful.  From the steak, to the lamb, and seafood, everything was delectable.  The service is outstanding with extremely attentive servers.  The ambiance is wonderful.  The piano and vocalist just added to the experience.  It is a bit pricey, but if you get the chance, you should not miss Bix.
author: Ashley M.

description: For the last 15 years this restaurant has never failed me.  Come early to enjoy the bar.  Real mixologists and not just drink makers so try something new.  The live music is very good and the environment is fun.  The food is very good and solid but not over the top.  The Bananas Foster is the best I have ever had.  Afterwards you can walk down to the end of the alley and make a right onto Montgomery and enjoy an indoor/outdoor firepit,  cigar and scotch/port at the Cigar Bar and Grill.  A great adventure.
author: David A.

description: Caviar on pillows of potato, tuna tartare on crisp toast, oysters on the half, marrow bones topped with flat leaf and a sprinkle of sea salt, grilled rack of lamb accompanied by a perfect napoleon, pork with pureed kabocha squash (just a taste but very good), a plate of delightful cookies that would make a child salivate, a gregarious & professional waiter who has amazing stories - and clearly lives a much more illustrious life than I - one  Bollinger, one Ridge, my partner in plonk, and two dear friends... what's not to love?
author: Lizelle G.

description: The food is pretty damn good but who's eating?  This is a great place for a martini with your Euro friends.  Or a glass of bubbly.  Or a late night whiskey.  Very insider San Francisco.
author: Margaret F.

description: I came here once with a group of friends to celebrate my roommates graduation from SFSU. The food was incredibly delicious and the atmosphere was one that would take some serious effort to feel suffocated in. Located in some alley off Jackson, you might want to come here after you've gotten your masters in anything, following a job to pay for dinner....it's like paying off a loan. Be warned.
author: James J.

description: Cool atmosphere, really, REALLY good food, and AMAZING service.  We really liked this place!  The cool architecture and live music made us feel like we were in New York.  Highly recommended for a romantic meal or a great place to have a nice dinner with friends!
author: Corey H.

description: Went there Sunday night for the first time and loved it!  Has a great appetizer/small plate menu as well as traditional entrees.  Had the tuna tartare, steak tartare and the sea bass ceviche.....all were amazing!  The space is classic 1930's!  Can't wait to go back!
author: Cameron M.

description: I went to lunch at BIX for a work event and ended up with food poisoning. It was a terrible experience. Just say no to shady looking tartar sauce!
author: CC M.

description: I don't usually complain about nothin' but the bartender on Monday night with the glasses and not thin was probably the most attitudinal, unpleasant barkeep around.  Such a cool place with such a not cool, unpleasant barguy on a quiet Monday.........so sad. I hope he finds a happier place than where he was last night. I am not in a hurry to go back...
author: Jack W.

description: I stumbled into Bix recently and was very impressed! From the moment we walked in the door, the level of service was exceptional. Bix has a very cool old school vibe. The waiters wear white jackets, however they are not stuffy at all! They have a huge selection of spirits and they make a great sidecar! I can't wait to go back and have dinner!
author: Lisa A.

description: This is a classy restaurant located a block away from Chinatown in the Financial Disctrict that serves great drinks and food with attentive service.  I went with their chicken hash + asparagus soup and I couldn't have been happier.
author: Tim G.

description:
A lot right but too much wrong.. my group of six gave a collective shoulder shrug to the question.."How was your food?" 
To Begin, the restaurant is beautiful with a wonderful atmosphere. But I have a theory that the gorgeous interior is distracting diners from the mediocre food. We spent nearly $800 on food/drink and we should have had a better experience.. Croque Monsignor (grilled cheese sandwich) appetizer was slightly burnt. The house made mozzarella cheese, yawn, great crab cake tho.. 
As for main course, meats not cooked as requested: a BIG no-no in my book. The seafood spaghetti elicited another yawn, pork shoulder was bland. 
Service was a disappointment too.  We are big tippers and this guy did not deserve it. He seemed frantic and distracted. My food was served by a waitress from down stairs.. why?? and it was not as warm as I think it should have been. Great live music and wonderful wine list. 
Ok BIX... the ball is in your court.. are you going to get serious about the food or die a slow death from your formerly stellar reputation?
author: Edward D.

description:
as soon as you walk into this place it makes you feel like you need to act really proper...  the atmosphere is like a 20's or 30's supper club...
i enjoyed my meal here.  quail for dinner and then i had a heavenly chocolate cake type of dessert.  kept forgetting the name even after asking my bartender what it was called several times.
talking about the bartender... he was really professional and attentive.. i was taking a while to drink my cocktail so he thought that i didn't like it and offered to make me another drink.  i told him that i liked my drink and was just taking my time :)
one day i'll have to go back and have dinner at a table...
author: charlotte s.

description:
Yay for date night! Ambiance was excellent, it could have been stuffy but our server Jackie was highly entertaining. She kept referring to  me as "not driving" (AND I wasn't, bring on the Burgundy!)
We shared a couple of entrees & appetizers.
The artichoke special w/ lemon aioli was DELICIOUS. 
Arugula w/ blood orange salad also tasty, although I personally prefer arugula mixed with other greens.
Pork chop, good until we realized the center wasn't cooked all the day.
Quelle horror! Had to dock a star for that.
Bananas Foster for dessert, highly recommend getting this if you're into the flavors.
Liked the pianist playing live while we dined, it made me feel like my fancy patent leather pumps were justified making an appearance.
Its nestled in a little alley, Gold's Alley, as it were and looks like a dive bar from outside. Inside its expansive & I personally loved the decor.
I think the food could stand some improvement, but I'd be willing to go back & try other items on the menu.
author: Claire S.

description: Outrageous flavors and presentation. Service was perfect. Attentive, informative and engaged. My one complaint was that the wines were horrendously overpriced. Really, the least expensive wine was $36 and only 3 wines were under $50. This is San Francisco, how about more reasonable wine choices.
author: Peter W.

description: I have been to Bix a couple of times for dinner and drinks.  What a very elegant and classy resataurant.  It's down a very quiet alley in the Financial District and you wouldn't expect it to be there.  Great bar that can turn out any drink you come up with.
author: Denny R.

description: I've been to this place many years ago and they are still one of the best American restaurants I've had the opportunity to dine at.  Their Steak Tartare and Lamb Chops are to die for!
author: Jerry N.

description: Tucked into an alley, tucked into a ripple in time. Surrounded by a collapse of dot com crash'ualties, Bix has survived, unscathed. Still classic, still one of the best live jazz venues in the city and still one of my favorite spots to sip on a martini. Dinner, desert, decor - I challenge you to find something wrong with the place. A nice place to stretch an evening out, and pretend it's 1945.
author: Christopher S.

description: A san francisco classic.  Love the retro '20's feel.  love the food.  Love the scene.  Easy access to downtown and north beach.  Salmon on a bed of lentils still makes me weak in the knees just thinking about it.
author: David T.

description: So servers have off nights. I remember my off nights, and I cringe. I understand. As off as your night might be however, it's unclear to me how giving me attitude is going to help. And not even the straightforward in-your-face-I-hate-you attitude, which I prefer. More of the you're-not-really-worth-serving-especially-if-you-don't-like-caviar attitude, which can ruin a good meal. Even a meal of a truffle burger that was absolutely perfect. I wore a black dress. I shaved my legs. I saved money for you. I pretended to like you and your swanky restaurant. Why can't you pretend to like me?
author: Katie T.

description: We actually went here for a wedding reception, not for an actual meal, but the food was still to die for.  I love the look and feel of this place, right down to driving down a dodgy alley to get in.  Totally speakeasy-esque.   I would have loved to get back to this place before we moved, but it never happened.  Still, this place, is totally worth it.
author: Statia M.

description: Possibly my favorite bar in the city -- quite a New York feeling.  Jazz piano, interesting history, solid martinis.
author: babsie g.

description: 134 reviews!!??? We had an amazing Merlot.  The tuna t was okay .. a bit on the buttery side.  The best note about the char was the burnt skin.  The kobe was a bit rough around the edges.  Overall, I would recommend the restaurant  for the 'alley experience' and live jazz.
author: Susan K.

description: Get the shrimp appetizer and bananas foster for dessert. omg so good.
author: Brian W.

description: I have only been to Bix a few times, and I have no idea why! The atmosphere is that of the sultry and forbidden Prohibition-era dinner hall. I took my boyfriend here for his birthday, and they gave us the perfect table-- right near the piano player. This place is gorgeous, the live Jazz a treat, and the food was overall delicious. I recommend ordering your favorite cocktail here rather than off the cocktail menu-- we both found our first round to be overcomplicated and strange. When we ordered Hendricks gin gimlets after that, we were happier. The appetizer we had was a delicate sashimi-- slightly oversalted but still refreshing. My entree was the catch of the day--- a superior Mahi in a light broth with perfectly cooked spring peas. Mind you, this was over a month ago and I still remember the meal perfectly. My boyfriend decided to opt for the duck and said it was crispy and decadent. The service was perfect. Our waiter was gracious, informative and entertaining, and the busser was extremely professional with his timing. What a wonderful evening! I love the mural on the wall and ceiling.
author: Brigid S.

description: I took Ramsis to Bix on his birthday and we were late 20 minutes, so we only had hour and a half to enjoy the food.   We order a bottle of Melbec, Pacific Oysters on the half shell, Creamed Organic Bloomsdale Spinach, Mixed Green Salad (special order), Potato Pillows and American Sturgeon Caviar, American Kobe Bavette Steak and Sturgeon (Fish Special of Day).  We really enjoyed our first and main courses but we were disappointed in Potato Pillows and American Sturgeon Caviar.  The caviar wasn't fresh and I hardly tasted its flavor because of the cream.  I don't think caviar and potato pillows go well together.  The waitress was nice and the atmosphere was fabulous.  The bar was packed and we were late so we didn't get to enjoy the live music.
author: Maki M.

description:
This place is just not for me unfortunately.  
We sat at the bar and had a few appetizers and a couple of drinks. 
The potato pillows with caviar & creme fraiche are a guilty pleasure. They're like an adult version of a tater tot with creamy and salty goodness.  Smooth on the inside crispy crunchy on the outside.  Definitely a success.
We also ordered the fried oysters and with asparagus and this one was not so successful.  The batter on the oysters was too soft, kind of like a bad tempura.
Lastly we ordered the deviled eggs with morel mushrooms and unfortunately the mushrooms were suspiciously missing from the flavor profile.  4 pieces at $10.95.
They do serve their greyhounds with fresh squeezed ruby red grapefruit juice however so that's a plus (although I didn't see anyone squeezing anything).
2 drinks + 3 appetizers came out to around $65.  Just not enough bang for my buck sadly.  Good service and nice atmosphere.  Maybe when I'm more grown up I'll like Bix.
author: Tempe M.

description: good music, beautiful space, extensive bar with signature cocktails, amazing food.  There was not an item from the menu that we tried that wasn't delicious.  I would recommend the steak tartare appetizer and the kobe beef entree, which was cooked to perfection.  I can't wait to go back!
author: audrey p.

description: Two Friday lunches.  Two burgers perfectly done to medium rare specification.  Perfect fries.  Friendly staff and nice atmosphere.  Highly recommended.  Yummmm.
author: Mikey P.

description: My favorite restaurant in town! The caviar-covered "potato-pillows" are the best.
author: Andrea W.

description: Bix seems to be hidden in what is probably one of the cleanest alleyway's in the city. I enjoyed the Kobe "Bavette" Steak with Pommes Puree, Roasted Spring Onions and Natural Jus.  It was a very tasty dish, a seemingly unique cut which was elegantly plated.  Live music and plenty of old FiDidy's here.
author: P H I L H.

description: Whenever I get a chance to visit SF, I always make it a point to swing by Bix.  The food is wonderful (try the Lobster pasta or the Kobe beef dish) and the service is impeccable.  Our last waiter's name was Stu & he made a good recommendation for a bottle of Cab.  Don't let the cabbie scare you when he enters this narrow alleyway because what's waiting inside is worth it all.  Oh yeah, ask about the 2 blue paintings upstairs!
author: Julia L.

description: Food was great, and the bartender totally got the price wrong on a 30-year Scotch, which was cool.
author: Don H.

description: One of my favorite restaurants in town.  Bix is a great place to go for drinks and end up staying for food.  Standard American fare presented in a setting from an era from long ago.  With the waiters in white coats and a pianist playing standards, you are transported back to a more civilized time. Great place to take clients and visiting family.
author: Lucas M.

description: Bix was really good. Hearts of romaine salad was great, but a little too much dressing. Still yummy. Definitely have to get the lobster cakes - kind of like crab cakes but even yummier and really buttery. Great wines - we just had them by the glass and the waiter was very knowlegdeable in that area. The best part was the drinks - they have some amazing ones, something like a Pomegranite Gin Fizz and other crazy ones. The ambiance is nice but a little bit dark. I would definitely go back, but not the best food I've ever had.
author: Alex H.

description: As usual the potato pillows were amazing. My fiancée ordered the blue cheese romaine salad and I orders the tomatoes prepared tableside which were both also excellent. For the main course I ordered the American Kobe steak with mashed potatoes which rivaled steaks I have had at both bobo's and epic. I couldn't have expected anything better. The only thing that fell short was the chocolate butterscotch brownie. The whipped cream was perfect but the brownie seemed on par with something out of a box and a bit on the dry side. The bananas foster which my fiancée ordered was out of this world by her account.
author: Beau H.

description: Art Deco fun at the bar. Heirloom tomato salad to die for and nice servers. Great spot for a special occasion, upstairs, table for two.
author: Helen K.

description: The setting is classic. Its an old gold bank from back in the day...if nothing else, go to the bar during happy hour to check it out. The food is actually very good here. Good for entertaining clients or a date.
author: Not M.

description: One of my favorite places in the City.  The food is phenomenal, the service is unbeatable and the ambiance oozes with class and old-warm charm.  The wine list is extensive and has something that will please anyone's palette.  The signature bar menu features drinks like the huckleberry Gin Fizz.  Perfect place for a romantic night out or when wanting to impress clients, in-laws, or anyone else.  I suggest you go with a big appetite so you can do a three course meal.
author: Katie P.

description: I went to Bix for the first time last night and I liked it. The food was great - Kobe Steak was perfectly cooked. The Foie Gras nothing to write home about, but the desserts were to die for and the waiter was a great sport. The only thing a bit upsetting was the hostess - a bit on the snippy side. thats why one less star. However, I would go there again for all the other reasons.
author: Conny F.

description:
old school baby. the waiters wear tuxes and mix your martini's table side. live jazz starts at 9:15. this place is gorgeous, with super tall ceiling and interesting paintings on the wall.

the food is awesome. mmm, piping hot sourdough rolls, my fav. to start i got butternut squash soup with crab...delicious. also got mini lamb burgers and truffle fries, perfecto! the rest of the table got pork chops, lobster spaghetti, truffle cheeseburger and arctic char. everything was great and the food came out real fast.

for dessert, we got mini ice cream sandwiches, these little guys were sooo tasty. a great way to finish a meal. 

so this place is dressy, people were literally in short black dresses, not what i was expecting. would come back here in a second!
author: elissa w.

description:
The four stars are because we only had drinks and appetizers here, not dinner.  For our bar experience I would give it a five!
When we asked the concierge at our hotel where Gold street was, he said, "Ah, you must be going to Bix!" with a tone of approval in his voice.  Gold street is actually a quaint alley, so the old-world sophistication of Bix is a bit of a surprise when you enter.  It's truly a beautiful room -- very Art Deco in its design and mood, with high ceilings and huge columns to support them.  The quality of service is old-fashioned, as well.  The hosts and bar staff were very polite and attentive in their starched white coats with the Bix logo embroidered on the pocket.  Our cocktails were wonderful (appropriately enough, I ordered an Old Fashioned), as was the appetizer sampler we ordered.  Just enough food to stave off starvation, but not enough to ruin our dinner (the restaurant we ate at did that -- see my review of Mona Lisa's). 
I also liked that the clientele here were adults, not over-aged children.  When we arrived there was a small party of 10 or 12 people at the bar.  While they were chatting and enjoying the occasion they were celebrating, they were not being loud or shrieky, and they did not overrun the small bar area.  They were mature (and by this I don't mean "old") enough to respect the other patrons who weren't there for a party.
We had such a nice experience here that we returned for an after-dinner nightcap to wash the taste of a bad Italian meal out of our mouths.  One friend ordered Absinthe, which was served with full ceremony.  A jazz trio was playing, providing a soothing backdrop after the loud clatter of the place we had dinner.  Next time we'll skip the bad Italian food and have dinner at Bix!
One final note -- I often judge places by the quality of the restroom -- you'd be surprised how accurate a reflection this can be!  The restrooms at Bix get five stars -- clean, tastefully decorated, fresh flowers, and high-quality paper towels that feel almost like cloth.  A classy place through and through.
author: Sandi P.

description:
amazing food, definitely unhealthy: everything drenched in butter. great environment, live band, attentive waiters, comfortable seating. every table on top floor is a good table, tables on bottom floor are closer to the live band. highly recommended to visit at least once.
edit: the open-faced cheeseburger is stupid stupid stupid.. and way overpriced. better burgers in the bay for less than half the price: Zare at Flytrap, NOPA, and Los Altos Grill
author: Rob G.

description: Very good food, fantastic pear martini (we skipped dessert to have another) and terrific waiter. I recommend sitting upstairs if you would like a more intimate dinner. The live music was very good the night we went (January 5). The burger and lobster dish were both incredible. The sides were as well.
author: R D.

description: When I find a place where I just feel "home," I hang on for dear life. That's the way it is for me at Bix. In fact, I can't believe I haven't written a review thus far. I have been so many times over at least the last 10 years and it never fails. Most times I go with friends to have a drink or a meal at the bar. Sometimes I actually sit in the restuarant. I just love the ambient mix of Art Deco, 20's nostalgia and beauty, with today's sensibility mostly from the financial district set. The martini, natch, is a must, as is their shrimp cocktail or any of their shrimp appetizers of the day. The service is always polished, the staff willing to please but not in an overarching way. This place is so classy it happily rubs off on its clientele!
author: M F.

description: I really love the atmosphere here. I feel like i'm in the 20's. The food is very good here. The bar is nice to go in and just get a few drinks. Sometimes they have a live band playing too. The service was also very good.
author: Winnie H.

description: One of the better upscale restaurants in the Financial District area. I had lunch with a friend and had a wide variety of delicious appetizers, skirt steak, desserts and the martinis are terrific. The price for two was under $200 including tip and well worth it for the quality of the meal.
author: N A.

description: Great food, atmosphere & drinks!! A perfect place for a date or dinner with your family! Start off with the steak tartar, followed by the heirloom tomato cart. Make sure you have the Chicken Hash followed by the deadly chocolate cake!
author: Emily M.

description: Old-school jazz bar.  Classic bar staff more apt to pour a dirty martini than a beer.  Excellent food and atmosphere.  On a nice day, sit out in the alley and watch the crowd come in after work.  Very classy, "Sinatra coulda drank here" place.
author: Todd S.

description: Excellent service, lovely music, great drinks, just faaaaaabulous!
author: Marta K.

description: LOVED Bix.  I mentioned in passing once that I'd never been so a friend took me and I am now obsessed.  The food was obviously good, but I was distracted because I loved the art, especially the painting of the waiter dude on the back wall and the giant mural behind the bar.
author: Shannon H.

description:
The atmosphere is awesome! Food is amazing! Live music (trio on Fridays) is cool! 

It's a great place to bring your date or celebrate a special romantic occassion. We started with crab rolls and I went to heaven after the first bite...then we ordered lamb and fish & both turned out very delicious. Also, we got a dessert, but i don't remember the name...it was ice cream with warm rum and bananas...just amazing! 

We paid $160 for 2 people: 2 cocktails, 2 glasses of wine, 1 appetizer, 2 main course dishes, 1 dessert, 2 coffees.

We stayed there for 3.5 hrs enjoying  food and music :):)
author: Ann S.

description: From classic cocktails to gourmet food, this place has it all.  The ambiance is relaxed and sofisticated.  Nice place to go for a special occasion.  I had the tomato soup and the Kobe beef.  Both were exquisite!  Everything is balanced and flavorful.  The servers were attentive and helpful when i asked for suggestions, and i would love to come back here again!
author: Marci B.

description: I love this place.  Not only does this place have a really nice bar with the best bar snacks, their food is amazing.  All their appetizers, especially the steak tartar is well done to perfection.  I have always enjoyed the extensive wine selection as well.  Definitely a great place to go for a special occasion or just after work.
author: Charles C.

description:
A
Nestled away in a tiny alley between bawdy Broadway and the majesty of the Transamerica pyramid is one of San Francisco's classiest restaurants run by one of our best restaurant owner operators ever to grace the scene hereabouts, Doug Biederbeck.  He's a descendent of the late Bix Biederbeck of the world of Jazz and it shows in the design, dcor, distilled spirits menu and the music that fills the elegant dining rooms and bar when its open.  In addition to being a really great full service, white linen restaurant, Bix serves up a classic burger that rivals the best to be found at 21 in New York and at the celebrity chef places that dot Las Vegas like fleas on an old dog.  Biederbeck is a maestro at everything connected to his restaurants and is always fine tuning and seeking perfection in every aspect of this place.  The burger is a large, hand formed hunk of premium ground sirloin that is mesquite gilled to perfection and served on a lightly toasted custom burger roll with excellent lettuce, tomato, onion and pickle as well as the best condiments money can buy.  Great hand cut, blanched Idaho russet potatoes are cooked to perfection in a high grade heart healthy oil and what is delivered is about as it gets.

Other sandwiches are offered including a great steak sandwich and they'll gladly produce a vegetarian or poultry burger to customer specifications.  The fries are first rate and come in a copious portion.  One of the great and tasty appetizers here are the mini lamb burgers that are addictive and delicious.  They're like sliders and can make a perfect meal in themselves with a side of their great fries.  Bix offers a continental menu with a lot of contemporary California and is overall pretty good, but it is the atmosphere most people keep coming back for time and again.  One of San Francisco's most sophisticated and deluxe dining and drinking establishments that is as welcoming as the finest private club one finds anywhere in the world, this place is great and the burger is superb.
author: Stu S.

description:
this is really not my scene...it's hidden in an alleyway and for good reason. they have a lounge singer that sporadically interferes with your table conversation. 

the waitress we had was snooty and patronizing. although the spaghetti with crab was amazing, the side of broccoli we got was inedibly salty. i don't even think it was broccoli.
author: selma s.

description: One of my favorite places to splurge.  I love the swanky and old school atmosphere, the live jazz music, and sitting at one of the balcony tables on the second floor where you have a view of the entire place (and the musicians).  Cocktails were strong, food was delicious, and dessert was chocolate goodness.  For some reason, I also enjoy the fact that it's located on a tiny alleyway that you would almost never know was there.
author: Kristen H.

description: Best Martini's in town.  Great live music, elegant decor, and the nostalgia of being in a former bank building.  The food is fairly good and the service is great.  Make reservations for dinner on weekends or you will be out of luck.  Ask for Stanford the manager.
author: Spencer Y.

description: Been going here on and off since 1992, and I've always had a great time, wonderful food, and fantastic cocktails.  Had a very memorable New Year's Eve here, they had a FAB party.  Took my parents to Bix when they came to visit (that's to say I went here with them and had Dad pay,) and we always remember that night foundly.  If you're looking for a place that feels like classic San Francisco, without being touristy, this is worth checking out.  Also a great place to meet friends just for a cockail after work.
author: Sean M.

description: Maybe my top San Francisco restaurant ever...the only problem I have is getting in sometimes. The bar is classic and so are the bartenders; I love having a glass of champagne there, it feels like you are in a movie. The service is always good and I wait all year for their tableside heirloom tomato salad!
author: Lauren D.

description: Went here for my husbands bday, very beautiful atmosphere, kinda reminds me of a movie scene.  Old man played the piano on a Monday nite, appetizers were small portions, entres were well satisfying, drink were good.  It was a busy nite, our waiter didnt pay too much intention to us, didnt bother asking what brought us here, NOTHING.  I would go again, but instead i would go straight to the drinks, and main meal, share dessert, and out.
author: mandy b.

description: The service is excellent.  The martinis are perfect.  The menu and the decor are a bit tired.  All in all a good time, but everyone needs a update every now and then.  Oh, and if you are on a date, make sure they don't sit you at the table right by the kitchen door.
author: Amme P.

description: An older crowd, but the bartenders really know what they are doing.
author: Ivy W.

description:
The only place for a liquid lunch in the city - it's perfectly lit and perfectly decor'ed, like that perfect rich old uncle's sitting room that you always wanted to visit (ok, i never had one of those either, but i watched a lot of Silver Spoons, so i'm just guessing that other people did...)
The picture of the ballerina and the clown making out kind of gives me the willies but people rave about the prix fixe and they do make accomodations for vegetarians.
author: Anjali K.

description: Found this through an excellent Yelp recommendation.  We sat at the bar which was empty from 5:30 to 6:30 pm on a Monday.  We had attentive service, but the bartender was a little uninformed about the menu.  Regardless, we purchased their recommended bottle of pinot noir and it was EXCELLENT.  We got the Chef's selection of appetizers and split a pasta entree, which they divided up for us.  This was one classy joint.  My only complaint was that it was freezing in the place, i guess they were prepping for a heavy dinner hour.  Regardless, it was a great dinner experience.
author: Claire C.

description: Good food, including some real old American standbyes (I recommend the rack of lambs - prompted me to joke about having a "nice rack" all night long), and nicely poured drinks. A little on the pricey side.
author: Tamar N.

description: What can I say...its a kick ass little speakeasy with an amazing wine list, champagne, oysters, and great American cuisine.  Its fun to drive down the small dark alley to get to it.  Inside it is very intimate and the jazz band was just right.  Good times.
author: Ryan G.

description: Took my boyfriend out for his birthday and invited some friends.. about 10 of us... the service was great, there was live music playing...very nice! appetizers were delicious! For my main entree I ordered the Lobster Spaghetti... Oh my... was that GREAT!!
author: Shirl C.

description: Another place near and dear to my heart.  Tucked away in a tiny alley... only to be found by people in the know.  I first came here around age 7 or 8.  I think it might have even been the reason I started loving jazz.  Food is consistently wonderful, as are the old-school cocktails.  Lobster spaghetti is a standout.  A cozy booth upstairs with close friends is always a good time.  I'll always love the painting of the ballerina kissing the clown.  Make reservations a little in advance, they tend to fill up quickly- pretty impressive after 18 years open.
author: Jenny S.

description: Recently read a review of their hamburger and it was rated the best linen napkin burger in town.  I was skeptical going in and left a believer.  The meat was tender, perfectly cooked medium rare, sides and support were fresh and presented wonderfully.  If there is reason to spend a little extra on your lunch, I highly recommend this stop.
author: Porfirio R.

description: This place is awesome for it's atmosphere and food. I went with my co-workers (party of eight) around 9pm and the place was still busy. I got to try all the appetizers and couple of their main dishes. I ordered the Kobe beef which was very delicious. Also, their drink selection is  great too.
author: Deb C.

description: I took my (a-hem) FRIEND, Brian for his 30th Birthday lunch. I think he liked it. I enjoyed it very much.  We went in January during Dine About Town.  I ordered from the DAT menu, got a salad, the Chicken a la BIX and then a chocolate dessert.  Brian ordered from the regular menu... he started with a crab salad which was delicious....and beautifully displayed.  His main entree was kobe beef steak... yummy! As I ate my lunch and some of his lunch and shared the dessert... I was full and enjoyed it all! Good thing I took the rest of the day off!
author: kiko v.

description: Bix is really fun! Although they are in desperate need of some new upholstery, I was charmed completely by the service, the live music, and the food. We had the steak tartare, which was divine, the potato pillows, which were decadent, and I adored the pork chop with squash puree. My girlfriend and I stretched dinner out for nearly three hours without noticing, and our bill was actually quite reasonable considering how much we consumed and how well we were entertained.
author: Lisa L.

description: I normally don't write reviews, but due to the events of the evening I feel it's nesisary.  We were celebrating my friend Jessica's wedding and throwing her a bachelorette party.  It started out great, but when the food arrived one of the ladies had hot soup poored down her hair and back.  Accidents happen, but it's how the restaurant handles them that sets them apart!  The rest of our food came out and the server who took our order had no idea where anything went.  While my friend barley touched her food clearly in pain & upset the manager brings two shots, one for him and one for her. NOT GOOD ENOUGH!!!  To add insult to INJURY they only took the soup and her salad off the bill. SADLY Mary left and went home and did not spend the rest of the evening with us.  Her hair and shirt were covered in creamed soup.  I called her the next day and she said she had blisters down her back and Bix charged her card $200.00 more then they were supposed to.  She has since not heard back from the owner and it has been two weeks!!!  WHAT???  I have wanted to eat at Bix for a long time now and because of the experience and treatment of my lovely friend I will never return.  I WISH I COULD LEAVE ZERO STARS!!!
author: Stacey R.

description: Good food, good service, piano music, mezzanine seating, nice bar, discreet location off an alley - this place has it all.  I dined at Bix on a recent visit to San Francisco, and am glad I did.  I recommend the lobster spaghetti highly.
author: GL K.

description: I don't make enough money to eat here, but for my baby's birthday we decided to go high class and take in a show and some fine dining.  The show sucked, unfortunately (some kind of Tango revue at the War Memorial Opera House), but the classy dinner was very nice.  I ordered something called (I think) Chicken Hash a la Bix, and it was pretty durn tasty...though reading this other review, I'm now quite curious about the $26 burger.  In any case, I cleaned my plate.  My drink of choice that evening was the Maker's Mark Manhattan, and that was DE-licious.  Our waitress was great, and everyone we interacted with was friendly.  Nice ambiance.  We were definitely (the opposite of slumming), but the next time we decide to (opposite of slum), we would definitely consider coming back here.
author: Brian P.

description: Classic San Francisco. While it is distinctly old school, it remains very up-to-date. Tucked on a tiny alley that is Gold Street, you feel like you are happening on a secret spot. Go for a martini or dinner or both. Cocktails are poored with individual bottles of Schweppes (hooray!).
author: Patrick B.

description:
Many years ago -- when I was in my 20's, my boss brought me here for a "Holiday" lunch.  I thought, "One day I'm going to bring my parents here to thank them for my  wonderful life".   Years later when I dragged myself out of my office, I thought, "I truly need a break, and I have yet to treat my parents to BIX."   The evening at BIX with my parents finally arrived and it was wonderful!  The superb food, drinks, atmosphere and service made for a relaxed swanky time with my folks -- yeah -- swanky with mom and dad!!!!   BUT, when my dad reached for his wallet, I said, " Dad, I'll get it this time", I felt like a big girl.  

Fifteen years later, Still Love BIX.    Swanky, Great Drinks - Great Food -- Great Times.
author: Camille W.

description:
totally overrated. I was in San Francisco for my brother's wedding, and while researching options for their rehearsal dinner, my dad suggested Bix. We ended up doing it at Piperade, which was awesome by the way. My brother is the editor at Dwell, right next door, so he knows Bix well (recommended their chicken hash after I told him of my disappointing experience.)
in any case, we arrived for our 8:30 Valentine's Day reservation and were seated upstairs as requested. got the Ginger Gimlet and must agree that for the price the size of the drinks (in a martini glass) is pretty slight. we ordered the dungeness crab "brioche" to share as a starter. What came was delicious but way too expensive for the price - $16! 4 little bite sized toasts.  in any case it was good so we didn't think much of it. we had both decided on the swordfish special which came with a lemon beurre blanc. it was the thinnest swordfish steak I have ever seen! probably 1/4 of an inch thick. the sauce was good, and not overwhelmingly, but I remember wishing there had been more because the accompanying vegetable was broccoli, which was very bland. and who serves broccoli with a $34 entree? it wasn't even broccolini...
we had some nice wine which was fine. 
The kicker came when at about 10:00 our server brought out our check although we had asked for coffee - espresso. we had both flown from Europe for the wedding so were tired and also accustomed to an espresso after dinner. I was rather surprised that our waiter - Doug - brought the check without being asked and I was astonished that when we reminded him of our coffee order, he whisked that check right off the table and returned, with the 2 espressos (actually disgustingly strong) and the adjusted bill. Call me crazy, but I would expect that if the server makes a mistake on a small item like coffee ($6) he would just let it go.  In addition my boyfriend couldn't drink the coffee and we ended up asking someone else to add some hot water because Doug was nowhere to be found. 
the live music was nice, but I was very disappointed. We had one night to eat out in SF and I really wish I had gone somewhere else. to this day, I'm still shocked about him correcting the bill.
author: katherine g.

description: Awesome. Great selection at the Bar for whatever you crave. The first time I was there I felt like I stepped out of an alley and into a speak-easy from the 1920's. They have a first rate jazz band, top notch food and the service is second to none.
author: Dave D.

description: My good friend loves this place- but she loves old rich men and if you do too then this is the place for you.  Its a total throw back to the 50's but what do you expect- it adds to the charm of the place.  The food was good though and the location is very cute- very SOHO like.  The mozzarella and Prosciutto, tuna tar tare, and Foie gras i definitely recommend.  I'm not an entree person so me and my bf just ordered  Hors D'oeuvres and first courses- which was good except the steak tartare something was just off- still figuring it out.  Also, i usually don't like bananas but the Banana foster was amazing.  Good place to go on a Sunday when everything else is closed.
author: Tam N.

description: Good food and nice atmosphere, but they apparently overbook, just like a doctor's office, so you can expect a long wait on a busy night, even if you have a reservation.
