I almost dont want to talk about how wonderful the restaurant is, I want to keep it a secret. There were 4 of us this time around and we had a great table on the first floor. We sampled oysters, firecracker shrimp, crab rolls and tuna tartare. All excellent choices and were very good. We brought a red wine bottle for the main course and bought a bottle of Chardonnay from the restaurant. The bottle was chilled too cold and we found it was refrigerated, not chilled in a wine cellar. We chose an expensive bottle of Chardonnay ~ we mentioned the temperature to our waiter. We had the Kobe beef, Lamb, and fish specials. They were all excellent and the creamed spinach was perfect. The desserts are generously proportioned and this was also a home-run. The music and overall experience was first class and we will be back again, and again  and again....
author: Sarah G.

description: We were having a drink at the bar while waiting for our table in the main dining room on a Friday evening, the service was superb we decided to stay at the bar for the entire meal.  Excellent global wine list including some good choices by the glass; for our dinner, the firecracker shrimp and dungeness crab rolls were the highlight appetizers, they were served tapa size, fresh and well spiced, a perfect way to start; the bone marrow were served in its original form and popping hot, I spread the pure fat all over the house sourdough and savored every bite; for our  main entrees, the sea bass were baked in the oven, the texture was just right; however sun dry tomato was used for topping instead of the blood orange relish as described on the menu which would have been more seasonal and interesting, the fresh lobster spaghetti was not intriguing but satisfying; by now we thought we had absolutely no room left, when the chocolate brioche was served, we could not stop after the first bite, it's served warm, goowy, decadent, pure chocolate heaven, perfect with my espresso and to end any meal!  We had a lovely time and will be back soon.   Valet is $10, live jazz starts at 10pm on the weekend.
author: J S.

description: Excellent food, atmosphere and service.  I had a fabulous caprese salad, then whipped potatoes and a vegetable ragout.  Everything was perfectly seasoned, I would go back for sure!
author: kelly m.

description: I've dined at Bix several times, and since Bruce Hill has taken over in the kitchen, the place never ceases to amaze.  It's become a special occasion only place for us, as the entree prices are now north of $30.  They do have a $35.95 special that includes a salad/soup, entree, and dessert, which helps keep the tab under control.  All of the food is exceptional.  The service is professional, and the setting is wonderful with the curved staircase, the iconic bar, and the giant mural that frames it.  If you're looking for a place that won't disappoint, I highly recommend  Bix.
author: John G.

description: Seldom am I wowed by a place. I would like to first start off by saying this is fantastic food prepared in the most non pretentious way. The service here is phenomenal, everyone was polite and helpful. I fell in love with this place from the moment I walked in. The jazz duo filled the atmosphere with cool, upbeat sounds. While the bartender mixes with fresh ingredients behind the bar. The decor has an old Hollywood/New York feel to it, with service and ambiance to match. However do not be mistaken, you know that you are in SF because of the laid back personality of the place. I highly recommend the burger to anyone who would consider themselves a burger connoisseur. The food, atmosphere, service and over all price is fantastic. I strongly suggest that if you are going to SF that you make a stop here at Bix.
author: Joseph Y.

description: Service is incredible. I brought my boyfriend at the time for his birthday and I got bonus points since he wanted to take me here too. I gently told the waiter it was his bday and they made it personalized. He was so impressed.  I was impressed.  Food, not bad. The bar is awesome too. Live jazz livens up the place.  Generally a mature crowd from the 3 times I've been here but it's sort of an SF landmark. You just have to go.
author: Eesayah O.

description: i went to bix for my birthday dinner - yum!  its a really cool place inside, high ceilings, big booths.  my friend who is a tour guide said it used to be a speakeasy.  everything we got was good - definitely order appetizers, all 3 that we got were delicious and the presentation was cool too.  there was a band playing while we were there too which i liked.  its a really great place to go for a special occasion!
author: Carolyn B.

description: Excellent food in a 1930's speak-easy atmosphere.  A little bit pricey, but the food, ambiance and live jazz make it worth experiencing.  There is also a wonderful bar if you are only looking for a night out on the town.
author: Mary C.

description: meh, the food was good, but i'm not it was worth the price. the service wasn't up to par.
author: J K L.

description: Definately a business only crowd. Great Happy hour, but the bartenders are terribly unattentive. I'm not sure if it is only because we just ordered happy hour or weren't wearing our business suits...because it wasn't all that busy. My 2 star rating is purely based on service.
author: angela p.

description: my coworkers love to come here to grab drinks from the bar.  it's a classy joint.
author: Dorothy L.

description: I dined at Bix for the first time this past Friday evening. It was my suggestion since I had been there once years ago only for drinks and remembered how much I enjoyed the overall ambiance of the place. One thing that makes it difficult is that it is in an ally way. However, I think they have their regular fan base and don't do too bad because from what I hear they've been around a while. It's kind of cool that it's got that NYC feel being in this obscure ally way and all and you pull right up and luckily there is valet. Our party of four was all there so we immediately got seated and they seated us at the table right in front of the band set up. We had 9PM reservations so that was about the time the music was going to start which I was looking forward to because I enjoy Jazz. We ordered drinks in which took quite some time to get back to us. Although our waiter was nice and polite, I'm not sure if it was the other people he communicated with or what, but in general the service was kind of slow. The food took quite some time to get to us. I'd say we waited about close to 45 minutes. And by that time, it wasn't super busy. I mean then again the restaurant is not that big either so I didn't feel there was an excuse to take that long to serve us. In anycase, thankfully, our food was DELICIOUS! So with that I cannot complain. We ordered the special that evening which was a New York Steak and fries with some Shrimp too. My boyfriend and I split the meal, and I'm glad we did because it was PLENTY for both of us. The portioning was excellent. The cost of our dish itself was 47 dollars which was probably the most expensive thing on the menu. Not bad at all. The pricing is definitely not bad. And nothing like some great jazz to kick off a great meal. Overall, a GREAT restaurant, I would definitely come back for drinks at the bar or dinner for sure because the food was great. The only thing I have to complain about is the slow service. I did hear from another friend that they had the same experience in which it was a bit slow for them too. Hopefully that will get picked up. But looking forward to going there as often as I can otherwise! Yayyy Bix!
author: ST1223 T.

description: Been here many times. This is a good classic San Fran Restaurant delivering consistent food, service, ambiance, and service.
author: Peter J.

description: Great ambiance coupled with superior cusine -- a 10. Love the high opulent ceilings, the dinner club atmosphere, the sound of martini shakers everywhere. For starters, we had Potato Pillows with Creme Fraiche and Caviar, Crab and Nori Fritters and Fire Cracker Shrimp with Chili Aoili. Each dish was perfection, but the Crab and Nori Fritters were an obvious favorite. For the main course, my husband had the Gulf Prawns with Potato Gnocci, Sweet Fennel, Sungold Tomatoes and Bread Crumbs, while I went out on a limb (for me) and tried the Grilled Boneless Quails with warm Radicchio Salad, Pancetta and Beet Vinaigrette, Manodori Balsamico. My entree was good, but my husband's inspired a severe case of dish envy -- though not so much as to spoil a perfect evening. We finished the meal by splitting a Roasted Banana Ice Cream Sundae covered in Spanish Peanuts and Carmelized Bananas -- what a fantastic way to celebrate seven years together.
author: Katie B.

description: An absolutely incredible dining experience here at BIX...once you find the place...! And thus the only reason why it loses a star...because I almost gave up on trying to find it after getting lost...twice. It is really difficult to get to (down a dark alley thats tough to find in itself) and luckily we were on foot. But, once you get past the location aspect, the actual dining experience was great. Beautifully designed interior, great atmosphere and mood (piano music was great), tasty drinks that were well worth the price, and the food was just perfect. I went with the most expensive burger ive ever seen ($26)...for the truffled open faced hamburger and it didnt disappoint. The lovely lady had the exquisite pork chop dish which just melted in your mouth. The appetizers were incredible and the dessert was pretty lavish. All in all, it was a great dining choice and one that I would definitely recommend to anyone to try. Good luck finding it though...!!!
author: Nathan H.

description: ate here once with the bf and didn't find anything memorable besides it was expensive and food wasn't really that great. it seems to have great reviews so maybe i'll have to visit again
author: Bee C.

description: food is great. music is great. i don't eat meat, but my friend was ticked off by the 26- hamburger. (and he appreciates food...a lot.)  my waiter was dry...but i really liked the waiter of the table next to me. what mine didn't fill in, i could overhear from him. ;) it's loud. jazzy.  i'm still looking for a place i want to go back to again and again. something that makes me forget that i can eat at a new restaurant every time i want to eat out. they make a great negroni. i'm really into the dessert plates that have all the little treats...their ice cream sandwiches were yummy.
author: heather m.

description: Interior was very, very classy...great place for a date.  Service was attentive and pleasant (thanks, Katie).  They even waived the (quite outrageous) $25 corkage fee because we purchased an additional bottle. You should defiantly go this route if you're planning to bring your own wine. You have to ask them to waive the fee, but then you get two bottles for around 30-40 (if you stick the lower-end wines on the list). Apps were pretty good...mini lamb burgers were EXCELLENT.... tender, and flavorful with just the right amount of spice. Shrimp were lackluster-not fiery as promised, just over-breaded and bland. Entrees were all VERY good. Pork Chop was sizable, tender and moist. Kobe beef didn't taste all that different from a really good fillet, but was presented beautifully. My crab spaghetti with lobster sauce was rich for sure, but not overly creamy or greasy. In fact, the sauce was light and flavorful, pasta cooked al dente and large chunks of sweet crab meat throughout the dish. We also ordered the carrots cooked in mint. Carrots had a very unique (somewhat sweet?) flavor and were cooked well- still a bit crunchy. Bananas foster was underwhelming- 2 banana slices?? But the chocolate semifreddie with toffee was unique and not overly sweet.  Over all, it was BIXtastic!
author: Jenni D.

description: Amazing atmosphere- very film noir.  I love coming here for cocktails at the bar and listening to the live jazz.  The drink menu is excellent and extensive.  The food I have had is good, nothing particularly of note.
author: Lynn G.

description: a specail place to experience one or twice. but beyond that it becomes a novelty. somewhat like going to pier 39 and eating crab or riding a cable car. the staircase and phone booth were my favorites. the food above average. dress up and check it out.
author: ray c.

description: I have dined at Bix more times than I can count on my fingers and toes. There are many good reasons to pay as much as you do and to go through the effort of getting dressed up to eat at this joint. If you want a nibble on a budget, eat at a cute little joint in the oh so casual lower haight or maybe the mission in most cases. I found that eating and drinking at the bar at Bix was more entertaining and had far better service than eating at a table. The space is filled with soft live music and the chatter of people. The food is delicious and rich. My friend described the butternut squash soup as tasting  like the gourd was just pulled out of the field and prepared. My favorite is the blanched veal marrow bones. Indeed a little "cave man" , but a special treat none the less. Bix is also THE place in SF to have a martini, not too big, and perfectly made. This place would be exellent to bring a date to if you dine at a table.
author: Charise B.

description: I always feel so mature when I go to Bix but in a good way!  I love the food, the decor is fantastic and the service is top notch.
author: Misti L.

description: I've been there twice and both times the food did not disappoint. The menu also seems to rotate pretty regularly which is another plus! The decor is fun and funky-- like an old fashion jazz supper club. Definitely a fun place to treat a friend for a celebratory event. Going here for dinner feels like you are actually "going out" versus just grabbing dinner. The bar is a fun place to hang out too. Please be forewarned (if its your first trip to Bix) that the restaurant is located in an alley, so its a little hard to find.
author: Mama L.

description: Great casual atmosphere, and awesome food.  Their mini flyers are drool-worthy.  The buns are almost like creme puff material - smooth, silky and deliciously buttery.  The butternut squash soup has a gorgeous drizzle of melted brown sugar and the texture of rich velvet.  The chocolate bread pudding and creme brulee are both great, but if you're hard pressed, go with the creme brulee.  Delish.
author: Lily K.

description: Hidden in such an ally that the location even threw off my navigation system. After a few circles, I saw the Bix neon sign glowing through the corridor. Almost appreciating the fact that you can't just 'roll up to the front.' You could hear a pin drop in the ally, but one step inside Bix and it was a great social joint. I let the lady order the Italian wine (she has more knowledge than I, so instead of looking like a fool I just nodded my head). For starters I had the lamb burgers which were very tasty. We also split a salad and shared the main dishes. I had the kobe beef which was filling, but her chicken dish was amazing. Almost looking like 2 patties, the dish was mixed with something unexplainable. After viewing the desert menu I told our waiter I'd pass, then I asked him if I was 'missing out' on anything. He responded with the chocolate bread pudding. I'm a sucker for desert, but it was rich and delicious. Great overall experience, speaking for my friend 'two thumbs up.'
author: omaid h.

description: Another great birthday dinner I had was here at Bix.  After being recommended by my boss, I decided to take him up on the offer.  My boyfriend made reservations, and asked that roses be placed on the table with champagne waiting upon our arrival.  We got there, only had to wait about 5 minutes (as they were packed!), and when I was taken to our table, I was definitely surprised.  So that was a great way to start the evening.  Then came the dirty martinis...ooh boy.  I am very picky about my martinis and they were sure spot on!  We both ordered salad, and an entree, both of which were to die for!  I was so happy because not only was it my birthday and I was sharing it with my boyfriend, I was loving every bite!  I really wanted to try their desserts but, we had decided long before that we were going to hope on over to Citizen Cake for dessert.  The decor is beautiful and its a pretty big space.  The restaurant itself is hidden as it is in an alley, but wasn't hard to find at all. Waiter was superb, and to be honest, the whole experience was!  It is a little pricey, but hey when it's my birthday dinner, I really don't care!
author: Samantha R.

description: Fun place to go for drinks. Nice ambiance. My only complaint would be that they had live music, but the sound of people talking was so loud, I didn't realize they had live music until my husband pointed it out to me at the end of the night. They had been playing and singing the whole time. Bummer.
author: suz q.

description: I have been most impressed by both the food and service at Bix. I was treating a young friend of mine who had just graduated high school. I made our reservation on open table and made a note on my dietary restrictions. I had never been to Bix and was a bit intimidated as we walked in. The clientale was older and refined (I am in my mid 30's, but I can easily pass for half my age), however the hostess and waitstaff was warm and friendly. Tthe ambiance was warm and welcoming . I loved the open second level with all of its circular seating, looking down upon the bar and grand piano. Aftter welcoming us to the restaurant, our waiter told us that he knew one of us had dietary restrictions. He told me what was "safe" on the menu, as well as state the chef would be more than happy to make a separate dish for me (which I ordered). The menu was sophisticated without being stuffy. The meal was wonderful and the portion sizes were ample. The sorbet was amazing (I know it sounds kind of funny, but you HAVE to taste their strawberry!). We enjoyed ourselves so much, we ordered another dessertt (chocolate) to take with us. The meal was a bit pricey, but I knew that going in. The quality of the food and service was well worth the cost.   I have been trying to find another excuse to go back ever since!
author: Ginger K.

description: i don't usually eat red meat but the steak tartar here is absolutely AMAZING!  my mouth starts to water every time i think about it.
author: michelle k.

description: The beet appetizer was exquisite. Nothing else was really memorable. What I do remember is getting crappy service. Our waitress spent all night with a bachelor party. Whenever we needed something, we had to get it through another waiter/busboy. Actually, I can't remember how the food tasted because all I was left with was a bad taste in my mouth.
author: Luke F.

description:
4.5

this is one of my (new found) favorite spots... it's such a romantic and beautiful space, matched with lovely food and wine... i'm making this review with the caveat that i've only eaten/sat at the bar and it wasn't on the weekend so i can't speak to the quality of the table service nor the feel of the weekend crowd.  we had excellent service at the bar (anyone who knows me knows my preference is, unless for a formal occasion, is to eat at the bar - i believe it grantees an overall better restaurant experience), and ordered a handful of yummy dishes, the best of which were the croques.  a delightful jazz singer accompanied the talented piano player and the crowd (it was fairly full for an odd wednesday evening) was cheerful and relaxed.  throw in the fact that bix is in an absolutely gorgeous old building and you've got a marvelous combination.  highly recommended.
author: Cindi H.

description: great appetizers. great music and awesome cocktails. chic date venue!
author: aj s.

description: the atmosphere of this place its truly amazing.  i loved every corner.  the drinks were fab.  i had their grilled cheese and tomato bisque.  I'm pretty sure i died for a minute and half and went to heaven.  it was sooo good.  the bad thing is, it was better than my dinner.  i had the kobe beef and was kind of disappointed.  but the drinks and everything else made up for it.  i guess i just ordered the wrong thing or i was feel particularly picky that evening.  either way, i cant wait to go back when i visit sf again.
author: christine k.

description: a great place to grab a drink and dinner. love the way its tucked back on an alley, but on the doorstep of the financial and north beach.
author: Patrick D.

description: Of course the food at Bix deserves 5 stars - it was absolutely delicious - the Heirloom tomato cart and the beets and chevre skewers were fantastic, as was everything else we ate - salads, entrees, dessert.  The 3 stars is for the service only - it was exceedingly slow - we waited a half an hour for our drinks and another 25 minutes before we ordered the appetizers - this was on a Tuesday night.  I didn't get the impression that the waiter was giving us time for a romantic meal because more than 3 times he'd be walking toward us, look at our table, scratch his head and turn around, knowing he'd forgotten something.  I have to say that all the other waiters were fantastic and constantly checking in on their tables.  I think we just happened to get someone with too many tables, or maybe he was just distracted.  But, absolutely no complaints on the food, it was wonderful and the music went a little way toward helping to distract us from the long waits.
author: Jessica T.

description: great atmosphere, classy & jazzy with a live band on the lower level by the bar. Reserve seats on the upper level for a better view. It could be really loud on the ground level. Food is above average. Good service.
author: Jen C.

description: Go to Bix.  Go for dinner.  Go for just drinks.  But go.  The atmosphere is fun and more fun.  I've never had a bad time at Bix.
author: Janet W.

description: If you are looking for a really laid back ambiance, this is a really great place for that. The food is decent. But I really enjoyed the setting more than anything. It is in the middle of this little alley..and when you step inside, it is a very dim....real nice for a date. Very high ceilings, good taste in background music, not too loud, not too soft.
author: DT l.

description: I can't believe I hadn't been here before.   This place oozes romance and sexiness. Good music, a beautiful dining room, and delicious food.   The chicken hash is as good as everyone says.  Can't wait to go back.  Bix has made it onto my list of favorite San Francisco restaurants.
author: Gabriela P.

description: Went to dinner here last night with some clients, and it was great. Bix is just such a unique restaurant, such a great throwback to the 40's supper clubs...waiters in white jackets, ambiant lighting and live jazz. I really can't wait to go back. If you go, must get the lobster spaghetti, it was soooo decadent and amazing. Plus their wine list is off the hook. We had a variety of items, truffle fries (yum!), halibut (yum!), beet salad (creative and delish) and of course the chocolate bread pudding is unreal, a must order.
author: Kristin L.

description: This is still one of my more favorite spots in the city.  Great location, good food, and great martini's.  These are bartenders who know how to make seriously great martini's, you can easily drink 4 of them so watch out!  This place always delivers.  Also a nice spot to take the parents when they're in town.  Parents always seem to love this place for some reason.
author: Marc G.

description: Awesome food.  Impeccable cocktails.  Near perfect service (Stu is fantastic!).  Super cool ambience.  All that's missing is Bogart sipping a martini downstairs.  This is on my short list of favorite places, period.
author: Mike L.

description: We enjoyed the food and services.  I didn't have very high expectation as my previous visit (gosh, 6 years ago) was just so-so.  But this time it was surprisingly good.  The food was tasty and our waiter was awesome.  The menu was not impressive and nothing special but everything was very tasty.  We would go back again.
author: raiderslum L.

description: Extremely poor service, terrible attitudes, non-welcoming environment, and tier-3 wait staff - with as many great restaurants as there are in the city (next time go to Boulevard, Jardiniere, Aqua...or any other), Bix should fall off of anyone's list as a restaurant option. The staff at Bix is just flat out rude... From the extremely unpleasant and unaccomodating host/hostesses, to waitresses with major attitudes and 100% focused on how much and how fast you order so as to maximize their tip potential.  I would highly recommend that anyone considering this restaurant, very much reconsider - you will be incredibly disapointed.
author: Jeff W.

description: I always love to try new places. Bix is one reason why I don't.  I've had the same bartender making me the same martini for the last 20 years. Thanks Bradley! Had my 30th at Bix. Always enjoy the music. Great for dinner or just popping in to hoist a couple. If you have to wait for your table because someone is camping out, the Bubble Lounge is a block away.
author: Jeff B.

description: Very good across the board, food was well prepared, server was very knowledgeable.  Only complaint is we asked for a serving of bread which was never delivered, and there were a couple of 10 minute stretches we didn't see our server.
author: TXSebas T.

description: my family and i had such a great experience here.  we came to celebrate my brother's birthday and bix provided the perfect combination of a fun atmosphere (with an amazingly entertaining waiter) and delicious and memorable food.  we started off with the truffle cheese croques for the table, which were the perfect bite-sized starts for a table of six.  then for my meal i had the arugula salad with raisins and pancetta, and the halibut, which was served over a vegetable i had never heard of, but was told was similar to celery root - delicious.  for dessert we all split a plate of mini ice cream sandwiches and the warm brioche pudding, which sent me on my way a very happy girl :).  bonus: our waiter highjacked my mom's digital camera after taking a family photo, and he snapped a pic of one of the black canvasses they have framed on the wall - turns out there are hidden portraits beneath that only show with a light like a camera flash!
author: ali l.

description: This restaurant is nothing short of amazing.  I went there last night with some friends, buoyed by some very strong recommendations, and Bix exceeded my expectations.  The service was fantastic (they don't have a waitlist, but Elena was so great that she called me back when a party cancelled), and the food was some of the best I've eaten in San Francisco (and I'm a total foodie).  Lobster spaghetti, bone marrow, potato pillows with caviar were divine.  American Kobe bavette steak was delicious.  Truffled cheeseburger had amazing flavors, but was a bit overcooked for my taste.  Foie gras was good, but not a must-have.  Truffled fries were beyond delicious, and all the desserts were amazing.  Chocolate brioche pudding, bananas foster, seasonal sorbet, little peanut butter sundae, I could go on.  One of my best meals in this city, and the only restaurant I've eaten at lately that I plan on returning to.
author: La D.

description: What a way to spend a birthday.  As I sauntered up the staircase I knew I was in the right place to celebrate.  Our server was great, although it took him a bit to warm up to us.  We ordered a bottle of champagne and began our fabulous night out.  We were lucky enough to sit upstairs in the swanky booths overlooking the restaurant.  Make a reservation request if you can.  With the champagne, we were given samples of the potato pillows with caviar and creme fraiche.  A sweet treat to get our mouths watering.  For an appetizer, we ordered the firecracker shrimp with chile aioli.  They were fine; not great, not bad.  Just fine.  And how could we pass up the heirloom tomato cart after all we had heard?!  It certainly did not disappoint.  The tomatoes were beefy and juicy.  The olive oil was fresh and the mozzarella is housemade - how could you pass that up?!  Our server suggested the rack of lamb and he did not steer us wrong.  It was first time trying lamb and it was delicious.  Tender, flavorful and the side of ricotta and squash was divine.  Our server even suggested a glass of red wine to enrich our taste buds during the lamb.  We shared the cheese plate, complete with a candle for my birthday.  And he even gave us an entire plate of fruit to accompany our cheese.  All in all, Bix is a pricey place to dine.  I would suggest using the valet instead of driving yourself crazy looking for parking.  Ten dollars is worth the stress you are saving yourself.  We even left our car with the valet while we went to Cobb's Comedy Club down the street.
author: Jennifer J.
